metadata.description: The Ontology for Biomedical Investigations (OBI) is build in a collaborative, international effort and will serve as a resource for annotating biomedical investigations, including the study design, protocols and instrumentation used, the data generated and the types of analysis performed on the data. This ontology arose from the Functional Genomics Investigation Ontology (FuGO) and will contain both terms that are common to all biomedical investigations, including functional genomics investigations and those that are more domain specific.

OBI:0002069.definition: A T cell epitope specific perforin release assay that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0002069.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific perforin release by T cells

OBI:0002068.definition: An assay of epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0002068.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells

OBI:0002065.definition: A T cell epitope specific granzyme B release assay that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0002065.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific granzyme B release by T cells

IAO:0000416.definition: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measuring a temporal interval
IAO:0000416.label: time measurement datum

IAO:0000415.definition: A textual entity that expresses an assertion that is intended to be tested.
IAO:0000415.label: hypothesis textual entity

IAO:0000414.definition: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measurement of mass quality
IAO:0000414.label: mass measurement datum

OBI:0002061.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0002061.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells

OBI:0002060.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0002060.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells

OBI:0002063.definition: A T cell epitope specific granzyme A release assay that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0002063.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific granzyme A release by T cells

OBI:0002062.definition: A T cell epitope specific killing assay that uses an in vitro cell killing assay.
OBI:0002062.label: in vitro assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing

OBI:0200017.definition: A cosine transformation is a data transformation which consists in applying the cosine function to a (one dimensional) real number input. The cosine function is one of the basic trigonometric functions and a definition is provided, e.g., at http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Cosine.html.
OBI:0200017.label: cosine transformation

OBI:0400085.definition: Apparatus in the fluidic subsystem of sorters that vibrates to break up the stream coming out of the flow chamber into droplets for sorting. The peizo electric crystal vibrates in a manner that breaks off droplets at regular intervals. Not all droplets contain a cell.
OBI:0400085.label: piezo electric crystal

OBI:0001878.definition: an establishing cell culture process whereby cells explanted directly from an organismal source or specimen, and placed in culture for maintenance or propagation as a primary cell culture
OBI:0001878.label: establishing primary cell culture

OBI:0000698.definition: A DNA ligase is an enzyme that covalently joins two compatible pieces of DNA through the cleavage of an ATP molecule
OBI:0000698.label: obsolete_DNA ligase

OBI:0001740.definition: A B cell epitope binding off rate measurement (koff) determination assay that uses an antibody binding detection by fluorescence quenching assay.
OBI:0001740.label: quenching assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0002119.definition: An imaging assay that utilizes a microscope to magnify features of the visualized material of interest that are not visible to naked eye.
OBI:0002119.label: microscopy assay

OBI:0002118.definition: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of the protein coding components of a genome (exons).
OBI:0002118.label: exome sequencing assay

OBI:1110156.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:1110156.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells

OBI:1110157.definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:1110157.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor production by T cells

OBI:1110150.definition: A T cell epitope specific killing assay performed in vitro that uses a chromium release assay.
OBI:1110150.label: 51 chromium assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing

OBI:1110151.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:1110151.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells

OBI:1110152.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:1110152.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells

OBI:0002448.definition: An artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization that is performed to identify differentially expressed genes through hybridization of cDNA probes.
OBI:0002448.label: differential screening hybridization

OBI:0002447.definition: An artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization that is performed to compare gene expression in different cell or tissue types based on normalization and suppression, which creates a subtracted cDNA or genomic DNA library.
OBI:0002447.label: suppression subtractive hybridization

OBI:0002110.definition: A centrally registered identifier symbol used to uniquely identify objects given by International DOI Foundation. The DOI system is particularly used for electronic documents such as journal articles.
OBI:0002110.label: digital object identifier

OBI:0002445.definition: A transcription profiling assay in which the transcription start site for a gene is determined by identifying the 5' end of mRNA. A radio-labeled primer is annealed to a complementary mRNA sequence near the 3' end, then cDNA is synthesized until the 5' end is reached.
OBI:0002445.label: transcription start site mapping by primer extension assay

OBI:0002444.definition: A role borne by a material entity and realized in an assay which achieves the objective to measure the magnitude/concentration/amount of the measurand in the entity bearing evaluant role.
OBI:0002444.label: measurand role

OBI:1110158.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:1110158.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells

OBI:1110159.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:1110159.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells

OBI:0002441.definition: An assay that produces a description of the qualities of an entity that has not been transformed, through observation and physical, non-invasive techniques.
OBI:0002441.label: physical examination of individual

OBI:0002116.definition: An analytical chromatography assay that utilizes a high performance liquid chromatography instrument for separation of compounts in a solution.
OBI:0002116.label: high performance liquid chromotography assay

OBI:0001143.definition: a labeled specimen that is the output of a labeling process and has grain labeled nucleic acid for detection of the nucleic acid in future experiments.
OBI:0001143.label: labeled nucleic acid extract

OBI:0001142.definition: a reference substance role that is borne by a material entity used in a dye swap design experiment for quality control or data normalization purposes
OBI:0001142.label: dye swap quality control role

OBI:0001141.definition: a CRID symbol used to distinguish one individual organism from another.
OBI:0001141.label: individual organism identifier

OBI:0001140.definition: a reference substance role that is borne by a material entity with a known amount which is mixed into the evaluant of assays for quality control or data normalization purposes
OBI:0001140.label: spike-in quality control role

OBI:0001147.definition: a processual entity that results in the increase of cell numbers
OBI:0001147.label: cell culture expansion

OBI:0001146.definition: An assay with the objective to characterize the disposition of two or more material entities to form a complex.
OBI:0001146.label: binding assay

OBI:0001145.definition: A 3D structure determination assay in which a complex of 2 or more material enties is characterized which provides information on their binding configuration.
OBI:0001145.label: 3D structure determination of bound complex assay

OBI:0001144.definition: A binding datum about the disposition of two or more material entities to form complexes which comes in the form of a scalar and unit that are utilized in equations that model the binding process
OBI:0001144.label: binding constant

OBI:1110011.definition: an allergic reaction is an pathologic immune response by an organism to a non-self entity that is normally harmless(the allergen)
OBI:1110011.label: allergic reaction

OBI:0001149.definition: a genetic transformation that involves the insertion of a protein coding cDNA sequence at a particular locus in an organism's chromosome. Typically, this is done in mice since the technology for this process is more refined, and because mouse embryonic stem cells are easily manipulated. The difference between knock-in technology and transgenic technology is that a knock-in involves a gene inserted into a specific locus, and is a "targeted" insertion.
OBI:0001149.label: gene knock in

OBI:0001148.definition: a genetic transformation that renders a gene non-functional, e.g. due to a point mutation, or the removal of all, or part of, the gene using recombinant methods.
OBI:0001148.label: gene knock out

REO:0000171.definition: a reagent role inhering in a molecular entity intended to associate with some molecular target to serve as a proxy for the presence, abundance, or location of this target in a detection of molecular label assay.
REO:0000171.label: molecular label role

UBERON:0000483.definition: Portion of tissue, that consists of one or more layers of epithelial cells connected to each other by cell junctions and which is underlain by a basal lamina. Examples: simple squamous epithelium, glandular cuboidal epithelium, transitional epithelium, myoepithelium[CARO].
UBERON:0000483.label: epithelium

OBI:0001819.definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001819.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells

OBI:0000817.definition: Fucoidan is a sulfated polysaccharide (MW: average 20,000) found mainly in various species of brown seaweed such as kombu, limu moui,bladderwrack, wakame, mozuku, and hijiki (variant forms of fucoidan have also been found in animal species, including the sea cucumber).
OBI:0000817.label: fucoidan

OBI:0000814.definition: Guar gum, also called guaran, is a galactomannan. It is primarily the ground endosperm of guar beans. The guar seeds are dehusked, milled and screened to obtain the guar gum.[1] It is typically produced as a free flowing, pale, off-white colored, coarse to fine ground powder.
OBI:0000814.label: guar gum

OBI:0000815.definition: For the chromogenic determination of antithrombin III. Autoanalyzer method for undiluted samples. For the quantitative chromogenic determination of the functional activity of antithrombin III in plasma on autoanalyzers for the diagnosis of diminished AT III synthesis, increased consumption, and for monitoring substitution therapy. Berichrom(r) Antithrombin III (A) is used for the rapid determination of the physiologically active antithrombin III and permits the diagnosis of congenital and acquired antithrombin III deficiency, a condition frequently associated with an increased risk of thrombosis. Acquired antithrombin III deficiencies frequently occur due to consumption following major operations or due to disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) in cases of septicaemia, nephroses, liver parenchymal damage (hepatitis, drug intoxication, alcoholism) and estrogen-containing contraceptives. The test permits early detection of patients at increased risk for thrombosis. Kit contains: 6 x for 5.0 mL Thrombin (bovine), 3 x for 3.0 mL Substrate Reagent, 1 x 30.0 mL Buffer Solution
OBI:0000815.label: Berichrom(r) Antithrombin III (A) Kit

OBI:0000812.definition: An assay that measures neural activity in the caudate nucleus
OBI:0000812.label: measuring neural activity in the caudate nucleus assay

OBI:0000813.definition: A study subject role which begins to exist when a subject is assigned to be one of those who will receive active ingredient, and is realized in a study execution in which they receive the active ingredient
OBI:0000813.label: to be treated with active ingredient role

OBI:0000810.definition: A planned process in which a person or their legal representative is informed about key facts about potential risks and benefits of a process and makes a documented decision as to whether the person in question will participate.
OBI:0000810.label: informed consent process

OBI:0002369.definition: A clinical history in which there was no diagnosis of cancer.
OBI:0002369.label: clinical history devoid of cancer

OBI:0001811.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001811.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells

OBI:0001810.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation assay that detects granulysin release by T cells.
OBI:0001810.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific granulysin release by T cells

OBI:0001813.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001813.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells

OBI:0001382.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001382.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells

OBI:0001815.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-18 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001815.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-18 production by T cells

OBI:0001814.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001814.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells

OBI:0000818.definition: A planned process with the objective to establish the relationship between data produced by a measurement device and physical qualities. This is done by using the measurement device under defined conditions, and either tuning it to adjust the measured output, or record the output and use it as a reference in future measurements.
OBI:0000818.label: calibration

OBI:0001816.definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001816.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells

OBI:0200106.definition: Discriminant function analysis is used to determine which variables discriminate between two or more naturally occurring groups. Analysis is used to determine which variable(s) are the best predictors of a particular outcome.
OBI:0200106.label: discriminant analysis

OBI:0001039.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution ribonucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines nucleic acid secondary structure at nucleotide resolution scale using intromolecular reactivity
OBI:0001039.label: inline probing RNA structure mapping assay

OBI:0001038.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines nucleic acid secondary structure at a nucleotide resolution scale using Rhutenium as reagent and chemical probe
OBI:0001038.label: Ruthenium structure mapping assay

OBI:0001037.definition:
A specimen 
fixation function is a function that holds or fastens an entity in a fixed position.
OBI:0001037.label: obsolete_specimen fixation function

OBI:0001036.definition: a function that allows specific identification of individual speciment from one another.
OBI:0001036.label: specimen fixation function

OBI:0001035.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using Nuclease S1
OBI:0001035.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution deoxyribonucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines nucleic acid secondary structure at a nucleotide resolution scale using DNAse 1 as reagent and enzymatic probe.
OBI:0001035.label: Nuclease S1 structure mapping assay

OBI:0001034.definition: An environmental control device is a device which has the function to control some aspect of the environment such as temperature, or humidity.
OBI:0001034.label: environmental control device

OBI:0001033.definition: A perturbation device is a device which is designed to perform a perturb function
OBI:0001033.label: perturbation device

OBI:0001032.definition: a device which has a function to emit light.
OBI:0001032.label: light emission device

OBI:0001031.definition: An image creation process that generate an image from the array.
OBI:0001031.label: array image creation

OBI:0001030.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using RNAse T1
OBI:0001030.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution ribonucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines nucleic acid secondary structure at a nucleotide resolution scale uses RNAse T1 as reagent and enzymatic probe.
OBI:0001030.label: RNASE T1 structure mapping assay

OBI:0001367.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001367.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells

OBI:0001366.definition: A process of RANTES production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001366.label: epitope specific RANTES production by T cells

OBI:0001497.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation assay that detects perforin release by T cells.
OBI:0001497.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific perforin release by T cells

OBI:0001496.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001496.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells

OBI:0001491.definition: A binding assay that uses radioactivity detection as an indicator of binding.
OBI:0001491.label: radioactivity detection binding assay

GO:0035397.definition: Positive regulation of an adaptive immune response mediated via cytokine production by helper T cell.
GO:0035397.label: helper T cell enhancement of adaptive immune response

OBI:0001361.definition: A transcription profiling assay that uses reverse transcription PCR (RT-PCR).
OBI:0001361.label: transcription profiling by RT-PCR assay

OBI:0000789.definition: A measurement data that represents the percentage of people or animals in a study or treatment group who are alive for a given period of time after diagnosis or initiation of monitoring.
OBI:0000789.label: survival rate

OBI:0000787.definition: An assay that measures the amount of antithrombin III in blood.
OBI:0000787.label: human antithrombin-III in blood assay

GO:0035398.definition: Positive regulation of a T cell mediated immune response mediated via cytokine production by a helper T cell.
GO:0035398.label: helper T cell enhancement of T cell mediated immune response

OBI:0000785.definition: Controlled variable specification  is a part of a study design. They are the entities that could vary, but are kept constant to prevent their influence on the effect of the independent variable on the dependent.
OBI:0000785.label: study design controlled variable

OBI:0001499.definition: A binding assay that uses fluorescence detection as an indicator of binding
OBI:0001499.label: fluorescence detection binding assay

OBI:0001498.definition: A growth environment pertaining to the atmospheric conditions that is used to culture or grow an organism.
OBI:0001498.label: atmosphere

OBI:0001369.definition: an allele information that is about the allele found most frequently in natural populations, or in standard laboratory stocks for a given organism.
OBI:0001369.label: wild type allele information

OBI:0001368.definition: An assay of epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001368.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells

OBI:0200100.definition: canonical variate analysis is a form of discriminant analysis that takes several continuous predictor variables and uses the entire set to predict several criterion variables, each of which is also continuous. CVA simultaneously calculates a linear composite of all x variables and  a linear composite of all y variables. Unlike other multivariate techniques, these weighted composites are derived in pairs. Each linear combination is called a canonical variate and takes the general linear form.
OBI:0200100.label: canonical variate analysis

OBI:0200101.definition: Linear discriminant functional analysis (LDFA) is a multivariate technique used in special applications where there are several intact groups (random assignment may be impossible) and they have been measured on several independent measures. Thus, you will want to describe how these groups differ on the basis of these measures. In this case, classification and prediction is the main objective.
OBI:0200101.label: linear discriminant functional analysis

GO:0097392.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 (CXCL16) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0097392.label: chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production

IAO:0000636.definition: A textual entity expressing information regarding the patients used in a study.
IAO:0000636.label: patients textual entity

GO:0097390.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 (CXCL12) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0097390.label: chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production

GO:0097391.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 (CXCL13) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0097391.label: chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production

IAO:0000633.definition: A part of a document about the materials required to reproduce the content of the document.
IAO:0000633.label: materials section

IAO:0000632.definition: A textual entity addressing a shortcoming or bias of a study design or execution.
IAO:0000632.label: study limitations textual entity

IAO:0000631.definition: A part of a document about biases or short comings related to the study design and execution.
IAO:0000631.label: study limitations section

IAO:0000630.definition: A part of a document where keywords selected by the author to categorize the major theme(s) of a document are listed.
IAO:0000630.label: keywords section

OBI:0200010.definition: A loess scale group transformation one-channel is a loess scale group transformation consisting in the application of a scale adjustment following a loess group transformation one-channel, to render the M group variances similar.
OBI:0200010.label: loess scale group transformation one-channel

IAO:0000639.definition: A part of a document about work in other publications that is relevant to the content of the document.
IAO:0000639.label: related work section

IAO:0000638.definition: A textual entity that expresses the pre-publication history (submission dates, reviewer comments, etc) for a document, often including a hyperlink to a web page detailing the information.
IAO:0000638.label: pre-publication history textual entity

OBI:0001781.definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001781.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells

OBI:0001780.definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001780.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells

OBI:0001783.definition: An assay of epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001783.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells

OBI:0001782.definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001782.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells

OBI:0001969.definition: biodiversity assessment objective is an objective of a planned process aimed at producing data item whose interpretation should provide insight about variety of biological species found in a biological sample at macroscopic or microscopic level
OBI:0001969.label: biodiversity assessment objective

OBI:0001968.definition: Operational Taxonomic Unit matrix  is a data item, organized as a table, where organismal taxonomic units, computed by sequence analysis and genetic distance calculation, are counted in a set of biological or environmental samples. The table is  used to appraise biodiversity of a population or community of living organism.
OBI:0001968.label: operational taxonomic unit matrix

OBI:0001787.definition: An assay of epitope specific vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001787.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells

OBI:0001786.definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001786.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells

OBI:0001789.definition: An assay of epitope specific RANTES production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001789.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific RANTES production by T cells

OBI:0001964.definition: An objective specification which what includes a description of two or more alternative actions to take in a particular situation and a metric that enables comparisons of the two actions. The objective specified is achieved in a planned process which includes a data transformation, the output of which is an identification of the 'best' choice according to the metric.
OBI:0001964.label: decision-theoretic analysis objective

OBI:0001967.definition: A multiplexing sequence identifier is a nucleic acid sequence which is used in a ligation step of library preparation process to allow pooling of samples while maintaining ability to identify individual source material and creation of a multiplexed library
OBI:0001967.label: multiplexing sequence identifier

OBI:0001966.definition: is a data transformation which uses sequence alignment and  'multiplex identifier sequence' information to pull together all reads belonging to a given single sample following the sequencing of a multiplexed library which combining several samples in one sequencing event
OBI:0001966.label: sequence library deconvolution

OBI:0001961.definition: a PCR program is a plan specification which is executed during a polymerase chain reaction (PCR) by a thermocycler instrument that will iterate through the changes in temperature and duration of each of the annealing, denaturation, elongation steps for as many times as specified by the program.
OBI:0001961.label: PCR program

OBI:0001960.synonyms: environmental gene survey;targeted gene survey DNA barcoding;targeted gene survey
OBI:0001960.definition: An assay that dteremines taxonomic and community diversity information by sequencing specific genomic regions used as marker of identity or diversity.
OBI:0001960.label: taxonomic diversity assessment by targeted gene survey

OBI:0001963.definition: is a directive information specifying a genomic region, possibly located in a coding genomic region, which is the focus of a planned process such as an assay, for instance in a environmental gene survey
OBI:0001963.label: target subfragment specification

OBI:0001962.definition: is a directive information specifying a coding genomic region which is the focus of a planned process such as an assay, for instance in a environmental gene survey
OBI:0001962.label: target gene specification

OBI:0000562.definition: An anion trap column is a trap column and ion-exchange column which contains cationic anion-exchange resins.
OBI:0000562.label: anion trap column

OBI:0000563.definition: A single wavelength detector, where the excitation light wavelength is normally a mercury lamp generated high intensity UV light at 253.7 nm. Many substances that fluoresce will be excited by light of this wavelength and hence be detected.
OBI:0000563.label: fluorescene detector

OBI:0000560.definition: An ion exchange column is a chromatography column that is used in ion exchange chromatography and anion or cation exchange resins to enable separation.
OBI:0000560.label: ion exchange column

OBI:0000561.definition: An NMR probe that is manufactured by Bruker.
OBI:0000561.label: Bruker NMR probe

OBI:0000566.definition: An Instrument which is used to carry out a NMR analysis of some sample.
OBI:0000566.label: NMR instrument

OBI:0000567.definition: An NMR magnet manufactured by Bruker that ensures field homogeneity without amplified effects from vibrations or thermal changes. This magnet technology uses active shielding and optimizes coil design.
OBI:0000567.label: Bruker UltraShield NMR magnet

OBI:0000564.definition: The Eagle is a 4 mm 1H/X solid-state MAS probe with a top spinning speed of 18 kHz. Its simple design is robust, reliable and easy to spin. Configurations are available for 200 to 600 MHz wide bore magnets on Tecmag, Bruker, Chemagnetics, JEOL and Varian spectrometers.
OBI:0000564.label: tecmag EAGLE probe

OBI:0000565.definition: The electrical conductivity detector measures the conductivity of the mobile phase. There is usually background conductivity which must be backed-off by suitable electronic adjustments. If the mobile phase contains buffers, the detector gives a base signal that completely overwhelms that from any solute usually making detection impossible. Thus, the electrical conductivity detector a bulk property detector. and senses all ions whether they are from a solute or from the mobile phase. In order to prevent polarization of the sensing electrodes, AC voltages must be used and so it is the impedance not the resistance of the electrode system that is actually measured. From a physical chemistry stand point the conductivity of a solution is more important than its resistance. However, it is the resistance (impedance) of the electrode system that determines the current across it. The resistance of any conductor varies directly as its length and inversely as its cross sectional area.
OBI:0000565.label: electrical conductivity detector

OBI:0001561.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal effective concentration (EC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001561.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring half maximal effective concentration [EC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001560.definition: An assay that measures the affinity of a ligand to a MHC in a cell lysate preparation and that quantifies the affinity with a binding constant.
OBI:0001560.label: obsolete cell lysate MHC binding constant determination assay

OBI:0000568.definition: The seal made by a piston in a diaphragm pump. The unique property of the reciprocating diaphragm pump is that the actuating piston does not come into direct contact with the mobile phase and thus, the demands on the piston-cylinder seal are not so great. The diaphragm has a relatively high surface area and thus, the movement of the diaphragm is relatively small and consequently the pump can be operated at a fairly high frequency. High frequency pumping results in a very significant reduction in pulse amplitude and, in addition, high frequency pulses are more readily damped by the column system. Nevertheless, it must be emphasized that diaphragm pumps are not pulseless.
OBI:0000568.label: piston-seal

OBI:0000569.definition: A mass selective detector is a GC detector that uses mass spectrometry. It is based upon the ionization of solute molecules in the ion source and the separation of the ions generated on the basis of their mass/charge ratio by an analyzer unit. This may be a magnetic sector analyzer, a quadruple mass filter, or an ion trap. Ions are detected by a dynode electron multiplier.
OBI:0000569.label: mass selective detector

OBI:0001565.definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001565.label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001564.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation and provides IC50 values determined under assay conditions where the IC50 approximates a KD value.
OBI:0001564.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex approximated by IC50 using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001567.definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand binding off rate measurement (koff) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001567.label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay measuring binding off rate [koff] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001566.definition: A binding datum that specifies the temperature at which half of the binding partners are forming a complex and the other half are unbound.
OBI:0001566.label: 50% dissociation of binding temperature (Tm)

OBI:0001769.definition:
An Investigation agent role borne by a person or organization which 
is realized in a specimen collection process.
OBI:0001769.label: specimen collector role

OBI:0001768.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001768.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells

OBI:0001763.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001763.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells

OBI:0001762.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001762.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells

OBI:0001761.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001761.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells

OBI:0001760.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001760.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 13 production by T cells

OBI:0001767.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001767.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells

OBI:0001343.definition: An assay of epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001343.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells

OBI:0001765.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001765.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells

OBI:0001764.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001764.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells

OBI:0000968.definition: A material entity that is designed to perform a function in a scientific investigation, but is not a reagent.
OBI:0000968.label: device

OBI:0000969.definition: a directive information entity that describes the dose that will be administered to a target
OBI:0000969.label: dose specification

OBI:0000966.definition: An assay in which a measurement is made by observing entities located in an organism.
OBI:0000966.label: in live organism assay

OBI:0000967.definition: A device that can be used to restrict the location of material entities over time
OBI:0000967.label: container

OBI:0000964.definition: An assay in which a measurement is made by observing entities located in a live cell.
OBI:0000964.label: in live cell assay

OBI:0000965.definition: a specimen that is output of a lyophilization storage process in which specimen is lyophilized for storage.
OBI:0000965.label: lyophilized specimen

OBI:0000962.definition: An objective specification which is fulfilled by the provision of some training.
OBI:0000962.label: training objective

OBI:0000963.definition: A label that is part of a categorical datum and that indicates the value of the data item on the categorical scale.
OBI:0000963.label: categorical label

OBI:0000960.definition: A function that is realized when a reagent is automatically added to some research material.
OBI:0000960.label: reagent application function

OBI:0000961.definition: A reagent application function that is realized when a molecular tracer, such as an antibody or probe is automatically transferred to a biological specimen.
OBI:0000961.label: addition of molecular tracer function

OBI:0000144.definition: a trial monitor role charged recommending whether to continue, modify, or end the trial
OBI:0000144.label: role of independent data monitoring committee

OBI:0000145.definition: a worker role of being responsible for making the histopathology diagnoses associated with data from a study; this activity occurs outside the study timeline
OBI:0000145.label: pathologist role

OBI:0000146.definition: a device that is designed for collecting 90% of the supernatant in a microplate well and separating the living cell with no stress, eliminating centrifugation and other similar techniques. It can be used in a variety of release assays with different radioactive isotopes, such as Cr51 or I125.
OBI:0000146.label: supernatant collection system harvesting frame

OBI:0001346.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001346.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells

OBI:0000140.definition: Label role is a role which inheres in a material entity and which is realized in a detection of label assay
OBI:0000140.label: obsolete_label role

OBI:0000143.definition: a reference participant role which is realized by making the reference to qualities at the start of the study or intervention
OBI:0000143.label: baseline participant role

OBI:0001389.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001389.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells

OBI:0000439.definition: a material entity resulting from the polymerization of agarose after heating agarose suspended in some buffer solution
OBI:0000439.label: agarose gel

OBI:0000364.definition:
An ion detector is a device that measures and records
the charge induced or current produced when an ion passes by or hits a
surface. 

Example: In a scanning instrument the signal produced in the detector
during the course of the scan versus where the instrument is in the
scan (at what m/Q) will produce a mass spectrum, a record of ions as a
function of m/Q.
OBI:0000364.label: ion detector

OBI:0000366.definition: An assay that detects and identifies chemical entities resulting from biochemical and cellular metabolism
OBI:0000366.label: metabolite profiling assay

OBI:0000367.definition: A light emission function is an excitation function to excite a material to a specific excitation state that it emits light.
OBI:0000367.label: light emission function

OBI:0000361.definition:
An ion source is a device that is part of a mass
spectrometer that ionizes the material under analysis. The ions are
then transported by magnetic or electric fields to the mass analyzer.
Techniques for ionization have been key to determining what types of
samples can be analyzed by mass spectrometry. Electron ionization and
chemical ionization are used for gases and vapors. In chemical
ionization sources, the material is ionized by chemical ion-molecule
reactions during collisions in the source. Two techniques often used
with liquid and solid biological samples include electrospray
ionization (due to John Fenn PMID 2675315.) and matrix-assisted laser
desorption/ionization (MALDI, due to M. Karas and F. Hillenkamp
(Measuring Mass: From Positive Rays to Proteins by Michael A. Grayson
(Editor) (ISBN 0-941901-31-9))).
OBI:0000361.label: ion source

OBI:0000368.definition: A record function is a function that registers or collects information in a particular format on a particular recording medium. For example on paper or a digital representation
OBI:0000368.label: record function

OBI:0000369.definition: A magnify function is a function to increase the size of a transmitted object image through the precise arrangement of energy diffraction elements along an imaging path.
OBI:0000369.label: magnify function

OBI:0001388.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells.
OBI:0001388.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells

OBI:1110154.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:1110154.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells

OBI:0302888.definition: washing is a process by which a material entity acting as  contaminant (e.g. excess staining reagent) is removed by application of one or more cycles of solution in flow.
OBI:0302888.label: washing

OBI:0302889.definition: irradiation is a process by which a material entity is exposed to radiative energy, which could be ionizing radiation (such as gamma rays or X-rays)  or not such as UV light or microwaves
OBI:0302889.label: irradiation

OBI:0302886.definition: centrifugation is a process separating molecules by size or density using centrifugal forces generated by a spinning rotor. G-forces of several hundred thousand times gravity are generated in ultracentrifugation
OBI:0302886.label: centrifugation

OBI:0302887.definition: Staining is a process which results in the addition a class-specific (DNA, proteins, lipids, carbohydrates) dye to a substrate to qualify or quantify the presence of a specific compound.
OBI:0302887.label: staining

OBI:0302884.definition: A material separation in which a desired component of an input material is separated from the remainder
OBI:0302884.label: extraction

OBI:0302885.definition: filtration is a process which separates components suspended in a fluid based on granularity properties relying on a filter device
OBI:0302885.label: filtration

OBI:0600029.definition: a protocol which results in the separation of supernatant material from a cell culture
OBI:0600029.label: isolation of cell culture supernatant

OGMS:0000090.definition: A processual entity whose completion is hypothesized (by a healthcare provider) to alleviate the signs and symptoms associated with a disorder
OGMS:0000090.label: treatment

OBI:0000912.definition: A 3D structure determination assay in which the diffraction of pattern of X-ray beams in a crystal of purified material entities is used to resolve the 3-dimensional structure of the material entity of interest.
OBI:0000912.label: X-ray crystallography assay

OBI:0600028.definition: a protocol with the objective to transcribe single-stranded RNA into complementary DNA (cDNA)
OBI:0600028.label: artificially induced reverse transcription

OBI:0000345.definition: A Mass analyzer is a device that separates ions according to their mass-to-charge ratio. All mass spectrometers are based on dynamics of charged particles in electric and magnetic fields in vacuum where the two laws of Lorentz force law and Newton's second law of motion apply.
OBI:0000345.label: mass analyzer

OBI:0002449.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a footprinting assay.
OBI:0002449.label: footprinting assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001365.definition: A study design that aims to study the processes that are carried out at the cellular level, but are not necessarily restricted to a single cell. For example, cell communication occurs among more than one cell, but occurs at the cellular level.
OBI:0001365.label: cellular process design

GO:0008283.definition: The multiplication or reproduction of cells, resulting in the expansion of a cell population.
GO:0008283.label: cell proliferation

OBI:0500024.definition: a  standard compliance rule is a compliance rule which defines conformity to a representation standard
OBI:0500024.label: standard compliance rule

OBI:1110153.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:1110153.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells

OBI:0100035.definition: a cell derived from a multicellular organism that has the potential to replicate indefinitely
OBI:0100035.label: obsolete_immortal cell

OBI:0000343.definition: a interpreting data that is used to ascribe properties or relations to types based on an observation instance (i.e., on a number of observations or experiences); or to formulate laws based on limited observations of recurring phenomenal patterns.
OBI:0000343.label: inductive reasoning

GO:0006974.definition: Any process that results in a change in state or activity of a cell (in terms of movement, secretion, enzyme production, gene expression, etc.) as a result of a stimulus indicating damage to its DNA from environmental insults or errors during metabolism.
GO:0006974.label: cellular response to DNA damage stimulus

OBI:0600025.definition: An assay that detects a specified substance
OBI:0600025.label: substance detection assay

GO:0071605.definition: The appearance of monocyte chemotactic protein-1 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0071605.label: monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production

OBI:0000210.definition: A digital entity intended to capture data in analytical cytology domain.
OBI:0000210.label: analytical cytology data file

OBI:0000211.definition: Proxy respondent is a worker role of describing patient's symptoms or condition to medical personnel
OBI:0000211.label: proxy respondent role

IAO:0000330.definition: A document part that describes  legal restrictions on making or distributing copies of the document
IAO:0000330.label: copyright section

OBI:0000213.definition: A fluorescence compensation matrix is a square matrix which is used as the left multiplier of the vector of fluorescence values while performing digital fluorescence compensation. Also, fluorescence compensation matrix is the inverse of the fluorescence spillover matrix.
OBI:0000213.label: fluorescence compensation matrix

OBI:0000214.definition: a reference role in which the characteristics or responses elicited by the substance playing the reference substance role are used to establish a "no effect" response
OBI:0000214.label: negative reference substance role

OBI:0000215.definition: a role which inheres in a human or organization who are able subject to applicable law to consent, on behalf of a prospective subject, to the subject`s participation in as clinical trial.
OBI:0000215.label: role of legally acceptable representative

OBI:0001518.definition: A process of tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001518.label: epitope specific tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production by T cells

OBI:0600026.definition: An assay that measures the mass of a material at two or more time points
OBI:0600026.label: longitudinal mass measurement assay

OBI:0001364.definition: a genetic characteristics information that is about known changes or the lack thereof from the genetic background, including allele information, duplication, insertion, deletion, etc.
OBI:0001364.label: genetic alteration information

IAO:0000100.definition: A data item that is an aggregate of other data items of the same type that have something in common. Averages and distributions can be determined for data sets.
IAO:0000100.label: data set

OBI:0002115.definition: A cytometry assay in which the presence of molecules of interest on or in cells is indicated by binding of antibodies labeled with rare earth element tags which are detected by time-of-flight mass spectrometry.
OBI:0002115.label: cytometry time of flight assay

OBI:0600020.definition: An assay that uses visual examination of cells or tissue (or images of them) to make an assessment regarding a quality of the cells or tissue. This assay can include steps of staining, imaging, and judgement.
OBI:0600020.label: histological assay

OBI:0002442.definition: A footprinting assay that uses the reaction of hydroxyl radicals with side-chain sites in molecules (proteins, DNA, etc)_ with the resultant mass shift demonstrating the site of modification, used to_ to asses the accessibility of that site.
OBI:0002442.label: hydroxyl-radical footprinting assay

OBI:0200164.definition: A proportion of expected false positives correction method is a multiple testing procedure that controls the ratio of the expected value of the numbers of false positives to the expected value of the numbers of rejected hypotheses.
OBI:0200164.label: proportion of expected false positives correction method

OBI:1110013.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:1110013.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells

OBI:0002117.definition: A DNA sequencing assay that intends to provide information about the sequence of an entire genome of an organism.
OBI:0002117.label: whole genome sequencing assay

IAO:0000105.definition: A digital document is a digital entity consisting of an electronic file which can be rendered into human-readable form by one or more computational applications.  The digital document does not refer to the information content of the document but to an instance of the file.
IAO:0000105.label: obsolete2_digital document

OBI:0002440.definition: A chromosome conformation capture assay that detects genome-wide chromosomal interactions. High-throughput techniques are used to sequence the ligated fragments after cross-linking and cutting with restriction enzymes.
OBI:0002440.label: Hi-C assay

UBERON:0000481.definition: Anatomical structure that has as its parts two or more portions of tissue of at least two different types and which through specific morphogenetic processes forms a single distinct structural unit demarcated by bona-fide boundaries from other distinct structural units of different types.
UBERON:0000481.label: multi-tissue structure

OBI:0001363.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-23 production by T cells.
OBI:0001363.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells

UBERON:0001874.definition: Subcortical nucleus of telencephalic , which together with the caudate nucleus, forms the striatum. The putamen lies lateral to the internal capsule and medial to the external medullary lamina, and is separated from the caudate nucleus by the fibers of the internal capsule for most of its length, except at its anterior portion.
UBERON:0001874.label: putamen

UBERON:0002097.definition: The organ covering the body that consists of the dermis and epidermis.
UBERON:0002097.label: skin of body

OBI:0302908.definition: is a planned process with specified input original document and specified output edited document
OBI:0302908.label: document editing

PATO:0001385.definition: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's containing a non-integral multiple of the monoploid number, due to extra or missing chromosomes.
PATO:0001385.label: aneuploid

UBERON:0001873.definition: Subcortical nucleus of telecephalic origin consisting of an elongated gray mass lying lateral to and bordering the lateral ventricle. It is divided into a head, body and tail in some species.
UBERON:0001873.label: caudate nucleus

OBI:0001510.definition: A mass spectrometry of MHC ligands that identifies eluted ligands from secreted MHC.
OBI:0001510.label: mass spectrometry assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation of MHC ligands eluted from secreted MHC

OBI:0302906.definition: a material separation process by which repetitive genomic DNA is removed during the construction of cDNA library.
OBI:0302906.label: DNA Subtraction

OBI:0001512.definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17A production assay that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001512.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17A production by T cells

OBI:0001514.definition: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the lowest concentration at which a specific compound significantly inhibits a process from occurring compared to in the absence of the compound.
OBI:0001514.label: minimal inhibitory concentration

OBI:0001515.definition: A material processing service in which a service provider makes physical modifications to a specified input material, such that at least one of the specified outputs of this process is a modified version of a specified input material.
OBI:0001515.label: material maintenance service

OBI:0001516.definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand binding half maximal effective concentration (EC50) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001516.label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay measuring half maximal effective concentration [EC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001528.definition: A service which has a material entity as specified input and/or specified output.
OBI:0001528.label: material service

OBI:0302900.definition: A group assignment which relies on chance to assign materials to a group of materials in order to avoid bias in experimental set up.
OBI:0302900.label: group randomization

CHEBI:37972.definition: The radioactive isotope of phosphorus with relative atomic mass 31.973907 and half-life of 14.26 days.
CHEBI:37972.label: phosphorus-32 atom

CHEBI:37973.definition: The radioactive isotope of phosphorus with relative atomic mass 32.971725, half-life of 25.34 days and nuclear spin (1)/2.
CHEBI:37973.label: phosphorus-33 atom

OBI:0000915.definition: A storage process in temperature that maintenance the frozen status of the stored entities.
OBI:0000915.label: freezing storage

OBI:0200012.definition: A loess scale group transformation two-channel is a loess scale group transformation consisting in the application of a scale adjustment following a loess group transformation two-channel, to render the M group variances similar.
OBI:0200012.label: loess scale group transformation two-channel

OBI:0002326.definition: A categorical value specification that is an assessment of the stage of a gynecologic cancer according to the International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) staging systems.
OBI:0002326.label: International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics cervical cancer stage value specification

GO:0051276.definition: A process that is carried out at the cellular level that results in the assembly, arrangement of constituent parts, or disassembly of chromosomes, structures composed of a very long molecule of DNA and associated proteins that carries hereditary information. This term covers covalent modifications at the molecular level as well as spatial relationships among the major components of a chromosome.
GO:0051276.label: chromosome organization

PATO:0000384.definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population whose sex organs contain only male gametes.
PATO:0000384.label: male

GO:0035944.definition: The appearance of a perforin protein due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0035944.label: perforin production

GO:0032623.definition: The appearance of interleukin-2 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032623.label: interleukin-2 production

GO:0032622.definition: The appearance of interleukin-19 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032622.label: interleukin-19 production

GO:0032621.definition: The appearance of interleukin-18 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032621.label: interleukin-18 production

GO:0032620.definition: The appearance of any member of the interleukin-17 family of cytokines due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032620.label: interleukin-17 production

OBI:0400081.definition: Part of the fluidics subsystem. A particle delivery vessel is used to introduce either a single sample or multiple samples to a flow cytometer. The most common particle delivery vessel is a sample tube.
OBI:0400081.label: particle delivery vessel

GO:0032626.definition: The appearance of interleukin-22 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032626.label: interleukin-22 production

GO:0032625.definition: The appearance of interleukin-21 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032625.label: interleukin-21 production

GO:0032624.definition: The appearance of interleukin-20 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032624.label: interleukin-20 production

GO:0032629.definition: The appearance of interleukin-25 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032629.label: interleukin-25 production

GO:0032628.definition: The appearance of interleukin-24 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032628.label: interleukin-24 production

OBI:0400089.definition: A Reflection is a sorter manufactured by iCyte. It uses digital signal processing, and can be configured with lasers of the users choice from among these excitation wavelengths: 355, 405,488, 532, 635nm. It accommodates up to 48 traditional PMTs. Options include an acousto-optical tunable filter (AOTF) and 16 channel spectrometer (370 to 730 nm). The various detection components can be uniquely configured across multiple Highly Automated Parallel Sorting (HAPS) modules. The Reflection can be used to analyse, sort, and collect cells.
OBI:0400089.label: Reflection

OBI:0400088.definition: A flow cell in which the laser irradiates the cell as it passes through a quartz cuvette. A quartz cuvette flow chamber can be used to allow the laser to irradiate cells.
OBI:0400088.label: quartz cuvette flow chamber

OBI:1110095.definition: A material separation where blood is taken from an organism.
OBI:1110095.label: blood harvesting

OBI:1110094.definition: The process of an epitope that is part of or derived from an immunogen coming into contact with adaptive immune cells resulting in these cells acquiring immune effector functions specific for the epitope.
OBI:1110094.label: immunization

OBI:0002219.definition: A histologic grade for ovarian tumor that is from a histological classification by the World Health Organization (WHO).
OBI:0002219.label: histologic grade for ovarian tumor according to the World Health Organization

OBI:1110091.definition: A role inhering in a material entity that is covalently bound to an epitope in order to increase the epitopes immunogenicity.
OBI:1110091.label: immune epitope carrier role

OBI:1110093.definition: Is a role borne by an agent, and realized when in contact with or inside another organism in which it is capable of replicating and causing disease
OBI:1110093.label: disposition to infect an organism

OBI:1110092.definition: Adjuvant role is a role that inheres in a material entity and which is realized through a process of modifying a biological response.
OBI:1110092.label: adjuvant role

OBI:0002210.definition: A categorical value specification that is a histologic grade assigned to a tumor slide specimen according to the Fuhrman Nuclear Grading System.
OBI:0002210.label: histologic grade according to the Fuhrman Nuclear Grading System

OBI:1110099.definition: A cell line derived from mouse fibroblasts.
OBI:1110099.label: L cell line

OBI:0002215.definition: A categorical value specification that is a histologic grade assigned to a ovarian tumor.
OBI:0002215.label: histologic grade for ovarian tumor

UBERON:0000956.definition: The thin layer of gray matter on the surface of the cerebral hemisphere that develops from the telencephalon. It consists of the neocortex (6 layered cortex or isocortex), the hippocampal formation and the olfactory cortex.
UBERON:0000956.label: cerebral cortex

OBI:0200076.definition: A column submatrix extraction is a submatrix extraction where all the rows of the input matrix are retained and selection only occurs on the columns.
OBI:0200076.label: column submatrix extraction

GO:0001906.definition: Any process in an organism that results in the killing of its own cells or those of another organism, including in some cases the death of the other organism. Killing here refers to the induction of death in one cell by another cell, not cell-autonomous death due to internal or other environmental conditions.
GO:0001906.label: cell killing

OBI:0200077.definition: Gating is a property-based vector selection with the objective of partitioning a data vector set into vector subsets based on dimension values of individual vectors (events), in which vectors represent individual physical particles (often cells) of a sample and dimension values represent light intensity qualities as measured by flow cytometry.
OBI:0200077.label: gating

OBI:0002072.definition: A MHC:ligand binding assay that detects qualitative binding.
OBI:0002072.label: assay measuring qualitiative binding of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0000816.definition: An electrode of very fine caliber consisting usually of a fine wire or a glass tube of capillary diameter drawn to a fine point and filled with saline or a metal used in physiological experiments to stimulate or record action currents of extracellular or intracellular origin in the nervous system.
OBI:0000816.label: micro electrode

OBI:0002070.definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay that is performed in vivo.
OBI:0002070.label: in vivo assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells

OBI:0002071.definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay that is performed on cells in vitro.
OBI:0002071.label: in vitro assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells

OBI:0002076.definition: A material entity that has two or more specimens as its parts.
OBI:0002076.label: collection of specimens

IAO:0000409.definition: A denotator type indicates how a term should be interpreted from an ontological perspective.
IAO:0000409.label: denotator type

OBI:0002074.definition: T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects suppression of an in vitro response.
OBI:0002074.label: in vitro assay measuring T cell epitope specific suppression

OBI:0001818.definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001818.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells

OBI:0002078.definition: A specimen collection process that generates multiple specimens from one source (e.g. one organism) during a time period which for the purpose of the study can be considered to be taken at the same sampling time.
OBI:0002078.label: specimen set collection process

OBI:0002079.definition: A collection of specimens that is collected from one source (e.g. one organism) during a time period which for the purpose of the study can be considered to be taken at the same sampling time.
OBI:0002079.label: specimens collected in one encounter

IAO:0000400.definition: A cartesian spatial coordinate datum is a representation of a point in a spatial region, in which equal changes in the magnitude of a coordinate value denote length qualities with the same magnitude
IAO:0000400.label: cartesian spatial coordinate datum

IAO:0000401.definition: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses one value to specify a position along a one dimensional spatial region
IAO:0000401.label: one dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum

IAO:0000402.definition: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses two values to specify a position within a two dimensional spatial region
IAO:0000402.label: two dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum

IAO:0000403.definition: A cartesion spatial coordinate datum that  uses three values to specify a position within a three dimensional spatial region
IAO:0000403.label: three dimensional cartesian spatial coordinate datum

A droplet sorter is part_of a flow cytometer sorter that converts the carrier fluid stream into individual droplets, and these droplets are directed into separate locations for recovery (enriching the original

OBI:0200108.definition: An eh transformation is a data transformation obtained by applying the function EH described in what follows to a (one dimensional) real number input. EH(x)=exp(x*d/r)+b*(d/r)*x-1, if x>=0, and EH(x)=-exp(-x*d/r)+b*(d/r)*x+1, otherwise. Here exp denotes an exponential transformation and b, d, r are positive real constants with the objective of normalization.
OBI:0200108.label: eh transformation

OBI:0000517.definition: A magnet which induces a certain frequency (MHz) and which has a certain bore diameter.\n  alt The NMR signal is a natural physical property of the certain atomic nuclei but it can only be detected with an external magnetic field. A magnet is a fundamental part of an NMR instrument which induces an electromagnetic force field (RF pulse) and by this excites and aligns the spins of the electrons of the NMR acquisition nucleus. It is usually a big (superconducting) electromagnet which is cooled by liquid helium and can be adjusted to a frequency between 200 and 950 MHz. The magnetic field strength is measured in Tesla or Gauss.
OBI:0000517.label: NMR magnet

OBI:0000516.definition: Part of an NMR instrument that detects the signals emitted from a sample. No single probe can perform the full range of experiments, and probes that are designed to perform more than one type of measurement usually suffer from performance compromises. The probe represents a rather fragile single point of failure that can render an NMR system completely unusable if the probe is dropped or otherwise damaged. Probes are usually characterised by Sample diameter and Frequency.\n  alt The instrument that transmits and receives radiofrequency to and from the NMR sample.
OBI:0000516.label: NMR probe

OBI:0000515.definition: A chromatofocusing column is a chromatography column in which a resin is equilibrated at one pH and eluted at a second pH. The use of a weak ion-exchange resin causes a pH gradient to be formed at the solvent front owing to the buffering action of the resin. This pH gradient in turn leads to an ordering of proteins by isoelectric point. Molecules of charge sign opposite the resin bind; those of charge sign like the resin do not bind.
OBI:0000515.label: chromatofocusing column

OBI:0000514.definition: A series of older Bruker NMR magnets, now out of production. The Bruker AMX500 has proven an extremely reliable workhorse, with excellent lineshape yielding superior water suppression even without gradients. The Oxford 11.7 Tesla 5.2 cm bore magnet rests on a TMC vibration damping table. Homogeneity is controlled by a BSN-18 and BSN-2 with 19 shim controls. In addition to the 5 mm triple resonance probe, the AMX is equipped with a 10mm broadband observe probe.
OBI:0000514.label: Bruker AMX series NMR instrument

OBI:0000513.definition: The Discovery console is a Windows XP Professional-based, integrated console designed especially for Solid-State NMR. The console includes everything needed to interface to any magnet and solids probe - from computer to cables to duplexing network.
OBI:0000513.label: DISCOVERY console

OBI:0000689.definition:
is a DNA sequencer which is manufactured by 454 Life Science Corporation and enables pyrosequencing to be performed. It comprises both optics and fluidics subsystems, which are
controlled by a computer subsystem. The fluidics subsystem ensures accurate reagent dispensing. It consists of a reagents cassette (which holds the reagent containers), a sipper manifold, pumps, valves, and debubblers. The fluidics subsystem flows the sequencing reagents across the wells of the PicoTiterPlate device, and moves the spent reagents from the PicoTiterPlate device to the waste receptacle. The optics subsystem consists of a CCD camera and a camera controller. The camera captures the light emitted in the wells of the PicoTiterPlate device during each step of the sequencing cycle, and sends the digital images to the computer subsystem for processing. The computer controls the other Sequencer subsystems, and processes the digital images sent by the camera to extract the DNA sequence information.
OBI:0000689.label: 454 Genome Sequence 20

OBI:0000990.definition: A microscope that produces an image of an object by targeting it with an electron beam
OBI:0000990.label: electron microscope

OBI:0000997.definition: The collection of material entities and their qualities that are located near a live organism, tissue or cell and can influence its growth.
OBI:0000997.label: growth environment

OBI:0000996.definition: an objective which aims to create a device with a specified function
OBI:0000996.label: device creation objective

OBI:0000995.definition: The directed combination of a material entity with a specimen.
OBI:0000995.label: administration of material to specimen

OBI:0000994.definition: is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the vein (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe
OBI:0000994.label: intravenous injection

CHEBI:31643.definition: A non-ionic gadolinium chelate having a macrocyclic tetraamine framework. It is used as a paramagnetic contrast agent in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
CHEBI:31643.label: gadoteridol

OBI:0001360.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001360.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells

OBI:0000171.definition: is the transplantation of tissue from one part of \nthe body to another in the same individual. )
OBI:0000171.label: autotransplantation

OBI:0001716.definition: complement-dependent cytotoxicity resulting from antibody binding to epitope
OBI:0001716.label: B cell epitope specific complement-dependent cytotoxicity

OBI:0001488.definition: An efficacy of epitope intervention experiment that tests the ability of the intervention to decrease an existing immune response
OBI:0001488.label: epitope tolerance induction experiment

OBI:0000172.definition: A measurement datum measuring the minimal signal that must be detected to generate an electrical event, as compared to the maximal detected signal in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role
OBI:0000172.label: parameter threshold

OBI:0000175.definition: A quantitative confidence value that represents the probability of obtaining a result at least as extreme as that actually obtained, assuming that the actual value was the result of chance alone.
OBI:0000175.label: p-value

OBI:0000174.definition: a study population role where the bearer is a population of material entities and the role is realized in the implementation of a study design wherein the entities bearing the study population role are observed or subjected to intervention according to the study design and are biological replicates, i.e. they receive the same treatment under the protocol
OBI:0000174.label: study group role

CHEBI:59050.definition: The dimethyl ester of sulfuric acid.
CHEBI:59050.label: dimethyl sulfate

OBI:0001482.definition: An assay of epitope specifictransforming growth factor-beta production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001482.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells

OBI:0001483.definition: A planned process that collects cells from culture.
OBI:0001483.label: cell collecting

OBI:0001480.definition: Phage display library panning is a process in which a diverse collection of phages encoding peptides or proteins are screened and the ones encoding active peptides/proteins are selected in an iterative process similar to natural selection.
OBI:0001480.label: phage display library panning

OBI:0001481.definition: A lowess transformation where the same normalization curve is used for all members of the data set; e.g. Features on an array, picked spots on a gel, or measured metabolites in a sample.
OBI:0001481.label: lowess global transformation

OBI:0001486.definition: Is the disposition borne by a material entity that is realized in a process of being bound in the antigen binding grove of an MHC protein complex.
OBI:0001486.label: disposition to be bound by an MHC protein complex

OBI:0001714.definition: immunoglobulin-mediated neutralization resulting from antibody binding to epitope
OBI:0001714.label: B cell epitope specific immunoglobulin-mediated neutralization

OBI:0001484.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity determination assay that uses an in vivo intervention experiment.
OBI:0001484.label: biological activity assay measuring T cell epitope specific in vivo activity

OBI:0001485.definition: A mixture containing MHC molecules that was purified to remove non-MHC molecular entities.
OBI:0001485.label: purified MHC molecule preparation

SO:0000104.definition: A sequence of amino acids linked by peptide bonds which may lack appreciable tertiary structure and may not be liable to irreversible denaturation.
SO:0000104.label: polypeptide

OBI:0000429.definition: The administration of a substance into the peritoneum of an organism
OBI:0000429.label: intraperitoneal administration

GO:0035399.definition: Positive regulation of a B cell mediated immune response mediated via cytokine production by a helper T cell.
GO:0035399.label: helper T cell enhancement of B cell mediated immune response

OBI:0000423.definition: an extract is a material entity which results from an extraction process
OBI:0000423.label: extract

OBI:0000669.definition: A cell proliferation assay in which cells are cultured in the presence of tritiated thymidine which is incorporated into newly synthesized DNA of replicating cells (during the S phase of the cell cycle).
