The radioactivity of tritiated thymidine in a cell is a proxy for cells that were actively replicating.
OBI:0000669.label: tritiated thymidine incorporation assay

GO:0005216.definition: Enables the facilitated diffusion of an ion (by an energy-independent process) by passage through a transmembrane aqueous pore or channel without evidence for a carrier-mediated mechanism. May be either selective (it enables passage of a specific ion only) or non-selective (it enables passage of two or more ions of same charge but different size).
GO:0005216.label: ion channel activity

OBI:0000420.definition: A material entity that has undergone a process of digestion with trypsin
OBI:0000420.label: obsolete_trypsinized material

OBI:0000355.definition: is an investigation with the goal to test one or more hypothesis
OBI:0000355.label: hypothesis driven investigation

OBI:0000426.definition: injection is process which aims at introducing a compound or a mixture into a material entity (either biological entity or instrument) by relying on devices such as syringe or injector connection, attached or forced into a vascular system (veins of an organism or tubes of a machine) or in a tissue.
OBI:0000426.label: injection

OBI:0000425.definition: An averaging objective is a data transformation objective where the aim is to perform mean calculations on the input of the data transformation.
OBI:0000425.label: averaging objective

OBI:0000356.definition: is an investigation in which data is generated and analyzed with the purpose of generating new hypothesis
OBI:0000356.label: hypothesis generating investigation

UBERON:0001264.definition: An endoderm derived structure that produces precursors of digestive enzymes and blood glucose regulating enzymes[GO].
UBERON:0001264.label: pancreas

OBI:0000198.definition: a reference participant role realized by equivalent treatment of participants
OBI:0000198.label: biological replicate role

OBI:0001710.definition: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment.
OBI:0001710.label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from challenge

OBI:0000192.definition: A microtiter_plate is a flat plate with multiple wells used as small test tubes.
OBI:0000192.label: microtiter plate

OBI:0001247.definition: A genotyping assay that uses a high througput sequencer
OBI:0001247.label: genotyping by high throughput sequencing assay

UBERON:0001268.definition: Transudate contained in the peritoneal cavity.
UBERON:0001268.label: peritoneal fluid

OBI:0000196.definition: a role which inheres in a Homo sapiens and is realized during a clinical trial - the impartial witness is independent of the trial and cannot be unfairly influenced by people involved with the trial
OBI:0000196.label: role of impartial witness

CL:0000789.definition: A T cell that expresses an alpha-beta T cell receptor complex.
CL:0000789.label: alpha-beta T cell

OBI:0302876.definition: A material entity that has been going through a process of being put into solution
OBI:0302876.label: dissolved material entity

OBI:0302874.definition: A document which is the output of a document editing process
OBI:0302874.label: edited document

CL:0000786.definition: A terminally differentiated, post-mitotic, antibody secreting cell of the B cell lineage with the phenotype CD138-positive, surface immunonoglobulin-negative, and MHC Class II-negative. Plasma cells are oval or round with extensive rough endoplasmic reticulum, a well-developed Golgi apparatus, and a round nucleus having a characteristic cartwheel heterochromatin pattern and are devoted to producing large amounts of immunoglobulin.
CL:0000786.label: plasma cell

OBI:0002425.definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether radiation was received or is being received for a previous  or current cancer, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process
OBI:0002425.label: radiation treatment exclusion criteria

OBI:0002424.definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether chemotherapy was received or is being received for a previous  or current cancer, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process
OBI:0002424.label: chemotherapy treatment exclusion criterion

OBI:1110012.definition: The process of an allergic disease occurring in an organism.
OBI:1110012.label: occurrence of allergy

OBI:0002427.definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether radiation was received within a certain timeframe, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002427.label: radiation treatment within the recent past exclusion criterion

OBI:0002426.definition: An exclusion criterion that defines whether chemotherapy was received within a certain timeframe, which when met, makes an individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002426.label: chemotherapy treatment within the recent past exclusion criterion

OBI:0001313.definition: A study design which aims to examine the transcriptome of a biological sample by reverse transcription PCR (RT-PCR).
OBI:0001313.label: transcription profiling by RT-PCR design

OBI:0000224.definition: a worker role authorized to make study-related decisions and carry out tasks related to the study; this role occurs during the study timeline
OBI:0000224.label: sub-investigator role

OBI:0000227.definition: a documenting process to encode an information entity into a digital document
OBI:0000227.label: data encoding

OBI:0000221.definition: A dye role that is realized when used to detect live cells in an experiment
OBI:0000221.label: vital dye role

OBI:0000220.definition: a reference subject  role which inheres in an organism or entity of organismal origin so that the characteristics or responses of the participant playing the reference participant role are used for comparison or reference
OBI:0000220.label: reference subject role

OBI:0000223.definition: Is a role which inheres in a material entity which is manufactured to be similar in appearance to a test material entity in e.g. a clinical trial to prevent participants from detecting which is the active and inactive substance
OBI:0000223.label: obsolete_blinded medication role

OBI:0002420.definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is silica.
OBI:0002420.label: exposure to silica history

OBI:0002131.definition: An Illumina methylation BeadChip which is an array that interrogates ~ 850,000 methylation sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.
OBI:0002131.label: Illumina Infinium MethylationEPIC BeadChip

IAO:0000181.definition:
A Venn diagram is a report graph showing all hypothetically possible
logical relations between a finite collection of sets.
IAO:0000181.label: Venn diagram

IAO:0000180.definition:
A heatmap is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data
where the values taken by a variable(s) are shown as colors in a
two-dimensional map.
IAO:0000180.label: heatmap

IAO:0000183.definition:
A dendrogram is a report graph which is a tree diagram
frequently used to illustrate the arrangement of the clusters produced by a
clustering algorithm.
IAO:0000183.label: dendrogram

OBI:0002422.definition: An information content entity  that indicates whether or not  an entity  has met all specific requirements in order to take part in a given process.
OBI:0002422.label: indicator of whether all inclusion criteria were met

IAO:0000185.definition: A photograph is created by projecting an image onto a photosensitive surface such as a chemically treated plate or film, CCD receptor, etc.
IAO:0000185.label: photograph

CHEBI:53526.definition: Thymidine linked to the radioisotope tritium. Used to label DNA in the study of cellular and viral DNA synthesis.
CHEBI:53526.label: tritiated thymidine

IAO:0000186.definition: A photographic print is a material entity upon which a photograph generically depends.
IAO:0000186.label: photographic print

OBI:0001519.definition: A cell lysate MHC binding assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect direct binding.
OBI:0001519.label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0400056.definition: A Influx Cell Sorter is a flow_cytometer_sorter manufactured by Cytopeia. It is a digital machine, with these laser options: Coherent 70, 90, 300 series water cooled lasers, solid state UV 355nm, Violet 408nm, Violet-Blue 479nm, Blue-488nm, Green-531nm, Red-635nm, Red-647nm. The sorting is multi-way, index, and proportional sorting. Filters and PMTs are used for all parameters (including forward light scatter), and up to 12 PMTs can be included. The Influx cell sorter can be used to measure, sort, and collect ndividual cells.
OBI:0400056.label: Influx Cell Sorter

OBI:0002134.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells.
OBI:0002134.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells

OBI:0400054.definition:
The ImageStream is a multispectral_imaging_flow_cytometer manufactured by Amnis. Its has digital electronics, a single standard 488 nm solid state laser. In addition an optional 658 nm and your choice of either a 405 nm or 375 nm solid state laser can be added. Information is collected using cameras. The ImageStream system CCD camera produces six images of each cell, including darkfield, brightfield, and up to four fluorescent colors. Each image is used to calculate over 40 features, so a six-image assay results in ~250 morphometric and photometric features per cell. The ImageStream is a flow cytometer that takes pictures of the cells in flow.
It has both components, an Image cytometer and a flow cytometer.
OBI:0400054.label: Amnis ImageStream

IAO:0000637.definition: A part of the document about the publication history of a document. This section typically details dates of document submission to a journal and dates of any re-submissions as well as reviewer comments and responses to reviewers by the authors.
IAO:0000637.label: pre-publication history section

OBI:0400055.definition: The inFlux Analyzer is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Cytopeia. It is a digital machine, with these laser options: Coherent 70, 90, 300 series water cooled lasers, solid state UV 355nm, Violet 408nm, Violet-Blue 479nm, Blue-488nm, Green-531nm, Red-635nm, Red-647nm. Filters and PMTs are used for all parameters (including forward light scatter), and up to 12 PMTs can be included. The Influx analyser can be used to measure the properties of individual cells.
OBI:0400055.label: inFlux Analyzer

OBI:0400052.definition: A helium-cadmium laser is a metal vapor laser that emits wavelengths of 442, 325 and 354 nms. This laser is a metal vapor laser. A helium-cadmium laser can by used to irradiate cells in a flow cytometer.
OBI:0400052.label: helium cadmium ion laser

IAO:0000635.definition: A part of a document about the patients that participated in a study.
IAO:0000635.label: patients section

OBI:0400053.definition: A helium-neon laser (HeNe) is an ion laser that uses helium and neon gas-ions as lasing medium. HeNe lasers emit at 543 nm and 633 nm most commonly and can also be used at 543, 594, and 611 nm.
OBI:0400053.label: helium neon ion laser

CHEBI:42098.definition: A hydroxy steroid that consists of 5beta-cardanolide having a double bond at the 20(22)-position as well as hydroxy groups at the 3beta-, 12beta- and 14beta-positions. It has been isolated from the plant species of the genus Digitalis.
CHEBI:42098.label: digoxigenin

IAO:0000634.definition: A part of a document containing typically short notes about the document itself and/or the authors. Often the notes section contains subsections related to funding, competing interests, ethical approval, etc.
IAO:0000634.label: notes section

OBI:0002139.definition: A value specification that specifies the volume of some thing.
OBI:0002139.label: volume value specification

OBI:0002133.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0002133.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring  epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production by T cells

OBI:0002138.definition: A value specification that specifies the temperature of some thing.
OBI:0002138.label: temperature value specification

OBI:1000048.definition: a transgenic organism is material entity which derives from an organism which has been modified to express a gene not normally part of it
OBI:1000048.label: transgenic organism

OBI:1000049.definition: A whole organism preparation resulting from a histological preparation known as whole mount preparation where the whole specimen is mounted or spread on the microscope (glass) slide
OBI:1000049.label: whole mount tissue

OBI:0000467.definition: An actively-shielded superconducting magnet from Bruker that combines Bruker BioSpin's advanced, proprietary UltraShield active shielding and UltraStabilized sub-cooling technologies. This shielded and stabilized (US2) magnet system delivers high sensitivity and spectral dispersion.
OBI:0000467.label: Bruker US 2 NMR magnet

UBERON:0002469.definition: A mucosa that is part of a esophagus [Automatically generated definition].
UBERON:0002469.label: esophagus mucosa

OBI:1000042.definition: a material entity synthesized to contain a number of peptides conjugated together in a non-linear fashion
OBI:1000042.label: peptide construct

OBI:0002202.definition: A cannot be assessed determination for histologic tumor grade.
OBI:0002202.label: GX

OBI:0001237.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-21 production by T cells.
OBI:0001237.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells

OBI:0001391.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-12 production by T cells.
OBI:0001391.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-12 production by T cells

GO:0071924.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 (CCL22) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0071924.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production

OBI:0000710.definition: is a DNA sequencer which is manufactured by Li-Cor corporation and enable automated chain termination based DNA sequencing
OBI:0000710.label: Li-Cor 4300 DNA Analysis System

GO:0040029.definition: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of gene expression; the process is mitotically or meiotically heritable, or is stably self-propagated in the cytoplasm of a resting cell, and does not entail a change in DNA sequence.
GO:0040029.label: regulation of gene expression, epigenetic

OBI:0002130.definition: An Illumina BeadChip which is an array that interrogates over 4.3 million whole-genome variants for genotyping and copy number variation.
OBI:0002130.label: Illumina Infinium Omni5Exome-4 Kit

OBI:0000860.definition: An assay that determines the presence of gene transcripts by hybridizing labeled RNA or DNA probes against messenger RNAs isolated from tissue or cell cultures, resolved on denaturing gel, transfered by a blotting procedure to a solid support. Detection of hybridization signals is carried out by immunofluorescence or radioactivity measurements using photographic films or digital imaging devices such as Phosphor Imager.
OBI:0000860.label: northern blot assay

OBI:0001785.definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001785.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells

OBI:0000050.definition: A platform is an object_aggregate that is the set of instruments and software needed to perform a process. definition_source: OBI.
OBI:0000050.label: obsolete_platform

OBI:0001784.definition: An assay of epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001784.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells

OBI:0000717.definition: is a DNA sequencer manufacturer by Helicos Corporation to carry out Single Molecule sequencing using reversible termination chemistry
OBI:0000717.label: HeliScope Single Molecule Sequencer

OBI:0000719.definition: vaccine preparation is a planned  process with specified output a vaccine
OBI:0000719.label: vaccine preparation

OBI:0001623.definition: A biological feature identification objective to identify the organism species in a specimen.
OBI:0001623.label: organism identification objective

OBI:1110082.definition: any entity capable of eliciting an immune response when introduced to components of the immune system
OBI:1110082.label: immunogen role

OBI:1110083.definition: is a role borne by an organism. It is realized by the organism during an immunization or an immune response taking place inside or on the surface of the organism, and in which the responding or stimulated immune system is part of the host.
OBI:1110083.label: host of immune response role

OBI:1110086.definition: The role played by an MHC molecule by binding a material entity playing the role of epitope when that epitope/MHC molecule pair are recognized (bound) by a TCR molecule on the surface of a cell playing the role of effector cell.
OBI:1110086.label: restricting MHC role

OBI:1110087.definition: A role which inheres in an organism or part thereof from which any part including cell, organ or tissue is removed with the intention that the donated part will be placed into another organism and/or cultured in vitro.
OBI:1110087.label: donor

OBI:1110084.definition: The function inhering in a T cell that is realized in an immune response that results from the T cell receptor binding to the MHC:epitope complex.
OBI:1110084.label: effector T cell function

OBI:1110085.definition: a function inhering in a cell  that expresses MHC molecules which is realized in the process of antigen processing and presentation of antigen derived parts by MHC molecules on the cell surface.
OBI:1110085.label: antigen presentation function

OBI:0000463.definition: There is a wide range of detectors available for both GC and LC each having their own particular areas of application. In general the more catholic the response, the less sensitive the detector and the most sensitive detectors are those that have a specific response. The performance of all detectors should be properly specified so that the user can determine which is most suitable for a specific application. Such specifications are also essential to compare the performance of different detectors supplied by alternative instrument manufactures. Detector specifications should be presented in a standard form and in standard units, so that detectors can be compared that function on widely different principles.
OBI:0000463.label: column chromatography detector

OBI:0000868.definition: A pattern matching objective aims to detect the presence of the constituents of a given pattern. In contrast to pattern recognition, the pattern is rigidly specified. Patterns are typicall sequences or trees.
OBI:0000868.label: pattern matching objective

OBI:1110048.definition: A T cell population characterized by not expressing the CD3 molecule on its surface.
OBI:1110048.label: cultured CD3- T cell population

PATO:0001793.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located on right side of a another entity.
PATO:0001793.label: right side of

OBI:1110049.definition: is a disease in which an abnormally strong inflammatory immune response is triggered against non-self entities, and the immune response has no protective effect
OBI:1110049.label: allergy

PATO:0001792.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located on left side of from the a another entity.
PATO:0001792.label: left side of

GO:0001913.definition: The directed killing of a target cell by a T cell through the release of granules containing cytotoxic mediators or through the engagement of death receptors.
GO:0001913.label: T cell mediated cytotoxicity

OBI:0002007.definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufacted by the Applied Biosystems corporation. Built upon SOLiD sequencing technology, the machine generates greater than 1 billion mappable reads per run.
OBI:0002007.label: SOLiD 3 Plus System

OBI:0002006.definition: A BeadChip which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon BeadChip tehcnology, the array integrates ~ 1 million markers per sample for genotyping, and copy number variation (CNV) and Cytogenetic analysis.
OBI:0002006.label: 1M-Duo Infinium HD BeadChip

OBI:0002005.definition: A methylation BeadChip which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon BeadChip tehcnology, the array interrogates ~ 27,000 CpG sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.
OBI:0002005.label: Methylation 27K BeadChip

OBI:0002004.definition: A methylation BeadChip which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon BeadChip tehcnology, the array interrogates ~ 485,000 methylation sites per sample at single-nucleotide resolution.
OBI:0002004.label: Methylation 450K BeadChip

OBI:0002003.definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. Built upon sequencing by synthesis technology, the machine provides an end-to-end solution (cluster generation, amplification, sequencing, and data analysis) in a single machine.
OBI:0002003.label: MiSeq

OBI:0002002.definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with two flow cells and a throughput of up to 160 Gb per day. Built upon sequencing by synthesis technology, the machine is optimized for generation of data for batching multiple samples or rapid results on a few samples.
OBI:0002002.label: Illumina HiSeq 2500

OBI:0002001.definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with two flow cells and a throughput of up to 55 Gb per day. Built upon sequencing by synthesis technology, the machine is optimized for generation of data for multiple samples in a single run.
OBI:0002001.label: Illumina HiSeq 2000

OBI:0002000.synonyms: Illumina Genome Analyzer IIx;Illumina GA IIx
OBI:0002000.definition: An Illumina Genome Analyzer II which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology. The Genome Analyzer IIx is the most widely adopted next-generation sequencing platform and proven and published across the broadest range of research applications.
OBI:0002000.label: Genome Analyzer IIx

OBI:0002009.synonyms: Nimblegen Mouse 3x720K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array
OBI:0002009.definition: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Nimblegen corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for mouse DNA against 3x720,000 features.
OBI:0002009.label: Mouse 3x720K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array

OBI:0002008.synonyms: Nimblegen Mouse 385K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array
OBI:0002008.definition: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Nimblegen corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for mouse DNA against 385,000 features.
OBI:0002008.label: Mouse 385K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array

OBI:0400148.definition: A DNA-microarray is a microarray that is used as a physical 2D immobilisation matrix for DNA sequences. DNA microarray-bound DNA fragments are used as targets for a hybridising probed sample.
OBI:0400148.label: DNA microarray

OBI:0400149.definition: A protein-microarray is a microarray, ususlly a piece of glass, on which different molecules of protein have been affixed at separate locations in an ordered manner. These are used to identify protein-protein or protein-small molecule interactions.
OBI:0400149.label: protein microarray

GO:0003674.definition: A molecular process that can be carried out by the action of a single macromolecular machine, usually via direct physical interactions with other molecular entities. Function in this sense denotes an action, or activity, that a gene product (or a complex) performs. These actions are described from two distinct but related perspectives: (1) biochemical activity, and (2) role as a component in a larger system/process.
GO:0003674.label: GO:molecular_function

OBI:0400140.definition: a device which holds a gel and running buffers to allow electrophoresis to be performed. A gel tank has the function to contain and to control the contained environment and transfer energy from an energy supply through the running buffers to the gel matrix and the material with charged molecules in an electric field across a porous matrix or medium with the objective to separate the charged molecules.
OBI:0400140.label: gel tank

OBI:0400142.synonyms: power pack;power supply unit;electrical power supply;PSU
OBI:0400142.definition: A power supply is an device or part of a device that permits the required application of a defined electrical charge to an instrument. The power supply may permit the defined application of a given amount of current for a defined length of time.
OBI:0400142.label: power supply

OBI:0400143.definition: A fluorometer is an instrument for the detection and measurement of parameters of fluoresence, which in turn are used to identify the presence and amount of specific molecules in the sample.
OBI:0400143.label: fluorometer

OBI:0400146.definition: A multispectral_imaging_flow_cytometer is an instrument which combines quantitative image analysis and flow cytometry in a single platform. It measures the amount, location and movement of molecules on, in, or between cells, and  the location and co-localization of multiple markers on or in cells. It can also quantitate morphologically distinct cell subpopulations.
OBI:0400146.label: multispectral imaging flow cytometer

OBI:0400147.definition: A processed material that is made to be used in an analyte assay. It consists of a physical immobilisation matrix in which substances that bind the analyte are placed in regular spatial position.
OBI:0400147.label: microarray

OBI:0001318.definition: An assay that detects proteins in a sample (quantified or otherwise analyzed), e.g. antibody profiling using an array based technology.
OBI:0001318.label: proteomic profiling by array assay

OBI:1110178.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:1110178.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells

OBI:1110179.definition: A T cell epitope qualitative binding assay that uses an MHC multimer staining assay.
OBI:1110179.label: MHC tetramer/multimer assay measuring binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

OBI:1110177.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:1110177.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells

OBI:1110174.definition: A T cell epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production assay that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:1110174.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production by T cells

OBI:1110175.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:1110175.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells

OBI:1110172.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:1110172.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells

OBI:1110173.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:1110173.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells

OBI:1110170.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:1110170.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells

OBI:1110171.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:1110171.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells

OBI:0002461.definition: A data format specification that is a binary file containing base calling data. These files are created by sequencing machines during the act of sequencing, and contain data about each of the nucleotide clusters on a sequencing flow cell.
OBI:0002461.label: BCL format

OBI:0002460.definition: An inclusion criterion that is based on fitting within the defined characteristics of a population based study design.
OBI:0002460.label: defined population inclusion criterion

OBI:0002463.definition: A processed material that consists of transcript isoforms of 7 spike-in RNA variant (SIRV) genes and possibly the 92 External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) RNA spike-in genes.
OBI:0002463.label: SIRV RNA spike-in

OBI:0002462.definition: A processed material developed by the External RNA Controls Consortium (ERCC) that  consists of 92 transcripts, derived and traceable from NIST-certified DNA plasmids.
OBI:0002462.label: ERCC RNA spike-in

OBI:0002465.definition: An age measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the age of a cell since cultured (the process of seeding cells onto a culture dish).
OBI:0002465.label: age since culture seeding measurement datum

OBI:0002464.definition: An accession number that applies to a database record for an individual sample object in an NCBI Sequence Read Archive (SRA) submission. These records are imported from the NCBI BioSample database.
OBI:0002464.label: SRS identifier

OBI:0002467.definition: A software application that implements an alignment counting algorithm, used to count the overlap of aligned sequencing reads with genes.
OBI:0002467.label: alignment counting application

OBI:0002466.definition: An algorithm used to assign aligned sequence reads, resulting from a reference genome transcriptome alignment algorithm, to sequence features (e.g. genes or transcripts).
OBI:0002466.label: alignment counting algorithm

OBI:0002469.definition: A base-calling application that implments a base-calling algorithm to convert BCL (binary base call) files, (e.g., those generated by Illumina sequencing systems) to standard FASTQ file formats for downstream analysis.
OBI:0002469.label: base calling application

OBI:0002468.definition: An algorithm that assigns nucleotides to temporal or spatial peaks generated by a detector, such as peaks of light intensities generated by a DNA sequencer
OBI:0002468.label: base calling algorithm

OBI:0400091.definition: A particle delivery vessel. The cytometer sample tube is a vessel in which the sample is introduced to the cytometer. Frequently the tube is placed on the cytometer in such a manner that a seal is formed between the tube and cytometer, and gas is used to create enough pressure to push the sample out of the tube and into the cytometer.
OBI:0400091.label: cytometer sample tube

OBI:0400096.definition: A solid-state laser is a laser that uses a lasing medium that is a solid, rather than a liquid such as dye lasers or a gas such as gas lasers. Semiconductor-based diode lasers are also in the solid state, but are generally considered separately from solid-state lasers. The first laser developed was an optical pumped ruby crystal solid state laser.
OBI:0400096.label: solid state laser

OBI:0001563.definition: A service in which a service provider makes physical changes to a specified input material entity with the objective of producing a new material entity form input materials, or modifying the input material entity, and returning this as output to the service consumer.
OBI:0001563.label: material processing service

OBI:0400094.definition: Part of the fluidics system. The sheath tank is the vessel that holds the sheath fluid at a constant pressure, allowing for it to be pushed into the flow chamber at a constant rate. The sheath tank holds the pressurized sheath fluid.
OBI:0400094.label: sheath tank

OBI:0400095.definition: A short pass filter is an optical filter that passes low wavelengths of light but attenuates (or reduces) wavelengths higher than the cutoff frequency. A short pass filter with a cutoff of 500 nm would pass all wavelengths less than 500 nm.
OBI:0400095.label: short pass filter

OBI:0001165.definition: An age measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the age of an organism since coitus, the process of copulation that occurs during the process of sexual reproduction.
OBI:0001165.label: age since coitus measurement datum

OBI:0001164.definition: An age measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the age of an organism since sowing, the process of placing a seed or spore in some media with the intention to invoke germination.
OBI:0001164.label: age since sowing measurement datum

OBI:0001167.definition: A time measurement datum that is the result of measurement of age of an organism
OBI:0001167.label: age measurement datum

OBI:0001562.definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17F production assay that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001562.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17F production by T cells

OBI:0001161.definition: An age measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the age of an organism since germination, the process consisting of physiological and developmental changes by a seed, spore, pollen grain (microspore), or zygote that occur after release from dormancy, and encompassing events prior to and including the first visible indications of growth.
OBI:0001161.label: age since germination measurement datum

OBI:0001160.definition: an objective specification to check the accuracy or the quality of the results of an assay by comparison with independent results
OBI:0001160.label: assay validation objective

OBI:0001163.definition: An age measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the age of an organism since eclosion, the process of emergence of an adult insect from its pupa or cocoon.
OBI:0001163.label: age since eclosion measurement datum

OBI:0001162.definition: a study design in which checks the accuracy or the quality of the result of an assay  by comparing with reverse transcription PCR results
OBI:0001162.label: validation by reverse transcription PCR design

OBI:0002556.definition: A value specifcation that specifies the youngest age when specifying an age range.
OBI:0002556.label: minimum age value specification

OBI:0001169.definition: An age measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the age of an organism since birth, the process of emergence and separation of offspring from the mother.
OBI:0001169.label: age since birth measurement datum

OBI:0001168.definition: An age measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the age of an organism since fertilization, the process of the union of gametes of opposite sexes during the process of sexual reproduction to form a zygote.
OBI:0001168.label: age since fertilization measurement datum

UBERON:0004648.definition: A muscularis mucosa that is part of a esophagus.
UBERON:0004648.label: esophagus muscularis mucosa

OBI:0002488.definition: A device that is a laboratory tool commonly used in chemistry, biology and medicine to transport a measured volume of liquid, often as a media dispenser.
OBI:0002488.label: pipette

OBI:0002558.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states a a set of medications, which, if used by an entity, makes that entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002558.label: use of medication inclusion criterion

OBI:0002483.definition: A data item that indicates the dilution of spike-in added to a specimen.
OBI:0002483.label: spike-in dilution factor

OBI:0002482.definition: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the amount of specimen collected.
OBI:0002482.label: specimen harvest quantity

OBI:0002481.definition: A cDNA library that is a collection of short tags from only one end of DNA fragments.
OBI:0002481.label: single-end library

OBI:0002480.definition: A scalar measurement datum that indicates the amount of sequencing library used as input for a sequencer.
OBI:0002480.label: sequencing library input quantity measurement datum

OBI:0002487.definition: A material separation device also commerically known as Isoraft, that is used to isolate single cells.
OBI:0002487.label: microraft

OBI:0002486.definition: An alignment counting algorithm that assigns gene features to genomic alignments using a hierarchical assignment scheme, which allows simultaneous quantification of multiple feature types or annotation levels without repeatedly assigning reads.
OBI:0002486.label: verse algorithm

OBI:0002485.definition: A sequencing assay that incorporates single-end reads and sequencing technology to determine transcripts, gene structures, and gene expressions.
OBI:0002485.label: transcript analysis by single-end sequencing assay

OBI:0002484.definition: A reference genome transcriptome alignment algorithm that is a standalone RNA-seq alignment algorithm that uses uncompressed suffix arrays and a mapping algorithm similar to those used in large-scale genome alignment tools to align RNA-seq reads to a genomic reference.
OBI:0002484.label: star algorithm

OBI:0600067.definition: a labeling in which the labeling reagent used  has a specificity to bind only certain components of the input material
OBI:0600067.label: specific labeling

OBI:0600049.definition: DNA polymerase amplification is an enzymatic amplification which uses DNA polymerase enzyme to make copies of a DNA contained in biomaterial used as input
OBI:0600049.label: DNA polymerase amplification

OBI:0001011.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using ENU probe
OBI:0001011.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines the secondary structure of a nucleic acid at the nucleotide resolution scale which uses ENU as reagent and chemical probe
OBI:0001011.label: ENU structure mapping assay

OBI:0001010.definition: An extract that is the output of an extraction process in which nucleic acid molecules are isolated from a specimen.
OBI:0001010.label: nucleic acid extract

OBI:0001013.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines nucleic acid secondary structure at nucleotide resolution scale using kethoxal as reagent and chemical probe
OBI:0001013.label: kethoxal structure mapping assay

OBI:0001012.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using RNAse V1
OBI:0001012.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution ribonucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines nucleic acid secondary structure at a nucleotide resolution scale using RNAse V1 as reagent and enzymatic probe
OBI:0001012.label: RNASE V1 structure mapping assay

OBI:0001015.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using DMS probe
OBI:0001015.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay which determins nucleic acid secondary structure at a nucleotide resolution scale using DMS as reagent and chemical probe
OBI:0001015.label: DMS structure mapping assay

OBI:0001014.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines structural information about the RNA species under study using proteins acting as enzymatic probes.
OBI:0001014.label: single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay using enzymatic probing

OBI:0001017.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines structural information about the RNA species under study using small chemical compounds acting as chemical probes.
OBI:0001017.label: single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay using chemical probing

OBI:0001016.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using DNAse I;DNAse footprinting assay
OBI:0001016.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution deoxyribonucleic acid structure mapping assay which uses DNAse 1 as reagent and enzymatic probe to generate data and information at nucleotide resolution scale contributing to the determination of nucleic acid secondary structure
OBI:0001016.label: DNASE 1 structure mapping assay

OBI:0001019.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using RNA adenosine deaminase I
OBI:0001019.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution ribonucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines nucleic acid secondary structure at a nucleotide resolution scale using RNA adenosine deaminase I as reagent and enzymatic probe.
OBI:0001019.label: RNA ADA I RNA structure mapping assay

OBI:0001018.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using Rhodium probe
OBI:0001018.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines nucleic acid secondary structure at a nucleotide resolution scale using Rhodium as reagent and chemical probe.
OBI:0001018.label: Rhodium DNA structure mapping assay

OBI:0002049.definition: A DNA sequencer manufactured by Illumina corporation, with two flow cell and a throughput of more than 400 Gb per day.
OBI:0002049.label: Illumina HiSeq 4000

IAO:0000619.definition: A textual entity that documents the consenting process used to enroll patients in a study.
IAO:0000619.label: consent textual entity

IAO:0000618.definition: A part of a document about the consent process that was used to enroll patients in a study.
IAO:0000618.label: consent section

OBI:0200193.definition: A data visualization which has input of a background corrected data set and produces an output of a report graph which is capable of rendering data of this type.
OBI:0200193.label: background corrected data visualization

OBI:0200192.definition: A data visualization which has input of a classified data set and produces an output of a report graph which is capable of rendering data of this type.
OBI:0200192.label: classified data visualization

OBI:0200195.definition: Proportional hazards model is a data transformation model to estimate the effects of different covariates influencing the times-to-failure of a system.
OBI:0200195.label: proportional hazards model estimation

OBI:0200194.definition: A data transformation which has the objective of performing survival analysis.
OBI:0200194.label: survival analysis data transformation

OBI:0200197.definition: is a data transformation objective where the aim is to analyse some aspect of spectral data by some data transformation process.
OBI:0200197.label: spectrum analysis objective

OBI:0200196.definition: A data transformation objective in which correlation is obtained (often measured as a correlation coefficient, ρ) which indicates the strength and direction of a relationship between two random variables.
OBI:0200196.label: correlation study objective

IAO:0000611.definition: A part of a document about a resource described in the document, e.g. software, that describes where and/or how that resource can be obtained.
IAO:0000611.label: availability section

CL:0000578.definition: A cell in vitro that has undergone physical changes as a consequence of a deliberate and specific experimental procedure.
CL:0000578.label: experimentally modified cell in vitro

IAO:0000613.definition: A part of a document about the medical history of a specific patient as it relates to the topic of the document.
IAO:0000613.label: case report section

IAO:0000612.definition: A textual entity expressing the location of a resource, e.g. software, or the manner in which a resource can be obtained.
IAO:0000612.label: availability textual entity

IAO:0000615.definition: A part of a document used to summarize the findings discussed in the document. The conclusion section is typically found near the end of a document.
IAO:0000615.label: conclusion section

GO:0042575.definition: A protein complex that possesses DNA polymerase activity and is involved in template directed synthesis of DNA.
GO:0042575.label: DNA polymerase complex

IAO:0000617.definition: A textual entity that expresses a situation involving one or more of the authors, or the funding source of a document whereby the authors or funding source stand to potentially gain (typically financially) from the results reported in the document.
IAO:0000617.label: conflict of interest textual entity

IAO:0000616.synonyms: declaration of competing interests;conflict of interest statement;conflict of interest;disclosure of potential conflicts of interest;competing interests
IAO:0000616.definition: A part of a document used to declare any competing interests regarding the authors and/or funding organization for the work described in the document.
IAO:0000616.label: conflict of interest section

OBI:0001052.definition: A light source used in fluorescence imaging that allows the imaging of living tissue up to a depth of 1 mm, based on the concept that two photons of low energy can excite a fluorophore in a quantum event, resulting in the emission of a fluorescence photon, typically at a higher energy than either of the two excitatory photons.
OBI:0001052.label: two-photon laser/detector

GO:0005739.definition: A semiautonomous, self replicating organelle that occurs in varying numbers, shapes, and sizes in the cytoplasm of virtually all eukaryotic cells. It is notably the site of tissue respiration.
GO:0005739.label: mitochondrion

OBI:0001766.definition: An assay of epitope specific vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001766.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells

OBI:0001907.definition: a genetic transformation of a cell line cell with transgenic constructs intended to confer the capability for indefinite propagation in culture
OBI:0001907.label: immortalizing cell line transformation

OBI:0001906.definition: An immortal cell line derived from a transformed cell that was part of a malignant tumor.
OBI:0001906.label: cancer cell line

OBI:0001905.definition: A cultured cell population that is derived through one or more passages in culture.
OBI:0001905.label: secondary cultured cell population

OBI:0001904.definition: A service provides sequencing service which is the realization of some sequencing such as RNA and DNA sequencing in which the service provider role is realized.
OBI:0001904.label: sequencing service

OBI:0001903.definition: An email address of the principal investigator providing the specimens for the investigation
OBI:0001903.label: email address of specimen provider principal investigator

OBI:0001902.definition: A sample preparation for assay that preparation of nucleic acids for a sequencing assay
OBI:0001902.label: sample preparation for sequencing assay

OBI:0001901.definition: A specimen identifier which is assigned by a sequencing facility
OBI:0001901.label: specimen identifier assigned by sequencing facility

OBI:0001900.definition: A specimen identifier which is assigned by a specimen repository
OBI:0001900.label: specimen identifier assigned by specimen repository

OBI:0001909.definition: An information content entity that is inferred from data.
OBI:0001909.label: conclusion based on data

OBI:0001908.definition: An information content entity that expresses an assertion that is intended to be tested.
OBI:0001908.label: testable hypothesis

OBI:0000504.definition: An automated chromatography system that injects the sample into the chromatography columns in order to increase speed and minimize human involvement in the purification process for  better reproducibility.
OBI:0000504.label: sample injection system

OBI:0000505.definition: A chromatography detector, that can detect many discrete wavelengths in parallel and produces a multiple wavelength chromatographic profile.
OBI:0000505.label: multiple wavelength detector

OBI:0000506.definition: The selective determination of aromatic hydrocarbons or organo-heteroatom species is the job of the photoionization detector (PID). This device uses ultraviolet light as a means of ionizing an analyte exiting from a GC column. The ions produced by this process are collected by electrodes. The current generated is therefore a measure of the analyte concentration. f the amount of ionization is reproducible for a given compound, pressure, and light source then the current collected at the PID's reaction cell electrodes is reproducibly proportional to the amount of that compound entering the cell. The reason why the compounds that are routinely analyzed are either aromatic hydrocarbons or heteroatom containing compounds (like organosulfur or organophosphorus species) is because these species have ionization potentials (IP) that are within reach of commercially available UV lamps. The available lamp energies range from 8.3 to 11.7 ev, that is, lambda max ranging from 150 nm to 106 nm. Although most PIDs have only one lamp, lamps in the PID are exchanged depending on the compound selectivity required in the analysis.
OBI:0000506.label: photoionization detector

OBI:0000507.definition: An instrument that generates gases for use with the gas chromatograph. Previously gas was obtained from gas tanks or gas cylinders. However, over the past decade the use of gas generators have become more popular as it avoids having gases at high pressure in the laboratory which is perceived by some as potentially dangerous. In addition, the use of a hydrogen generator avoids the use of a cylinder of hydrogen at high pressure which is also perceived by some as a serious fire hazard despite the fact that they have been used in laboratories, quite safely for nearly a century.
OBI:0000507.label: gas generator

OBI:0000500.definition: A dual loop autosampler is an autosampler that is designed for handling both analytical (10 mL/min flow rate) to preparative scale sample purification (100 mL/min flow rate).
OBI:0000500.label: dual loop autosampler

OBI:0000501.definition: A chromatography detector, that can detect signals within a certain range at user-defined wavelengths.
OBI:0000501.label: variable wavelength detector

OBI:0001585.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001585.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells

OBI:0000503.definition: The LC-NMR/MS setup was first introduced by Bruker BioSpin in 1999. An LC-NMR system including a Bruker Peak Sampling Unit (BPSU-36) was coupled with a Bruker Daltonics esquire series ion trap mass spectrometer via a Bruker NMR-MS interface (BNMI). Since October 2004 the Bruker Daltonics microTOF-LC time-of-flight mass spectrometer can also be integrated in an LC-NMR setup.
OBI:0000503.label: Bruker LC-NMR platform

OBI:0001059.definition: A microplate reader that is used for enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays (ELISA).
OBI:0001059.label: ELISA microplate reader

OBI:0001589.definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17A production assay that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001589.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17A production by T cells

OBI:0001588.definition: The process of material entities forming complexes.
OBI:0001588.label: binding

OBI:0000508.definition: A column jacket is a piece of column chromatography equipment that covers a column in order to ensure thermoisolation and create a controllable thermostatic microenvironment.
OBI:0000508.label: column jacket

OBI:0000509.definition: The electron capture detector is a GC detector that uses a radioactive Beta emitter (electrons) to ionize some of the carrier gas and produce a current between a biased pair of electrodes. When organic molecules that contain electronegative functional groups, such as halogens, phosphorous, and nitro groups pass by the detector, they capture some of the electrons and reduce the current measured between the electrodes.
OBI:0000509.label: electron capture detector

OBI:0002046.definition: a device that is used as a binding surface for ligand during a surface plasmon resonance assay, consisting of a glass plate to which a metal film is attached
OBI:0002046.label: surface plasmon resonance sensor chip

OBI:0000694.definition: animal feeding is a process in which animals are provided with food
OBI:0000694.label: animal feeding

OBI:0000695.definition: A DNA sequencing assay which rely on the use of dideoxynucleotides used in 4 distinct sequencing reaction on the same DNA sample. The dideoxynucleotides, once incorporated in the complementary DNA strand being synthesized by the DNA polymerase prevent any further chain elongation. The newly generated sequences are resolved on a polyacrylamide gel using electrophoresis and labels (either fluorochrome or radioactivity) are used to determine the nucleotide present at a given position
OBI:0000695.label: chain termination sequencing assay

OBI:0001742.definition: A B cell epitope on rate measurement (kon) determination assay that uses an antibody binding detection by fluorescence quenching assay.
OBI:0001742.label: quenching assay measuring the on rate [kon] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0000697.definition: A DNA sequencing by synthesis assay that identifiies the sequnece of billions of DNA molecules immobilized to a surface using DNA polymerase and fluorescently labeled nucleotides added one at a time. The sequencing process does not require an amplification step and is typically able to produce reads of 25 base pair length.
OBI:0000697.label: Helicos sequencing assay

OBI:0001749.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001749.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells

OBI:0001748.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001748.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells

OBI:0000692.definition: a recombination enzyme based cloning is a recombinant vector cloning process that uses complementary nucleotide sequences in both the insert genetic material and the cloning vector with a recombination enzyme to directly create a recombinant vector
OBI:0000692.label: recombination enzyme based cloning

OBI:0000693.definition: A DNA methylation profiling assay that identifies methylated sites in genomic DNA and determines the methylation pattern that affect gene transcription using immunoprecipitation of methylated genomic DNA, creation of a library of corresponding DNA fragments (either single or paired-end fragments) and subsequent sequencing using parallelized sequencing methods.
OBI:0000693.label: MeDIP-seq assay

OBI:0001745.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001745.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells

OBI:0001744.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001744.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells

OBI:0001747.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001747.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells

OBI:0001746.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001746.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells

OBI:0001741.definition: A B cell epitope on rate measurement (kon) determination assay that uses a surface plasmon resonance assay.
OBI:0001741.label: surface plasmon resonance assay measuring the on rate [kon] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0000699.definition: An assay that measures the occurrence of death events in one or more organisms over time
OBI:0000699.label: survival assessment assay

OBI:0001743.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001743.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells

IAO:0000027.definition: a data item is an information content entity that is intended to be a truthful statement about something (modulo, e.g., measurement precision or other systematic errors) and is constructed/acquired by a method which reliably tends to produce (approximately) truthful statements.
IAO:0000027.label: data item

OBI:0000980.definition: a service provider role which is realized by a servicer provider organization performing a protocol execution
OBI:0000980.label: obsolete_protocol service provider role

OBI:0000981.definition: a specimen that is output of a process that cell culture inoculated into agar for long term storage.
OBI:0000981.label: agar stab specimen

OBI:0000982.definition:
An image acquisition device that generates a
three-dimensional image of the inside of an object from a large series of
two-dimensional X-ray images taken around a single axis of rotation.
OBI:0000982.label: computed tomography scanner

OBI:0000983.definition: The administration of a substance into the intranasal mucosis of an organism
OBI:0000983.label: intranasal mucosal administration

OBI:0000984.definition: A measurement datum that measures the quantity of something that may be administered to an organism or that an organism may be exposed to. Quantities of nutrients, drugs, vaccines and toxins are referred to as doses.
OBI:0000984.label: dose

OBI:0000985.definition: A study design in which the independent variable is the environmental condition in which the specimen is growing
OBI:0000985.label: growth condition intervention design

OBI:0000986.definition: A training process with the objective to provide a trainee with the skill to run DNA sequencing experiments
OBI:0000986.label: obsolete_DNA sequencing training service

OBI:0000988.definition: The interpretation of the information available about bodily features (clinical picture) of a patient resulting in a diagnosis
OBI:0000988.label: performing a diagnosis

OBI:0000989.definition: A device that is used to amplify a single or few copies of a piece of DNA across several orders of magnitude, generating thousands to millions of copies of a particular DNA sequence.
OBI:0000989.label: PCR instrument

OBI:0001349.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001349.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells

OBI:0000167.definition: An electronic case report form is a digital document used to record all of the protocol required information to be reported for each trial subject. An eCRF has the property that it can be audited and compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11.
OBI:0000167.label: electronic case report form

OBI:0000164.definition:
Mixed population of cDNAs (complementaryDNA) made from mRNA from a defined source, usually a specific cell type. This term should be associated only to nucleic acid interactors not to their proteins product. For instance in 2h screening use living cells (MI:0349) as sample process.

ALT DEF (PRS):: a cDNA library is a collection of host cells, typically E.Coli cells but not exclusively. modified by transfer of plasmid DNA molecule used as vector containing a fragment or totality of cDNA molecule (the insert) .  cDNA library may have an array of role and applications.
OBI:0000164.label: cDNA library

OBI:0000162.definition: A nutrient role that inheres in a material entity and is realized in the use of that material entity by an organism to provide all needed nourishment.
OBI:0000162.label: complete nutrient role

SO:0000988.definition: A quality of a nucleotide polymer that has no terminal nucleotide residues.
SO:0000988.label: circular

OBI:0000161.definition: a role realized when a participant serves as reference to itself
OBI:0000161.label: crossover population role

OBI:0001341.definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses a cell culture analyte detection bioassay.
OBI:0001341.label: cell culture analyte detection bioassay measuring epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor production by T cells

GO:0006006.definition: The chemical reactions and pathways involving glucose, the aldohexose gluco-hexose. D-glucose is dextrorotatory and is sometimes known as dextrose; it is an important source of energy for living organisms and is found free as well as combined in homo- and hetero-oligosaccharides and polysaccharides.
GO:0006006.label: glucose metabolic process

OBI:0001342.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001342.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells

OBI:0001345.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells.
OBI:0001345.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells

OBI:0001344.definition: An assay of epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001344.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells

OBI:0000169.definition: a negative reference substance is a reference role in which the substance playing the reference substance role is physically similar in appearance to the test substance
OBI:0000169.label: placebo role

OBI:0000438.definition: An assay that measures changes (expansion, amplification, deletion, mutation) in the sequence of a DNA molecule.
OBI:0000438.label: DNA sequence variation detection assay

CHEBI:15956.definition: An organic heterobicyclic compound that consists of 2-oxohexahydro-1H-thieno[3,4-d]imidazole having a valeric acid substituent attached to the tetrahydrothiophene ring. The parent of the class of biotins.
CHEBI:15956.label: biotin

OBI:0200052.definition: A probabilistic algorithm is one which involves an element of probability or randomness in the transformation of the data.
OBI:0200052.label: probabilistic algorithm

OBI:0000430.definition:
plasmid = DNA and has_quality circular and has_function
(is_realized_as some gene expression) GO:0010467
OBI:0000430.label: plasmid

OBI:0000431.definition: A process in which an input substance is injected into a organ section.
OBI:0000431.label: injection into organ section

OBI:0000432.definition: a material entity resulting from the polymerization of acrylamide with TEMED in some buffer solution
OBI:0000432.label: polyacrylamide gel

OBI:0000433.definition: An assay with the objective to determine a sequence feature of DNA
OBI:0000433.label: DNA sequence feature detection assay

OBI:0000434.definition: is the specification of an objective to add a material into a target material. The adding is asymmetric in the sense that the target material largely retains its identity
OBI:0000434.label: adding material objective

OBI:0000435.definition: An assay which generates data about a genotype from a specimen of genomic DNA. A variety of techniques and instruments can be used to produce information about sequence variation at particular genomic positions.
OBI:0000435.label: genotyping assay

OBI:0000436.definition: a needle is a sharp, hollow device used to penetrate tissue or soft material. When attached to a syringe. it allows delivery of a specific volume of liquid or gaseous mixture.
OBI:0000436.label: needle

OBI:0000341.definition: histological sample preparation is the preparation of an input tissue via slicing and labeling to make tissue microstructure of interest visible in a future histology assay
OBI:0000341.label: histological sample preparation

OBI:0000188.definition: a worker role comprised of providing a confirmed and consensus diagnosis for histopathology results obtained during the investigation
OBI:0000188.label: role of pathology review board

PR:000014060.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the human RNASET2 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.
PR:000014060.label: ribonuclease T2

OBI:0000181.definition: a population is a collection of individuals from the same taxonomic class living, counted or sampled at a particular site or in a particular area
OBI:0000181.label: population

OBI:0000182.definition: A 3D structure determination assay that uses magnetic properties of atomic nuclei to determine the 3D structure and dynamics of molecules in the input sample.
OBI:0000182.label: nuclear magnetic resonance 3D structure determination assay

OBI:0000185.definition: An assay that produces a picture of an entity.
OBI:0000185.label: imaging assay

OBI:0000186.definition: Protocol_optimization is a protocol_testing_objective role describing a study designed to identify the best protocol.  This may be carried out by comparing different protocols or by modifying the parameters used within a single protocol.
OBI:0000186.label: protocol optimization objective

OBI:0302867.definition: A data item that was generated on the basis of a calculation or logical reasoning
OBI:0302867.label: predicted data item

OBI:0302868.definition: a data item which has been processed by a mean centering data transformation where each output value is produced by subtracting the mean from the inout value
OBI:0302868.label: mean-centered data

CL:0000794.definition: A CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cell that is capable of killing target cells in an antigen specific manner with the phenotype perforin-positive and granzyme B-positive.
CL:0000794.label: CD8-positive, alpha-beta cytotoxic T cell

OBI:0200179.definition:
A class prediction objective (sometimes called supervised classification) is a data transformation objective where the aim is to create a predictor from training data through a machine learning technique. The training data consist of pairs of objects (typically vectors of attributes) and
class labels for these objects. The resulting predictor can be used to attach class labels to any valid novel input object. Depending on usage, the prediction can be definite or probabilistic. A classification is learned from the training data and can then be tested on test data.
OBI:0200179.label: class prediction objective

OBI:0200178.synonyms: discriminant analysis objective;unsupervised classification objective;clustering objective
OBI:0200178.definition: A class discovery objective (sometimes called unsupervised classification) is a data transformation objective where the aim is to organize input data  (typically vectors of attributes) into classes, where the number of classes and their specifications are not known a priori. Depending on usage, the class assignment can be definite or probabilistic.
OBI:0200178.label: class discovery objective

OBI:0200173.definition: A background correction objective is a data transformation objective where the aim is to remove irrelevant contributions from the measured signal, e.g. those due to instrument noise or sample preparation.
OBI:0200173.label: background correction objective

OBI:0200172.definition: A partitioning objective is a data transformation objective where the aim is to generate a collection of disjoint non-empty subsets whose union equals a non-empty input set.
OBI:0200172.label: partitioning objective

OBI:0200171.definition: A partitioning data transformation is a data transformation that has objective partitioning.
OBI:0200171.label: partitioning data transformation

OBI:0200170.definition: An averaging data transformation is a data transformation that has objective averaging.
OBI:0200170.label: averaging data transformation

OBI:0200177.definition: A center calculation objective is a data transformation objective where the aim is to calculate the center of an input data set.
OBI:0200177.label: center calculation objective

OBI:0200176.definition: Fisher's exact test is a data transformation used to determine if there are nonrandom associations between two Fisher's exact test is a statistical significance test used in the analysis of contingency tables where sample sizes are small where the significance of the deviation from a null hypothesis can be calculated exactly, rather than relying on an approximation that becomes exact in the limit as the sample size grows to infinity, as with many statistical tests.
OBI:0200176.label: Fisher's exact test

OBI:0200175.synonyms: clustering data transformation;unsupervised classification data transformation
OBI:0200175.definition: A class discovery data transformation (sometimes called unsupervised classification) is a data transformation that has objective class discovery.
OBI:0200175.label: class discovery data transformation

OBI:0200174.definition: A curve fitting objective is a data transformation objective in which the aim is to find a curve which matches a series of data points and possibly other constraints.
OBI:0200174.label: curve fitting objective

CHEBI:27889.definition: An elemental lead that has formula Pb.
CHEBI:27889.label: lead(0)

OBI:0000232.definition: Hardware_optimization is a hardware_testing_objective describing a study designed to identify the best hardware.
OBI:0000232.label: hardware optimization objective

OBI:0000233.definition: Place holder class, Utility class to gather the defined classes
OBI:0000233.label: obsolete_defined_material

OBI:0000231.definition: enzymatic cleavage is a protocol application to digest the fraction of input material that is susceptible to that enzyme
OBI:0000231.label: enzymatic cleavage

OBI:0000237.definition: Antigen is a role played by material which when introduced into an immune-competent organism causes an immune response
OBI:0000237.label: antigen role

OBI:0000234.definition: a worker role that analyzes data obtained during a trial or study; this role occurs after the trial or study is completed or terminated.
OBI:0000234.label: trial statistician role

OBI:0000235.definition: A quantitative confidence value which is the standard deviations of the sample in a frequency distribution, obtained by dividing the standard deviation by the total number of cases in the frequency distribution.
OBI:0000235.label: standard error

UO:0000002.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the amount of matter/energy of a physical object.
UO:0000002.label: mass unit

OBI:0200129.definition: A network analysis in which an input data set describing node objects and edge relationships between node objects is used to determine the output quality of one of the node objects in the network.
OBI:0200129.label: node quality calculation

OBI:0001422.definition: A study design that compares tissues, regions, organs within or between organisms
OBI:0001422.label: organism part comparison design

OBI:0000446.definition: a process by which the identity (what a thing is) of a material entity is established within a certain confidence interval
OBI:0000446.label: obsolete_identification

OBI:0002395.definition: A measurement datum of the total number of live births a female has had.
OBI:0002395.label: number of live births

OBI:0600031.definition: A cytometry assay in which cells are cultured on a surface coated with a capture antibody binding a secretory material of interest which subsequently gets stained resulting in a spot for each cell producing the secretory material of interest.
OBI:0600031.label: enzyme-linked immunospot assay

OBI:0600009.definition: a planned process in which an input material is exposed to a defined set of conditions in a controlled environment. The environment is a specified input.
OBI:0600009.label: exposure of material to environment

OBI:0600008.definition: the planned process of gaining possession of a continuant
OBI:0600008.label: acquisition

OBI:0600037.definition: The act of taking part of a homogeneous cell culture and creating one or more additional separate cultures of similar qualities. input: cell_culture, output cell_culture min cardinality 2. part of cell culturing
OBI:0600037.label: cell culture splitting

OBI:1110033.definition: A cell line derived from mouse dendritic cells.
OBI:1110033.label: JAWS II cell line

PATO:0001233.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the back or upper surface of an organism relative to another entity.
PATO:0001233.label: dorsal to

OBI:0600002.definition: An assay that determines the grade (severity/stage) of a tumor sample, used in cancer biology to describe abnormalities/qualities of tumor cells or tissues. Values can be described by terms from NCI Thesaurus.
OBI:0600002.label: tumor grading

GO:0040030.definition: Any heritable epigenetic process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of protein function by self-perpetuating conformational conversions of normal proteins in healthy cells. This is distinct from, though mechanistically analogous to, disease states associated with prion propagation and amyloidogenesis. A single protein, if it carries a glutamine/asparagine-rich ('prion') domain, can sometimes stably exist in at least two distinct physical states, each associated with a different phenotype; propagation of one of these traits is achieved by a self-perpetuating change in the protein from one form to the other, mediated by conformational changes in the glutamine/asparagine-rich domain. Prion domains are both modular and transferable to other proteins, on which they can confer a heritable epigenetic alteration of function; existing bioinformatics data indicate that they are rare in non-eukarya, but common in eukarya.
GO:0040030.label: regulation of molecular function, epigenetic

OBI:0002034.definition: An RNA-seq assay that combines enzymatic capture of m(7)G-capped mRNA 5' ends with high-throughput sequencing.
OBI:0002034.label: transcript leader sequencing assay

OBI:0002392.definition: An exposure to second hand smoke in person's current household.
OBI:0002392.label: exposure to second hand smoke in current household

OBI:0600000.definition: is process in which a material substance is added to a cell culture
OBI:0600000.label: adding substance to cell culture

UBERON:0000948.definition: A myogenic muscular circulatory organ found in the vertebrate cardiovascular system composed of chambers of cardiac muscle. It is the primary circulatory organ.
UBERON:0000948.label: heart

PATO:0001237.definition: A physical object quality which inheres in a single-bearer.
PATO:0001237.label: quality of a single physical entity

PATO:0001238.definition: A physical entity quality which exists in relation towards some other entity.
PATO:0001238.label: quality of related physical entities

OBI:0002032.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay that performs simultaneous in vitro profiling of the secondary structure of thousands of RNA species at single nucleotide resolution using enzymatic probing based on deep sequencing fragments of RNAs that were treated with structure-specific enzymes
OBI:0002032.label: parallel analysis of RNA structure assay

UBERON:0002037.definition: Part of the metencephalon that lies in the posterior cranial fossa behind the brain stem. It is concerned with the coordination of movement[MESH]. A large dorsally projecting part of the brain concerned especially with the coordination of muscles and the maintenance of bodily equilibrium, situated between the brain stem and the back of the cerebrum , and formed in humans of two lateral lobes and a median lobe[BTO]. Brain structure derived from the anterior hindbrain, and perhaps including posterior midbrain. The cerebellum plays a role in somatic motor function, the control of muscle tone, and balance[ZFA].
UBERON:0002037.label: cerebellum

OBI:1110036.definition: The JY cell line is an Epstein-Barr virus (EBV)-immortalised b cell lymphoblastoid line.(wikipedia)
OBI:1110036.label: JY cell line

OBI:0100055.definition: A material entity that represents generations of a primary culture.
OBI:0100055.label: obsolete_cell line cell

OBI:0600005.definition: a process with the objective to obtain a material entity that was part of an organism for potential future use in an investigation
OBI:0600005.label: collecting specimen from organism

OBI:0002031.synonyms: DNA sequence variation detection by snp array
OBI:0002031.definition: A genotyping by array assay that uses SNP array technology.
OBI:0002031.label: genotyping by SNP array assay

GO:0032641.definition: The appearance of lymphotoxin A due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032641.label: lymphotoxin A production

GO:0032640.definition: The appearance of tumor necrosis factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032640.label: tumor necrosis factor production

GO:0070358.definition: A process involved in the controlled movement of a bacterial cell powered by the continuous polymerization of actin at one pole of the cell.
GO:0070358.label: actin polymerization-dependent cell motility

PR:000025467.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the Aspergillus oryzae rntA gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.
PR:000025467.label: guanyl-specific ribonuclease T1

PATO:0001348.definition: A bacterial mating type indicating the absence of F plasmid in a bacterial cell.
PATO:0001348.label: F minus mating type

OBI:0002279.synonyms: pN: Pathologic spread colon lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)
OBI:0002279.definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
OBI:0002279.label: pathologic lymph node stage for lung according to AJCC 7th edition
