CHEBI:15422.definition: An adenosine 5'-phosphate in which the 5'-phosphate is a triphosphate group. It is involved in the transportation of chemical energy during metabolic pathways.
CHEBI:15422.label: ATP

PATO:0001344.definition: A S. cerevisiae mating type cells that secrete a pheromone that stimulates a haploids.
PATO:0001344.label: alpha mating type (yeast)

PATO:0001345.definition: A S. pombe mating type determined by the mat1-Mc and mat1-Mi on the mat1 locus.
PATO:0001345.label: h minus

PATO:0001346.definition: A S. pombe mating type determined by the mat1-Pc and mat1-Pi on the mat1 locus.
PATO:0001346.label: h plus

PATO:0001347.definition: A bacterial mating type indicating the presence of F plasmid in a bacterial cell.
PATO:0001347.label: F mating type

OBI:0002270.synonyms: pN: Pathologic spread colon lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)
OBI:0002270.definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
OBI:0002270.label: pathologic lymph node stage for colon and rectum according to AJCC 7th edition

PATO:0001341.definition: A S. cerevisiae mating type cells that secrete a pheromone that in alpha haploids stimulates processes that lead to mating.
PATO:0001341.label: a mating type (yeast)

UBERON:0002369.definition: Either of a pair of complex endocrine organs near the anterior medial border of the kidney consisting of a mesodermal cortex that produces glucocorticoid, mineralocorticoid, and androgenic hormones and an ectodermal medulla that produces epinephrine and norepinephrine[BTO].
UBERON:0002369.label: adrenal gland

UBERON:0002106.definition: the organ that functions to filter blood and to store red corpuscles and platelets
UBERON:0002106.label: spleen

UBERON:0002107.definition: An exocrine gland which secretes bile and functions in metabolism of protein and carbohydrate and fat, synthesizes substances involved in the clotting of the blood, synthesizes vitamin A, detoxifies poisonous substances, stores glycogen, and breaks down worn-out erythrocytes[GO].
UBERON:0002107.label: liver

OBI:0002014.definition: An epigenetic modification assay that identifies sites of DNA methylation using ChIP-chip technologies.
OBI:0002014.label: DNA methylation profiling by ChIP-chip assay

OBI:0002015.definition: A transcription profiling assay that uses Massive Parallel Signature Sequencing (MPSS).
OBI:0002015.label: transcription profiling by MPSS assay

OBI:0002016.definition: An epigenetic modification assay that identifies regions containing specific histones and their modifications using ChIP-chip techniques.
OBI:0002016.label: histone modification identification by ChIP-chip assay

OBI:0002017.definition: An epigenetic modification assay that identifies regions containing specific histones and their modifications using ChIP-Seq techniques.
OBI:0002017.label: histone modification identification by ChIP-Seq assay

IAO:0000422.definition: A textual entity that is used as directive to deliver something to a person, or organization
IAO:0000422.label: postal address

OBI:0002011.synonyms: Nimblegen Human 2.1M Whole-Genome CGH Tiling Array v2.0
OBI:0002011.definition: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Nimblegen corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 2.1 million features.
OBI:0002011.label: Human 2.1M Whole-Genome CGH Tiling Array v2.0

OBI:0002012.definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Pacific Biosciences corporation. Built upon single molecule real-time sequencing technology, the machine is optimized for generation with long reads and high consensus accuracy.
OBI:0002012.label: PacBio RS II

OBI:0002013.definition: A human array which is manufacutred by NanoString Technologies. Built upon color-coded molecular barcodes technology, the array profiles miRNA with increased specificity and sensitivty than microarrays.
OBI:0002013.label: nCounter Human miRNA Expression array

OBI:0002018.definition: A transcription factor binding site assay that utilizes ChIP-chip technology.
OBI:0002018.label: transcription factor binding site identification by ChIP-chip assay

OBI:0002019.definition: A transcription factor binding site assay that utilizes ChIP-seq technology.
OBI:0002019.label: transcription factor binding site identification by ChIP-Seq assay

OBI:1110021.definition: the detrimental process in which an infectious agent colonizes or replicates in a host environment
OBI:1110021.label: infection process

OBI:0400171.definition: a processed material which has the function to define a bounded habitat which is amenable to keeping animals.
OBI:0400171.label: animal cage

OBI:0400170.definition: a microscope slide is a device usually made of glass which is used as a solid matrix for (biological) material deposited on its surface and which is compatible for use with a microscope instrument
OBI:0400170.label: microscope slide

OBI:1110182.definition: A biological process where T cells proliferate resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110182.label: epitope specific T cell proliferation

OBI:1110181.definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay performed on cells in vitro that uses a BrdU incorporation assay.
OBI:1110181.label: BrdU assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells

OBI:1110180.definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay performed on cells in vitro that uses a tritiated thymidine incorporation assay.
OBI:1110180.label: 3H-thymidine assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells

OBI:1110187.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-10 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110187.label: epitope specific IL-10 release by T cells

OBI:1110185.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IFNg resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110185.label: epitope specific IFN-g release by T cells

OBI:1110184.definition: A biological process where T cells produce GM-CSF resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110184.label: epitope specific GM-CSF release by T cells

OBI:0002476.definition: A data item that is the number of times an amplification reaction happened.
OBI:0002476.label: number of rounds of amplification

OBI:0002477.definition: A reference substance role that is played by a reference genome when used during sequence alignment.
OBI:0002477.label: reference genome role

OBI:0002474.definition: A worker role played by the person who performs the library preparation process to generate a sequencing library for a sample to be sequenced.
OBI:0002474.label: material sequencing library preparation role

OBI:0002475.definition: A data item that is the number of PCR cycles used during the construction of a sequencing library.
OBI:0002475.label: number of PCR cycles during library construction

OBI:0002472.definition: A central registered identifier symbol that denotes a specific study in dbGaP.
OBI:0002472.label: dbGaP study identifier

OBI:0002473.definition: A worker role played by the person who runs the enzymatic amplifying process.
OBI:0002473.label: material amplification role

OBI:0002470.definition: A base calling application that implments a base calling algorithm to convert BCL (binary base call) files generated by Illumina sequencing systems to standard FASTQ file formats for downstream analysis.
OBI:0002470.label: bcl2fastq software application

OBI:0002471.definition: A data item that is the date when a process was initiated.
OBI:0002471.label: date process started

OBI:0002478.definition: An algorithm that attempts to align a nucleic acid sequence to a reference genome and transcriptome.
OBI:0002478.label: reference genome-transcriptome alignment algorithm

OBI:0002479.definition: A measurement datum that is the result of the measurement of the number of bases in a DNA or RNA sequence.
OBI:0002479.label: sequence read length measurement datum

UBERON:0001090.definition: Transudate contained in the synovial cavity of joints, and in the cavity of tendon sheaths and bursae.
UBERON:0001090.label: synovial fluid

UBERON:0002812.definition: A cerebral hemisphere that is in the left side of a brain.
UBERON:0002812.label: left cerebral hemisphere

UBERON:0002813.definition: A cerebral hemisphere that is in the right side of a brain.
UBERON:0002813.label: right cerebral hemisphere

OBI:0302716.definition: A pool of specimens is a mixture of a population of samples which have been gathered from one or more sample populations, obtained by the physical process of mixing individual specimens, e.g.  mixing the DNA collected from the individual fish.
OBI:0302716.label: pool of specimens

OBI:0000449.definition:
This is only a placeholder for defined classes, as are its siblings _defined_material and _defined protocol application.
Its children should be defined classes constructed as output of a process.
OBI:0000449.label: obsolete_defined_output

OBI:0200059.definition: An MHC binding prediction takes an input of a biomaterial sequence and through an analysis of this sequence, produces as output a prediction of the likelihood that the biomaterial will bind to an MHC molecule.
OBI:0200059.label: mhc binding prediction

OBI:0001006.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using CMCT probe
OBI:0001006.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay which uses CMCT as reagent and chemical probe to generate data and information at nucleotide resolution scale contributing to the determination of nucleic acid secondary structure
OBI:0001006.label: CMCT structure mapping assay

OBI:0001007.definition: A planned process that captures an image of an object.
OBI:0001007.label: image creation

OBI:0001005.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using RNAse CL3
OBI:0001005.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution ribonucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines nucleic acid secondary structure at a nucleotide resolution scale using RNAse CL3 as reagent and enzymatic probe.
OBI:0001005.label: RNASE CL3 structure mapping assay

OBI:0001002.definition: A device formed by conducting material or by a mesh of such material, that blocks out external static electric fields.
OBI:0001002.label: Faraday cage

OBI:0001003.definition: a storage process with input cell culture and agar and output agar stab for long time storage
OBI:0001003.label: agar stab storage

OBI:0001000.definition: A document with a set of printed or written questions with a choice of answers, devised for the purposes of a survey or statistical study.
OBI:0001000.label: questionnaire

OBI:0001001.definition: An assay that uses a set of questions (the Edinburgh Handedness inventory) to generate a score that can be used to assess the dominance of a person's right or left hand in everyday activities. The inventory can be used by an observer assessing the person, or by a person self-reporting hand use. The latter method tends to be less reliable due to a person over-attributing tasks to the dominant hand.
OBI:0001001.label: Edinburgh handedness assay

OBI:0001008.synonyms: single nucleotide resolution mapping assay using Fe-MP probe
OBI:0001008.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution ribonucleic acid structure mapping assay that determines nucleic acid secondary structure at the nucleotide resolution scale using Fe-MP as reagent and chemical probe.
OBI:0001008.label: MPE-Fe(II) structure mapping assay

OBI:0001009.definition: A binding assay where the specified output determines if two or more material entities do or do not have the disposition to form a complex above a threshold level of significance. The threshold can be defined through detection limits of the instrument, the use of experimental controls that establish what is considered significant binding, or a predefined cutoff based on what binding is considered significant in a certain context.
OBI:0001009.label: obsolete_qualitative binding detection assay

OBI:0002290.definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of colon cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
OBI:0002290.label: pathologic distant metastases stage for colon according to AJCC 7th edition

OBI:0000751.definition: dependent variable specification is part of a study design. The dependent variable is the event studied and expected to change when the independent variable varies.
OBI:0000751.label: study design dependent variable

OBI:0000750.definition: a directive information entity that is part of a study design. Independent variables are entities whose values are selected to determine its relationship to an observed phenomenon (the dependent variable). In such an experiment, an attempt is made to find evidence that the values of the independent variable determine the values of the dependent variable (that which is being measured). The independent variable can be changed as required, and its values do not represent a problem requiring explanation in an analysis, but are taken simply as given. The dependent variable on the other hand, usually cannot be directly controlled
OBI:0000750.label: study design independent variable

PR:000025402.definition: A protein complex that is a membrane-bound heterodimeric co-receptor for MHC class-I antigen/T-cell receptor interaction.
PR:000025402.label: T cell receptor co-receptor CD8

OBI:0001652.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses an immuno staining assay.
OBI:0001652.label: immuno staining assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0000845.definition: The primary structure of an RNA molecule that is completely defined by the set of its nucleic residue parts and the linear order induced by the peptide bonds that hold them together
OBI:0000845.label: primary structure of RNA molecule

OBI:0200186.definition: An error correction objective is a data transformation objective where the aim is to remove (correct for) erroneous contributions arising from the input data, or the transformation itself.
OBI:0200186.label: error correction objective

OBI:0000913.definition: An assay in which the activity of a promoter in a cell is monitored by using a reporter gene that was inserted in a genomic location under control of the promoter and whose expression can be easily detected based on qualities or functions of the gene.
OBI:0000913.label: promoter activity detection by reporter gene assay

OBI:0200184.definition: A descriptive statistical calculation data transformation is a data transformation that has objective descriptive statistical calculation and which concerns any calculation intended to describe a feature of a data set, for example, its center or its variability.
OBI:0200184.label: descriptive statistical calculation data transformation

OBI:0200185.definition: A scaling data transformation is a data transformation that has objective scaling.
OBI:0200185.label: scaling data transformation

OBI:0200182.definition: A data vector reduction is a data transformation that has objective data vector reduction and that consists of reducing the input vectors k to a smaller number of output vectors j, where j<k.
OBI:0200182.label: data vector reduction data transformation

OBI:0200183.definition: is a data transformation objective where all, or some of a data set is adjusted by some data transformation according to some scale, for example a user defined minimum or maximum
OBI:0200183.label: scaling objective

IAO:0000608.definition: A textual entity expression information about an author of a document. This information may include biographical information and may discuss how the authors' professional experiences are relevant to the work described in the document.
IAO:0000608.label: author information textual entity

IAO:0000609.definition: A part of a document, distinct from the abstract, that describes the significance and broader context of the document content. The author summary is often written in a non-technical manner and is aimed at both scientists and non-scientist readers.
IAO:0000609.label: author summary section

IAO:0000606.synonyms: list of abbreviations;abbreviations list;abbreviations;list of abbreviations used;abbreviations used
IAO:0000606.definition: A part of a document where abbreviations and their long-forms used within the document are listed.
IAO:0000606.label: abbreviations section

IAO:0000607.definition: A part of a document about the authors that provides biographical information and may discuss how the authors' professional experiences are relevant to the work described in the document.
IAO:0000607.label: author information section

IAO:0000605.definition: A textual entity listing abbreviations and their expansions that are used in a document.
IAO:0000605.label: abbreviation textual entity

OBI:0000911.definition: An assay that uses a reverse transcription step (an RNA strand is reverse transcribed into its DNA complement using the enzyme reverse transcriptase) before a PCR assay.
OBI:0000911.label: real time reverse-transcription polymerase chain reaction assay

OBI:0200188.definition: A cross validation objective is a data transformation objective in which the aim is to partition a sample of data into subsets such that the analysis is initially performed on a single subset, while the other subset(s) are retained for subsequent use in confirming and validating the initial analysis.
OBI:0200188.label: cross validation objective

OBI:0200189.definition: A merging objective is a data transformation objective in which the data transformation has the aim of performing a union of two or more sets.
OBI:0200189.label: merging objective

OBI:0200053.definition: EM is a probabilistic algorithm used to estimate the maximum likelihood of parameters from existing data where the model involves unobserved latent variables. The input to this method is the data model for which the estimation is performed over and the output is an approximated probability function.
OBI:0200053.label: expectation maximization

OBI:0000917.definition:
A specimen obtained using a cotton swab on a stick, passed up the nostril to obtain a sample of
exudate and epithelial debris for microbiological or cellular examination.
OBI:0000917.label: nasal swab specimen

OBI:0000916.definition: A cytometry assay in which an input cell population is put in solution, is passed by a laser, and optical sensors are used to detect scattering of the laser light and/or fluorescence of specific markers to count and characterize the particles in solution.
OBI:0000916.label: flow cytometry assay

OBI:0001914.definition: A polymerase chain reaction that amplifies multiple targets with a single primer pair mediated by hybridization of a primer with its target sequence using ligation.
OBI:0001914.label: multiplex ligation-mediated amplification

OBI:0001915.definition: An assay which quantifies the timing of DNA replication as a function of genome position using array technology.
OBI:0001915.label: DNA replication timing by array assay

OBI:0001916.definition: A molecular feature identification objective that aims to examine charateristics of DNA replication, such as replication time.
OBI:0001916.label: DNA replication identification objective

OBI:0001917.definition: A molecular feature identification objective that aims to determine spatial organization of chromatin.
OBI:0001917.label: chromosome conformation identification objective

OBI:0001910.definition: A cell culture comprised of primary cultured cells and the media in which they are being actively propaged or quiescently stored.
OBI:0001910.label: primary cell culture

OBI:0001911.definition: A cell culture comprised of cell line cells and the media in which they are being actively propagated or quiescently stored.
OBI:0001911.label: cell line culture

OBI:0001912.definition: A processed material that serves as a liquid vehicle for freezing cells for long term quiescent stroage, which contains chemicls needed to sustain cell viability across freeze-thaw cycles.
OBI:0001912.label: cell freezing medium

OBI:0001913.definition: computation run time is a time measurement datum which corresponds the time expressed in second, minute, hour necessary for a computer program to complete a process execution, for example genome assembly. It is an important metrics as it indicates the resource occupancy and computer program efficiency.
OBI:0001913.label: computation run time

OBI:0001172.definition: A data item of paired values, one indicating the dose of a material, the other quantitating a measured effect at that dose. The dosing intervals are chosen so that effect values be interpolated by a plotting a curve.
OBI:0001172.label: dose response curve

OBI:0001173.definition: A planned process in which a service provider performs a task (i.e. a planned process) for a service consumer.
OBI:0001173.label: service

OBI:0001170.definition: An assay that determines the concentration of RNA in a sample in which an RNA strand is first reverse transcribed into its DNA complement (complementary DNA, or cDNA) using the enzyme reverse transcriptase, and the resulting cDNA is amplified using traditional or real-time PCR.
OBI:0001170.label: reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction assay

OBI:0001171.definition: The time it takes for 50% of a class of stochastic processes to occur.
OBI:0001171.label: half life datum (t 1/2)

OBI:0001918.definition: An assay that combines immunoprecipitation of an RNA-binding protein and array technology to identify mRNAs associated with selected RNA binding proteins (RBPs).
OBI:0001918.label: RNA-binding protein immunoprecipitation array profiling assay

OBI:0001919.definition: An assay that measures the organization of chromosomes at the genome-wide scale.
OBI:0001919.label: Carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay

OBI:0001174.definition: The injection of immune effector material (antibodies, T cells or B cells) into an organism so that the organisms immune system gains its  immune effector function to recognize specific antigens.
OBI:0001174.label: passive immunization

OBI:0001175.definition: an objective specification to generate a population or type of organism within species that have some uniform behavioral, morphological, physiological, or genetic characteristics with similarly bred organisms.
OBI:0001175.label: selective organism creation objective

OBI:0001590.definition: A purified MHC binding assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001590.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001591.definition: A binding assay that measures the formation or disassociation of a complex of 2 material entities directly without use of a competitve ligand.
OBI:0001591.label: direct binding assay

OBI:0001592.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding half maximal effective concentration (EC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001592.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring half maximal effective concentration [EC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001593.definition: A binding assay that detects the inhibition of binding between 2 material entities known to form a complex by the addition of a third material entity of interest. Inhibition of binding between the 2 materials reflects binding by the third material.
OBI:0001593.label: competitive inhibition of binding assay

OBI:0001594.definition: A cell bound MHC binding assay that uses fluorescence to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation
OBI:0001594.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001595.definition: A MHC binding 3D structure determination of MHC molecule:epitope complex assay that uses an X-ray crystallography assay.
OBI:0001595.label: X-ray crystallography assay determining the 3D structure of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0001596.definition: A 3D structural organization datum that is part of a PDB file and has a specific chain identifier that identifies the entire information on a subset of the material entities
OBI:0001596.label: PDB file chain

OBI:0001597.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses a T cell epitope recognition assay to measure ligand binding.
OBI:0001597.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using T cell epitope recognition

OBI:0001598.definition: A maintenance service in which a service provider actively manages or maintains data or a database for the service consumer.  Maintenance of the data is performed to maintain its integrity or enhance its quality or utility for the consumer, but new data is not generated as a result of the maintenance.
OBI:0001598.label: data maintenance service

OBI:0001599.definition: A cell bound MHC binding assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001599.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001281.definition: An assay of epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001281.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells

OBI:0001752.definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001752.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells

OBI:0001753.definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001753.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells

OBI:0001750.definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001750.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells

OBI:0001751.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001751.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells

OBI:0001756.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001756.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells

OBI:0001757.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001757.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells

OBI:0001754.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001754.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells

OBI:0001755.definition: A directive information entity which defines and states a principle of standard by which selection process may take place.
OBI:0001755.label: selection criterion

OBI:0001758.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001758.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production by T cells

OBI:0001759.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001759.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 12 production by T cells

OBI:0001505.definition: A planned process to separate a material entity into different compositions of which one or more have are purified fractions that contain higher concentration of a desired component, while others contain impurities and are not of interest
OBI:0001505.label: purification

CHEBI:31624.definition: A xanthene dye that is highly fluorescent, detectable even when present in minute quantities. Used forensically to detect traces of blood, in analytical chemistry as an indicator in silver nitrate titrations and in microscopy.
CHEBI:31624.label: fluorescein

CHEBI:31991.definition: 3H-2,1-Benzoxathiole 1,1-dioxide in which both of the hydrogens at position 3 have been substituted by 4-hydroxyphenyl groups. A pH indicator changing colour from yellow below pH 6.8 to bright pink above pH 8.2, it is commonly used as an indicator in cell cultures and in home swimming pool test kits. It is also used in the (now infrequently performed) phenolsulfonphthalein (PSP) test for estimation of overall blood flow through the kidney.
CHEBI:31991.label: phenol red

GO:0097458.definition: Any constituent part of a neuron, the basic cellular unit of nervous tissue. A typical neuron consists of a cell body (often called the soma), an axon, and dendrites. Their purpose is to receive, conduct, and transmit impulses in the nervous system.
GO:0097458.label: neuron part

OBI:0001358.definition: A study design in which a modification of the transcriptome, proteome (not genome) is made, for example RNAi, antibody targeting.
OBI:0001358.label: post-transcriptional modification design

OBI:0001359.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-8 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001359.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-8 production by T cells

OBI:0001356.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001356.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells

OBI:0001357.definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001357.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor production by T cells

OBI:0001354.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001354.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells

GO:0005694.definition: A structure composed of a very long molecule of DNA and associated proteins (e.g. histones) that carries hereditary information.
GO:0005694.label: chromosome

OBI:0001353.definition: A T cell epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production assay that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001353.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production by T cells

OBI:0001350.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001350.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells

OBI:0001351.definition: A process of tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001351.label: epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells

OBI:0001777.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells.
OBI:0001777.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 22 production by T cells

OBI:0000409.definition: a reference substance role which inheres in nucleic acid material entity and is realized in the process of using the nucleic acid bearing the template role as a reference during synthesis of a reverse copy.
OBI:0000409.label: nucleic acid template role

GO:0036392.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 (CCL20) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0036392.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 20 production

OBI:0000405.definition: a complementary nucleotide probe role which inheres in nucleic acid molecular entity and is realized by the use of the entity bearing the role to initiate chain elongation.
OBI:0000405.label: primer role

OBI:0000404.definition: A gel dryer is a device which has the function to contain and to control the contained environment to facilitate the drying of gels
OBI:0000404.label: gel dryer

OBI:0000407.definition: The extraction of RNA from an input material that specifically isolates viral RNA
OBI:0000407.label: viral RNA extraction

OBI:0000401.definition: An environmental control function is a function that regulates a contained environment within specified parameter ranges. For example the control of light exposure, humidity and temperature.
OBI:0000401.label: environment control function

OBI:0000400.definition: A display function is a function to present information by translating that information through some lookup process into visual form.
OBI:0000400.label: display function

OBI:0000403.definition: A sort function is a function to distinguish material components based on some associated physical quality or entity and to partition the separate components into distinct fractions according to a defined order.
OBI:0000403.label: sort function

OBI:0000218.definition: An investigation report is a report on the results of an investigation.
OBI:0000218.label: investigation results report

OBI:0000219.definition: Cellular_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize a biological feature monitored at the cellular level, e.g. stage of cell cycle, stage of differentiation.
OBI:0000219.label: cellular feature identification objective

OBI:0302859.definition: an organism that is the output of a genetic transformation process
OBI:0302859.label: genetically modified organism

OBI:0000539.definition: An NMR probe that is designed for generating pictures from sample states via NMR imaging.
OBI:0000539.label: imaging NMR probe

OBI:0000538.definition: A solvent filter that sits between the pump and the injection valve that prevents dust particles, general debris and, to some extent, bacteria from entering the chromatography system. Contaminants can interfere with the low-pressure gradient former or the pump and particles entering valves may interfere with the proper function. The result could cause an increased baseline noise, non-repeatable gradient forming, unreliable flow rate or other interferences. Solvent in-line filters are low-pressure filters and will allow a high flow rate due to a large surface area and large porosity.
OBI:0000538.label: in-line filter

OBI:0001839.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001839.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells

OBI:0000531.definition:
The Bruker BioSpin CryoProbe is a high-performance cryogenically cooled probe developed for high-resolution applications. It has improved signal/noise (S/N) ratios obtained by reducing the operating temperature of the coil and the pre-amplifier. As a result, the efficiency of the coil is improved and the noise of the coil and the pre-amplifier are reduced.The dramatic increase in the S/N ratio by a factor of 3-4, as compared to conventional probes, leads to a possible reduction in experiment time of up to 16 or a reduction in required sample concentration by a factor of up to 4. The CryoProbes possess key characteristics for NMR analysis:
   Significant S/N gains (with moderately salty samples also)
   Short pulse widths
   Short ring down times
   Linear behavior in power response
   Gradient capability
   CryoProbes are available as Triple Resonance, Dual, Selective X Detection, MicroImaging, and Quad Nucleus Probes configurations at 400 MHz and higher
   All high resolution probes have a lock circuit
   All high resolution probes have Z-gradient.
OBI:0000531.label: Bruker CryoProbe

OBI:0000530.definition: An NMR magnet of which Brukers claims it is the latest and most advanced self-shielding NMR magnet technology ever developed. These magnets are the ultimate advancement in high performance, actively-shielded NMR solutions. They offer unprecedented shielding performance whilst ensuring no compromise in system homogeneity, stability or cryogenic specifications.
OBI:0000530.label: Bruker UltraShield Plus NMR magnet

OBI:0000533.definition: An affinity column is a chromatography column that is used in affinity chromatography. Differences in the affinity of molecules to be separated to a stationary phase are used for discriminate retention.
OBI:0000533.label: affinity column

OBI:0000532.definition: A device that binds the chromatography column and additional connector elements and / or valves or syringes into one physical unity for further processing.
OBI:0000532.label: column cartridge

OBI:0000535.definition: A Gel filtration column is a chromatography column for size-exclusion chromatography, in which the stationary phase is a gel. The main application of gel filtration chromatography is the fractionation of proteins and other water-soluble polymers.
OBI:0000535.label: gel filtration column

OBI:0000534.definition: An NMR instrument that is manufactured by tecmag.
OBI:0000534.label: tecmag NMR instrument

OBI:0000537.definition: An assay that determines lost or amplified genomic regions of DNA by comparing genomic DNA originating from tissues from the same or different individuals using specific techniques such as CGH, array CGH, SNP genotyping
OBI:0000537.label: copy number variation profiling assay

OBI:0000536.definition: A fraction detector is a device that allows regular or specified samples to be taken from a column eluate and stored in a retrievable form. The storage vessels are usually small sample tubes or vials that are oriented in a rotating disk or in a moving belt, there movement usually being controlled by a microprocessor. On receiving a signal from the microprocessor, the next vial is placed under the column outlet and the eluate collected until receiving another signal from the computer. Once the properties of the chromatogram that describes the separation has been ascertained, then the collection program can be defined. The fractions can be collected on a basis of time either at regular intervals or a specific times to collect specific peaks. Alternatively the fractions can be collected by monitoring the detector output and when a peak starts to elute the fraction collector is activated and the peak collected in a specific vial. When the peak returns to base line the column eluate is then directed to waste until the next peak starts eluting. Fraction collectors are in common use with most liquid chromatographs. They are used to collect samples for further purification, subsequent examination by spectroscopic techniques or for biological or organoleptic testing.
OBI:0000536.label: fraction collector

GAZ:00000448.definition: A reference to a place on the Earth, by its name or by its geographical location.
GAZ:00000448.label: geographic location

PATO:0001340.definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an organism or a population with both male and female sexual organs in one individual.
PATO:0001340.label: hermaphrodite

OBI:0000245.definition: An entity that can bear roles, has members, and has a set of organization rules. Members of organizations are either organizations themselves or individual people. Members can bear specific organization member roles that are determined in the organization rules. The organization rules also determine how decisions are made on behalf of the organization by the organization members.
OBI:0000245.label: organization

OBI:0000243.definition: a responsible party role involved with any of the following activities:  initiating, managing and funding a study
OBI:0000243.label: sponsor role

OBI:0000242.definition: Software_testing_objective is a hardware_optimization role describing a study designed to examine the effects of using different software or software parameters, e.g. data processing software.
OBI:0000242.label: software testing objective

OGMS:0000063.definition: The totality of all processes through which a given disease instance is realized.
OGMS:0000063.label: disease course

OBI:0000249.definition: technical replicate role is realized when two portions from one evaluant are used in replicate runs of an assay
OBI:0000249.label: technical replicate role

OBI:0000248.definition: a role that inheres in a material entity and is realized in the use of that material entity by lab animal to provide all needed nourishment.
OBI:0000248.label: feed role

CHEBI:17709.definition: An adenosine 5'-phosphate having a sulfo group attached to one the phosphate OH groups.
CHEBI:17709.label: 5'-adenylyl sulfate

GO:0042605.definition: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an antigen peptide.
GO:0042605.label: peptide antigen binding

OBI:0002067.definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0002067.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells

OBI:0002372.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a blood relative.
OBI:0002372.label: family clinical history of cancer

OBI:0001300.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001300.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells

OBI:0002066.definition: A T cell epitope specific granzyme B release assay that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0002066.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific granzyme B release by T cells

VO:0000002.definition: a process of administering substance in vivo that involves in adding a vaccine into a host (e.g., human) in vivo with the intent to invoke a protective or therapeutic adaptive immune response.
VO:0000002.label: vaccination

UBERON:0007610.definition: The anterior and posterior arteries created at the bifurcation of the popliteal artery. The anterior tibial artery begins at the lower border of the popliteus muscle and lies along the tibia at the distal part of the leg to surface superficially anterior to the ankle joint. Its branches are distributed throughout the leg, ankle, and pes. The posterior tibial artery begins at the lower border of the popliteus muscle, lies behind the tibia in the lower part of its course, and is found situated between the medial malleolus and the medial process of the calcaneal tuberosity. Its branches are distributed throughout the leg and foot.
UBERON:0007610.label: tibial artery

GO:0009566.definition: The union of gametes of opposite sexes during the process of sexual reproduction to form a zygote. It involves the fusion of the gametic nuclei (karyogamy) and cytoplasm (plasmogamy).
GO:0009566.label: fertilization

OBI:0001737.definition: A X-ray crystallography assay measuring epitope specfic antibody binding event in angstroms
OBI:0001737.label: obsolete B cell epitope specific X-ray crystallography assay

UBERON:0001913.definition: An emulsion of fat globules within a fluid that is secreted by the mammary gland during lactation.
UBERON:0001913.label: milk

OBI:0001650.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses an immunoblot assay.
OBI:0001650.label: immunoblot assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0200098.definition: Soft independent modeling by class analogy (SIMCA) is a descriptive statistics method for supervised classification of data. The method requires a training data set consisting of samples (or objects) with a set of attributes and their class membership. The term soft refers to the fact the classifier can identify samples as belonging to multiple classes and not necessarily producing a classification of samples into non-overlapping classes.
OBI:0200098.label: soft independent modeling of class analogy analysis

OBI:0001683.definition: An in-situ hybridization assay that uses fluorescence to detect chromosomal integrity
OBI:0001683.label: chromosome organization assay by fluorescence in-situ hybridization

OBI:0001731.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a surface plasmon resonance assay.
OBI:0001731.label: surface plasmon resonance assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0000879.definition: a labeling in which random primers are used to uniformly label input DNA
OBI:0000879.label: random primed DNA labeling

CHEBI:17234.definition: An aldohexose used as a source of energy and metabolic intermediate.
CHEBI:17234.label: glucose

GO:0044030.definition: Any process that modulates the frequency, rate or extent of the covalent transfer of a methyl group to either N-6 of adenine or C-5 or N-4 of cytosine.
GO:0044030.label: regulation of DNA methylation

OBI:0002010.synonyms: Nimblegen Human 3x720K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array
OBI:0002010.definition: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Nimblegen corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 3x720,000 features.
OBI:0002010.label: Human 3x720K Whole Genome CGH Tiling Array

OBI:0002406.definition: A processed material used for delivery of hormones in hormone replacement therapy.
OBI:0002406.label: delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy

OBI:1110043.definition: A mixed cell population that is characterized by its ability to bind to tissue culture flasks or plates. This population typically contains macrophages and other cells capable of playing the antigen presenting cell role.
OBI:1110043.label: cultured adherent cell populaiton

OBI:0001738.definition: A B cell epitope 3D structure determination assay that uses an X-ray crystallography assay.
OBI:0001738.label: X-ray crystallography assay determining the 3D structure of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0200091.definition: a data transformation objective of determining the concordance or agreement between human judges.
OBI:0200091.label: inter-rater reliability objective

UBERON:0002046.definition: A two-lobed endocrine gland found in all vertebrates, located in front of and on either side of the trachea in humans, and producing various hormones, such as triiodothyronine and calcitonin[BTO].
UBERON:0002046.label: thyroid gland

OBI:0200092.definition: Is a data transformation process in which the Westfall and Young method is applied with the aim of controlling for multiple testing
OBI:0200092.label: Westfall and Young family wise error rate correction

OBI:0000849.definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the organelle(s).
OBI:0000849.label: organellar RNA extraction

OBI:0200093.definition: A polynomial transformation is a data transformation that is obtained through a polynomial, where a polynomial is a mathematical expression involving a sum of powers in one or more variables multiplied by coefficients (e.g. see http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Polynomial.html). The number of variables and the degree are properties of a polynomial. The degree of a polynomial is the highest power of its terms, where the terms of a polynomial are the individual summands with the coefficients omitted.
OBI:0200093.label: polynomial transformation

OBI:0002409.definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a cream for transdermal administration.
OBI:0002409.label: cream delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy

OBI:0002397.definition: A clinical history in which a woman has had gynecologic surgery in the past.
OBI:0002397.label: gynecologic surgery history

OBI:0002396.definition: An age measurement datum performed on a female when her first biological child was born.
OBI:0002396.label: age when gave birth to first child

GO:0019882.definition: The process in which an antigen-presenting cell expresses antigen (peptide or lipid) on its cell surface in association with an MHC protein complex.
GO:0019882.label: antigen processing and presentation

OBI:0002394.definition: A measurement datum of the total number of pregnancies a woman has had.
OBI:0002394.label: number of pregnancies

OBI:0002393.definition: A clinical history in which a female has had a pregnancy.
OBI:0002393.label: pregnancy history

OBI:0002391.definition: An exposure to second hand smoke that occurred in the (patient's) household when the person was a child.
OBI:0002391.label: exposure to second hand smoke in household during childhood

OBI:0002390.definition: A clinical history in which there has been second hand exposure to tobacco smoking.
OBI:0002390.label: exposure to second hand smoke

OBI:0002399.definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has had a unilateral oophorectomy.
OBI:0002399.label: unilateral oophorectomy history

OBI:0002398.definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has had a hysterectomy.
OBI:0002398.label: hysterectomy history

OBI:0000848.definition: A RNA extraction process typically involving the use of poly dT oligomers in which the desired output material is polyA RNA.
OBI:0000848.label: polyA RNA extraction

OBI:0302745.definition: adipose tissue is a tissue which main constituents are adipocytes. adipose tissue can be classified base on its location (site) but also based on adipocyte subtypes (brown or white) which reflect functional differences and is only found in animals, Vertebrates or invertebrates.
OBI:0302745.label: obsolete_adipose tissue

OBI:0002243.synonyms: pT: Pathologic spread kidney primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)
OBI:0002243.definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of renal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
OBI:0002243.label: pathologic primary tumor stage for kidney according to AJCC 7th edition

OBI:0400075.definition: A MoFlo is a flow_cytometer_sorter manufactured by Dako Cytomation. It features digital electronics, the option to include several lasers (solid state 488 nm, 635 nm, and a 351 nm diode laser), and has the filtering and collection capacity for up to 10 flouresecent parameters. The MoFlo is an instrument that can be used to both analyze quantitatively and collect cells in a flowing medium.
OBI:0400075.label: MoFlo

OBI:0000323.definition: is the serous membrane that forms the lining of the abdominal cavity
OBI:0000323.label: obsolete_peritoneum

UBERON:0002116.definition: the portion of the small intestine that extends from the jejunum to the colon
UBERON:0002116.label: ileum

OBI:0400050.definition: A  Guava_Personal_Cell_Analysis System is a flow_cytometer_analyser that includes a single 532 nm laser, and filters and PMTs to collect up to 2 fluorescent parameters. It includes a photodiode forward scatter collector. Guava cytometers use aspiration instead of fluid systems to transport cells within the machine. The PCA96 uses only tubes to introduce specimen. The Guava PCA cytometer is a small portable cytometer particularly useful for field measurement.
OBI:0400050.label: Guava Personal Cell Analysis

OBI:0001662.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a nuclear magnetic resonance assay.
OBI:0001662.label: NMR assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0400073.definition: A metal vapor laser is a gas laser in which the lasing medium is metal vapor. A metal vapor laser can by used to irradiate cells in a flow cytometer.
OBI:0400073.label: metal vapor laser

OBI:0002037.definition: An array based nucleic acid structure mapping assay that identifies nucleosome positions genome wide, by detection of regions protected by nucleosomes from digestion by micrococal nuclease using tiling array assays
OBI:0002037.label: micrococcal nuclease digestion followed by tiling array assay

OBI:0400168.definition: A microtome is a mechanical instrument used to cut biological specimens into very thin segments for further treatment (e.g. ISH) and ultimately microscopic or histologic examination. Most microtomes provide cooling facilities (cryo-microtome) and use a steel blade to cut a slice of defined thickness. Some are automatic, and some are driven by hand.
OBI:0400168.label: microtome

OBI:0400169.definition: A microscope is an instrument which magnifies the view on objects (too small to be viewed by the naked eye) under increased resolution. A microscope can be an optical instrument but also and electronic instrument. There are various kind of optical microscopes, e.g confocal microscope, epifluoresence microscope)
OBI:0400169.label: microscope

OBI:1110190.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-12 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110190.label: epitope specific IL-12 release by T cells

OBI:1110191.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-13 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110191.label: epitope specific IL-13 release by T cells

OBI:0400051.definition: The Guava_Personal_Cell_Analysis-96 Systems is a flow_cytometer_analyser that includes a single 532 nm laser, and filters and PMTs to collect up to 2 fluorescent parameters. It includes a photodiode forward scatter collector. Guava cytometers use aspiration instead of fluid systems to transport cells within the machine. The PCA96 uses either tubes or 96 well plates to introduce specimen. The Guava PCA -96 cytometer is a small portable cytometer particularly useful for field measurement.
OBI:0400051.label: Guava Personal Cell Analysis-96

OBI:1110193.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-17 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110193.label: epitope specific IL-17 release by T cells

OBI:1110195.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-18 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110195.label: epitope specific IL-18 release by T cells

OBI:1110196.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-1b resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110196.label: epitope specific IL-1b release by T cells

OBI:0001238.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-9 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001238.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-9 production by T cells

OBI:1110199.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-4 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110199.label: epitope specific IL-4 release by T cells

OBI:0000634.definition: An assay that measures the state of methylation of DNA molecules using genomic DNA collected from a material entity using a range of techniques and instrument such as DNA sequencers and often relying on treatment with bisulfites to ensure cytosine conversion.
OBI:0000634.label: DNA methylation profiling assay

OBI:0000635.definition: The JEOL ECA and ECX NMR spectrometers now support the MRM/Protasis CapNMR Probe for well plate-based and microvial-based NMR analysis. The CapNMR probe is available at proton frequencies ranging from 300 MHz to 800 MHz in both indirect configurations (e.g. 1H{13C} and 1H {31P}) and also in triple resonance configurations (e.g. 1H{13C, 15N}, 1H{31P, 15N}). Both employ a high-strength z-directed field gradient. The flowprobes come with the choice of two flowcell volumes: a 5 μl flowcell with an NMR active volume of 2.5 μl, and a 10 μl flowcell with an NMR active volume of 5 μl. The fluidic connections are 75 μm i.d. and 1/32 o.d. FEP Teflon with hastelloy unions for exceptional solvent compatibility.
OBI:0000635.label: JEOL CapNMR probe

OBI:0600024.definition: a protocol application in which cells are kept alive in a defined environment outside of an organism.  part of cell_culturing
OBI:0600024.label: maintaining cell culture

PATO:0000918.definition: A 3-D extent quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's amount of 3-dimensional space it occupies.
PATO:0000918.label: volume

OBI:0001231.definition: An assay of epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001231.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells

OBI:0600027.definition: a material transformation to break the membranes of cells, releasing the cells contents; input=>cells; output=>cell_lysate
OBI:0600027.label: artificially induced cell membrane lysis

OBI:0000880.definition: an extract which is the output of an extraction process in which RNA molecules are isolated from a specimen.
OBI:0000880.label: RNA extract

PATO:0001741.definition: A radiation quality inhering in bearer by virtue of the bearer's exhibiting or being caused by radioactivity.
PATO:0001741.label: radioactive

OBI:0200026.definition: A total intensity transformation single is a data transformation that takes as input an n-dimensional (real) vector and multiplies each component of this vector by a coefficient, where the coefficient is obtained by taking the sum of the input components or of a subset of these, multiplied by a constant of choice.
OBI:0200026.label: total intensity transformation single

OBI:0000883.definition: A cell killing assay that measures if and how many target cells are killed within an organism.
OBI:0000883.label: in vivo cell killing assay

GO:0006338.definition: Dynamic structural changes to eukaryotic chromatin occurring throughout the cell division cycle. These changes range from the local changes necessary for transcriptional regulation to global changes necessary for chromosome segregation.
GO:0006338.label: chromatin remodeling

OBI:0001235.definition: A transcription profiling by array assay that uses a tiling path array.
OBI:0001235.label: transcription profiling by tiling array assay

SO:0000149.definition: A contiguous sequence derived from sequence assembly. Has no gaps, but may contain N's from unavailable bases.
SO:0000149.label: contig

OBI:0001234.definition: A molecular feature identification objective that aims to detect epigenetic modifications, such as DNA methylation, histone modifications.
OBI:0001234.label: epigenetic modification identification objective

OBI:0002029.definition: A transcription profiling assay that quantifies RNA through creating short signature tags of the messages and ligating them into a larger molecule than was sequenced.
OBI:0002029.label: serial analysis of gene expression assay

OBI:0002028.definition: A library preparation in which tags identifiying transcripts are created, ligated to form ditags, amplified, concatemerized and ligated into a vector to create a library.
OBI:0002028.label: SAGE ditag library preparation

OBI:0001945.definition: N50 statistic computed for the scaffold produced by the assembly process. The method for computing the value is similar to that of contig N50 but uses scaffold information instead of contig information
OBI:0001945.label: scaffold N50

OBI:0002021.definition: A DNA sequencer which is a desktop sequencer ideal for smaller-scale studies manufactured by the Illumina corporation. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology.
OBI:0002021.label: NextSeq 500

OBI:0002020.definition: An assay that identifies epigenetic modifications including histone modifications, open chromatin, and DNA methylation.
OBI:0002020.label: epigenetic modification assay

OBI:0002023.synonyms: Affymetrix HT Human Genome U133 Plus 2 Array Plate Set;HG-U133 Plus 2 array;HG-U133 Plus 2
OBI:0002023.definition: A tiling array which is  a comprehensive whole human genome expression array manufactured by the Affymetrix corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 47,000 transcripts and variants.
OBI:0002023.label: Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 tiling array

OBI:0001944.definition: A planned process that identifies and reports sequence features (e.g. protein coding regions) in sequence data.
OBI:0001944.label: sequence annotation

OBI:0002025.synonyms: Human Exon 1.0;Affymetrix Human Exon 1.0 St Array;Human Exon 1.0 ST Array
OBI:0002025.definition: A tiling microarray which is manufactured by the Affymetrix corporation. Built to analyze 3' DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 28,000 genes. It  can be used for gene expression and alternative splicing assay
OBI:0002025.label: Human Exon 1.0 ST tilling array

OBI:0002024.definition: An AB SOLid System which is manufacted by the Applied Biosystems corporation. Built upon SOLiD sequencing technology, the machine generates greater than 1 billion mappable reads per run.
OBI:0002024.label: SOLiD 4 System

OBI:0002027.synonyms: Illumina GA IIe;Illumina Genome Analyzer IIe
OBI:0002027.definition: An Illumina Genome Analyzer II which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology. The Genome Analyzer IIe makes industry-leading next-generation sequencing technology accessible to more laboratories.
OBI:0002027.label: Genome Analyzer IIe

OBI:0002026.synonyms: HG-U133;HG-U133 array;Affymetrix HT Human Genome U133 Array Plate Set
OBI:0002026.definition: A tiling array which is manufactured by the Affymetrix corporation. Built to analyze DNA sequence copy number by comparative genomic hybridization for human DNA against 39,000 transcripts and variants.
OBI:0002026.label: Human Genome U133 tiling array

OBI:0001613.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001613.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001612.definition: A process of vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001612.label: epitope specific vascular endothelial growth factor production by T cells

OBI:0001611.definition: direct binding assay measuring MHC ligand binding using MHC derived from a purified MHC molecule preparation
OBI:0001611.label: obsolete purified MHC direct binding assay

OBI:0001610.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001610.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific intracellular cytokine staining (ICS) IL-223 production by T cells

OBI:0001617.definition: A CRID symbol that is sufficient to look up a citation from the PubMed, a literature database of life sciences and biomedical information.
OBI:0001617.label: PubMed ID

OBI:0001616.definition: A CRID symbol denotes a specimen and used to distinguish one specimen from another in an investigation.
OBI:0001616.label: specimen identifier

OBI:0001615.definition: A textual entity that describes an investigation.
OBI:0001615.label: investigation description

OBI:0001614.definition: A CRID symbol uniquely indentifies the submitted GeneBank sequence record.
OBI:0001614.label: GenBank ID

PR:000025478.definition: A protein with ribonuclease activity that is purified from chicken liver.
PR:000025478.label: ribonuclease CL3

OBI:0002033.definition: An RNA-seq assay that combines TL-seq with polysome fractionation
OBI:0002033.label: translation-associated transcript leader sequencing assay

OBI:0001619.definition: A time measurement datum that is the measure of the time when the specimens are collected.
OBI:0001619.label: specimen collection time measurement datum

OBI:0001618.definition: An average value of the depth of sequence coverage based both on external (e.g. Cot-based size estimates) and internal (average coverage in the assembly) measures of genome size.
OBI:0001618.label: average depth of sequence coverage

OBI:0000465.definition: An organic acid column is a chromatography column which enables (reversed-phase) separation of hydrophilic aliphatic and aromatic organic acids with UV detection. Organic acid columns allow retention of polar and apolar organic acids and are hydrolysis resistant.
OBI:0000465.label: organic acid column

CL:0000084.definition: A type of lymphocyte whose defining characteristic is the expression of a T cell receptor complex.
CL:0000084.label: T cell

UBERON:0000992.definition: the gonad of a female organism which contains germ cells
UBERON:0000992.label: female gonad

REO:0000280.definition: a molecular reagent intended to associate with some molecular target to serve as a proxy for the presence, abundance, or location of this target in a detection of molecular label assay
REO:0000280.label: molecular label

OBI:0002080.definition: A specimen set that is collected from one person during a time period which for the purpose of the study can be considered to be taken at the same sampling time.
OBI:0002080.label: human specimen set

UBERON:0001621.definition: An artery that supplies the myocardium.
UBERON:0001621.label: coronary artery

OBI:0001223.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001223.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells

OBI:0001929.definition: A value specification that specifies the mass of some thing.
OBI:0001929.label: mass value specification

OBI:0001928.definition: A planned process which results in the creation of group of entity from a larger group by the application of predefined criteria.
OBI:0001928.label: selection

OBI:0000018.definition: a role realized through the process of supplying materials such as animal subjects, reagents or other materials used in an investigation.
OBI:0000018.label: material supplier role

OBI:0001299.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001299.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells

OBI:0001298.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001298.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells

OBI:0001297.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001297.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells

OBI:0001296.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001296.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells

OBI:0001923.definition: A sequencing assay that detremines amino acid sequences of proteins using multiple rounds of mass spectrometry and molecule fragmentation.
OBI:0001923.label: protein sequencing by tandem mass spectrometry assay

OBI:0001294.definition: a genotype information about an organism and includes information that there are no known modifications to the genetic background. Generally it is the genotype information of a representative individual from a class of organisms.
OBI:0001294.label: wild type organism genotype information

OBI:0001925.definition: A ChIP-seq assay which uses immunoprecipitation to isolate protein bound DNA followed by an exonuclease step to degrade DNA that is not protein bound to provide greater resolution of the DNA binding site
OBI:0001925.label: chromatin immunoprecipitation with exonuclease sequencing assay

OBI:0001924.definition: An assay that identifies nucleosome positioning by genome wide sequencing of regions sensitive to digestion by micrococal nuclease
OBI:0001924.label: micrococcal nuclease digestion followed by high throughput sequencing assay

OBI:0001291.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001291.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells

OBI:0001926.definition: A transcription profiling assay that quantifies the microRNA species within a biological sample.
OBI:0001926.label: microRNA profiling assay

OBI:0000016.definition: Regulation-assigned role is a regulatory role defined by legislation or governmental orders
OBI:0000016.label: regulation-assigned role

OBI:0001109.definition: A device that is used to acquire and image bead array data.
OBI:0001109.label: bead array reader

OBI:0000541.definition: A series of older Bruker NMR magnets, now out of production.
OBI:0000541.label: Bruker AC series NMR instrument

GO:0097280.definition: Histamine release triggered by the binding of an antigen to an immunoglobulin bound to the cell surface.
GO:0097280.label: histamine secretion mediated by immunoglobulin

GO:0097281.definition: The process that gives rise to an immune complex. Immune complexes are clusters of antibodies bound to antigen, to which complement may also be fixed, and which may precipitate or remain in solution. Examples are the clumping of cells such as bacteria or red blood cells in the presence of an antibody, precipitation of a toxin after an antibody binds to it, and clumping of viral particles as a result of antibody binding to the virus.
GO:0097281.label: immune complex formation

GO:0097282.definition: The inhibition of an antigen's biological effects by antibody binding to it. An example is neutralization of diphtheria toxin by preventing its entry into human cells via the binding of antibody specific for diphtheria toxin.
GO:0097282.label: immunoglobulin-mediated neutralization

OBI:0001104.definition: A balance with weighing pan(s) inside a transparent enclosure that is used to measure mass to a very high degree of precision and accuracy.
OBI:0001104.label: analytical balance

OBI:0001103.definition: A device that provides three-dimensional motion for biomedical applications (e.g., gel trays).
OBI:0001103.label: rocker

OBI:0000014.definition: a regulatory role involved with making and/or enforcing relevant legislation and governmental orders
OBI:0000014.label: regulator role

OBI:0001101.definition: A micropipette that can be programmed by the user to aspirate a volume of liquid reagent or sample and dispense a series of aliquots in successive dispensing operations.
OBI:0001101.label: electronic repeater pipette

OBI:0001100.definition: A type of centrifuge that is designed for small tubes (0.2 ml to 2.0 ml), has a compact design, and has a small footprint.
OBI:0001100.label: microcentrifuge

OBI:0000543.definition: A small membrane filter of defined pore size, that filters samples from a syringe.
OBI:0000543.label: syringe filter

OBI:0600051.definition: a protocol application that uses different concentrations of materials in a defined order to create a gradient to facilitate the separation of an input material into its components with specific qualities
OBI:0600051.label: gradient separation

OBI:0600053.definition: a protocol application that uses an electrical potential to move material through a defined matrix in order to separate it by its resistance to movement and its charge
OBI:0600053.label: electrophoresis

OBI:0400049.definition: A Guava_EasyCyte_Plus System is a flow_cytometer_analyser that includes a single 488 nm laser, and filters and PMTs to collect up to 4 fluorescent parameters. It includes a photodiode forward scatter collector and an optional photodiode for side scatter collection.Guava cytometers use aspiration instead of fluid systems to transport cells within the machine. The EasyCyte plus accepts 96 well plates as well as tubes. The Guava_EasyCyte_Plus cytometer is a small portable cytometer particularly useful for field measurement.
OBI:0400049.label: Guava EasyCyte Plus

OBI:0001727.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a radio immuno assay.
OBI:0001727.label: RIA measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001726.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses an antibody binding detection by fluorescence quenching.
OBI:0001726.label: quenching assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001725.definition: histamine secretion mediated by immunoglobulin resulting from antibody binding to epitope
OBI:0001725.label: B cell epitope specific histamine secretion mediated by immunoglobulin

OBI:0001724.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a viral hemagglutination inhibition assay.
OBI:0001724.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific hemagglutination inhibition

OBI:0001723.definition: A B cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the off rate.
OBI:0001723.label: assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001722.definition: hypersensitivity resulting from antibody binding to epitope
OBI:0001722.label: B cell epitope specific hypersensitivity

OBI:0200089.definition: A multiple testing correction method is a hypothesis test performed simultaneously on M > 1 hypotheses.  Multiple testing procedures produce a set of rejected hypotheses that is an estimate for the set of false null hypotheses while controlling for a suitably define Type I error rate
OBI:0200089.label: multiple testing correction method

OBI:0001720.definition: immune complex formation resulting from antibody binding to epitope
OBI:0001720.label: B cell epitope specific immune complex formation

OBI:0200086.definition: A spread calculation is a data transformation that has objective spread calculation.
OBI:0200086.label: spread calculation data transformation

OBI:0200085.definition: A data transformation which has the objective of spectrum analysis.
OBI:0200085.label: mass spectrometry analysis

OBI:0000547.definition: The evaporative light scattering detector, as its name implies, utilizes a spray that continuously atomizes the column eluent into small droplets. These droplets are allowed to evaporate, leaving the solutes as fine particulate matter suspended in the atomizing gas.
OBI:0000547.label: evaporative light scattering detector

OBI:0200083.definition: A data transformation objective which has the data transformation aims to model time to event data (where events are e.g. death and or disease recurrence); the purpose of survival analysis is to model the underlying distribution of event times and to assess the dependence of the event time on other explanatory variables
OBI:0200083.label: survival analysis objective

UBERON:0000477.definition: Anatomical group that has its parts adjacent to one another.
UBERON:0000477.label: anatomical cluster

OBI:0001729.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses an antibody binding detection by fluorescence quenching assay.
OBI:0001729.label: quenching assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001728.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.
OBI:0001728.label: ELISA measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0002574.definition: A RNA extraction process in which only RNAs lacking a polyA tail are retained
OBI:0002574.label: RNA extraction with polyA depletion

OBI:0001429.definition: A study design that assays events associated with cell development or differentiation.
OBI:0001429.label: cell differentiation design

OBI:0002573.definition: A RNA extract that is the output of an extraction process in which RNA molecules lacking poly A tails at thier 3' ends are purified.
OBI:0002573.label: polyA depleted RNA extract

OBI:0400048.definition: A Guava_EasyCyte_Mini is a flow_cytometer_analyser that includes a single 488 nm laser, and filters and PMTs to collect up to 3 fluorescent parameters. It includes a photodiode forward scatter collector and an optional photodiode for side scatter collection.Guava cytometers use aspiration instead of fluid systems to transport cells within the machine. The mini accepts tubes only for inputting cells or beads. The Guava_EasyCyte_Mini cytometer is a small portable cytometer particularly useful for field measurement.
OBI:0400048.label: Guava EasyCyte Mini

OBI:0600059.definition: a genetic transformation which relies on the use of lysogenic infection to transfer DNA sequences into an organism
OBI:0600059.label: DNA transduction

OBI:0000748.definition: A DNA methylation profiling assay which determines the methylation status of genomic DNA using DNA sequencing techniques preceded by a bisulfite based chemical modification of genomic DNA at CpG island location.
OBI:0000748.label: bisulfite sequencing assay

OBI:0000749.definition: A CART (classification and regression trees) is a data transformation method for producing a classification or regression model with a tree-based structure.
OBI:0000749.label: CART

OBI:0000742.definition: A nucleic acid digest is a material that is the output of a process in which nucleic acids are combined with a restriction enzyme resulting in digested fragments with defined ends based on the enzymes cleavage site
OBI:0000742.label: nucleic acid restriction enzyme digest
