OBI:0000743.definition: An assay that determines information about an immune response
OBI:0000743.label: immune response assay

OBI:0000740.definition: A material sample role is a specimen role borne by a material entity that is the output of a material sampling process.
OBI:0000740.label: material sample role

OBI:0000741.definition: A clustered data set in which the topology, i.e. the spatial properties between data points, is preserved from the original input data from which it was derived.
OBI:0000741.label: topologically preserved clustered data set

OBI:0000747.definition: A material entity that has the material sample role
OBI:0000747.label: material sample

OBI:0000744.definition: A specimen gathering process with the objective to obtain a specimen that is representative of the input material entity
OBI:0000744.label: material sampling process

OBI:0000413.definition: a process with the objective to obtain a cell culture in which all cells are in the same stage of the cell cycle
OBI:0000413.label: cell cycle synchronization

OBI:0000410.definition: a plasmid in which extraneous DNA has been inserted.
OBI:0000410.label: recombinant plasmid

OBI:0000411.definition: A material to be added role played by a small, self-replicating DNA or RNA molecule - usually a plasmid or chromosome - and realized in a process whereby foreign DNA or RNA is inserted into the vector during the process of cloning.
OBI:0000411.label: cloning vector role

OBI:0000416.definition: cloning insert role is a role which inheres in DNA or RNA and is realized by the process of being inserted into a cloning vector in a cloning process.
OBI:0000416.label: cloning insert role

OBI:0000415.definition: PCR is the process in which a DNA polymerase is used to amplify a piece of DNA by in vitro enzymatic replication. As PCR progresses, the DNA thus generated is itself used as a template for replication. This sets in motion a chain reaction in which the DNA template is exponentially amplified.
OBI:0000415.label: polymerase chain reaction

OBI:0000418.definition: An assay that determines the concentration of glucose molecules in a blood serum sample
OBI:0000418.label: measuring glucose concentration in blood serum assay

OBI:0000419.definition:
enzyme and has_function some GO:0003964 (RNA-directed DNA polymerase
activity)
OBI:0000419.label: reverse transcriptase

OBI:0302837.definition: decapitated organism is an organism which has had it's head removed
OBI:0302837.label: decapitated organism

OBI:0001439.definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001439.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells

OBI:0001438.definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001438.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells

OBI:0001433.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells that uses a radio immuno assay.
OBI:0001433.label: radio immuno assay measuring epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells

OBI:0001432.definition: A study design that identifies locations and members of operons in a genome.
OBI:0001432.label: operon identification design

OBI:0302840.definition: A information content entity that has undergone a digital curation performed by a curator for accuracy checks and compliance with curation requirements. Information which has been assessed for accuracy by domain experts.
OBI:0302840.label: curated information

OBI:0001430.definition: A study design that identifies forms and abundance of transcripts in the genome.
OBI:0001430.label: transcription profiling design

OBI:0302846.definition: a role that borne by an organism and realized by some group randomization process
OBI:0302846.label: randomized group participant role

OBI:0302847.definition: A methylated polymer which has artificially acquired one or more methyl groups
OBI:0302847.label: methylated polymer

OBI:0001435.definition: A study design in which the methylation state of DNA is determined and is compared between samples using high throughput sequencing technology.
OBI:0001435.label: DNA methylation profiling by high throughput sequencing design

IAO:0000019.definition: A binary digital entity is a digital entity that is encoded in a way that is not easily human readable and that contains other than text characters.
IAO:0000019.label: obsolete2_binary digital entity

UBERON:0005022.definition: A mucosa that is part of a nasopharynx [Automatically generated definition].
UBERON:0005022.label: mucosa of nasopharynx

UBERON:0005023.definition: A mucosa that is part of a oropharynx [Automatically generated definition].
UBERON:0005023.label: mucosa of oropharynx

IAO:0000013.definition: a report that is published in a journal
IAO:0000013.label: journal article

OBI:0100067.definition: Group of biomaterials present in the bronchial aveolar space of an organism which are collected through lavage including the reagents used to for the lavage process, organisms, cells, and cellular secretions present in the bronchial aveolar space.
OBI:0100067.label: bronchial alveolar lavage

IAO:0000010.definition:
Software is a plan specification composed of a series of instructions that can be 
interpreted by or directly executed by a processing unit.
IAO:0000010.label: software

IAO:0000017.definition: A model number is an information content entity specifically borne by catalogs, design specifications, advertising materials, inventory systems and similar  that is about manufactured objects of the same class. The model number is an alternative term for the class. The manufactered objects may or may not also bear the model number. Model numbers can be encoded in a variety of other information objects, such as bar codes, numerals, or patterns of dots.
IAO:0000017.label: model number

IAO:0000015.definition: A quality of an information bearer that imparts the information content
IAO:0000015.label: information carrier

OBI:0000528.definition: A sample valve that must be able to sustain pressures up to 10,000 p.s.i., although it is most likely to operate on a continuous basis, at pressures of 3,000 p.s.i. or less. The higher the operating pressure the tighter the valve seating surfaces must be forced together to eliminate any leak. It follows that any abrasive material, however fine, that passes into the valve can cause the valve seating to become scored each time it is rotated which will ultimately lead to leaks. This will cause the sample size to vary between samples and eventually affect the accuracy of the analysis. It follows that any solid material must be carefully removed from any sample before filling the valve. The sample volume of an internal loop valve is situated in the connecting slot of the valve rotor and can be used only for relatively small sample volumes. Internal sample loop valves provide samples with volumes ranging from 0.1 ml to about 0.5 ml. Valve operation is shown in figure 6. The left-hand side diagram shows the load position. The sample occupies the rotor slot and has been filled by passing the sample from an appropriate syringe through the rotor slot to waste. While loading the sample, the mobile phase supply is passed through the valve directly to the column. To place the sample onto the column, the valve is then rotated and the valve slot containing the sample is now placed between the solvent supply and the column. As a result, the sample is passed into the column by the flow of solvent.
OBI:0000528.label: liquid chromatography valve

OBI:0000529.definition: An NMR probe that is manufactured by JEOL.
OBI:0000529.label: JEOL NMR probe

OBI:0000526.definition: For preparative LC with injection of sample volumes ranging from L to mL ranges.
OBI:0000526.label: preparative autosampler

OBI:0000527.definition: Hyphenated analytical techniques combining mass spectrometry and chromatography are well-established laboratory tools. The combination of chromatography and NMR has also made its way into the analytical laboratory. Further developments even combine all three techniques into an LC-NMR/NMR-MS system. The use of solid phase extraction provides an efficient interface between chromatography and NMR with demands for special type of flow probes.
OBI:0000527.label: flow high resolution probe

OBI:0000525.definition: Injected sample enters column immediately (while split valve to split vent is closed). Here a sample is introduced into a heated small chamber via a syringe through a septum - the heat facilitates volatilization of the sample and sample matrix. The carrier gas then either sweeps the entirety (splitless mode) or a portion (split mode) of the sample into the column. In split mode, a part of the sample/carrier gas mixture in the injection chamber is exhausted through the split vent.
OBI:0000525.label: splitless GC injector

OBI:0000522.definition: A vial is a cylindrical container often made from glass tubing.
OBI:0000522.label: vial

OBI:0000523.definition: A rotor device that holds the NMR sample and enables the adjustment of the orientation of the rotation axis for a sample in a NMR instrument in the magic angle.
OBI:0000523.label: magic angle spinning rotor

OBI:0000520.synonyms: detection of analyte in blood sample;chemical pathology
OBI:0000520.definition: An analyte assay which uses analytical methods to produce measurements and data on the concentration of chemical parameters (analytes) present in a bodily fluid collected from an organism.
OBI:0000520.label: clinical chemistry assay

OBI:0000521.definition: A flame ionization detector is a GC detector that consist of a hydrogen/air flame and a collector plate which are normally heated independently of the chromatographic oven. Heating is necessary in order to prevent condensation of water generated by the flame and also to prevent any hold-up of solutes as they pass from the column to the flame. There is an electrode above the flame to collect the ions formed at a hydrogen/air flame. The number of ions hitting the collector is measured and a signal is generated. Flame ionization detectors are most widely used and generally applicable for gas chromatography and hence is used for routine and general purpose analysis. It is easy to use but destructive of the sample.
OBI:0000521.label: flame ionization detector

OBI:0200029.definition: A mean centering is a data transformation that takes as input an n-dimensional (real) vector, performs a mean calculation on its components, and subtracts the resulting mean from each component of the input.
OBI:0200029.label: mean centering

OBI:0000257.definition: A DNA extraction is a nucleic acid extraction where the desired output material is DNA.
OBI:0000257.label: DNA extraction

OBI:0000250.definition: A molecular label role which inheres in a material entity and which is realized in the process of detecting a molecular dye that imparts color to some material of interest.
OBI:0000250.label: dye role

OBI:0000251.definition: A data set which is a subset of data that are a similar to each other in some way.
OBI:0000251.label: cluster

OGMS:0000073.definition: The representation of a conclusion of a diagnostic process.
OGMS:0000073.label: diagnosis

OBI:0000253.definition: Is a material transformation in which strands of nucleic acids that are (somewhat) complementary form a double-stranded molecule. Has input at least two single stranded molecules of nucleic acid molecules.
OBI:0000253.label: artificially induced nucleic acid hybridization

GO:0042611.definition: A transmembrane protein complex composed of an MHC alpha chain and, in most cases, either an MHC class II beta chain or an invariant beta2-microglobin chain, and with or without a bound peptide, lipid, or polysaccharide antigen.
GO:0042611.label: MHC protein complex

GO:0016570.definition: The covalent alteration of one or more amino acid residues within a histone protein.
GO:0016570.label: histone modification

OBI:0001177.definition: An assay that determines the sequence of an RNA molecule.
OBI:0001177.label: RNA sequencing assay

IAO:0000178.definition: A material entity in which a concretization of an information content entity inheres.
IAO:0000178.label: material information bearer

IAO:0000179.definition:
A histogram is a report graph which is a statistical description of a
distribution in terms of occurrence frequencies of different event classes.
IAO:0000179.label: histogram

OBI:0200021.definition: A linlog transformation is a data transformation, described in PMID 16646782, whose input is a matrix [y_ik] and whose output is a matrix obtained by applying formula (9) of this paper, where values below an appropriately determined threshold (dependent on the row i) are transformed via a polynomial of degree 1, and values above this threshold are transformed via a logarithm.
OBI:0200021.label: linlog transformation

OBI:0200020.definition: A homogeneous polynomial transformation is a polynomial transformation where all the term of the polynomial have the same degree.
OBI:0200020.label: homogeneous polynomial transformation

OBI:0001240.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001240.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells

OBI:0200023.definition: A loess global transformation is a loess transformation where only one loess fitting is performed, utilizing one subset of (or possibly all of) the data points in the input so that there is only one resulting loess curve y=f(x) which is used for the transformation.
OBI:0200023.label: loess global transformation

OBI:1110051.definition: A T cell population characterized by not expressing the CD8 molecule on its surface.
OBI:1110051.label: cultured CD8- T cell population

UBERON:0001830.definition: One of the smaller, largely mucus-secreting, exocrine glands of the oral cavity, consisting of the labial, buccal, molar, lingual, and palatine glands[MP].
UBERON:0001830.label: minor salivary gland

CHEBI:17137.definition: A sulfur oxoanion that has formula HO3S.
CHEBI:17137.label: hydrogensulfite

OBI:0001239.definition: A study design in which sequencing technology (e.g. Solexa/454) is used to generate RNA sequence, analyse the transcibed regions of the genome, and/or to quantitate transcript abundance
OBI:0001239.label: transcription profiling by high throughput sequencing design

OBI:0200025.definition: A loess scale group transformation is a data transformation consisting in the application of a scale adjustment following a loess group transformation, to render the group variances for the second variable (y) similar.  Has objective scaling.
OBI:0200025.label: loess scale group transformation

OBI:0200024.definition: A loess group transformation is a loess transformation where the input is partitioned into groups and for each group a loess fitting is performed, utilizing a subset of (or possibly all of) the data points in that group. Thus, a collection of loess curves y=f_i(x) is generated, one per group. Each (x, y) in the input is transformed into (x, y-f_i(x)), where f_i(x) is the curve corresponding to the group to which that data point belongs.
OBI:0200024.label: loess group transformation

OBI:0000578.definition: The sample-tube holds the NMR sample and sits in the nmr probe. It is usually a glass tube of 5-20mm diameter.
OBI:0000578.label: NMR sample tube

OBI:0200027.definition: A total intensity transformation paired is a data transformation that takes as input two n-dimensional (real) vectors and multiplies each component of the first vector by a coefficient, where the coefficient is obtained by taking the ratio of the sum of the second input components or of a subset of these by the sum of the first input components or of a subset of these (the same subset is used for the two vectors).
OBI:0200027.label: total intensity transformation paired

OBI:0001241.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells that uses a cell culture analyte detection bioassay.
OBI:0001241.label: cell culture analyte detection bioassay measuring epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells

OBI:1110050.definition: A T cell population characterized by not expressing the CD4 molecule on its surface.
OBI:1110050.label: cultured CD4- T cell population

OBI:0002287.synonyms: pN: Pathologic spread ovarian lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)
OBI:0002287.definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
OBI:0002287.label: pathologic lymph node stage for ovary according to AJCC 7th edition

UBERON:0036149.definition: Area of skin in the hypoastric region of the abdomen.
UBERON:0036149.label: suprapubic skin

OBI:0200140.definition: feature is a (parent_class) that describes a characteristic, trait or quality of a data transformation
OBI:0200140.label: mathematical feature

OBI:0000947.definition: is a role which inheres in a person or organization and is realized in in a planned process which provides access to training, materials or execution of protocols for an organization or person
OBI:0000947.label: service provider role

OBI:0001242.definition: A T cell epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production assay that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001242.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production by T cells

OBI:1110053.definition: A disease characterized by abnormal and uncontrolled cell division
OBI:1110053.label: cancer

OBI:0200147.definition: A network analysis in which an input data set describing node objects and edge relationships between node objects is used to determine the output quality of the network as a whole.
OBI:0200147.label: network graph quality calculation

PATO:0000186.definition: An organismal quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's behavior aggregate of the responses or reactions or movements in a given situation.
PATO:0000186.label: behavioral quality

OBI:0200145.definition: A network subgraph quality calculation in which an input data set describing internal nodes, edges and node degrees is used to determine the average node degree within the subgraph.
OBI:0200145.label: intra subgraph connectivity calculation

GO:0008228.definition: The process in which a microorganism (or other particulate material) is rendered more susceptible to phagocytosis by coating with an opsonin, a blood serum protein such as a complement component or antibody.
GO:0008228.label: opsonization

OBI:0001243.definition: An assay of epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001243.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells

OBI:1110052.definition: A T cell population characterized by not expressing the CD4 nor the CD8 molecule on its surface.
OBI:1110052.label: cultured CD4-/CD8- T cell population

OBI:0400040.definition: A FASCSAria is a flow_cytometer_sorter manufactured by Becton Dickinson. It features digital electronics, a solid state 488 nm blue laser, a solid state 407 nm violet laser, and a HeNe (633 nm) ion laser. The Aria has the filters and PMTs to collect side scatter and 9 fluorescent parameters. The Aria has a photodiode detector for forward scatter collector. The flow cell is Quartz cuvette. The FACSAria is a sorter used to collect and analyse cells using up to 11 parameters.
OBI:0400040.label: FACSAria

PATO:0001631.definition: A quality of related physical entities inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's pertaining to or involving or having the nature of space in relation to another entity.
PATO:0001631.label: relational spatial quality

CHEBI:42191.definition: A polyamino carboxylic acid that has formula C10H16N2O8.
CHEBI:42191.label: ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid

OBI:0001244.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001244.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells

OBI:1110055.definition: placeholder to be imported from disease ontology
OBI:1110055.label: obsolete_disease

OBI:0002055.definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that detects biological activity.
OBI:0002055.label: assay measuring T cell epitope specific biological activity

CHEBI:16991.definition: High molecular weight, linear polymers, composed of nucleotides containing deoxyribose and linked by phosphodiester bonds; DNA contain the genetic information of organisms.
CHEBI:16991.label: deoxyribonucleic acid

OBI:0001329.definition: A study design in which the family history such as traits, characteristics, susceptibility to disease is studied.
OBI:0001329.label: family history design

ENVO:00002257.definition: Podzols are soils with a typically ash-grey upper subsurface horizon, bleached by loss of organic matter and iron oxides, on top of a dark accumulation horizon with brown, reddish or black illuviated humus and/or reddish Fe compounds. Podzols occur in humid areas in the boreal and temperate zones and locally also in the tropics.
ENVO:00002257.label: podzol

OBI:0002384.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female child of a sibling.
OBI:0002384.label: niece clinical history of cancer

OBI:0002385.definition: A diagnosis that is an assertion that a patient who is the subject of a diagnostic process has an infectious disease.
OBI:0002385.label: diagnosis of infectious disease

OBI:0002386.definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the hepatitis B virus.
OBI:0002386.label: diagnosis of hepatitis B

OBI:0002387.definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the hepatitis C virus.
OBI:0002387.label: diagnosis of hepatitis C

OBI:0002380.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male sibling of a parent.
OBI:0002380.label: uncle clinical history of cancer

OBI:0002381.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female parent of a parent.
OBI:0002381.label: grandmother clinical history of cancer

OBI:0002382.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male parent of a parent.
OBI:0002382.label: grandfather clinical history of cancer

OBI:0002383.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male child of a sibling.
OBI:0002383.label: nephew clinical history of cancer

OBI:0002388.definition: A diagnosis of infectious disease caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (1 or 2).
OBI:0002388.label: diagnosis of HIV

OBI:0002389.definition: A clinical history in which there is repeated reactive screening assays for human immunodeficiency virus (1 or 2) antibodies regardless of the results of supplemental assays.
OBI:0002389.label: clinical history of repeated HIV assays

OBI:0000882.definition: A cytometry assay that monitors a cell population to track how many are killed by other cells.
OBI:0000882.label: cell-cell killing assay

OBI:0001245.definition: A T cell epitope specific perforin release assay that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001245.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific perforin release

OBI:1110054.definition: Is a disease characterized by an immune response of an organism against parts of itself
OBI:1110054.label: autoimmune disease

OBI:0002256.synonyms: pT: Pathologic spread ovarian primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)
OBI:0002256.definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
OBI:0002256.label: pathologic primary tumor stage for ovary according to AJCC 7th edition

OBI:0400099.definition: A flow_cytometer_sorter is a flow_cytometer that analyzes and separates or sorts particles passing through (based on properties measured during analysis) to collect cells of interest.
OBI:0400099.label: flow cytometer sorter

GO:0001788.definition: Cytolysis of target cells by natural killer cells, eosinophils, neutrophils, monocytes, or macrophages following engagement of antibodies bound to the target cells by Fc receptors on the effector cells.
GO:0001788.label: antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity

UBERON:0000007.definition: The pituitary gland is an endocrine gland that secretes hormones that regulate many other glands [GO]. An endocrine gland located ventral to the diencephalon and derived from mixed neuroectodermal and non neuroectodermal origin [ZFIN].
UBERON:0000007.label: pituitary gland

UBERON:0001134.definition: Muscle tissue that consists primarily of skeletal muscle fibers.
UBERON:0001134.label: skeletal muscle tissue

PATO:0000383.definition: A biological sex quality inhering in an individual or a population that only produces gametes that can be fertilised by male gametes.
PATO:0000383.label: female

OBI:0400117.definition: An instrument which removes liquid by the application of negative pressure,  i.e. vacuum.
OBI:0400117.label: vacuum dryer

OBI:0400116.definition: An instrument that is capable of repeatedly altering and maintaining specific temperatures for defined periods of time.
OBI:0400116.label: thermal cycler

OBI:0400115.definition: A spectrophotometer is an instrument that measures the intensity of light as a function of the color, or more specifically, the wavelength of light, transmitted by a substance.
OBI:0400115.label: spectrophotometer

OBI:0400114.definition: A device that converts a variable electrical current to mechanical vibration of a metallic probe. The device is used for the lysis of cells, the mixing of compounds or solutions, to framgent molecules of DNA, or to create emulsions.
OBI:0400114.label: sonicator

OBI:0400113.definition: An instrument used to chemically synthesize oligonucleotides.
OBI:0400113.label: oligonucleotide synthesizer

OBI:0400112.definition: a device that is used for automated liquid transfer and handling.
OBI:0400112.label: liquid handler

OBI:0400111.definition: A device which is used to maintain the temperature of one or more hybridization_chamber(s) at a defined, constant temperature.
OBI:0400111.label: hybridization station

OBI:0400110.definition: A device which is used to maintain constant contact of a liquid on an array.  This can be either a glass vial or slide.
OBI:0400110.label: hybridization chamber

OBI:0400119.definition: a device that is used to wash Affymetrix-type arrays.
OBI:0400119.label: microarray wash station

OBI:0400118.definition: A vortexer is an instrument that mixes small vials of liquid by creating a rotation of the liquid around its own center. It consists of an electric motor with the drive shaft oriented vertically and attached to a cupped rubber piece mounted slightly off-center. As the motor runs the rubber piece oscillates rapidly in a circular motion. When a test tube or other appropriate container is pressed into the rubber cup (or touched to its edge) the motion is transmitted to the liquid inside and a vortex is created.
OBI:0400118.label: vortexer

UBERON:0007311.definition: Matter ejected from the lungs, bronchi, and trachea, through the mouth.
UBERON:0007311.label: sputum

IAO:0000578.definition: An information content entity that consists of a CRID symbol and additional information about the CRID registry to which it belongs.
IAO:0000578.label: centrally registered identifier

IAO:0000579.definition: A CRID registry is a dataset of CRID records, each consisting of a CRID symbol and additional information which was recorded in the dataset through a assigning a centrally registered identifier process.
IAO:0000579.label: centrally registered identifier registry

IAO:0000574.definition: a planned process in which a new CRID is created, associated with an entity, and stored in the CRID registry thereby registering it as being associated with some entity
IAO:0000574.label: assigning a centrally registered identifier

IAO:0000575.synonyms: associating information with a CRID in the CRID registry
IAO:0000575.definition: A planned process in which a CRID registry associates an information content entity with a CRID symbol
IAO:0000575.label: associating information with a centrally registered identifier in its registry

IAO:0000576.definition: a planned process with the objective to establish a system that allows to refer to specific entities of a certain kind and store information about them, by establishing a CRID registry and plan specifications for the process of 1) assigning a CRID and 2) looking up a CRID.
IAO:0000576.label: obsolete_establishing a CRID registry

IAO:0000577.definition: A symbol that is part of a CRID and that is sufficient to look up a record from the CRID's registry.
IAO:0000577.label: centrally registered identifier symbol

IAO:0000572.definition: a planned process in which a document is created or added to by including the specified input in it.
IAO:0000572.label: documenting

IAO:0000573.definition:
A line graph is a type of graph created by connecting a series of data
points together with a line.
IAO:0000573.label: line graph

OBI:0400029.definition: A CytoSub is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Cyto Buoy Inc. They are a single laser, multi parameter instrument. Various types of micro-laser are offered; available measuring parameters are forward light scatter, side scatter, and fluorescence (max. 9 colour bands). The current series have 5 parameters. The CytoSub is the submersible version equipped with a high pressure sample inlet loop and a high pressure housing to allow underwater operation down to 200 m, lowered on a cable or mounted on a flooded underwater vehicle.
OBI:0400029.label: CytoSub

OBI:0400028.definition: A CytoSense is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Cyto Buoy Inc. They are a single laser, multi parameter instrument. Various types of micro-laser are offered; available measuring parameters are forward light scatter, side scatter, and fluorescence (max. 9 colour bands). The current series have 5 parameters. The CytoSense is the basic instrument, which can be used for normal laboratory applications, as well as for autonomous monitoring with internal data logging or direct data transmission. The special instrument design and its splashproof housing allow operation on moving platforms and outdoor sites.
OBI:0400028.label: CytoSence

OBI:0001230.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-5 production by T cells.
OBI:0001230.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells

OBI:0400023.definition: A CyFlow_ML is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Partec. It is a digital machine which uses 4 light sources: triple laser configurations including new powerful 200mW@488nm blue solid state laser + 100W UV lamp for highest resolution DNA analysis, and can collect 16 optical parameters: FSC1, FSC2, SSC, FL1-FL13. Ultracompact high end desktop multilaser Flow Cytometer for all applications in cell analysis and absolute counting.
OBI:0400023.label: CYFlow ML

OBI:0400022.definition: A Cyan is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Dako Cytomation. It features include digital electronics, three lasers: 488 nm, 635 nm, and 405 nm, and filters and collectors for nine fluorescent parameters and two scatter parameters. The Cyan can be used for measuring the properties of individual cells.
OBI:0400022.label: Cyan

OBI:0400020.definition: Part of the fluidics subsystem. The collection tube is a vessel for capturing cells of interest that have been identified by a sorter. The collection tube is the end location of sorted cells.
OBI:0400020.label: cell sorter collection tube

OBI:0400027.definition: A flow cytometer analyser which is manufactured by Cyto Buoy Inc. They are the buoy mounted version of the CytoSense, equipped with wireless transmission of control and data files. They are a single laser, multi parameter instrument. Various types of micro-laser are offered; available measuring parameters are forward light scatter, side scatter, and fluorescence (max. 9 colour bands). The current series have 5 parameters.
OBI:0400027.label: CytoBuoy flow cytometer analyzer

OBI:0400026.definition: A CyFlow_Space is a flow_cytometer_sorter manufactured by Partec. Its specs are: 8optical parameters, 6 colours:FSC, SSC, FL1-FL6 , 3laser light sources: 200mW@488nm blue solid state laser 25mW@635nm red diode laser 50mW@405nm violet or 8mW@375nm ultraviolet diode laser _ultracompact desktop high end instrument. Parallel 16bit digital pulse processing. The CyFlow Space is a 6-Colour FCM System and Cell Sorter for Clinical Routine and Research.
OBI:0400026.label: CyFlow Space

OBI:0400025.definition: A CyFlow_Sl3 is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Partec. Its specs are: ultracompact and fully equipped mobile/portable instrument, dimensions [cm]: L 43 x H 16 x D 37 , highest stability/robustness and highest precision, 5 optical parameters: FSC, SSC, FL-1, FL-2, FL-3, 20mW@488nm blue solid state laser, other laser light sources optional (UV, violet, green, red), WindowsTM XP FloMax (software for real time data acquisition, data display, and data evaluation), parallel 16 bit digital pulse processing. The CyFlow SL3 is a compact and dedicated portable Flow Cytometer for accurate and affordable cell analysis and true volumetric absolute counting in HIV Monitoring and AIDS patient follow-up by precise and direct CD4 and CD4% measurement.
OBI:0400025.label: CyFlow SL3

OBI:0400024.definition: a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Partec. Its specs are: ultracompact and fully equipped mobile/portable instrument, dimensions [cm]: L 43 x H 16 x D 37, highest stability/robustness and highest precision, 5 optical parameters: FSC, SSC, FL-1, FL-2, FL-3, 20mW@488nm blue solid state laser , other laser light sources optional (UV, violet, green, red), WindowsTM XP FloMax (software for real time data acquisition, data display, and data evaluation), parallel 16 bit digital pulse processing Compact mobile Flow Cytometer for any kind of cell analysis and absolute volumetric counting. The CyFlow_SL allows to analyze forward and side scatter signals in combination with up to 3 fluorescence channels.
OBI:0400024.label: CyFlow SL

OBI:0200036.definition: A data transformation process in which the Benjamini and Hochberg method sequential p-value procedure  is applied with the aim of correcting false discovery rate
OBI:0200036.label: Benjamini and Hochberg false discovery rate correction method

OBI:1110039.definition: A human T-B lymphoblastoid hybrid cell line
OBI:1110039.label: T2 cell line

OBI:1110038.definition: A cell line derived from a mouse lymphoma, specifically a Rauscher virus-induced tumor.This cell ine is antigen processing-defective and expresses a very low level of MHC molecules on its surface.
OBI:1110038.label: RMA cell line

CHMO:0000701.synonyms: LC-MSMS;liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectroscopy;LCMSMS;LC-MS/MS;LC-MS-MS;LC-MS2;LC/MS/MS;liquid chromatography tandem mass spectroscopy;liquid chromatography tandem mass spectrometry
CHMO:0000701.definition: A method where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being ionised and characterised by mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance using two mass spectrometers in series.
CHMO:0000701.label: liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry

OBI:0002038.definition: A RNA-seq assay that sequences only mRNA protected by the ribosome during translation.
OBI:0002038.label: ribosomal profiling by sequencing assay

OBI:0002039.definition: An assay to capture the location of open chromatin, DNA-binding proteins, individual nucleosomes and chromatin compaction at nucleotide resolution by Tn5 transposase insertion.
OBI:0002039.label: assay for transposase-accessible chromatin using sequencing

OBI:0002036.definition: An assay which aims to provide information about the in vivo organization/structure of nucleic acids using chemical or enzymatic probes using a microarray.
OBI:0002036.label: array based nucleic acid structure mapping assay

OBI:1110032.definition: A cell line derived from human cervical cancer cells.
OBI:1110032.label: HeLa cell line

OBI:1110031.definition: A cell line derived from mouse (C57BL/6N) lymphoma cells.
OBI:1110031.label: EL-4 cell line

OBI:0002035.definition: A mass spectrometry assay that measures the absolute mass of the cleaved peptides derived from an unknown protein of interest. These masses are then compared to values for known protein sequences to identify the unknown protein.
OBI:0002035.label: peptide mass fingerprinting assay

OBI:0600007.definition: A process by which a substance is intentionally given to an organism resulting in exposure of the organism to that substance.
OBI:0600007.label: administering substance in vivo

OBI:0600006.definition: A protocol application in which an organism is intentionally put to death
OBI:0600006.label: killing

OBI:1110035.definition: A cell line derived from human T cells.
OBI:1110035.label: Jurkat cell line

OBI:1110034.definition: is a material entity that has the antigen role
OBI:1110034.label: antigen

OBI:0001600.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells.
OBI:0001600.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells

OBI:0001601.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001601.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific intracellular cytokine staining (ICS) IL-21 production by T cells

OBI:0001602.definition: A cell bound MHC binding assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect direct binding.
OBI:0001602.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001603.definition: A rate measurement datum of how quickly bound complexes disassociate
OBI:0001603.label: binding off rate measurement datum (koff)

OBI:0001604.definition: A purified MHC binding assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure the 50% dissociation of binding temperature of direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001604.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring 50% dissociation of binding temperature [Tm] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001605.definition: A rate measurement datum of how quickly bound complexes form
OBI:0001605.label: binding on rate measurement datum (kon)

OBI:0001606.definition: A cell bound MHC binding assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect direct binding.
OBI:0001606.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001607.definition: An assay of epitope specific tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production by T cells that detects tumor necrosis factor production.
OBI:0001607.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production by T cells

OBI:0001608.definition: A purified MHC binding assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001608.label: purified MHC direct binding assay of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001609.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-8 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001609.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-8 production by T cells

OBI:0001232.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects RANTES production by T cells.
OBI:0001232.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific RANTES production by T cells

UBERON:0001638.definition: Any of the tubular branching vessels that carry blood from the capillaries toward the heart.
UBERON:0001638.label: vein

OBI:0001288.definition: An assay of epitope specific lymphotoxin A production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001288.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific lymphotoxin A production by T cells

OBI:0001289.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001289.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells

OBI:0001939.definition: A data item that is the total number of bases in reads, divided by genome size, assumed to be the reference size (for instance of 3.10 Gb for human and 2.73 Gb for mouse) and refers to the percentage of the genome that is contained in the assembly based on size estimates; these are usually based on cytological techniques. Genome coverage of 90–95% is generally considered to be good, as most genomes contain a considerable fraction of repetitive regions that are difficult to sequence. So it is not a cause for concern if the genome coverage of an assembly is a bit less than 100%.
OBI:0001939.label: genome coverage

OBI:0001936.definition: a material entity that is the specified output of an addition of molecular label process that aims to label some molecular target to allow for its detection in a detection of molecular label assay
OBI:0001936.label: molecular-labeled material

OBI:0001285.definition: A study design that is done in a test tube or a culture dish, e.g. A bacterial invasion assay in an established cell culture.
OBI:0001285.label: in vitro design

OBI:0001934.definition: an information content entity that has been generated by a prediction process in which an estimate of a value of an entity is made which can be measured but without performing such a measurement. The value specification is intended to be close to the value a measurement process would produce modulo a prediction error.
OBI:0001934.label: predicted value

OBI:0001935.definition: A predicted value where the prediction specifies the mass of some thing.
OBI:0001935.label: predicted mass value

OBI:0001932.definition: A planned process in which predicted values for some thing are compared to measured values for that thing.
OBI:0001932.label: comparing prediction to measurement

OBI:0001933.definition: An information content entity that specifies a value within a classification scheme or on a quantitative scale.
OBI:0001933.label: value specification

OBI:0001282.definition: An assay in which surface-bound, translationally competent ribosome complexes are used to generate a translation profile for mRNA, which mRNA may be a single molecular species, or a combination of species, including complex mixtures such as those found in the set of mRNAs isolated from a cell or tissue. One or more components of the surface-bound ribosome complex may be labeled at specific positions to permit analysis of multiple or single molecules for determination of ribosomal conformational changes and translation kinetics. Translation profiles are used as the basis for comparison of an mRNA or set of mRNA species. The translation profile can be used to determine such characteristics as kinetics of initiation, kinetic of elongation, identity of the polypeptide product, and the like. Analysis of translation profiles may be used to determine differential gene expression, optimization of mRNA sequences for expression, screening drug candidates for an effect on translation.
OBI:0001282.label: translation profiling assay

OBI:0001283.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001283.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells

OBI:0001118.definition: A pipetting system that has a plurality of tip fittings and is used for multi-well plate applications.
OBI:0001118.label: multichannel pipette

OBI:0001119.definition: A device that is used to harvest cells from microplates and deposit samples on a filter mat. NOT AN INSTRUMENT?
OBI:0001119.label: cell harvester

OBI:0001114.definition: A device that is used to isolate and collect nucleic acids (DNA or RNA) for subsequent molecular analysis.
OBI:0001114.label: nucleic acid extraction/purification instrument

OBI:0001115.definition: A microplate washer that is used for enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays (ELISA).
OBI:0001115.label: ELISA microplate washer

OBI:0001116.definition: A device that is used for the vacuum-driven processing of multiwell strips or plates, or spin columns. IS THIS AN INSTRUMENT? IS THE DEFINTION CORRECT - TO DISTRIBUTE PRESSURE EVENLY.
OBI:0001116.label: vacuum manifold

OBI:0001117.definition: A device that is used to isolate and collect DNA for subsequent molecular analysis.
OBI:0001117.label: DNA extraction/purification instrument

OBI:0001110.definition: An PCR instrument that enables both detection and quantification of one or more specific sequences in a DNA sample.
OBI:0001110.label: real-time PCR machine

OBI:0001111.definition: A device that is used for the warming of paraffin embedding medium.
OBI:0001111.label: paraffin oven

OBI:0001112.definition: A device that is used to sterilize equipment and supplies by subjecting them to high pressure steam at 121 C or more, typically for 15 to 20 minutes depending on the size of the load and the contents.
OBI:0001112.label: autoclave

OBI:0001113.definition: A device that is used to wash immunoassays in microwell strips and plates with professional accuracy. WHAT IS PROFESSIONAL ACCURACY??
OBI:0001113.label: microplate washer

OBI:0000642.definition: Instead of measuring simple gas phase (carbon containing) ions created in a flame as with the flame ionization detector, or the change in background current because of electronegative element capture of thermal electrons as with the electron capture detector, the AED has a much wider applicability because it is based on the detection of atomic emissions. The strength of the AED lies in the detector's ability to simultaneously determine the atomic emissions of many of the elements in analytes that elute from a GC capillary column (called eluants or solutes in some books). As eluants come off the capillary column they are fed into a microwave powered plasma (or discharge) cavity where the compounds are destroyed and their atoms are excited by the energy of the plasma. The light that is emitted by the excited particles is separated into individual lines via a photodiode array. The associated computer then sorts out the individual emission lines and can produce chromatograms made up of peaks from eluants that contain only a specific element.
OBI:0000642.label: atomic emission detector

OBI:0000641.definition: The ECA series of NMR spectrometers is a high performance, research grade NMR system configurable to a wide range off applications. The ECA NMR is available from 300 to 930 MHz field strengths and is 1GHz ready. The system is designed around a modular, digital NMR electronics chassis controlled from a UNIX or Windows workstation and acquisition system. Both the workstation and spectrometer may be connected to a standard network, allowing seamless remote operation anywhere in the world.
OBI:0000641.label: JEOL ECA NMR spectrometer

OBI:0000640.definition: An NMR probe designed to allow the indirect detection of acquisition nuclei.
OBI:0000640.label: indirect detection probe

CL:0000542.definition: A lymphocyte is a leukocyte commonly found in the blood and lymph that has the characteristics of a large nucleus, a neutral staining cytoplasm, and prominent heterochromatin.
CL:0000542.label: lymphocyte

OBI:0400084.definition: A photomultiplier is a device that is normally in the form of a tube, that uses a photocathode to convert photons into photoelectrons which are then amplified. PMTs are typically used to detect SSC and fluorescent parameters. Cytometers have a PMT for each color they can collect.
OBI:0400084.label: photomultiplier tube

OBI:0000649.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a descriptive statistical calculation data transformation and consists of producing a data set that represents one or more features of interest about the input data set.
OBI:0000649.label: data set of features

OBI:0000648.synonyms: data set with assigned discovered class labels
OBI:0000648.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a class discovery data transformation and consists of a data set with assigned discovered class labels.
OBI:0000648.label: clustered data set

OBI:0400087.definition: A preamplifier is part of the electronics subsystem. It converts the current output from its associated detector to a voltage. The preamplifier is the first stage in analog electronics signal processing.
OBI:0400087.label: preamplifier

OBI:0001734.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a calorimetric binding assay.
OBI:0001734.label: calorimetry assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001735.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium association constant (KA) determination assay that uses an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay.
OBI:0001735.label: ELISA measuring the association constant [KA] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001736.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium association constant (KA) determination assay that uses a radio immuno assay.
OBI:0001736.label: RIA measuring the association constant [KA] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0400086.definition: Part of the fluidics system. A plate loader positions the wells of a multi-well plate under the aspiration tube is a preset order. A plate loader is used for high throughput applications.
OBI:0400086.label: plate loader

OBI:0001730.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium association constant (KA) determination assay that uses a surface plasmon resonance assay.
OBI:0001730.label: surface plasmon resonance assay measuring the association constant [KA] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0200099.definition: Discriminant function analysis is a form of discriminant analysis used to determine which variables discriminate between two or more naturally occurring groups. Analysis is used to determine which variable(s) are the best predictors of a particular outcome.
OBI:0200099.label: discriminant function analysis

OBI:0001732.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium association constant (KA) determination assay that uses an antibody binding detection by fluorescence quenching assay.
OBI:0001732.label: quenching assay measuring the association constant [KA] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001733.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium association constant (KA) determination assay that uses a calorimetric binding assay.
OBI:0001733.label: calorimetry assay measuring the association constant [KA] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0200094.definition: A logarithmic transformation is a data transformation consisting in the application of the logarithm function with a given base a (where a>0 and a is not equal to 1) to a (one dimensional) positive real number input. The logarithm function with base a can be defined as the inverse of the exponential function with the same base. See e.g. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logarithm.
OBI:0200094.label: logarithmic transformation

GO:0032627.definition: The appearance of interleukin-23 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032627.label: interleukin-23 production

UBERON:0000463.definition: Material anatomical entity in a gaseous, liquid, semisolid or solid state; produced by anatomical structures or derived from inhaled and ingested substances that have been modified by anatomical structures as they pass through the body.
UBERON:0000463.label: organism substance

OBI:0200097.definition: Non negative matrix factorization is a data transformation in which factorises a matrix and which forces that all elements must be equal to or greater than zero.
OBI:0200097.label: non-negative matrix factorization

OBI:0001739.definition: A B cell epitope binding off rate measurement (koff) determination assay that uses a surface plasmon resonance assay.
OBI:0001739.label: surface plasmon resonance assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

CL:0000182.definition: The main structural component of the liver. They are specialized epithelial cells that are organized into interconnected plates called lobules. Majority of cell population of liver, polygonal in shape, arranged in plates or trabeculae between sinusoids; may have single nucleus or binucleated.
CL:0000182.label: hepatocyte

OBI:0400080.definition: a device or part of a device that deals with the behavior and properties of light and the interaction of light with matter. Commonly optical subsystems consist of an excitation optics and collection optics. The excitation optics of a flow cytometer optical subsystem consist of the laser and lenses that are used to shape and focus the laser beam. The collections optics consist of a collection lens to collect light emitted from the particle laser beam interaction and a system of optical mirrors and filters to route specified wavelengths of the collected light to designated optical detectors. The optical subsystem in a flow cytometer consists of the equipment used to irradiate particles, and collect the light either emitted or scattered by those particles.
OBI:0400080.label: optical subsystem

OBI:0400083.definition: A photodiode is a semiconductor photodetector used to detect light and generate an electrical current. Typically used in forward scatter (FSC) detection. The photodiode collects the forward light scatter in a cytometer.
OBI:0400083.label: photodiode

GO:0048869.definition: A biological process whose specific outcome is the progression of a cell over time from an initial condition to a later condition.
GO:0048869.label: cellular developmental process

OBI:0400082.definition: A photodetector is a device used to detect and measure the intensity of radiant energy through photoelectric action. In a cytometer, photodetectors measure either the number of photons of laser light scattered on impact with a cell (for example), or the flourescence emitted by excitation of a fluorescent dye.
OBI:0400082.label: photodetector

OBI:0000889.definition: A survival curve is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the percentage of survival is plotted as a function of time.
OBI:0000889.label: survival curve

OBI:0000888.definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the nucleus.
OBI:0000888.label: nuclear RNA extraction

OBI:0001259.definition: A study design that characterizes the association of transcripts and translation machinery.
OBI:0001259.label: translational bias design

OBI:0000739.definition: Studen't t-test is a data transformation with the objective of a statistical hypothesis test in which the test statistic has a Student's t distribution if the null hypothesis is true. It is applied when the population is assumed to be normally distributed but the sample sizes are small enough that the statistic on which inference is based is not normally distributed because it relies on an uncertain estimate of standard deviation rather than on a precisely known value.
OBI:0000739.label: Student's t-test

OBI:0000738.definition: restriction enzyme based cloning is a recombinant vector cloning process that has as an input genetic material that was cleaved with restriction enzymes, and a cloning vector that was cleaved with complementary restriction enzymes. It uses ligase to chemically join the input genetic material and the cloning vector to create a recombinant vector.
OBI:0000738.label: restriction enzyme based cloning

OBI:0000737.definition: A cloning vector is an engineered material that is used as an input material for a recombinant vector cloning process to carry inserted nucleic acids. It contains an origin of replication for a specific destination host organism, encodes for a selectable gene product and contains a cloning site.
OBI:0000737.label: cloning vector

OBI:0000736.definition: is a collection of short tags from DNA fragments, are extracted and covalently linked as single tag constructs
OBI:0000736.label: single fragment library

OBI:0000735.definition: a material consisting of 14.5% protein, 8.5% fat and 9.5% fiber produced to feed rodents
OBI:0000735.label: NTP-2000

OBI:0000734.definition: A DNA sequencing assay that relies on DNA polymerase activity to perform chain extension during the sequencing reaction step.
OBI:0000734.label: DNA sequencing by synthesis assay

OBI:0000885.definition:
A quality inhering in a molecule that refers to general three-dimensional form of local segments of biopolymers such as proteins and nucleic acids (DNA/RNA). It does not, however, describe specific atomic positions in three-dimensional space, which are considered to be tertiary structure.
Secondary structure was introduced by Kaj Ulrik Linderstrøm-Lang in the 1952 Lane medical lectures at Stanford.
OBI:0000885.label: secondary structure of sequence macromolecule

OBI:0000732.definition: an enzyme that has a specific target cleavage sites within nucleic acids
OBI:0000732.label: restriction enzyme

OBI:0000731.definition: A recombinant vector is created by a recombinant vector cloning process, and contains nucleic acids that can be amplified. It retains functions of the original cloning vector.
OBI:0000731.label: recombinant vector

OBI:0000730.definition: A DNA sequencing by synthesis assay which sequences a single strand of DNA by synthesizing the complementary strand along it, one base pair at a time, and detecting which base was actually added at each step. The template DNA is immobilized, and solutions of A, C, G, and T nucleotides are added and removed after the reaction, sequentially. Light is produced only when the nucleotide solution complements the first unpaired base of the template. The sequence of solutions which produce chemiluminescent signals allows the determination of the sequence of the template. ssDNA template is hybridized to a sequencing primer and incubated with the enzymes DNA polymerase, ATP sulfurylase, luciferase and apyrase, and with the substrates adenosine 5-prime phosphosulfate (APS) and luciferin.
OBI:0000730.label: pyrosequencing assay

OBI:0000395.definition: A signal amplification function is a signal conversion function to inject energy into an input signal so as to produce an output signal with increased differential magnitude while also seeking to minimize increases in the signal to noise ratio. For example, to produce a 0.1 KW output signal from a 1 mW RMS input signal.
OBI:0000395.label: signal amplification function

OBI:0000466.definition: The most commonly used detector in preparative GC is the thermal conductivity detector (hot wire detector). Even this detector, however, is often too sensitive and has too high a flow impedance. Under such circumstances, the procedure mentioned above must be employed. The eluent from the preparative column is split and a small portion diverted through the detector (sometimes with further dilution with carrier gas to reduce sensitivity).
OBI:0000466.label: thermal conductivity detector

OBI:0000397.definition: An image acquisition function is a function to acquire an image of a material
OBI:0000397.label: image acquisition function

OBI:0000464.definition: A Bruker autosampler is an autosampler made by Bruker.
OBI:0000464.label: Bruker autosampler

OBI:0000391.definition: An energy supply function is a function to supply or transfer energy from an energy source to a consumer of the energy
OBI:0000391.label: energy supply function

OBI:0000390.definition: A thermostatic circulator is a device which cools or heats a circulating liquid. It has the function to contain control the contained environment and transfer energy from or to the circulating liquid
OBI:0000390.label: thermostatic circulator

OBI:0000393.definition: A signal conversion function is an information processor function which transforms a signal into another type of signal. For example an analog-to-digital_converter, Ac/Ac converter, a synapse converts electrical action potentials into an intermediate chemical signal. The post synapse converts it back into an electric one passed on to the axon.
OBI:0000393.label: signal conversion function

OBI:0000392.definition: An information processor function is a function that converts information from one form to another, by a lossless process or an extraction process.
OBI:0000392.label: information processor function

OBI:0001236.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001236.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells

OBI:0000399.definition: A solid support function is a function of a device on which an entity is kept in a defined position and prevented in its movement
OBI:0000399.label: solid support function

OBI:0000398.definition: An image creation device is a device which captures a digitized image of an object
OBI:0000398.label: image creation device

OBI:0000469.definition: A liquid chromatography device that mixes different solvents, e.g. under high pressure and in differrent volumes ranging from 5 ml to 5 L capacity. Powerful magnetic mixers provide vigorous agitation required for high pressure reaction chemistry.
OBI:0000469.label: solvent mixer

OBI:0000468.definition: A protein column is a chromatography column used for the separation of complex protein mixtures. Protein columns enable sample desalting, followed by chromatographic separation or fractionation of complex protein samples, e.g. immunodepleted serum or plasma proteins.
OBI:0000468.label: protein column

OBI:0400097.definition: A Somacount is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Bently Instruments. It is a specialized tool for counting somatic cells in milk by specifically staining them with Ethidium Bromide and counting the cells that fluoresce. It has one laser, and the filters and a PMT for the single parameter. There are three sizes available, the 150, 300, and 500 with the number indicating the maximum number of cells that can be analysed per hour. The Somacount is an example of a very specific use cytometer; it exclusively counts somatic cells in milk.
OBI:0400097.label: Somacount

OBI:0002423.definition: An inclusion criterion that uses the age of majority for a state or institution, where one is generally considered to be an adult, which if met, makes an individual suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002423.label: age of majority inclusion criterion

CL:0000451.definition: A cell of hematopoietic origin, typically resident in particular tissues, specialized in the uptake, processing, and transport of antigens to lymph nodes for the purpose of stimulating an immune response via T cell activation. These cells are lineage negative (CD3-negative, CD19-negative, CD34-negative, and CD56-negative).
CL:0000451.label: dendritic cell

OBI:0001420.definition: A process of helper T cell enhancement of T cell mediated immune response resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001420.label: epitope specific helper T cell enhancement of T cell mediated immune response

OBI:0001421.definition: A process of interferon-beta production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001421.label: epitope specific interferon-beta production by T cells

OBI:0302835.definition: Is a polymer which has lost secondary or tertiary structure
OBI:0302835.label: denatured polymer

OBI:0001423.definition: A T cell epitope specific granzyme B release assay that uses an intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay.
OBI:0001423.label: intracellular material detection measuring epitope specific granzyme B release by T cells

OBI:0001425.definition: A study design that investigates protein binding sites on nucleic acids.
OBI:0001425.label: protein binding site identification design

OBI:0001426.definition: A study design that assays differences associated with an organism's sex, gender or mating type.
OBI:0001426.label: sex comparison design

OBI:0001427.definition: A study design in which gene expression on a genome-wide basis is evaluated, without bias toward coding or noncoding regions, using tiling arrays containing oligonucleotides that are either overlapping or spaced at regular intervals.
OBI:0001427.label: transcription profiling by tiling array design

IAO:0000009.definition: A label is a symbol that is part of some other datum and is used to either partially define  the denotation of that datum or to provide a means for identifying the datum as a member of the set of data with the same label
IAO:0000009.label: datum label

OBI:0000861.definition: Likelihood-ratio is a data transformation which tests whether there is evidence of the need to move from a simple model to a more complicated one (where the simple model is nested within the complicated one); tests of the goodness-of-fit between two models.
OBI:0000861.label: Likelihood-ratio test

IAO:0000001.definition: a directive information entity that specifies what should happen if the trigger condition is fulfilled
IAO:0000001.label: conditional specification

IAO:0000003.definition: A measurement unit label is as a label that is part of a scalar measurement datum and denotes a unit of measure.
IAO:0000003.label: measurement unit label

IAO:0000005.definition: a directive information entity that describes an intended process endpoint. When part of a plan specification the concretization is realized in a planned process in which the bearer tries to effect the world so that the process endpoint is achieved.
IAO:0000005.label: objective specification

IAO:0000006.definition: A narrative object is an information content entity that is a set of propositions.
IAO:0000006.label: narrative object

IAO:0000007.definition: a directive information entity that describes an action the bearer will take
IAO:0000007.label: action specification

OBI:0200143.definition: A network subgraph quality calculation in which an input data set describing subgraphs and directional relationship edges between subgraphs and other network objects is used to enumerate the number of unique relationships pointing into an individual subgraph.
OBI:0200143.label: subgraph in-degree calculation

OBI:0000083.definition: An electronic case report tabulation is a digital document containing tabular data about multiple trial participants which is part of a clinical regulatory submission.  An eCRT has the property that it can be audited and compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11  and has format suited to review by regulators.
OBI:0000083.label: electronic case report tabulation

OBI:0200141.definition: The log base is a feature of a logarithmic function which is defined in http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logarithm. Its value can be any positive real number different from 1.
OBI:0200141.label: log base

OBI:0200146.definition: A network subgraph quality calculation in which an input data set of subgraph in-degree and out-degree qualities is used to calculate the ratio of indegree to outdegree as a measure of modularity.
OBI:0200146.label: subgraph modularity calculation

OBI:0000084.definition: a polystyrene tube is a test tube made of polystyrene
OBI:0000084.label: polystyrene tube

OBI:0200144.definition: A network subgraph quality calculation in which an input data set describing subgraphs and relationship edges between subgraphs and other network objects is used to enumerate the number of unique relationships pointing out of an individual subgraph.
OBI:0200144.label: subgraph out-degree calculation

OBI:0000086.definition: A role inhering in a biological or chemical entity that is intended to be applied in a scientific technique to participate (or have molecular components that participate) in a chemical reaction that facilitates the generation of data about some entity distinct from the bearer, or the generation of some specified material output distinct from the bearer.
OBI:0000086.label: reagent role

OBI:0000089.definition: a regulator involved with making and enforcing legislation and governmental orders relevant to chemical manufacture
OBI:0000089.label: role of regulator of chemical manufacturer

OBI:0200149.definition: A unit-variance scaling is a data transformation that divides all measurements of a variable by the standard deviation of that variable.
OBI:0200149.label: unit-variance scaling

OBI:0200031.definition: A differential expression analysis objective is a data transformation objective whose input consists of expression levels of entities (such as transcripts or proteins), or of sets of such expression levels, under two or more conditions and whose output reflects which of these are likely to have different expression across such conditions.
OBI:0200031.label: differential expression analysis objective

OBI:0000269.definition: A measurement datum recording the number of measurement events lost due to overloading of the analysis chip in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role
OBI:0000269.label: number of lost events computer

OBI:0000268.definition: Organism_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize a biological feature monitored at the level of the organism, e.g. height, weight, stage of development, stage of life cycle.
OBI:0000268.label: organism feature identification objective

PATO:0001025.definition: A physical quality that inheres in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's amount of force per unit area it exerts.
PATO:0001025.label: pressure

OBI:0000260.definition: A plan is a realizable entity that is the inheres in a bearer who is committed to realizing it as a planned process.
OBI:0000260.label: plan

OBI:0000264.definition: A sample population is an object aggregate that is selected from the population, e.g. the fish in the net that were sampled from the lake, the people that responded to the call for volunteers.
OBI:0000264.label: obsolete_sample population

OBI:0000068.definition: a study personnel role played by a party who reports the outcome of a study component
OBI:0000068.label: reporting party role

GO:0000785.definition: The ordered and organized complex of DNA, protein, and sometimes RNA, that forms the chromosome.
GO:0000785.label: chromatin

OBI:0002111.definition: An iCLIP assay that is enhanced to robustly identify protein-RNA interactions with high efficiency through improvements in library preparation of RNA fragments.
OBI:0002111.label: enhanced cross-linking immunoprecipitation high-throughput sequencing assay

OBI:0000060.definition: a responsible party involved in planning, overseeing the conduct of a study or study component, and interpreting data from a study
OBI:0000060.label: trial monitor role

OBI:0000067.definition: a role that inheres in a material entity that is realized in an assay in which data is generated about the bearer of the evaluant role
OBI:0000067.label: evaluant role

OBI:0000066.definition: a planned process that consists of parts: planning, study design execution, documentation and which produce conclusion(s).
OBI:0000066.label: investigation

OBI:0000065.definition: triton X100 is a chemical entity which belongs to the group of The pluronics which are triblock copolymers of ethylene oxide and propylene oxide. Triton x-100 is_used_as detergent due to its non-ionic surfactant properties
OBI:0000065.label: polyethylene glycol p-(1,1,3,3-tetramethylbutyl)-phenyl ether

OBI:0000064.definition: a reference role in which the characteristics or responses elicited by the substance playing the reference substance role are used to establish a "100%" response
OBI:0000064.label: positive reference substance role

IAO:0000144.definition: A textual entity that expresses the results of reasoning about a problem, for instance as typically found towards the end of scientific papers.
IAO:0000144.label: conclusion textual entity

OBI:0000867.definition: is a planned process in which the objective is to generate a cell line from a natural population of cancer cells which are already immortal
OBI:0000867.label: establishing cancer cell line

IAO:0000140.definition: A settings datum is a datum that denotes some configuration of an instrument.
IAO:0000140.label: setting datum

OBI:0001178.definition: An assay that tests  if inducing an epitope specific immune response in an organism has an effect, such as the ability to prevent, treat or excarbate diseases in the organism.
OBI:0001178.label: efficacy of epitope intervention experiment

OBI:0001179.definition: An epitope protection experiment in which the ability of the epitope to protect the host from an infection is assessed.
OBI:0001179.label: epitope protection from infectious challenge experiment

OBI:0001675.definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17A production assay that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001675.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-17A production by T cells

OBI:0001674.definition: A transcription profiling assay which measures RNA transcript abundances in biological samples by extracting 5' ends of capped transcripts, RTPCR and sequence those. Copy numbers of CAGE tags provide a way of quantification and provide a measure of expression of the transcriptome
OBI:0001674.label: cap analysis of gene expression assay

OBI:0200109.definition: A b transformation is a data transformation obtained by applying the function B described in what follows to a (one dimensional) real number input. B(x)= a*exp(b*x)-c*exp(-d*x)+f, where exp denotes an exponential transformation and a, b, c, d, f are real constants with a, b, c, d positive with the objective of normalization.
OBI:0200109.label: b transformation

OBI:1110155.definition: A T cell epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production assay that uses an ELISA.
OBI:1110155.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production by T cells

OBI:0002190.definition: An organization that delivers messages, packages, and mail.
OBI:0002190.label: courier organization

GO:0003824.definition: Catalysis of a biochemical reaction at physiological temperatures. In biologically catalyzed reactions, the reactants are known as substrates, and the catalysts are naturally occurring macromolecular substances known as enzymes. Enzymes possess specific binding sites for substrates, and are usually composed wholly or largely of protein, but RNA that has catalytic activity (ribozyme) is often also regarded as enzymatic.
GO:0003824.label: catalytic activity

OBI:0002113.definition: An RNA-seq assay to identify spans of nascent transcription in the genome through isolation of recent bromouridine (Bru) labelled RNAs.
OBI:0002113.label: bromouridine labeling and sequencing assay

GO:0003823.definition: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with an antigen, any substance which is capable of inducing a specific immune response and of reacting with the products of that response, the specific antibody or specifically sensitized T-lymphocytes, or both. Binding may counteract the biological activity of the antigen.
GO:0003823.label: antigen binding

OBI:0001678.definition: A process of granzyme A production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001678.label: epitope specific granzyme A production by T cells

OBI:0002194.definition: A microtome that is manufactured by Microm and uses a vertical cutting stroke common to all rotary microtomes engaged by a horizontal sliding movement. An operating arm replaces the handwheel and is attached to both sides of the instrument for greater convenience to permit control of sectioning from the left or right.
OBI:0002194.label: Microm Ergostar HM200

OBI:0001253.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-9 production by T cells.
OBI:0001253.label: biological activity assay measuring interleukin-9 production by T cells

OBI:0001176.definition: An immunization in which an individual epitope is administered into a host organism.
OBI:0001176.label: Individual epitope immunization in vivo

CL:0000066.definition: A cell that is usually found in a two-dimensional sheet with a free surface. The cell has a cytoskeleton that allows for tight cell to cell contact and for cell polarity where apical part is directed towards the lumen and the basal part to the basal lamina.
CL:0000066.label: epithelial cell

OBI:0002112.definition: An RNA-seq assay which is targeting small RNA (< 200 bp) sequences such as, but not exclusive to, miRNAs using, for example, small RNA library preparation kits.
OBI:0002112.label: small RNA sequencing assay

OBI:0000437.definition: an assay objective to determine the presence or concentration of an analyte in the evaluant
OBI:0000437.label: analyte measurement objective

OBI:0002198.definition: An organization that provides molecular analysis service.
OBI:0002198.label: molecular analysis facility organization

OBI:0200107.definition: PLS Discriminant Analysis (PLS-DA) is a discriminant analysis performed in order to sharpen the separation between groups of observations, by hopefully rotating PCA (Principal Components Analysis) components such that a maximum separation among classes is obtained, and to understand which variables carry the class separating information.
OBI:0200107.label: partial least square discriminant analysis

OBI:0000100.definition: First subject treated role is a study subject role borne by the subject realized in the application of the process specified in intervention study design with no previous study subject realizing the role prior in the study
OBI:0000100.label: obsolete_role of being first subject treated

OBI:0001252.definition: A study design in which the array platform is compared, e.g. Agilent versus Affymetrix.
OBI:0001252.label: array platform variation design

OBI:0002216.definition: A histologic grade for ovarian tumor that is from a two-tier histological classification of tumors.
OBI:0002216.label: histologic grade for ovarian tumor according to a two-tier grading system

OBI:0001495.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects the ability of epitope specific helper T cells to enhance either B cell or T cell adaptive immune response function.
OBI:0001495.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific T cell helper activity

CHEBI:33839.definition: A macromolecule is a molecule of high relative molecular mass, the structure of which essentially comprises the multiple repetition of units derived, actually or conceptually, from molecules of low relative molecular mass.
CHEBI:33839.label: macromolecule
