OBI:0001328.definition: A study design that assays events associated with development. Development applies to organism(s) acquiring a mature state.
OBI:0001328.label: organism development design

OBI:0001794.definition: An assay of epitope specific lymphotoxin A production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001794.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific lymphotoxin A production by T cells

OBI:0200104.definition: The Principal Component Regression method is a regression analysis method that combines the Principal Component Analysis (PCA)spectral decomposition with an Inverse Least Squares (ILS) regression method to create a quantitative model for complex samples. Unlike quantitation methods based directly on Beer's Law which attempt to calculate the absorbtivity coefficients for the constituents of interest from a direct regression of the constituent concentrations onto the spectroscopic responses, the PCR method regresses the concentrations on the PCA scores.
OBI:0200104.label: principal component regression

OBI:0001251.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-13 production by T cells.
OBI:0001251.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells

OBI:0001494.definition: An enzymatic amplification which amplifies nucleic acid sequence by making many copies off the same template.
OBI:0001494.label: linear amplification

OBI:0002114.definition: An RNA-seq assay to identify RNA populations of specific ages through isolation of RNAs first labelled with bromouridine (Bru) followed by chasing in uridine for different periods of time.
OBI:0002114.label: bromouridine pulse-chase and sequencing assay

OBI:0001451.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-6 production by T cells.
OBI:0001451.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells

OBI:0001450.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-4 production by T cells.
OBI:0001450.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells

CHEBI:472552.definition: A pyrimidine 2'-deoxyribonucleoside compound having 5-bromouracil as the nucleobase.
CHEBI:472552.label: 5-bromo-2'-deoxyuridine

OBI:0200105.definition:
Partial least squares regression is an extension of the multiple linear regression model (see, e.g., Multiple Regression or General Stepwise Regression). In its simplest form, a linear model specifies the (linear) relationship between a dependent (response) variable Y, and a set of predictor variables, the X's, so that
Y = b0 + b1X1 + b2X2 + ... + bpXp
In this equation b0 is the regression coefficient for the intercept and the bi values are the regression coefficients (for variables 1 through p) computed from the data.
OBI:0200105.label: partial least square regression analysis

IDO:0000666.definition: A disposition to initiate processes that result in a disorder in a human organism.
IDO:0000666.label: human pathogenicity disposition

OBI:0002356.definition: A categorical value specification that is an assessment of a participant's performance status (general well-being and activities of daily life).
OBI:0002356.label: performance status value specification

OBI:0001250.definition: An intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay  that measures epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation
OBI:0001250.label: obsolete intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay  of epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation

OBI:0001327.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects lymphotoxin A production by T cells.
OBI:0001327.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific lymphotoxin A production by T cells

OBI:0001454.definition: A study design in which an infective agent such as a bacterium, virus, protozoan, fungus etc. infects a host organism(s) and the infective agent is assayed.
OBI:0001454.label: pathogenicity design

OBI:0001325.definition: An assay of epitope specific RANTES production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001325.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific RANTES production by T cells

OBI:0000869.definition: A RNA extract that is the output of an extraction process in which RNA molecules with poly A tail at its 3' end are purified.
OBI:0000869.label: polyA RNA extract

OBI:0200102.definition: Regression analysis is a descriptive statistics technique that examines the relation of a dependent variable (response variable) to specified independent variables (explanatory variables). Regression analysis can be used as a descriptive method of data analysis (such as curve fitting) without relying on any assumptions about underlying processes generating the data.
OBI:0200102.label: regression analysis method

OBI:0001456.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells.
OBI:0001456.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells

PATO:0001375.definition: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's containing a single set of homologous chromosomes.
PATO:0001375.label: haploid

OBI:1110201.definition: A material entity bearing the disposition to cause an allergic reaction
OBI:1110201.label: allergen

OBI:1110202.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-5 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110202.label: epitope specific IL-5 release by T cells

OBI:1110203.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-6 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110203.label: epitope specific IL-6 release by T cells

OBI:1110204.definition: A biological process where T cells lyse antigen presenting cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope on MHC molecules of the antigen presenting cell.
OBI:1110204.label: epitope specific killing by T cells

OBI:1110206.definition: A biological process where T cells produce TNF resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110206.label: epitope specific TNF release by T cells

OBI:1110207.definition: An assay that determines information about the production of the cytokine interferon gamma
OBI:1110207.label: assay detecting IFN-gamma production

GO:0042101.definition: A protein complex that contains a disulfide-linked heterodimer of T cell receptor (TCR) chains, which are members of the immunoglobulin superfamily, and mediates antigen recognition, ultimately resulting in T cell activation. The TCR heterodimer is associated with the CD3 complex, which consists of the nonpolymorphic polypeptides gamma, delta, epsilon, zeta, and, in some cases, eta (an RNA splice variant of zeta) or Fc epsilon chains.
GO:0042101.label: T cell receptor complex

PR:000025471.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the Aspergillus oryzae nucS gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.
PR:000025471.label: nuclease S1

GO:0071607.definition: The appearance of macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0071607.label: macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production

CHEBI:16670.definition: Amide derived from two or more amino carboxylic acid molecules (the same or different) by formation of a covalent bond from the carbonyl carbon of one to the nitrogen atom of another with formal loss of water. The term is usually applied to structures formed from alpha-amino acids, but it includes those derived from any amino carboxylic acid. X = OH, OR, NH2, NHR, etc.
CHEBI:16670.label: peptide

OBI:0200103.definition:
multiple linear regression is a regression method that models the relationship between a dependent variable Y, independent variables Xi, i = 1, ..., p, and a random term epsilon. The model can be written as
    Y = \beta_0 + \beta_1 X_1 + \beta_2 X_2 + \cdots +\beta_p X_p + \varepsilon
where \beta_0 =  0 is the intercept ("constant" term), the \beta_i s  are the respective parameters of independent variables, and p is the number of parameters to be estimated in the linear regression.
OBI:0200103.label: multiple linear regression analysis

OBI:0000442.definition: The heart is a muscular organ found in all vertebrates that is responsible for pumping blood throughout the blood vessels by repeated, rhythmic contractions
OBI:0000442.label: obsolete_heart

OBI:0002533.definition: A specimen that is derived from colon.
OBI:0002533.label: colon specimen

OBI:0002532.definition: A specimen that is derived from esophagus mucosa.
OBI:0002532.label: esophagus mucosa specimen

OBI:0002531.definition: A specimen that is derived from cortex of kidney.
OBI:0002531.label: cortex of kidney specimen

OBI:0002530.definition: A specimen that is derived from adipose tissue.
OBI:0002530.label: adipose tissue specimen

OBI:0002537.definition: A specimen that is derived from thyroid gland.
OBI:0002537.label: thyroid gland specimen

OBI:0002536.definition: A specimen that is derived from cerebral cortex.
OBI:0002536.label: cerebral cortex specimen

OBI:0002535.definition: A specimen that is derived from esophagus muscularis mucosa.
OBI:0002535.label: esophagus muscularis mucosa specimen

OBI:0002534.definition: A specimen that is derived from lung.
OBI:0002534.label: lung specimen

OBI:0002284.synonyms: pN: Pathologic spread kidney lymph nodes (AJCC 7th Edition)
OBI:0002284.definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of renal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.
OBI:0002284.label: pathologic lymph node stage for kidney according to AJCC 7th edition

OBI:0002539.definition: A specimen that is derived from tibial nerve.
OBI:0002539.label: tibial nerve specimen

OBI:0002538.definition: A specimen that is derived from cerebellum.
OBI:0002538.label: cerebellum specimen

GO:0042110.definition: The change in morphology and behavior of a mature or immature T cell resulting from exposure to a mitogen, cytokine, chemokine, cellular ligand, or an antigen for which it is specific.
GO:0042110.label: T cell activation

OBI:0400104.definition: An processed material which acquires images of fluorescence (induced with lasers) from labeled molecules on the surface of the microarray chip
OBI:0400104.label: array scanner

OBI:0400105.definition: a device which deposits biological material onto a substrate in a defined pattern.
OBI:0400105.label: arrayer

OBI:0400106.definition: A device with a rapidly rotating container that applies centrifugal force to its contents
OBI:0400106.label: centrifuge

OBI:0400107.definition: A computer is an instrument which manipulates (stores, retrieves, and processes) data according to a list of instructions.
OBI:0400107.label: computer

OBI:0400100.definition: Part of the fluidics system. A syringe pump can be used to inject the sample fluid and cells into the sheath fluid in the flow chamber. Syringe pumps are useful for creating stable flow rates.
OBI:0400100.label: syringe pump

OBI:0400101.definition: A voltage amplifier is a device that amplifies the voltage signal.
OBI:0400101.label: voltage amplifier

OBI:0400102.definition: Part of the fluidics systems. In analyzers the sheath and sample fluid, once analyzed is dumped into a waste tank. The waste tank is where the fluids passing through the cytometer end up after the analysis is finished.
OBI:0400102.label: waste tank

OBI:0400103.definition: A DNA sequencer is an instrument that determines the order of deoxynucleotides in deoxyribonucleic acid sequences.
OBI:0400103.label: DNA sequencer

IAO:0000408.definition: A scalar measurement datum that is the result of measurement of length quality
IAO:0000408.label: length measurement datum

OBI:0400108.definition: A heating block is an instrument or part of an instrument which raises or maintains the temperature of a sample to a defined constant temperature during certain parts of an assay
OBI:0400108.label: heating block

OBI:0400109.definition: A homogenizer is an instrument for the homogenization of various types of material, such as tissue, plant, food, soil, and many others.
OBI:0400109.label: homogenizer

OBI:0002077.definition: A collection of specimens derived from one common specimen via one or more material processing process(es).
OBI:0002077.label: specimens derived from shared ancestor

OBI:0001490.definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001490.label: cytometric bead array measuring epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor production by T cells

UBERON:0000955.definition: The brain is the center of the nervous system in all vertebrate, and most invertebrate, animals. Some primitive animals such as jellyfish and starfish have a decentralized nervous system without a brain, while sponges lack any nervous system at all. In vertebrates, the brain is located in the head, protected by the skull and close to the primary sensory apparatus of vision, hearing, balance, taste, and smell[WP].
UBERON:0000955.label: brain

OBI:0002075.definition: An immune epitope assay that detects either the processing and presentation of a ligand by an antigen presenting cell or the binding of a ligand to an MHC molecule.
OBI:0002075.label: MHC ligand assay

GO:0071706.definition: The appearance of any member of the TNF superfamily due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0071706.label: tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production

OBI:0002407.definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a pill for oral administration.
OBI:0002407.label: pill delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy

OBI:0001493.definition: A cell bound MHC binding assay that uses a T cell epitope recognition assay.
OBI:0001493.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay of a MHC:ligand complex using T cell epitope recognition

OBI:0002106.definition: a assay detecting a molecular label assay where the amount of carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester is measured using fluorescence detection.
OBI:0002106.label: carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester staining assay

OBI:0400038.definition: A FACS_Canto2 is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by BD. It features digital electronics, two solid state lasers at 488 and 633 nm with the option for a third 405 nm laser, and filters and collectors for measuring up to 8 fluorescent paramters with either the 2 or 3 laser option. The FACS_Canto2 is an analyser usually used in clinical applications.
OBI:0400038.label: FACS Canto2

OBI:0400039.definition: A FACS_Scan is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Becton Dickinson. IT features analog electronics, one 488 nm solid state laser, and the filters and PMTs to collect up to three fluorescent parameters The FACS_Scan is usually used for research applications.
OBI:0400039.label: FACS Scan

OBI:0400030.definition: A dichroic filter is an optical filter which is used to selectively pass light of a small range of colors while reflecting other colors. A dichroic filter passes the specified range of light whereas a dichroic mirror reflects the specified range of light.
OBI:0400030.label: dichroic filter

OBI:0400031.definition: A dichroic mirror is an optical filter which is used to selectively reflect light of a small range of colors while passing other colors. A dichroic filter passes the specified range of light whereas a dichroic mirror reflects the specified range of light.
OBI:0400031.label: dichroic mirror

OBI:0400032.definition: Part of the fluidics subsystem. The differential pressure gauge monitors the difference between sample and sheath fluid pressures in systems where pressure is used to force the sample fluid to flow in the center of the sheath fluid. A differential pressure gauge can be used by the operator to make sure that the sample fluid is at a greater pressure than the sheath fluid, which maintains a core of sample fluid.
OBI:0400032.label: differential pressure gauge

OBI:0400033.definition: A diode laser is a laser in which the active medium is a p-n junction semiconductor laser diode, similar to that found in a light-emitting diode. Laser diodes emit at wavelengths from 375 nm to 1800 nm, and wavelengths of over 3 micrometer have been demonstrated. A diode laser can by used to irradiate cells in a flow cytometer.
OBI:0400033.label: diode laser

OBI:0001492.definition: A T cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on survival.
OBI:0001492.label: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection based on survival

OBI:0400036.definition: The FACS Calibur is one of the most popular cytometers in use for research.
OBI:0400036.label: FACS Calibur

OBI:0400037.definition: A FACS_Canto is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Becton Dickinson. It features digital electronics, a solid state 488 nm, and a HeNe 633 nm lasers, and filters and PMTs for collecting up to 6 fluorescent parameters. The FACS_Canto is an analyser usually used in clinical applications.
OBI:0400037.label: FACS Canto

OBI:0400012.definition: A Bactiflow is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Chemunex SA. It is a cell counter for bacteria and other micro organisms. Bacteria are stained with a fluorochrome and the number of particles that fluoresce are counted. The system uses digital electronics, a single laser and a single detector. An ALS version is available as well - Automatic Labeling System. The Bactiflow is specialized cytometer used exclusively for counting microbes.
OBI:0400012.label: Bactiflow

OBI:0400013.definition: A band pass filter is an optical filter that passes wavelengths of light within a certain range and rejects (attenuates) frequencies outside that range. The passed wavelengths are indicated in the specifications of the filter and its name. A 480/20 band-pass filter pass light with at wavelengths of 460 to 500 nm and attenuates all others.
OBI:0400013.label: band pass filter

OBI:0400010.definition: An argon-ion laser is an ion laser that uses argon ions as the lasing medium. These lasers are used primarily to emit light at wave lengths of 458 nm, 488 nm or 514.5 nm, though it is possible to use them to emit several wavelengths of blue and green light. Argon-ion lasers can emit light at many different wave lenghts, and excite a number of different flourochromes.
OBI:0400010.label: argon ion laser

OBI:1110028.definition: A cell line derived from human embryonic kidney cells. This cell line contains the SV40 Large T-antigen, allowing episomal replication of transfected plasmids containing the SV40 origin of replication.
OBI:1110028.label: 293-T cell line

OBI:1110029.definition: A cell line derived from human B cells. This cell line was created by EBV transformation (B-lymphoblastoid cell-line (BLCL)).
OBI:1110029.label: C1R cell line

OBI:0600003.definition: A protocol application during which a series of tests are made of a patient leading to determination of disease state, or condition.
OBI:0600003.label: performing a clinical assessment

OBI:1110020.definition: Process of administering an object playing the role of immunogen to a cell culture
OBI:1110020.label: Immunization in vitro

OBI:0400016.definition: A BioSorter250 is a flow_cytometer_sorter manufactured by Union Biometrica. It includes analog electronics, 488/514 nm multi-line Argon-ion laser for fluorescence and a light stabilized 670 nm forward scatter laser for extinction and time-of-flight. It has filters and PMTs for 3 fluorescent parameters and photodiodes for scatter, time of flight, and extinction. The flow cell is quartz cuvette. The BioSorterTM 250 is an instrument for analyzing and sorting objects from 40-200 microns in diameter.
OBI:0400016.label: BioSorter250

OBI:1110022.definition: is a receptor produced by cells of the adaptive immune system with the purpose of binding epitopes.
OBI:1110022.label: adaptive immune receptor

OBI:1110023.definition: a material entity bearing the immunogen role
OBI:1110023.label: immunogen

OBI:1110024.definition: Is a process in which an infectious agent is in direct contact with a potential host organism in its habitat. This is preceded by proximity to the infectious agent
OBI:1110024.label: environmental exposure to infectious agent

OBI:0600015.definition: group assignment is a process which has an organism as specified input and during which a role is assigned
OBI:0600015.label: group assignment

OBI:0600016.definition: physical combination of several instances of like material
OBI:0600016.label: pooling specimens

OBI:0600017.definition: An assay that detects the presence or a quality of a molecular label which is a proxy for the detection of the molecular target to which the label is attached
OBI:0600017.label: assay detecting a molecular label

OBI:0001635.definition: A binding assay in which affinity is measured by detecting a change in fluorescence (usually quenching) that occurs upon binding of the antibody to the ligand. The fluorescent signal that is affected by binding is either from an exogenous fluorophore attached to the ligand, or is the intrisic fluorescence of aromatic (tryptophan) residues on the binding site of the antibody (no conjugated fluorophore necessary) or, less commonly, on the ligand binding region (epitope).
OBI:0001635.label: antibody binding detection by fluorescence quenching

OBI:0001634.definition: A binding assay in which the heat generated or absorbed during a binding event is measured, which allows determination of binding constants, reaction stoichiometry, enthalpy and entropy.
OBI:0001634.label: calorimetric binding assay

OBI:0001636.definition: A plan specification of organization A to give money to organization B so that B conducts investigations. Organization A has funder role and Organization B has research organization role.
OBI:0001636.label: grant

OBI:0001631.definition: An imaging assay in which an electrons are used to probe the density, shape and composition of an input material which are detected in an electron microscope and utilized to produce an image of the material.
OBI:0001631.label: electron microscopy imaging assay

OBI:0001630.definition: An analyte assay that uses a biomaterial's preferential affinity for either the mobile phase or the stationary phase to separate it from other materials and thereby detect its presence in an input material.
OBI:0001630.label: analytical chromatography

OBI:0001633.definition: A material entity that is generated by a purification process in which an input material is separated to obtain a fraction with a higher concentration of a desired component
OBI:0001633.label: purified material

OBI:0001632.definition: A assay detecting a molecular label assay in which the label is attached to an antibody so that substances are marked based on the antibody's binding specificity.
OBI:0001632.label: immuno staining assay

OBI:0400015.definition: A BioSorter2000 is a sorter manufactured by Union Biometrica. It includes analog electronics, 488/514 nm multi-line Argon-ion laser for fluorescence and a light stabilized 670 nm forward scatter laser for extinction and time-of-flight. It has filters and PMTs for 3 fluorescent parameters and photodiodes for scatter, time of flight, and extinction. The flow cell is quartz cuvette. The BioSorterTM 2000 is an instrument for analyzing and sorting objects from 500 microns to 1.5 millimeters in diameter.
OBI:0400015.label: BioSorter2000

OBI:0000546.definition: A pump system optimized for capillary chromatography.
OBI:0000546.label: capillary pump system

OBI:0001638.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) assay that provides IC50 values determined under assay conditions where the IC50 approximates a KD value using a B cell epitope antigen inhibition of binding assay.
OBI:0001638.label: antigen inhibition assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex approximated by IC50

OBI:0302714.definition: a collection is a bfo:aggregate object, that is a set of material object of the same kind
OBI:0302714.label: obsolete_collection (of entities of organismal origin)

PR:000025477.definition: A protein with ribonuclease activity that is a constituent of cobra venom.
PR:000025477.label: ribonuclease V1

CHEBI:15377.definition: An oxygen hydride consisting of an oxygen atom that is covalently bonded to two hydrogen atoms.
CHEBI:15377.label: water

OBI:0001121.definition: A device that moves charged particles through a medium by using an electric field induced by electrodes.
OBI:0001121.label: gel electrophoresis system

OBI:0001120.definition: A compact fluorometer that can be carried or moved with ease.
OBI:0001120.label: portable fluorometer

OBI:0001123.definition: A device that is used for the dissection of tissues under magnification.
OBI:0001123.label: microdissection instrument

OBI:0001122.definition: A measurement device for analyzing the structure of a material from the scattering pattern produced when a beam of radiation or particles (e.g. X rays or neutrons) interacts with it.
OBI:0001122.label: diffractometer

GO:0006260.definition: The cellular metabolic process in which a cell duplicates one or more molecules of DNA. DNA replication begins when specific sequences, known as origins of replication, are recognized and bound by initiation proteins, and ends when the original DNA molecule has been completely duplicated and the copies topologically separated. The unit of replication usually corresponds to the genome of the cell, an organelle, or a virus. The template for replication can either be an existing DNA molecule or RNA.
GO:0006260.label: DNA replication

OBI:0001124.definition: A device that is used to fabricate glass micropipettes.
OBI:0001124.label: micropipette puller

OBI:0001127.definition: A device or system for dehydrating and then chemically fixing electron microscopy samples at low temperatures in preparation for various treatments including embedding in resins.
OBI:0001127.label: freeze substitution system

OBI:0001126.definition: A microscope that uses optics and a charge-coupled device (CCD) camera to output a digital image to a monitor.
OBI:0001126.label: digital microscope

GO:0071612.definition: The appearance of IP-10 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0071612.label: IP-10 production

OBI:0001128.definition: A microinjection device that is used to measure very small volumes of liquids.
OBI:0001128.label: micropipette

OBI:0000650.definition: A differential expression analysis data transformation is a data transformation that has objective differential expression analysis and that consists of
OBI:0000650.label: differential expression analysis data transformation

OBI:0000651.definition: a portion of urine collected from an organism
OBI:0000651.label: urine specimen

OBI:0000652.definition: is a material processing with the objective to combine two or more material entities as input into a single material entity as output.
OBI:0000652.label: material combination

OBI:0001258.definition: A study design which aims to identify protein and DNA interactions using a combination of chromatin immunoprecipitation and high throughput sequencing. Massively parallel sequence analyses are used in conjunction with whole-genome sequence databases to analyze the interaction pattern of any protein with DNA, or the pattern of any epigenetic chromatin modifications.
OBI:0001258.label: ChIP-seq design

OBI:0000654.definition: a quality inheres_in some device and is concretization of some (device_setting_specification and is_about a quality of the device
OBI:0000654.label: device setting

OBI:0000655.definition: a material entity derived from a portion of blood collected from an organism
OBI:0000655.label: blood specimen

OBI:0000656.definition: A data set which is the output of a curve fitting data transformation in which the aim is to find a curve which matches a series of data points and possibly other constraints.
OBI:0000656.label: data set of predicted values according to fitted curve

OBI:0000658.definition: Data representational model is an information content entity of the  relationships between data items. A data representational model is encoded in a data format specification such as for cytoscape or biopax.
OBI:0000658.label: data representational model

OBI:0001700.definition: An analyte assay in which an input material is mixed with antibodies and bound antigen:antibody complexes are separated out using immunoprecipitation. Either the antibody has known specificy, and the antigen mixture is tested for the presence of a specific antigen, or the antigen solution is well defined and the antibody solution is tested for the presence of antigen specific antibodies.
OBI:0001700.label: immunoprecipitation assay

OBI:0001703.definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that detects qualitative binding.
OBI:0001703.label: assay measuring qualitiative binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001702.definition: a process of an immunoglobulin complex binding to a material entity at the immunoglobulin complementarity determining region (CDR).
OBI:0001702.label: immunoglobulin binding to epitope

OBI:0001257.definition: A process of interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001257.label: epitope specific interleukin-1 alpha production by T cells

OBI:0001256.definition: A process of lymphotoxin A production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001256.label: epitope specific lymphotoxin A production by T cells

OBI:0001707.definition: The release of histamine by cells stimulated through their Fc receptors which are loaded with immunoglobulins.
OBI:0001707.label: immunoglobulin mediated histamine release

OBI:0001254.definition: A process of interleukin-3 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001254.label: epitope specific interleukin-3 production by T cells

CL:0000625.definition: A T cell expressing an alpha-beta T cell receptor and the CD8 coreceptor.
CL:0000625.label: CD8-positive, alpha-beta T cell

CL:0000624.definition: A mature alpha-beta T cell that expresses an alpha-beta T cell receptor and the CD4 coreceptor.
CL:0000624.label: CD4-positive, alpha-beta T cell

UBERON:0001155.definition: Last portion of the large intestine before it becomes the rectum.
UBERON:0001155.label: colon

OBI:0001352.definition: a genetic alteration information that about one of two or more alternative forms of a gene or marker sequence and differing from other alleles at one or more mutational sites based on sequence. Polymorphisms are included in this definition.
OBI:0001352.label: allele information

UBERON:0001159.definition: The part of the large intestine that is closest to the rectum and anus. It forms a loop that averages about 40 cm. in length, and normally lies within the pelvis, but on account of its freedom of movement it is liable to be displaced into the abdominal cavity.
UBERON:0001159.label: sigmoid colon

OBI:0001385.definition: An assay of epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001385.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells

OBI:0001384.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-3 production by T cells that uses a cell culture analyte detection bioassay.
OBI:0001384.label: cell culture analyte detection bioassay measuring epitope specific interleukin-3 production by T cells

OBI:0001387.definition: A study design that classifies an individual or group of individuals on the basis of alleles, haplotypes, SNPs using microarray technology.
OBI:0001387.label: genotyping by array design

OBI:0001386.definition: A process of monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001386.label: epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells

OBI:0001381.definition: A process of interleukin-23 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001381.label: epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells

OBI:0000729.definition: A cloning plasmid is a plasmid that was engineered to contain a bacterial origin of replication, encodes for a selectable gene product and contains a cloning site.
OBI:0000729.label: cloning plasmid

OBI:0001383.definition: An assay of epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001383.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells

OBI:0001129.definition: A device that is used to measure the ion currents across the membrane of excitable cells, such as neurons, while holding the membrane voltage at a set level.
OBI:0001129.label: voltage clamp device

OBI:0000724.definition: A DNA sequencing by synthesis assay that identifies sequence information using DNA polymerase and reversible terminator, requiring immobilization of genomic DNA fragments onto a surface and a specific clonal amplification step known as bridge PCR. Reliance on a reversible terminator allows cycles of DNA chain extension by DNA polymerase and imaging without the need of electrophoretic separation of newly synthesized DNA fragment as with Sanger sequencing.
OBI:0000724.label: Solexa sequencing assay

OBI:0000725.definition: host role is a role played by an organism and realized by providing nourishment, shelter or a means of reproduction to another organism within the organism playing the host role
OBI:0000725.label: host role

OBI:0000894.definition: a protein extract is the output of an extraction process from tissues or cell cultures resulting in a solution of cellular and/or organellar proteins in buffer solution used to prevent degradation,
OBI:0000894.label: protein extract

OBI:0000895.definition: A RNA extract that is the output of an extraction process in which total celluar and organelle RNA molecules are isolated from a specimen.
OBI:0000895.label: total RNA extract

OBI:0000892.definition: An analyte assay that detects the presence of a specific sequence in a DNA sample, which has been digested by restriction enzymes, resolved by gel electrophoresis, and blotted to a solid support, followed by hybridization of a probe raised against a specific sequence and detected with fluorescence or radioactivity.
OBI:0000892.label: Southern blot assay

OBI:0000893.synonyms: kinetic polymerase chain reaction;qPCR;quantitative real time polymerase chain reaction;Q-PCR
OBI:0000893.definition: An assay, based on the PCR, that amplifies and simultaneously quantifies a specific DNA molecule based on the use of complementary probes/primers. It enables both detection and quantification (as absolute number of copies or relative amount when normalized to DNA input or additional normalizing genes) of one or more specific sequences in a DNA sample.
OBI:0000893.label: real time polymerase chain reaction assay

OBI:0000722.definition: is a collection of short paired tags from the two ends of DNA fragments are extracted and covalently linked as ditag constructs
OBI:0000722.label: paired-end library

OBI:0000723.definition: A DNA sequencing assay that performs chain extension during the sequencing reaction step using DNA ligase
OBI:0000723.label: DNA sequencing by ligation assay

OBI:0000474.definition: A pump system optimized for nano flow chromatography.
OBI:0000474.label: nano pump system

OBI:0000475.definition: NMR tubes are often used once and discarded, creating needless waste. With the Bruker BioSpin Autoclean system you can now recycle 5mm, 3mm, or 5mm/3mm step-down (Wilmad 520-1B) NMR tubes. AutoClean NMR Tube Washing System is a simple way to recoup the substantial investment your organization makes in quality NMR tubes, and cut back on needless waste material.
OBI:0000475.label: Bruker AutoClean system

OBI:0000476.definition: The traditional hardware system that allows a human to inject a sample into an inlet by hand, using a syringe.
OBI:0000476.label: manual injection system

OBI:0000477.definition: An older Varian Broadband NMR spectrometer.
OBI:0000477.label: Varian GEMINI spectrometer

OBI:0000470.definition: An assay that identifies the amount and type of material entities present in a sample by fragmenting the sample and measuring the mass-to-charge ratio of the resulting particles.
OBI:0000470.label: mass spectrometry assay

OBI:0000471.definition: a planned process that carries out a study design
OBI:0000471.label: study design execution

OBI:0000473.definition: The NMR Case is an economical NMR sample changer for laboratories with modest automation needs. It expands the maximum number of samples your spectrometer can process during unattended operation to 24. The NMR Case consists of multiple components. The NMR Case exchange module installed atop your cryostat. The two front legs are adjustable, making the NMR Case compatible with many different cryostats.
OBI:0000473.label: Bruker NMR Case sample changer

OBI:0000478.definition: A device that connects two or more columns together in a functional way with leak-tight connection, low dead volume, low thermal mass and high inertness.
OBI:0000478.label: column connector

OBI:0000479.definition: An NMR probe that is designed to hold a solid sample.
OBI:0000479.label: solid NMR probe

OBI:0001419.definition: A ChIP-ChIP assay in which immunoprecipitated chromatin is run on a tiling array that covers stretches of DNA to to detect which elements in those stretches are present in the isolated chromatin
OBI:0001419.label: ChIP-chip by tiling array assay

OBI:0001418.definition: A study design that examines the relationship between the size of the administered dose and the extent of the response.
OBI:0001418.label: dose response design

OBI:0002073.definition: An efficacy of T cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment.
OBI:0002073.label: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific protection from challenge

OBI:0001415.definition: A process of interleukin-9 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001415.label: epitope specific interleukin-9 production by T cells

OBI:0001414.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interferon-gamma production by T cells.
OBI:0001414.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells

OBI:0001417.definition: A study design which aims to identify protein binding sites in genomic DNA by a combination of chromatin immunoprecipitation and tiling microarray (chip) assays.
OBI:0001417.label: ChIP-chip by tiling array design

OBI:0001416.definition: An assay of epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells that detects tumor necrosis factor production.
OBI:0001416.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production by T cells

OBI:0001411.definition: A study design that compares cells of different type, for example different cell lines.
OBI:0001411.label: cell type comparison design

OBI:0001410.definition: A study design in which surface-bound, translationally competent ribosome complexes are used to generate a translation profile for mRNA, where mRNA may be a single molecular species, or a combination of species, including complex mixtures such as those found in the set of mRNAs isolated from a cell or tissue. One or more components of the surface-bound ribosome complex may be labeled at specific positions to permit analysis of multiple or single molecules for determination of ribosomal conformational changes and translation kinetics. Translation profiles are used as the basis for comparison of an mRNA or set of mRNA species. The translation profile can be used to determine such characteristics as kinetics of initiation, kinetic of elongation, identity of the polypeptide product, and the like. Analysis of translation profiles may be used to determine differential gene expression, optimization of mRNA sequences for expression, screening drug candidates for an effect on translation.
OBI:0001410.label: translation profiling design

OBI:0001413.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells that uses a cell culture analyte detection bioassay.
OBI:0001413.label: cell culture analyte detection bioassay measuring epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells

OBI:0001412.definition: An assay of epitope specific RANTES production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001412.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific RANTES production by T cells

OBI:0600032.definition: a protocol application to repair damaged DNA molecules
OBI:0600032.label: artificially induced DNA repair

IAO:0000038.definition: A diagram that presents one or more tuples of information by mapping those tuples in to a two dimensional space in a non arbitrary way.
IAO:0000038.label: graph

OBI:1110003.definition: a process in which an infectious agent comes into physical contact with a host organism.
OBI:1110003.label: host exposure to infectious agent

IAO:0000035.definition: A study interpretation is a textual entity about the implications of a study result. Examples include discussion of whether a hypothesis is false, whether the study failed to address the hypothesis, and whether the study results have led to new hypotheses
IAO:0000035.label: obsolete_study interpretation

IAO:0000037.definition: A dot plot is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where each data point is represented by a single dot placed on coordinates corresponding to data point values in particular dimensions.
IAO:0000037.label: dot plot

IAO:0000031.definition: a numeral that denotes an integer
IAO:0000031.label: integer numeral

OBI:0600030.definition: a protocol application to induce a specific disease in an organism
OBI:0600030.label: experimental disease induction

IAO:0000033.definition: An information content entity whose concretizations indicate to their bearer how to realize them in a process.
IAO:0000033.label: directive information entity

IAO:0000032.definition: a scalar measurement datum is a measurement datum that is composed of two parts, numerals and a unit label.
IAO:0000032.label: scalar measurement datum

OBI:0000096.definition: Protocol_testing_objective is a methodology_testing_objective role describing a study designed to examine the effects of using different protocols.
OBI:0000096.label: protocol testing objective

OBI:0000097.definition: A role that is realized through the execution of a study design in which the bearer of the role participates and in which data about that bearer is collected.
OBI:0000097.label: participant under investigation role

OBI:0000094.definition: A planned process which results in physical changes in a specified input material
OBI:0000094.label: material processing

GO:0071610.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0071610.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production

OBI:0000092.definition: a role of which inheres in a Homo sapiens and realized during administration and oversight of the daily activities of Institutional Review Boards (IRBs) in the USA
OBI:0000092.label: role of certified IRB professional

OBI:0000093.definition: a role which inheres in a person and is realized by the process of being under the care of a physician or health care provider
OBI:0000093.label: patient role

OBI:0200131.definition: A node quality calculation in which an input data set describing object nodes and quantitative relationship edges between object nodes is used to sum all of the quantitative relationships of an individual object node.
OBI:0200131.label: quantitative node degree calculation

OBI:0000091.definition: a role which inheres in a molecular entity and is realized by the process of recording or registering a stimulus.
OBI:0000091.label: detector reagent role

OBI:0200139.definition: A network subgraph quality calculation in which an input data set describing subgraphs and quantitative relationship edges between subgraphs and other network objects is used to sum the quantitative relationships of an individual subgraph.
OBI:0200139.label: quantitative subgraph degree calculation

OBI:0200138.definition: A network subgraph quality calculation in which an input data set describing subgraphs and relationship edges between subgraphs and other network objects is used to enumerate the number of unique relationships of an individual subgraph.
OBI:0200138.label: subgraph degree calculation

OBI:0000406.definition: is double stranded DNA that is the specified output of a polymerase chain reaction
OBI:0000406.label: PCR product

OBI:0600004.definition: A planned process with the objective to obtain a population of human subjects to participate in an investigation by determining eligibility of subjects and obtaining informed consent.
OBI:0600004.label: human subject enrollment

OBI:0000278.definition: a part of an occurrence of a disease process which is associated with position in the normal progression of the disease
OBI:0000278.label: disease stage

OBI:0000274.definition: is a process with the objective to place a material entity bearing the 'material to be added role' into a material bearing the 'target of material addition role'.
OBI:0000274.label: adding a material entity into a target

OBI:0000275.definition: A measurand role borne by a molecular entity or an atom and realized in an analyte assay which achieves the objective to measure the magnitude/concentration/amount of the analyte in the entity bearing evaluant role.
OBI:0000275.label: analyte role

OBI:0000272.definition: A plan specification which has sufficient level of detail and quantitative information to communicate it between investigation agents, so that different investigation agents will reliably be able to independently reproduce the process.
OBI:0000272.label: protocol

OBI:0000273.definition: a regulator involved with making and enforcing legislation and governmental orders relevant to the development, testing, manufacture and use of food, drugs and medical devices
OBI:0000273.label: role of regulator of consumables and medical devices

UO:0000280.definition: A unit which represents a standard measurement occurrence of a process per unit time.
UO:0000280.label: rate unit

OBI:0000078.definition: An eMedical record is a digital document derived from a computer system used primarily for patient care in a clinical setting.  Not required to be compliant with requirements of 21 CFR Part 11.
OBI:0000078.label: eMedical record

OBI:0000079.definition: a processed material that provides the needed nourishment for microorganisms or cells grown in vitro.
OBI:0000079.label: culture medium

GO:0008150.definition: A biological process represents a specific objective that the organism is genetically programmed to achieve. Biological processes are often described by their outcome or ending state, e.g., the biological process of cell division results in the creation of two daughter cells (a divided cell) from a single parent cell. A biological process is accomplished by a particular set of molecular functions carried out by specific gene products (or macromolecular complexes), often in a highly regulated manner and in a particular temporal sequence.
GO:0008150.label: biological_process

OGMS:0000015.definition: A series of statements representing health-relevant qualities of a patient and of a patient's family.
OGMS:0000015.label: clinical history

OBI:0002455.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically relevant histories of exposure of an entity, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002455.label: clinically relevant exposure inclusion criterion

OBI:0000070.definition: A planned process with the objective to produce information about the material entity that is the evaluant, by physically examining it or its proxies.
OBI:0000070.label: assay

OBI:0000071.definition: A data item which is used to indicate the degree of uncertainty about a measurement.
OBI:0000071.label: quantitative confidence value

OBI:0000073.definition: A sample_preparation_for_assay is a protocol_application including material_enrollments and biomaterial_transformations. definition_source: OBI.
OBI:0000073.label: sample preparation for assay

OBI:0000075.definition: diagnosis is an assessment of a disease or injury, its likely prognosis and treatment.
OBI:0000075.label: diagnosis textual entity

OBI:0000076.definition: a process which is external in origin to the investigation that has an impact on the outcome.
OBI:0000076.label: unplanned occurrence effecting an investigation

OBI:0002105.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a bio-layer interferometry assay.
OBI:0002105.label: bio-layer interferometry assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

UBERON:0001323.definition: The tibial nerve is a branch of the sciatic nerve. The tibial nerve passes through the popliteal fossa to pass below the arch of soleus. In the popliteal fossa the nerve gives off branches to gastrocnemius, popliteus, soleus and plantaris muscles, an articular branch to the knee joint, and a cutaneous branch that will become the sural nerve. The sural nerve is joined by fibres from the common peroneal nerve and runs down the calf to supply the lateral side of the foot. Below the soleus muscle the nerve lies close to the tibia and supplies the tibialis posterior, the flexor digitorum longus and the flexor hallucis longus. The nerve passes into the foot running posterior to the medial malleolus. Here it is bound down by the flexor retinaculum in company with the posterior tibial artery. [WP,unvetted].
UBERON:0001323.label: tibial nerve

OBI:0002450.definition: A footprinting assay that uses hydroxyl-radical footprinting to measure B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody.
OBI:0002450.label: hydroxyl-radical footprinting assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

CL:0000842.definition: A leukocyte with a single non-segmented nucleus in the mature form.
CL:0000842.label: mononuclear cell

OBI:0002451.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0002451.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells

OBI:0000388.definition: A connection function is a function to couple two or more flow channels so that material or signals can be transported from one set of channels to another.
OBI:0000388.label: connection function

OBI:0000389.definition: An isoelectric focusing device is a device in which isoelectric focusing can be performed. An isoelectric focussing device had the function to contain and control the contained environment and transfer electrical energy from a power supply to a separation medium and the charged material to be separated.
OBI:0000389.label: isoelectric focusing device

OBI:0002452.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interferon-alpha production by T cells.
OBI:0002452.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interferon-alpha production by T cells

OBI:0200043.definition: An average linkage hierarchical clustering is an agglomerative hierarchical clustering which generates successive clusters based on a distance measure, where the distance between two clusters is calculated as the average distance between objects from the first cluster and objects from the second cluster.
OBI:0200043.label: average linkage hierarchical clustering

OBI:0000383.definition: A transfer function is a function to displace a material from one location to another.
OBI:0000383.label: transfer function

OBI:0000380.definition: A gas filter function is a filter function which prevents the flow of solid objects, defined by specific qualities, in a gas-solid mixture
OBI:0000380.label: gas filter function

OBI:0000381.definition: A liquid filter function is a filter function which prevents the flow of solid objects, defined by specific qualities, in a liquid-solid mixture
OBI:0000381.label: liquid filter function

OBI:0000387.definition: A cool function is a function to decrease the internal kinetic energy of a material below the initial kinetic energy of that type of material.
OBI:0000387.label: cool function

OBI:0000384.definition: An electricity supply function is an energy supply function to transfer electricity from one source to another, typically a consumer of the electricity or as a stimulus during a neuroscience experiment.
OBI:0000384.label: electricity supply function

OBI:0000385.definition: An ionization function is a function to physically convert an atom or molecule into an ion by adding or removing charged particles such as electrons or other ions.
OBI:0000385.label: ionization function

OBI:0500008.definition: balanced incomplete block design is a kind of factorial design where all treatment pairs occur together within a block an equal number ?? times. ??ii' is the number of times treatment i occurs with i'
OBI:0500008.label: balanced incomplete block design

OBI:0001921.definition: An RNA-binding protein immunoprecipitation array profiling assay that combines immunoprecipitation of an RNA-binding protein and RNA tiling array to identify mRNAs associated with selected RNA binding proteins (RBPs).
OBI:0001921.label: RNA-binding protein immunoprecipitation tiling array profiling assay

OBI:0000032.definition: a worker role comprised of handling the administrative duties of a trial or study.
OBI:0000032.label: clinical research coordinator role

PATO:0001167.definition: A structural quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer being harmed or injured or spoiled, such that its functionality is impaired.
PATO:0001167.label: damaged

OBI:0001525.definition: A 3d structural organization datum capturing the results of X-ray crystallography or NMR experiment that is formatted as specified by the Protein Databank (http://www.wwpdb.org/docs.html). A PDB file can describe the structure of multiple molecules, each of which has a different chain identifier assigned.
OBI:0001525.label: PDB file

CHEBI:33709.definition: A carboxylic acid containing one or more amino groups.
CHEBI:33709.label: amino acid

OBI:0000038.definition: Chromatography column in chemistry is a tube and contents (typically glass) used to purify individual chemical compounds from mixtures of compounds. It is often used for preparative applications on scales from micrograms up to kilograms.
OBI:0000038.label: chromatography column

OBI:0001520.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001520.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0302912.definition: a process in which a significant increase in the electrical conductivity and permeability of the cell plasma membrane caused by an externally applied electrical field. It is usually used in molecular biology as a way of introducing some substance into a cell, such as loading it with a molecular probe, a drug that can change the cell's function, or a piece of coding DNA
OBI:0302912.label: electroporation

PATO:0001396.definition: A monadic quality of continuant that exists at the cellular level of organisation.
PATO:0001396.label: cellular quality

OBI:0001097.definition: A liquid handling device that provides automatic liquid extraction.
OBI:0001097.label: liquid extraction robot

GO:0003964.definition: Catalysis of the reaction: deoxynucleoside triphosphate + DNA(n) = diphosphate + DNA(n+1). Catalyzes RNA-template-directed extension of the 3'- end of a DNA strand by one deoxynucleotide at a time.
GO:0003964.label: RNA-directed DNA polymerase activity

OBI:0300310.definition: Any design in which the decision as to whether to enroll the next patient, pair of patients, or block of patients is determined by whether the cumulative treatment difference for all previous patients is within specified limits.  Enrollment is continued if the difference does not exceed the limits.  It is terminated if it does
OBI:0300310.label: sequential design

OBI:0001922.definition: A microRNA profiling assay that analyzes the microRNA component of the transcriptome using high throughput sequencing technology.
OBI:0001922.label: microRNA profiling by high throughput sequencing assay

OBI:0000899.definition: A RNA extract that is the output of an extraction process in which RNA molecules found in an organelle, e.g., mitochondrion, ER, or chloroplast, excluding the nucleus, are extracted.
OBI:0000899.label: organellar RNA extract

UBERON:0002358.definition: A serous membrane that lines the peritoneal cavity[VHOG,modified].
UBERON:0002358.label: peritoneum

UBERON:0002367.definition: The prostate gland is a partly muscular, partly glandular body that is situated near the base of the mammalian male urethra and secretes an alkaline viscid fluid which is a major constituent of the ejaculatory fluid.
UBERON:0002367.label: prostate gland

OBI:0000922.definition: A specimen that has been frozen in order to store it.
OBI:0000922.label: frozen specimen

OBI:0200169.definition: A normalization data transformation is a data transformation that has objective normalization.
OBI:0200169.label: normalization data transformation

BFO:0000040.definition: An independent continuant that is spatially extended whose identity is independent of that of other entities and can be maintained through time.
BFO:0000040.label: material entity

OBI:0200005.definition: A feature extraction objective is a data transformation objective where the aim of the data transformation is to generate quantified values from a scanned image.
OBI:0200005.label: feature extraction objective

GO:0010467.definition: The process in which a gene's sequence is converted into a mature gene product or products (proteins or RNA). This includes the production of an RNA transcript as well as any processing to produce a mature RNA product or an mRNA or circRNA (for protein-coding genes) and the translation of that mRNA or circRNA into protein. Protein maturation is included when required to form an active form of a product from an inactive precursor form.
GO:0010467.label: gene expression

OBI:0200004.definition: A log-log curve fitting is a curve fitting where first a logarithmic transformation is applied both to the x and the y coordinates of the input data points (x_1, y_1), (x_2, y_2), ..., (x_n, y_n), and then coefficients a and b are determined to optimize the fit of log(y)=a+b*log(x) to these input data points.
OBI:0200004.label: log-log curve fitting

GO:0002250.definition: An immune response mediated by cells expressing specific receptors for antigen produced through a somatic diversification process, and allowing for an enhanced secondary response to subsequent exposures to the same antigen (immunological memory).
GO:0002250.label: adaptive immune response

OBI:0002520.definition: A specimen that is derived from heart.
OBI:0002520.label: heart specimen

OBI:0002521.definition: A specimen that is derived from renal medulla.
OBI:0002521.label: renal medulla specimen

OBI:0002522.definition: A specimen that is derived from adrenal gland.
OBI:0002522.label: adrenal gland specimen

OBI:0002523.definition: A specimen that is derived from breast.
OBI:0002523.label: breast specimen

OBI:0002524.definition: A specimen that is derived from urinary bladder.
OBI:0002524.label: urinary bladder specimen

OBI:0002525.definition: A specimen that is derived from tibial artery.
OBI:0002525.label: tibial artery specimen

OBI:0002526.definition: A specimen that is derived from skin.
OBI:0002526.label: skin of body specimen

OBI:0002527.definition: A specimen that is derived from pancreas.
OBI:0002527.label: pancreas specimen

OBI:0002528.definition: A specimen that is derived from stomach.
OBI:0002528.label: stomach specimen

OBI:0002529.definition: A specimen that is derived from pituitary gland.
OBI:0002529.label: pituitary gland specimen

OBI:0002298.definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of lung cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
OBI:0002298.label: pathologic distant metastases stage for lung according to AJCC 7th edition

OBI:0000925.definition: is a material entity bearing the disposition to infect an organism
OBI:0000925.label: infectious agent

OBI:0400135.definition: An image_cytometer is an instrument for image-based study or measurement of cells.
OBI:0400135.label: image cytometer

OBI:0400137.definition: A cytometer is an instrument for counting and measuring cells.
OBI:0400137.label: cytometer

OBI:0200160.definition: A generalized FWER correction method is a multiple testing procedure that controls the probability of at least k+1 false positives, where k is a user-supplied integer.
OBI:0200160.label: generalized family wise error rate correction method

OBI:0200161.definition: A quantile number of false positives correction method is a MTP that controls for the pth quantile of the distribution of the number of false positives out of the total number of tests performed'
OBI:0200161.label: quantile number of false positives correction method

OBI:0200162.definition: A TPPFP correction method is a MTP that controls the probability that the proportion of false positives among all rejected hypotheses is no greater than a constant q, where q is between 0 and 1.
OBI:0200162.label: tail probability for the proportion of false positives correction method

OBI:0200163.definition: The false discovery rate is a  data transformation used in multiple hypothesis testing to correct for multiple comparisons. It controls the expected proportion of incorrectly rejected null hypotheses (type I errors) in a list of rejected hypotheses. It is a less conservative comparison procedure with greater power than familywise error rate (FWER) control, at a cost of increasing the likelihood of obtaining type I errors. .
OBI:0200163.label: false discovery rate correction method

OBI:0000552.definition: reverse transcribe pcr is a process which allow amplification of cDNA during a pcr reaction while the cDNA results from a retrotranscription of messenger RNA isolated from a material entity.
OBI:0000552.label: reverse transcribed polymerase chain reaction

OBI:1110300.definition: A report about experiments in an investigation that characterize immune epitopes, and was submitted directly by the authors to the Immune Epitope Database (IEDB)
OBI:1110300.label: direct submission to IEDB

OBI:0200165.definition: A quantile proportion of false positives correction method is a multiple testing procedure that controls the pth quantile of the distribution of the proportion of false positives among the rejected hypothesis (false discovery rate).
OBI:0200165.label: quantile proportion of false positives correction method

OBI:0200166.definition: An objective specification to transformation input data into output data
OBI:0200166.label: data transformation objective

PATO:0002204.definition: Handedness where the organism exhibits no overall dominance in the use of right or left hand or foot in the performance of tasks that require one hand or foot or a dominant hand or foot.
PATO:0002204.label: ambidextrous handedness

OBI:0200167.definition:
A normalization objective is a data transformation objective where the aim is to remove
systematic sources of variation to put the data on equal footing in order
to create a common base for comparisons.
OBI:0200167.label: data normalization objective

PATO:0002201.definition: A behavioral quality inhering ina bearer by virtue of the bearer's unequal distribution of fine motor skill between its left and right hands or feet.
PATO:0002201.label: handedness

PATO:0002202.definition: Handedness where the organism preferentially uses the left hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot or a dominant hand or foot.
PATO:0002202.label: left handedness

PATO:0002203.definition: Handedness where the organism preferentially uses the right hand or foot for tasks requiring the use of a single hand or foot or a dominant hand or foot.
PATO:0002203.label: right handedness

OBI:0001805.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001805.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells

OBI:0000394.definition: A blot module is a device which has the function to conatin and facilitate the material transfer process blotting to be realised
OBI:0000394.label: blot module

OBI:0400009.definition: Arc lamp is a light source that produces light by an electric arc (or voltaic arc). The lamp consists of two electrodes typically made of tungsten which are separated by a gas. The type of lamp is often named by the gas contained in the bulb; including neon, argon, xenon, krypton, sodium, metal halide, and mercury. The electric arc in an arc lamp consists of gas which is initially ionized by a voltage and is therefore electrically conductive. To start an arc lamp, usually a very high voltage is needed to ignite or strike the arc. This requires an electrical circuit sometimes called an igniter, which is part of a larger circuit called the ballast. The ballast supplies a suitable voltage and current to the lamp as its electrical characteristics change with temperature and time. Older cytometers may use arc lamps to irradiate particles at the interrogation point.
OBI:0400009.label: arc lamp

OBI:0400008.definition: An analyser is a flow_cytometer that is used to measure properties of particles (whole cells, nuclei, chromosomes, diatoms, plankton, bacteria, viruses) by moving these particles through a detection chamber. An analyser is used to collect data for analysis.
OBI:0400008.label: flow cytometer analyzer

OBI:0400005.definition: A A10 is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Apogee. It uses an arc lamp as a light source, with choices of 75W Xe, 75W Xe/Hg or 100W Hg arc lamps. It has filters and collectors for up to three fluorescent parameters and two scatter parameters. It uses analog electronics. The A10 can be used for measuring the properties of individual cells.
OBI:0400005.label: A10-Analyzer

GO:0006909.definition: An endocytosis process that results in the engulfment of external particulate material by phagocytes. The particles are initially contained within phagocytic vacuoles (phagosomes), which then fuse with primary lysosomes to effect digestion of the particles.
GO:0006909.label: phagocytosis

OBI:0400007.definition: An analog-to-digital_converter is an instrument that converts an infinite resolution analog signal to a finite resolution digital signal.
OBI:0400007.label: analog-to-digital converter

OBI:0400006.definition: A A40-MiniFCM is a flow_cytometer_analyser that allows for the choice of one of four lasers (375nm, 405nm,488nm, 532nm, 635nm), and PMTs and filters for collecting up to four parameters. It uses digital electronics. A military version of this cytometer is available as well. The A40-MiniFCM is geared towards the most demanding applications such as archaea, bacteria and large virus.
OBI:0400006.label: A40-MiniFCM

GO:0006306.definition: The covalent transfer of a methyl group to either N-6 of adenine or C-5 or N-4 of cytosine.
GO:0006306.label: DNA methylation

PR:000007928.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the human GDNF gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.
PR:000007928.label: glial cell line-derived neurotrophic factor

GO:0071608.definition: The appearance of macrophage inflammatory protein 1 alpha due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0071608.label: macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production

GO:0071609.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 5 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0071609.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 5 production

GO:0071604.definition: The appearance of any member of the transforming growth factor-beta family of cytokines due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels. Transforming growth factor-beta family members include TGF-B1, TGF-B2, and TGF-B3.
GO:0071604.label: transforming growth factor beta production

OBI:1110014.definition: is the process in which an adaptive immune receptor binds to a material entity (realizing its disposition). The binding affinity is significant enough to trigger an immune response. Specifically, transient non-specific binding of adaptive immune receptors occurring during immune surveillance is not considered significant binding.
OBI:1110014.label: epitope binding by adaptive immune receptor

GO:0071606.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0071606.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 4 production

OBI:1110016.definition: A function realized as an immune response, which inheres in a T cell, B cell or antibody which derives from or is produced by a cell with prior antigen experience.
OBI:1110016.label: adaptive immune effector function

OBI:0600021.definition: a protocol application to preserve defined  qualities of cells or tissues (sample) which may otherwise change over time
OBI:0600021.label: cell fixation

OBI:1110010.definition: The role borne by a material entity that is realized when it is recognized by the immune system and results in the occurrence of an allergic disease.
OBI:1110010.label: disposition to cause an allergic reaction

OBI:0600023.definition: a protocol application to digest the fraction of input material that is susceptible to that enzyme
OBI:0600023.label: non specific enzymatic cleavage

OBI:0600022.definition: the use physical means to remove a portion of a substance from the rest
OBI:0600022.label: excision

CL:0000057.definition: A connective tissue cell which secretes an extracellular matrix rich in collagen and other macromolecules. Flattened and irregular in outline with branching processes; appear fusiform or spindle-shaped.
CL:0000057.label: fibroblast

PATO:0001374.definition: A cellular quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's number of homologous sets of chromosomes in the nucleus or primary chromosome-containing compartment of the cell, each set essentially coding for all the biological traits of the organism.
PATO:0001374.label: ploidy

PATO:0001377.definition: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's containing more than two homologous sets of chromosomes.
PATO:0001377.label: polyploid

OBI:1110030.definition: is the administration of an infectious agent to a cell culture with the objective to have the agent colonize and replicate in culture
OBI:1110030.label: experimental infection of cell culture

OBI:0001136.definition: A tool for measuring adsorption of material onto planar metal (typically gold and silver) surfaces or onto the surface of metal nanoparticles.
OBI:0001136.label: surface plasmon resonance instrument

OBI:0001137.definition: An device that is used to determine the order of amino acids in protein sequences.
OBI:0001137.label: protein sequencer

OBI:0001134.definition: A gel electrophoresis system that is used to separate DNA or RNA molecules by size, achieved by moving negatively charged nucleic acid molecules through an agarose matrix with an electric field.
OBI:0001134.label: agarose gel electrophoresis system

OBI:0001135.definition: A measuring instrument that is used to determine the weight or mass of an object.
OBI:0001135.label: balance

OBI:0001132.definition: An electrophoresis system that is used to separate ionic species by their charge and frictional forces and mass.
OBI:0001132.label: capillary electrophoresis instrument

OBI:0001133.definition: A high performance liquid chromatography instrument that employs temperature-dependent separation of DNA containing mismatched base pairs from PCR-amplified DNA fragments for chromatographic mutation analysis.
OBI:0001133.label: denaturing high-performance liquid chromatography instrument

OBI:0001130.definition: A device that heats materials in a vacuum.
OBI:0001130.label: vacuum oven

OBI:0001131.definition: A device that is used to heat microscope slides.
OBI:0001131.label: slide warmer

GO:0097278.definition: Lysis of a cell resulting from triggering of the complement cascade. An example can be seen with complement activation and subsequent lysis of a bacterial cell as a result of the binding of IgM to the cell surface followed by the binding of complement proteins to that antibody.
GO:0097278.label: complement-dependent cytotoxicity

OBI:0001138.definition: A device that is used to generate X-rays.
OBI:0001138.label: X-ray source

OBI:0001139.definition: A chromatography device that dissolves a mixture in liquid mobile phase to separate the analyte to be measured from other molecules in the mixture and allows it to be isolated
OBI:0001139.label: liquid chromatography instrument

OBI:0001248.definition: An assay in which chromatin is immunoprecipitated and subsequently analyzed using a DNA microarray to identify which parts of DNA are part of the isolated chromatin
OBI:0001248.label: ChIP-chip assay

OBI:0001249.definition: A process of T cell tolerance induction resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001249.label: epitope specific T cell tolerance induction

OBI:0000667.definition: An MHC multimer assay is an assay that detects T cells capable of binding the MHC:ligand complexes present in the multimer. The multimer is fluorescently labelled. The T cells bound to multimers are counted in a flow cytometer
OBI:0000667.label: obsolete MHC multimer staining assay

OBI:0000666.definition: A background correction data transformation (sometimes called supervised classification) is a data transformation that has the objective background correction.
OBI:0000666.label: background correction data transformation

OBI:0000661.definition: An analyte assay where binding of an enzyme linked antibody to a material entity that is immobilized on solid support is detected utilizing a chemiluminescent reaction. Depending on the setup, the enzyme-linked antibody could be binding directly to the analyte, or it serves as a secondary antibody detecting binding of the primary antibody to the analyte.
OBI:0000661.label: enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay

OBI:0000660.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a background correction data transformation.
OBI:0000660.label: background corrected data set

OBI:0001718.definition: A B cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the on rate.
OBI:0001718.label: assay measuring the on rate [kon] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0000662.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of an error correction data transformation and consists of producing a data set which has had erroneous contributions from the input to the data transformation removed (corrected for).
OBI:0000662.label: error corrected data set

CHEBI:59051.definition: The diethyl ester of dicarbonic acid.
CHEBI:59051.label: diethyl pyrocarbonate

OBI:0001717.definition: antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity resulting from antibody binding to epitope
OBI:0001717.label: B cell epitope specific antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity

CHEBI:59053.definition: A carbodiimide having cyclcohexyl and 2-(4-morpholinyl)ethyl as the two N-substituents.
CHEBI:59053.label: N-cyclohexyl-N'-(2-(4-morpholinyl)ethyl)carbodiimide

CHEBI:59052.definition: A butanone derivative having two hydroxy substituents at the 1-position and an ethoxy substituent at the 3-position.
CHEBI:59052.label: 1,1-dihydroxy-3-ethoxy-2-butanone

CHEBI:59055.definition: A tetracarboxylic acid consisting of ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid having a 4-bromoacetamidobenzyl group at the C1-position and (S)-configuration.
CHEBI:59055.label: (S)-1-(4-bromoacetamidobenzyl)EDTA

OBI:0001246.definition: An assay of epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001246.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor superfamily cytokine production by T cells

CHEBI:59056.definition: A combined intercalating and chelating reagent. The iron chelate, prepared by adding Fe(NH4)2(SO4)2, effects random oxidative cleavage of DNA in the presence of O2 and a reducing agent. This activity is useful as a footprinting probe.
CHEBI:59056.label: EDTA methidiumpropylamide

OBI:0001812.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001812.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells

OBI:0001398.definition: A sequence feature identification objective that aims to characterize the interactions between protein and DNA which includes identification of transcription factor binding sites.
OBI:0001398.label: protein and DNA interaction identification objective

OBI:0001399.definition: A process of interleukin-22 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001399.label: epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells

OBI:0001392.definition: A T cell epitope specific killing assay that uses an in vivo cell mediated cell killing assay.
OBI:0001392.label: in vivo assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing
