OBI:0000599.definition: An NMR console manufactured by tecmac.
OBI:0000599.label: tecmag NMR console

OBI:0000598.definition: Although there are many direct ozone chemiluminescent reactions with various gaseous molecules, the incorporation of a conversion step to convert various non-chemiluminescent analytes to a species capable of reacting with ozone to produce chemiluminescence broadens the horizon of this technique tremendously. The conversion of nearly all nitrogen- and sulfur-containing compounds to their respective chemiluminescent species for universal nitrogen and sulfur detection has made nitrogen/sulfur chemiluminescence detection the most widely used analytical methods based upon ozone-induced chemiluminescence. In addition to non-chromatographic applications, nitrogen/sulfur chemiluminescence detection has been adapted to various chromatographic techniques from gas chromatography to liquid and supercritical fluid chromatography as specialized element-specific detectors. The characteristics of these detectors are evaluated and compared to other element-selective detection techniques. The unique features of the chemiluminescence detectors have made them powerful tools in many diverse fields of analytical chemistry.
OBI:0000598.label: ozone-induced chemiluminescence detector

OBI:0000597.definition: An NMR magnet that is manufactured by Bruker.
OBI:0000597.label: Bruker NMR magnet

OBI:0000596.definition: An NMR instrument that is manufactured by Bruker.
OBI:0000596.label: Bruker NMR instrument

OBI:0000595.definition: A chromatography detector as used by high-performance anion exchange chromatography that provides sensitive and specific detection of carbohydrates. Pulsed Electrochemical Detection (PED) allows simple, sensitive, and direct detection of numerous polar aliphatic compounds, especially carbohydrates. This technique exploits the electrocatalytic activity of noble metal electrode surfaces to oxidize various polar functional groups. In PED, multi-step potential-time waveforms at Au and Pt electrodes realize amperometric/coulometric detection while maintaining uniform and reproducible electrode activity. The response mechanisms in PED are dominated by the surface properties of the electrode, and, as a consequence, members of each chemical class of compounds produce virtually identical voltammetric responses. Thus, the full potential is realized when combined with high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC).
OBI:0000595.label: pulsed amperometric detector

OBI:0000594.definition: An Adapter that enabled the connection of a column to additional devices.
OBI:0000594.label: column adapter

OBI:0000593.definition: A cation trap column is a trap column and ion-exchange column which contains anionic cation-exchange resins.
OBI:0000593.label: cation trap column

OBI:0000592.definition: An optical filter that is used to obtain monochromatic light of a defined wavelength from detector lamps.
OBI:0000592.label: chromatography detector filter

OBI:0000591.definition: The introduction of biological screening and combinatorial chemistry for chemical synthesis has also introduced new requirements for NMR automation, e.g., the use of well plates for sample input, increased demands on throughput, and the need for quick and simple interpretation of the acquired NMR data.
OBI:0000591.label: Bruker BEST NMR system

OBI:0000590.definition:
Over the past few years there has been a significantly growing demand for miniaturization in all areas ofmodern research and development. Evoked by many exciting applications, there is a need for analytical methods which require less amounts of sample. Bruker BioSpin meets this challenge with a revolutionary NMR probe design: The 1mm MicroProbe. It operates with disposable 1mm capillary sample tubes and the sample volume of 5 microliters enables the use of lowest amounts of sample to run all high resolution NMR experiments with outstanding sensitivity and up to 16 times faster measurements. Due to the TXI-type probe design, the z-gradient coil and the automatic matching and tuning accessory, the 1mm MicroProbe can be used for a wide variety of NMR experiments. The key advantages of this probe include:
   up to 4 times higher mass sensitivity than 5mm conventional probes (with respect to the same sample amount)
   excellent solvent suppression properties
   virtually no salt effect
   discrete samples in tubes that can be sealed and stored
   automation accessory for sample preparation and handling available.
OBI:0000590.label: Bruker 1mm MicroProbe

OBI:0000609.definition: A glass column is a chromatography column made out of glass that is usually used for larger scale and preparative liquid chromatography separations.
OBI:0000609.label: glass column

OBI:0000608.definition: A gas generator that generates hydrogen gas.
OBI:0000608.label: hydrogen generator

OBI:0000607.definition: Samples that are neither solid nor liquid, being of biological, chemical, or pharmaceutical interest, reveal highly resolved spectra when magic angle spinning is applied. The correct solution is a gradient, such that the field varies along the spinner axis. This so-called Magic Angle Gradient is employed in Brukers high resolution Magic Angle Spinning (hr-MAS) probes, and is implemented in such a way that it is compatible with the stator and does not interfere with the sample eject or insert. Bruker BioSpin has developed a series of dedicated probes for standard bore magnets to accommodate the rapidly expanding field of hr-MAS. These probes are available in double (e.g. 1H and 13C) and triple resonance (e.g. 1H, 13C, 15N) modes and come equipped with a deuterium lock channel. The probes have automatic sample ejection and insertion capability, with the availability of an optional sample changer, enabling fully automated sample runs. Probes can be equipped with an optional B0 gradient, directed along the magic angle, so that gradient spectroscopy can be done used.
OBI:0000607.label: high resolution magic angle spin probe

OBI:0000606.definition: An open tubular column is a chromatography column in which the particles of the solid stationary phase or the support coated with a liquid stationary phase are concentrated on or along the inside tube wall leaving an open, unrestricted path for the mobile phase in the middle part of the tube.
OBI:0000606.label: open tubular column

OBI:0000605.definition: The chart recorder is a device that transduces signal-intensities into a graphical peak output: As the separated components of the gas sample emerge into the detector, the change in voltage in the detecting bridge circuit causes a representative peak to be drawn on a chart recorder. The position of the peak along the time axis of the chart measures the component's retention time, which identifies the component. This is directly related to carrier gas flow rate, temperature and column packing and dimensions. The area under each peak is proportional to the concentration of the component of the sample. The area of the peaks inscribed on the chart recorder can be determined by multiplying the height of the peak in mm, by the width of the peak in mm at 1/2 the peak height. The calibration curves for use with the chart recorder are therefore peak area plotted against concentration.
OBI:0000605.label: chart recorder

OBI:0000604.definition: A lamp used in a chromatography detector that excites sample molecules at certain frequencies / emission wavelengths, e.g. Mercury Vapor Lamp (253.7 nm), Zinc Vapor Lamp (2123.9 nm and 307.6 nm), Cadmium Vapor Lamp (228.8, 326.1,340.3, and 346.6 nm). To obtain monochromatic light an appropriate light filter would be needed.
OBI:0000604.label: detector lamp

OBI:0000603.definition: A liquid chromatography column is a chromatography column that is used in liquid chromatography, i.e. a column that is provided with a liquid sample mix.
OBI:0000603.label: liquid chromatography column

OBI:0000602.definition: A part of the column content that separates column packing compartments. In radial columns the packing is supported between two cylindrical frits and the gap between represents the bed height or column length. The outer frit is the column inlet and consequently the sample initially has a large area of stationary phase with which to interact. Frits are porous metal products to prevent unwanted particles from entering the chromatography system. These particles may come from the sample, the solvent or debris generated by the chromatography system itself. Such particles entering the system may lead to clogging of capillaries, interference with the chromatography by changing chromatographic parameters or disturbance of the detector function. Characteristics of a frit, besides the diameter and the thickness, is the porosity (pore distribution, density).
OBI:0000602.label: column frit

OBI:0000601.definition: A chromatography consumable is a consumable that is used in a chromatography experiment.
OBI:0000601.label: chromatography consumable

OBI:0000600.definition: An NMR instrument that is manufactured by JEOL.
OBI:0000600.label: JEOL NMR instrument

OBI:0500028.definition: an exclusion criterion (rule) is_a *eligibility criterion*  which defines and states a condition which, if met, makes an entity unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process. For instance, in a study protocol, exclusion criteria indicate the conditions that prospective subjects SHOULD NOT meet to be eligible for participation in a study
OBI:0500028.label: exclusion criterion

OBI:0001709.definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that quantitavely characterizes the binding of an antibody / BCR with a ligand by determining a binding constant.
OBI:0001709.label: assay measuring a binding constant of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0002408.definition: A delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy that is a patch for transdermal administration.
OBI:0002408.label: patch delivery form for hormonal replacement therapy

OBI:0001708.definition: A B cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the dissociation constant KD.
OBI:0001708.label: assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0500020.definition: Groups of assays that are related as part of a time series.
OBI:0500020.label: time series design

OBI:0500022.definition: a stopping rule (criterion) is_a *rule* which causes a *stopping process* to happen
OBI:0500022.label: stopping rule

OBI:0500023.definition: a compliance rule is a rule which ensures a compliance process occurs
OBI:0500023.label: compliance rule

OBI:0001569.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding off rate measurement (koff) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001569.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring binding off rate [koff] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

GO:0097088.definition: The appearance of interleukin-17F due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0097088.label: interleukin-17F production

OBI:0500026.definition:
an eligibility criterion (rule) is_a selection criterion which 
defines and states the requirements (positive or negative) for an entity to be considered as suitable for a given task or participation in a process.
OBI:0500026.label: eligibility criterion

OBI:0500027.definition: an inclusion criterion (rule) is_a *eligibility criterion*  which defines and states a condition which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process. For instance, in a study protocol, inclusion criteria indicate the conditions that prospective subjects MUST meet to be eligible for participation in a study.
OBI:0500027.label: inclusion criterion

IAO:0000101.definition: An image is an affine projection to a two dimensional surface, of measurements of some quality of an entity or entities repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range, where the measurements are represented as color and luminosity on the projected on surface.
IAO:0000101.label: image

OBI:0000026.definition: A dye role that is realized when the stain is used to colour cells and or cellular components for the purposes of visualization
OBI:0000026.label: cytological stain role

OBI:0000025.definition: a role inhering in a material entity that is realized when  characteristics or responses elicited by the substance are used for comparison or reference.
OBI:0000025.label: reference substance role

IAO:0000102.definition: data about an ontology part is a data item about a part of an ontology, for example a term
IAO:0000102.label: data about an ontology part

OBI:0000023.synonyms: data set with assigned class labels
OBI:0000023.definition: A data set that is produced as the output of a class prediction data transformation and consists of a data set with assigned class labels.
OBI:0000023.label: classified data set

IAO:0000104.definition: A directive information entity with action specifications and objective specifications as parts that, when concretized, is realized in a process in which the bearer tries to achieve the objectives by taking the actions specified.
IAO:0000104.label: plan specification

OBI:0000021.definition: A list-mode data file is a binary digital entity where events are stored sequentially, parameter by parameter.
OBI:0000021.label: list-mode data file

OBI:0000020.definition: a worker role of carrying out the study according to the protocol document or study plan delivered by the PI, under the control of the study director.  This role cannot make decisions about the study execution
OBI:0000020.label: contract research organization role

IAO:0000109.definition: A measurement datum is an information content entity that is a recording of the output of a measurement such as produced by a device.
IAO:0000109.label: measurement datum

OBI:0001511.definition: A disposition of a material entity to be presented by MHC molecules on the cell surface as a result of antigen processing by an antigen presenting cell.
OBI:0001511.label: disposition to be a product of antigen processing and presentation

OBI:0302905.definition: the process of extracting one material from another by washing with a solvent to remove adsorbed material from an adsorbent (as in washing of loaded ion-exchange resins to remove captured ions)
OBI:0302905.label: elution

OBI:0001513.definition: A purified MHC binding assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001513.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0302903.definition: a planned process by which totally or partially complementary, single-stranded nucleic acids are  combined into a single molecule called heteroduplex or homoduplex to an extent depending on the amount of complementarity.
OBI:0302903.label: nucleic acid hybridization

OBI:0302902.definition: immbolization is a process by which material entity become (possibly covalently but not necessarily) attached to the surface of another material entity used a substratum.
OBI:0302902.label: immobilization

OBI:0000029.definition: pellet role is a role which inheres in a material entity and is realized by a material separation process using gravitational force generated by a centrifuge in which the material bearing the pellet role is the heavier or heaviest component of the output material..
OBI:0000029.label: centrifuge pellet role

OBI:0001517.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001517.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

CL:0000814.definition: A mature alpha-beta T cell of a distinct lineage that bears natural killer markers and a T cell receptor specific for a limited set of ligands. NK T cells have activation and regulatory roles particularly early in an immune response.
CL:0000814.label: mature NK T cell

OBI:0001568.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001568.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0200072.definition: A curve fitting is a data transformation that has objective curve fitting and that consists of finding a curve which matches a series of data points and possibly other constraints.
OBI:0200072.label: curve fitting data transformation

OBI:0001701.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that measures the ability of an antigen to inhibit antibody binding to a known ligand.
OBI:0001701.label: antigen inhibition assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0200070.definition: Edge weighting is the substitution or transformation of edge length using numerical data.  Data input include a symmetric adjacency matrix for a network and a second data set, for example a list of interactor pairs and a confidence score associated with the experimental detection of each pair's interaction.  Each element in the adjacency matrix is transformed or replaced with the corresponding number in the second data set.  Output data are a modified adjacency matrix reflecting the transformed state of the network.
OBI:0200070.label: edge weighting

OBI:0200071.definition: A loess transformation is a data transformation that takes as input a collection of real number pairs (x, y) and, after performing (one or more) loess fittings, utilizes the resulting curves to transform each (x, y) in the input into (x, y-f(x)) where f(x) is one of the fitted curves.
OBI:0200071.label: loess transformation

OBI:0000939.definition: a process that achieves a training objective
OBI:0000939.label: training process

OBI:0000938.definition: A measurement datum that is reported on a categorical scale
OBI:0000938.label: categorical measurement datum

OBI:0200074.definition: A submatrix extraction is a projection whose input is a matrix and whose output is a matrix obtained by selecting certain rows and columns from the input. (Note that, if one represents the input matrix as a vector obtained by concatenating its rows, then extracting a submatrix is equivalent to projecting this vector into that composed by the entries belonging to the rows and columns of interest from the input matrix.)
OBI:0200074.label: submatrix extraction

OBI:0000659.definition: A planned process with the objective of collecting a specimen.
OBI:0000659.label: specimen collection process

OBI:0000935.definition:
A device that is used to physically interact with a sample under
a microscope, where a level of precision of movement is necessary that
cannot be achieved by the unaided human hand.
OBI:0000935.label: micromanipulator

OBI:0000934.definition: is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the muscle (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe
OBI:0000934.label: intramuscular injection

OBI:0200078.definition: A descriptive statistical calculation objective is a data transformation objective which concerns any calculation intended to describe a feature of a data set, for example, its center or its variability.
OBI:0200078.label: descriptive statistical calculation objective

OBI:0200079.definition: An arithmetic mean calculation is a descriptive statistics calculation in which the mean is calculated by taking the sum of all of the observations in a data set divided by the total number of observations. It gives a measure of the 'center of gravity' for the data set. It is also known as the first moment.
OBI:0200079.label: arithmetic mean calculation

OBI:0000931.definition: the part of the execution of an intervention design study which is varied between two or more subjects in the study
OBI:0000931.label: study intervention

OBI:0000930.definition: A measurement device that is used to calculate the heat flow of a chemical reaction or physical change.
OBI:0000930.label: calorimeter

OBI:0000933.definition:
A device that produces a three-dimensional image or picture of functional processes in the body. It detects pairs of gamma rays emitted indirectly by a positron-emitting
radionuclide (tracer), which is introduced into the body on a biologically active molecule.
OBI:0000933.label: positron emission tomography scanner

OBI:0000932.definition: A device with a separation function realized in a planed process
OBI:0000932.label: material separation device

OBI:0000792.definition: A data transformation which assesses how the results of a statistical analysis will generalize to an independent data set.
OBI:0000792.label: statistical model validation

OBI:0001705.definition: A B cell epitope dependent biological activity determination assay that detects inhibition of the antibody's activity by the antigen.
OBI:0001705.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific antigen inhibition of antibody activity

GO:0097087.definition: The appearance of interleukin-17A due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0097087.label: interleukin-17A production

OBI:0000109.definition: a biological vector role is a material to be added role that is realized by the process of transmitting material to the organism that is the target of the transmission.
OBI:0000109.label: biological vector role

OBI:0000339.definition: a process of creating or modifying a plan specification
OBI:0000339.label: planning

OBI:0000338.definition: A planned process in which data gathered in an investigation is evaluated in the context of existing knowledge with the objective to generate more general conclusions or to conclude that the data does not allow one to draw general conclusion
OBI:0000338.label: drawing a conclusion based on data

OBI:0001255.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001255.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells

OBI:0000707.definition: A decision tree building data transformation is a data transformation that has objective decision tree induction.
OBI:0000707.label: decision tree building data transformation

UBERON:0001970.definition: vital aqueous secretion of the liver that is formed by hepatocytes and modified down stream by absorptive and secretory properties of the bile duct epithelium.
UBERON:0001970.label: bile

OBI:0000704.definition: A decision tree induction objective is a data transformation objective in which a tree-like graph of edges and nodes is created and from which the selection of each branch requires that some type of logical decision is made.
OBI:0000704.label: decision tree induction objective

OBI:0002142.definition: A microRNA profiling assay using digital molecular barcoding technology to quantify target microRNA molecules without the need for amplification.
OBI:0002142.label: Nanostring nCounter miRNA expression assay

OBI:0200037.definition: A pareto scaling is a data transformation that divides all measurements of a variable by the square root of the standard deviation of that variable.
OBI:0200037.label: pareto scaling

IAO:0000182.definition: A survival curve is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the percentage of survival is plotted as a function of time.
IAO:0000182.label: obsolete_survival curve

OBI:0002411.definition: A menopausal status that is neither pre- nor post-menopausal.
OBI:0002411.label: indeterminate menopausal status

OBI:0002412.definition: A menopausal status indicating that less than 6 months has passed since the last menstrual period and there has not been prior bilateral oophorectomy and not on estrogen replacement.
OBI:0002412.label: premenopausal status

IAO:0000184.definition: A scatterplot is a graph which uses Cartesian coordinates to display values for two variables for a set of data. The data is displayed as a collection of points, each having the value of one variable determining the position on the horizontal axis and the value of the other variable determining the position on the vertical axis.
IAO:0000184.label: scatter plot

GO:0030041.definition: Assembly of actin filaments by the addition of actin monomers to a filament.
GO:0030041.label: actin filament polymerization

OBI:0002413.definition: A menopausal status indicating that it has been 6-12 months since last menstrual period.
OBI:0002413.label: perimenopausal status

OBI:0001441.definition: A study design in which proteins in a sample are detected, quantified or otherwise analysed, through an array-based technology.
OBI:0001441.label: proteomic profiling by array design

OBI:0000705.definition: A sequencing assay in which the amino acid sequence of input peptides or proteins is determined by iteratively cleaving of the amino-terminal (N-terminal) residue without disrupting the peptide bonds and identifying it by e.g. chromatography or electropheresis.
OBI:0000705.label: Edman degradation

OBI:0002414.definition: A menopausal status indicating that it has been more than 12 months since the last menstrual period with no prior hysterectomy or that there has been a prior bilateral oophorectomy.
OBI:0002414.label: postmenopausal status

OBI:0002147.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) group O antigens.
OBI:0002147.label: HIV group O antibody assay

CLO:0000001.definition: A cultured cell that is part of a cell line - a stable and homogeneous population of cells with a common biological origin and propagation history in culture
CLO:0000001.label: cell line cell

OBI:0002416.definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is arsenic.
OBI:0002416.label: exposure to arsenic history

OBI:0002454.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically relevant planned processes that a human being actively participates in , which, if met, makes the human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002454.label: clinically relevant lifestyle inclusion criterion

OBI:0002417.definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is asbestos.
OBI:0002417.label: exposure to asbestos history

OBI:0400041.definition: The FACSvantage is a flow_cytometer_sorter manufactured by Becton Dickinson. It has analog electronics, three lasers (several options are available), and the filters and PMTs to collect 6 fluorescent parameters and side scatter, and a photodiode to collect forward scatter. The FACSvantage can be used to analyse, sort and collect cells.
OBI:0400041.label: FACSvantage

OBI:0000702.definition:
is a DNA sequencer which is manufactured by 454 Life Science Corporation and enables pyrosequencing to be performed. It comprises both optics and fluidics subsystems, which are
controlled by a computer subsystem. The fluidics subsystem ensures accurate reagent dispensing. It consists of a reagents cassette (which holds the reagent containers), a sipper manifold, pumps, valves, and debubblers. The fluidics subsystem flows the sequencing reagents across the wells of the PicoTiterPlate device, and moves the spent reagents from the PicoTiterPlate device to the waste receptacle. The optics subsystem consists of a CCD camera and a camera controller. The camera captures the light emitted in the wells of the PicoTiterPlate device during each step of the sequencing cycle, and sends the digital images to the computer subsystem for processing. The computer controls the other Sequencer subsystems, and processes the digital images sent by the camera to extract the DNA sequence information.
OBI:0000702.label: 454 Genome Sequencer FLX

OBI:0002419.definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is chromium.
OBI:0002419.label: exposure to chromium history

OBI:0002148.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) surface antigens.
OBI:0002148.label: surface HBV antibody assay

OBI:0400042.definition: A FC_500 is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Beckman Coulter. It features digital electronics, 488 nm and 635 nm lasers, filters and PMTs for 5 fluorescent parameters, a diode for collecting side scatter and a solid state detector for forward scatter. The FC 500 is an analyser usually used for either research or clinical applications.
OBI:0400042.label: FC 500

PATO:0001339.definition: A composition quality inhering in an bearer by virtue of the bearer's homogeneity of a biomaterial.
PATO:0001339.label: biomaterial purity

PATO:0001338.definition: A biological sex quality inhering in a population of multiple sexes.
PATO:0001338.label: mixed sex

OBI:0000653.definition: A fuzzy clustering objective is a data transformation objective where the aim is to assign input objects (typically vectors of attributes) a probability that a point belongs to a class, where the number of class and their specifications are not known a priori.
OBI:0000653.label: fuzzy clustering objective

OBI:0000703.definition: is a DNA sequence which is manufactured by Illumina (Solexa) corporation. it support sequencing of single or paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology
OBI:0000703.label: Illumina Genome Analyzer II

OBI:0400047.definition: A gas laser is a laser in which the lasing medium is a gas. The laser medium is places between two parallel mirrors for light emission amplification. The gas is excited to emit light via an external light source or an electric current discharging through the gas.
OBI:0400047.label: gas laser

OBI:0001719.definition: A B cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the association constant KA.
OBI:0001719.label: assay measuring the association constant [KA] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

BFO:0000015.definition: An occurrent that has temporal proper parts and for some time t, p s-depends_on some material entity at t.
BFO:0000015.label: process

OBI:0100058.definition: A material entity which results from the transplantation of living cells, tissues or organs  from on organism of one species to an organism of another species.
OBI:0100058.label: xenograft

BFO:0000017.definition: A specifically dependent continuant  that inheres in continuant  entities and are not exhibited in full at every time in which it inheres in an entity or group of entities. The exhibition or actualization of a realizable entity is a particular manifestation, functioning or process that occurs under certain circumstances.
BFO:0000017.label: realizable entity

OBI:0100056.synonyms: immortal cell line sample;permanent cell line
OBI:0100056.definition: A cell line that is expected to be capable of indefinite propagation in an vitro culture.
OBI:0100056.label: obsolete_immortal cell line culture

OBI:0100051.definition: A material entity that has the specimen role.
OBI:0100051.label: specimen

OBI:0200073.definition: A family wise error rate correction method is a multiple testing procedure that controls the probability of at least one false positive.
OBI:0200073.label: family wise error rate correction method

OBI:1110008.definition: Is an occurrence of a disease caused by an infection
OBI:1110008.label: occurrence of infectious disease

UBERON:0002409.definition: Transudate contained in the pericardial cavity.[FMA]
UBERON:0002409.label: pericardial fluid

OBI:0200180.definition: is a data transformation objective whereby the aim is to the calculate the spread of a dataset, spread is a descriptive statistic which describes the variability of values in a data set
OBI:0200180.label: spread calculation objective

OBI:0002030.synonyms: DNA sequence variation detection by tiling array
OBI:0002030.definition: A genotyping by array assay that uses tiling array technology.
OBI:0002030.label: genotyping by tiling array assay

OBI:0000701.definition: A self-organizing map (SOM) is an artificial neural network with objective class discovery that uses a neighborhood function to preserve the topological properties of a dataset to produce low-dimensional (typically 2) discretized representation of the training data set. A set of artificial neurons learn to map points in an input space to coordinates in an output space. The input space can have different dimensions and topology from the output space, and the SOM will attempt to preserve these.
OBI:0000701.label: self-organizing map

OBI:0001647.definition: A B cell epitope 3D structure determination assay that uses a nuclear magnetic resonance assay.
OBI:0001647.label: NMR assay determining the 3D structure of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

GO:0002534.definition: The synthesis or release of a cytokine following a inflammatory stimulus as part of an inflammatory response, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0002534.label: cytokine production involved in inflammatory response

PATO:0001421.definition: A viability quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's condition before death.
PATO:0001421.label: alive

PATO:0001422.definition: A viability quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the cessation of the bearer's life.

UBERON:0003688.definition: A fold of peritoneum originating at the stomach and supporting the viscera.
UBERON:0003688.label: omentum

OBI:0002374.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male sibling.

OBI:0002377.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female parent.
OBI:0002377.label: mother clinical history of cancer

OBI:0002376.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a male parent.
OBI:0002376.label: father clinical history of cancer

OBI:0002371.definition: A diagnosis that is an assertion that a patient who is the subject of a diagnostic process has cancer.
OBI:0002371.label: diagnosis of cancer

OBI:0002370.definition: A clinical history in which it is not known whether there was a diagnosis of cancer.
OBI:0002370.label: unknown clinical history of cancer

OBI:0002373.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in the female sibling of a parent.
OBI:0002373.label: aunt clinical history of cancer

OBI:0001640.definition: A B cell epitope dependent biological activity determination assay that detects antigen activation.
OBI:0001640.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific immunoglobulin-mediated antigen activation

OBI:0000728.definition: rodent care  is the process by which rodents are being provided with a controlled living environment while kept in captivity for the purpose of research.
OBI:0000728.label: rodent care

OBI:0002379.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a person's male child.
OBI:0002379.label: son clinical history of cancer

OBI:0002378.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer in a female sibling.
OBI:0002378.label: sister clinical history of cancer

OBI:0200187.definition: A sequence analysis data transformation is a data transformation that has objective sequence analysis and has the aim of analysing ordered biological data for sequential patterns.
OBI:0200187.label: sequence analysis data transformation

OBI:0001380.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-18 production by T cells.
OBI:0001380.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-18 production by T cells

OBI:0002403.definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual is currently a hormonal birth control user.
OBI:0002403.label: hormonal birth control current use history

OBI:0002402.definition: A hormonal birth control use history that indicates an individual has previously been a hormonal birth control user but is not a current user.
OBI:0002402.label: hormonal birth control former use history

OBI:0002401.definition: An information content entity that indicates whether a woman has ever used oral contraceptives in order to block ovulation and prevent the occurrence of pregnancy.
OBI:0002401.label: hormonal birth control use history

OBI:0002400.definition: A gynecologic surgery history in which a woman has not had either a hysterectomy or an oophorectomy.
OBI:0002400.label: neither hysterectomy nor oophorectomy history

OBI:0002159.definition: An analyte assay that is meant to detect hepatitis C virus (HCV) nucleic acids.
OBI:0002159.label: HCV nucleic acid testing

OBI:0002158.definition: An analyte assay that is meant to detect human immunodeficiency virus (HIV-1) nucleic acids.
OBI:0002158.label: HIV-1 nucleic acid testing

OBI:0002405.definition: A clinical history in which an individual has had hormonal replacement therapy in the past.
OBI:0002405.label: hormonal replacement therapy history

GO:0043565.definition: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with DNA of a specific nucleotide composition, e.g. GC-rich DNA binding, or with a specific sequence motif or type of DNA e.g. promotor binding or rDNA binding.
GO:0043565.label: sequence-specific DNA binding

OBI:0002155.definition: An analyte assay that is meant to detect general antibodies that react with substances that are produced by cellular damage caused by Treponema pallidum indicating a syphilis infection. VDRL tests require a microscope and can be done on cerebrospinal fluid as well as blood.
OBI:0002155.label: venereal disease research laboratory test

OBI:0002154.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to cytomegalovirus (CMV) antigens.
OBI:0002154.label: CMV antibody assay

OBI:0002157.definition: An analyte assay that is meant to detect hepatitis B virus (HBV) surface antigens.
OBI:0002157.label: HBV surface antigen assay

OBI:0002156.definition: An analyte assay that is meant to detect with the aid of carbon or charcoal particles general antibodies that react with substances that are produced by cellular damage caused by Treponema pallidum indicating a syphilis infection. RPR tests can be done without a microscope.
OBI:0002156.label: rapid plasma reagin test

OBI:0002151.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to Hepatitis C virus (HCV) antigens.
OBI:0002151.label: HCV antibody assay

OBI:0002150.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detectimmunoglobulin M (IgM) antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) core antigens.
OBI:0002150.label: core HBV IgM antibody assay

OBI:0002153.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect immunoglobulin M (IgM) antibodies that bind to Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) antigens.
OBI:0002153.label: EBV IgM antibody assay

OBI:0002152.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect immunoglobulin G (IgG) antibodies that bind to Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) antigens.
OBI:0002152.label: EBV IgG antibody assay

OBI:0400074.definition: A mixed argon krypton gas laser is an ion laser in which the lasing medium is a mixture of argon and krypton. A mixed argon-krypton laser can by used to irradiate cells in a flow cytometer.
OBI:0400074.label: mixed argon-krypton gas laser

OBI:0400076.definition: A particle deliver vessel. A multi-well plate is a vessel that can deliver multiple samples to a flow cytometer in a specified order. It must be used with a plate loader.
OBI:0400076.label: multi-well plate

OBI:0400077.definition: A Neodymium-YAG (yttrium aluminum garnet) laser is a solid state laser in which the lasing medium is a solid rod of crystalline material pumped by a flash lamp or a diode laser. Typical output wavelengths are 355, 532, and 1064 nm. A neodymium-YAG laser can by used to irradiate cells in a flow cytometer.
OBI:0400077.label: neodymium-YAG laser

OBI:0400070.definition: A Luminex_200 is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Luminex. The optical specifications are: Reporter laser: 532 nm, nominal output 10 - 15 mW, maximum 500 mW, frequency-doubled diode; mode of operation, continuous wave (CW). Classification laser: 635 nm, 9.1 __ 6%, maximum output 25 mW, diode; mode of operation, continuous wave (CW) Reporter detector: Photomultiplier tube, detection bandwidth of 565 - 585 nm Classification detector and doublet discriminator: Avalanche photo diodes with temperature compensation
OBI:0400070.label: Luminex 200

OBI:0400071.definition: A MACS Quant is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Miltenyi. It uses digital electronics, and has three lasers of wavelengths 405 nm, 488 nm, and 635 nm. It has filters and detectors to collect 7 fluorescent parameters and 2 scatter parameters. The MACS Quant is an analyser usually used in research applications.
OBI:0400071.label: MACS Quant

OBI:0302743.definition: liver is an anatomical entity which constituent are mainly hepatocytes, which has a function of detoxification, hematopoietic center, glucose and fat metabolism management. liver is only found in animals , all Vertebrates and some families of invertebrates
OBI:0302743.label: obsolete_liver

OBI:0000897.definition: A single-nucleotide-resolution nucleic acid structure mapping assay which determines nucleic acid secondary structure at a nucleotide resolution scale using DEPC as reagent and chemical probe
OBI:0000897.label: DEPC structure mapping assay

PATO:0001394.definition: A ploidy quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's having two copies (homologs) of each chromosome, usually one from the mother and one from the father.
PATO:0001394.label: diploid

OBI:0400078.definition: An obscuration bar is a an optical subsystem which is a strip of metal or other material that serves to block out direct light from the illuminating beam. The obscuration bar prevents the bright light scattered in the forward directions from burning out the collection device.
OBI:0400078.label: obscuration bar

OBI:0400079.definition: An optical filter is an optical subsystem that selectively transmits light having certain properties (often, a particular range of wavelengths, that is, range of colours of light), while blocking the remainder. They are commonly used in photography, in many optical instruments, and to colour stage lighting Optical filters can be arranged to segregate and collect light by wave length.
OBI:0400079.label: optical filter

OBI:0001225.definition: a genetic characteristics information which is a part of genotype information that identifies the population of organisms
OBI:0001225.label: genetic population background information

OBI:0002089.definition: A container with an environmental control function.
OBI:0002089.label: physical store

OBI:0002088.definition: A container with the function of containing a specimen.
OBI:0002088.label: specimen container

OBI:0002087.definition: A contain function that involves physical contact with a specimen. This function is typically performed in such a way that the specimen is usable for an investigation or assay.
OBI:0002087.label: containing a specimen function

OBI:0002086.definition: A bisulfite sequencing assay that identifies genomic methylation patterns by using a bisulfite based protocol with the Tet enzyme to differentiate 5-hydroxylmethylcytosine (5hmC) from 5-methylcytosine (5mC) through a step-wise oxidative demethylation of 5mC, converting it to 5-carboxylcytosine (5caC) while keeping 5hmC protected.
OBI:0002086.label: Tet-assisted bisulfite sequencing assay

OBI:0002085.synonyms: transcript expression location detection by fluorescent HCR.
OBI:0002085.definition: An in situ hybridization assay in which the location (e.g. anatomical/tissue) of a transcript is detected by a multiplexed fluorescent in situ hybridization, based on orthogonal amplification with hybridization chain reactions (HCR). RNA probes complementary to mRNA targets trigger chain reactions in which fluorophore-labeled RNA hairpins self-assemble into tethered fluorescent amplification polymers.
OBI:0002085.label: transcript expression location detection by hybridization chain reaction assay

OBI:0002084.synonyms: chromatin modifier binding site identification by ChIP-Seq assay
OBI:0002084.definition: A ChIP-seq assay that identifies regions of chromatin bound to a chromatin modifying protein, e.g. a histone acetyltransferase.
OBI:0002084.label: transcription cofactor activity region identification by ChIP-Seq assay

OBI:0002083.definition: A reporter gene assay that detects expression of a reporter gene that was inserted under the control of an enhancer of interest.
OBI:0002083.label: enhancer activity detection by reporter gene assay

OBI:0002082.definition: An assay that detects expression of a reporter gene that was inserted under the control of a regulatory sequence of interest.
OBI:0002082.label: reporter gene assay

OBI:0002081.definition: A collection of specimens that was derived from the same source material entity at different time points in order to observe changes in that entity.
OBI:0002081.label: specimens collected longitudinally

OBI:0000721.definition: An assay that measures glucose clearance from blood over time by repeated glucose measurement in blood serum or plasma after the administration of a glucose bolus in-vivo. This assay can be used to evaluate the severity of insulin resistance or the efficiency of glucose clearance.
OBI:0000721.label: glucose tolerance test

OBI:0600054.definition: the use of environmental conditions to select for the organism or cells that have a certain trait
OBI:0600054.label: selection by survival

OBI:0600055.definition: the use of enzymes to cut DNA molecules, the study of DNA through cleavage, mapping, and analysis of the fragments
OBI:0600055.label: DNA cleavage, restriction analysis

OBI:0600056.definition: protease cleavage is an enzymatic cleavage which relies on enzyme with protease activity to act on proteins and produce polypeptides (protein fragments).
OBI:0600056.label: protease cleavage

OBI:0600057.definition: the use of enzymes to duplicate DNA molecule any process used to make additional copies of a biomaterial
OBI:0600057.label: enzymatic DNA replication

OBI:0600050.definition: a protocol application to digest the fraction of input material that is susceptible to that enzyme
OBI:0600050.label: specific enzymatic cleavage

OBI:1110061.definition: a process in which an organism (host) is exposed to some material entity, which results in an immune reactivity
OBI:1110061.label: exposure resulting in immune reactivity

OBI:0600052.definition: a protocol application that uses diffusion through a semi-permeable membrane to separate an input material into two fractions of different composition
OBI:0600052.label: dialysis

OBI:0600060.definition: a transfection which relies on the use of physical, electrical and chemical phenomena to introduce DNA into a cell
OBI:0600060.label: DNA transfection

OBI:0002575.definition: A method for sequencing isoforms by enriching a cDNA library for full-length reads spanning entire transcript isoforms.
OBI:0002575.label: isoform sequencing

OBI:0000891.definition: A cytometry assay which measures the degreee to which input cells are replicating.
OBI:0000891.label: cell proliferation assay

OBI:0600058.definition: the use of enzymes to increase the number of molecules of a biomaterial
OBI:0600058.label: enzymatic amplification

OBI:0002572.definition: An RNA-seq assay to study non-polyadenylated transcripts, such as, but not exclusive to unspliced and circular isoforms, through the depletion of polyadenylated transcripts prior to high-throughput sequencing.
OBI:0002572.label: polyA-depleted RNA sequencing assay

OBI:0002571.definition: An RNA-seq assay to study transcriptomes through the enrichment of polyadenylated transcripts or removal of ribosomal RNA prior to high-throughput sequencing.
OBI:0002571.label: polyA-selected RNA sequencing assay

OBI:0002570.definition: A mouse array which is manufacutred by NanoString Technologies. Built upon color-coded molecular barcodes technology, the array profiles miRNA with increased specificity and sensitivty than microarrays.
OBI:0002570.label: nCounter Mouse miRNA Expression array

OBI:0001073.definition: A glass cutting and breaking device that is used to produce glass knives used in ultramicrotomy.
OBI:0001073.label: microtome knife maker

OBI:0001072.definition: A device consisting of a vessel, similar in construction to a vacuum flask, that is used to maintain cold cryogenic temperatures. FIX THIS DEFINITION
OBI:0001072.label: cryostat

OBI:0001071.definition: A confocal microscope that uses a programmable spatial light modulator for generating an arbitrary pattern of conjugate illumination and detection apertures.
OBI:0001071.label: programmable array microscope

OBI:0001070.definition: A device that is used to measure ionizing radiation.
OBI:0001070.label: scintillation counter

OBI:0001077.definition: A device that is used to image small laboratory animals (e.g., rats and mice) in vivo.
OBI:0001077.label: small-animal image acquisition device

OBI:0001076.definition: An incubating device that provides shaking motion for biomedical applications (e.g., cell cultures).
OBI:0001076.label: incubator shaker

OBI:0001075.definition: A device that creates an appropriate environment for nucleic acid hybridization.
OBI:0001075.label: hybridization oven

OBI:0001074.definition: A device that is used for the fixation or stabilization of biological materials as the first step in specimen preparation for electron microscopy.
OBI:0001074.label: cryofixation device

OBI:0600065.definition: Place holder class, see editor note
OBI:0600065.label: obsolete_defined processes

OBI:0001079.definition: A microscope that is used to increase micrograph contrast and/or reconstruct three-dimensional images by using a spatial pinhole to eliminate out-of-focus light in specimens that are thicker than the focal plane.
OBI:0001079.label: confocal microscope

OBI:0001078.definition: An image acquisition device that is responsive to an infrared emissive target within a given field of view.
OBI:0001078.label: infrared image acquisition device

OBI:0000952.definition: The administration of a substance into the mouth of an organism
OBI:0000952.label: oral administration

OBI:0002091.definition: A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 5' end of the mRNA.
OBI:0002091.label: 5' rapid amplification of cDNA ends

OBI:0001713.definition: opsonization resulting from antibody binding to epitope
OBI:0001713.label: B cell epitope specific opsonization

OBI:0200181.definition: A center calculation data transformation is a data transformation that has objective of center calculation.
OBI:0200181.label: center calculation data transformation

OBI:0002092.definition: A rapid amplication of cDNA ends to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 3' end of the mRNA.
OBI:0002092.label: 3' rapid amplification of cDNA ends

OBI:0001989.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001989.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001988.definition: A MHC binding constant determination assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant (KD).
OBI:0001988.label: assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0001987.definition: A MHC binding constant determination assay measuring equilibrium association constant (KA).
OBI:0001987.label: assay measuring the association constant [KA] of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0001986.definition: An immunostaining assay to detect and potentially localize antigens within the cells of a tissue section.
OBI:0001986.label: immunohistochemistry

OBI:0001985.definition: An analyte assay where binding of the analyte to immobilized matrix is measured.
OBI:0001985.label: microarray assay

OBI:0001984.definition: An in vivo intervention experiment in which the ability of the intervention to reduce or cure the effects of a disease are tested.
OBI:0001984.label: treatment intervention experiment

OBI:0001983.definition: An in vivo intervention experiment that tests the ability of the intervention to decrease an immune response.
OBI:0001983.label: tolerance induction intervention experiment

OBI:0001982.definition: An in vivo intervention experiment that tests the ability of the intervention to prevent occurrence of a disease in a host.
OBI:0001982.label: protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment

OBI:0001981.definition: An in vivo intervention experiment that tests the ability of the intervention to increase the severity of a disease in the host.
OBI:0001981.label: disease exacerbation in vivo intervention experiment

OBI:0001980.definition: An assay in which the effect of a targeted process (the intervention) on an organism is tested.
OBI:0001980.label: in vivo intervention experiment

CHEBI:23367.definition: Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, radical ion, complex, conformer etc., identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity.
CHEBI:23367.label: molecular entity

OBI:0001875.definition: a cultured cell population comprised of a single type of immune system cell
OBI:0001875.label: cultured immune cell population

UBERON:0000173.definition: Amniotic fluid is a bodily fluid consisting of watery liquid surrounding and cushioning a growing fetus within the amnion. It allows the fetus to move freely without the walls of the uterus being too tight against its body. Buoyancy is also provided. The composition of the fluid changes over the course of gestation. Initially, amniotic fluid is similar to maternal plasma, mainly water with electrolytes. As the fetus develops, proteins, carbohydrates, lipids, phospholipids originating from the lungs, fetal cells, and urea are deposited in the fluid.
UBERON:0000173.label: amniotic fluid

OBI:0200075.definition: A row submatrix extraction is a submatrix extraction where all the columns of the input matrix are retained and selection only occurs on the rows.
OBI:0200075.label: row submatrix extraction

PATO:0001632.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the front of an organism relative to another entity.
PATO:0001632.label: anterior to

PR:000001004.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the human CD4 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof. CD4 is an accessory protein for MHC class-II antigen/T-cell receptor interaction. It is the primary receptor for HIV-1. CD4 has four immunoglobulin-like domains in its extracellular region that share the same structure, but can differ in sequence.
PR:000001004.label: CD4 molecule

UBERON:0000178.definition: A fluid that is composed of blood plasma and erythrocytes.
UBERON:0000178.label: blood

OBI:1110118.definition: A cell line derived from mouse mastocytoma.
OBI:1110118.label: P815 cell line

OBI:1110111.definition: Is a process in which an infectious agent comes close enough to a potential host organism in its habitat that a contact can result
OBI:1110111.label: environmental proximity to infectious agent

OBI:1110114.definition: a process in which a vector carrying an infectious agent comes close enough to a potential host organism that a contact can result
OBI:1110114.label: contact to pathogen carrying biological vector

OBI:0001972.synonyms: Ion 318 Chip;Ion PGM 318 Chip;Ion PGM 318 Chip v2
OBI:0001972.definition:
An ion semiconductor chip manufactured by Life Technologies which detects polymerase-driven base incorporation to translate into digital form. The 318 chip is compatible with the Ion Torrent PGM and has a run time of:

4.4 hours for 200 bp reads with an output of 60 Mb-1 Gb,
7.3 hours for 400 bp reads with an output of 1.2 Gb-2 Gb.
OBI:0001972.label: Ion 318 Chip v2

OBI:1110116.definition: A cell specimen comprised of a mixed cell population obtained by processing whole spleen into individual cells, typically performed using a sieve or blender. This population includes T cells, B cells, macrophages, and other cell types.
OBI:1110116.label: splenocyte specimen

OBI:0001217.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-22 production by T cells.
OBI:0001217.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells

OBI:0001216.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells that uses a cell culture analyte detection bioassay.
OBI:0001216.label: cell culture analyte detection bioassay measuring epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells

OBI:0001215.definition: A T cell epitope specific perforin release assay that uses an intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay.
OBI:0001215.label: intracellular material detection assay measuring epitope specific perforin release

OBI:0001214.definition: A study design that tests different normalization procedures.
OBI:0001214.label: normalization testing design

OBI:0001212.definition: A process of type IV hypersensitivity by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001212.label: epitope specific type IV hypersensitivity by T cells

OBI:0001211.definition: A study design where all or part of an organism is removed and studied in vitro, e.g. part of a mouse is removed and cultured in vitro. A cell culture with an established cell line is an in vitro experiment.
OBI:0001211.label: ex vivo design

OBI:0001210.definition: An assay of epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001210.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells

OBI:0001711.definition: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a disease exacerbation in vivo intervention experiment.
OBI:0001711.label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific disease exacerbation

OBI:0001219.definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001219.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells

OBI:0001218.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-8 production by T cells.
OBI:0001218.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-8 production by T cells

OBI:0001187.definition: An assay that measures the presence or amount of an infectious agent in an evaluant
OBI:0001187.label: infectious agent detection assay

OBI:0001186.definition: An epitope protection from infectious challenge experiment in which the readout is a reduction in the presence of pathogens in the host compared to controls.
OBI:0001186.label: epitope protection from infectious challenge experiment based on pathogen burden

OBI:0001185.definition: An organism that is bred to have some uniform behavioral, morphological, physiological, or genetic characteristics with similarly bred organisms
OBI:0001185.label: selectively maintained organism

OBI:0001184.definition: An efficacy of epitope intervention experiment that tests the efficacy of inducing an immune epitope response to prevent disease in a host.
OBI:0001184.label: epitope protection experiment

OBI:0001183.definition: An epitope protection experiment in which the ability of the epitope to protect the host from developing tumors is assessed.
OBI:0001183.label: epitope protection from tumor challenge experiment

OBI:0001182.definition: A binding datum that states that there is no significant disposition of two or more entities to form a complex
OBI:0001182.label: negative binding datum

OBI:0001181.definition: A data item that states if two or more material entities have the disposition to form a complex, and if so, how strong that disposition is.
OBI:0001181.label: binding datum

OBI:0001180.definition: half maximal effective concentration (EC50) is a scalar measurement datum corresponding to the concentration of a compound which induces a response halfway between the baseline and maximum after some specified exposure time.
OBI:0001180.label: half maximal effective concentration (EC50)

OBI:0002456.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more gravidity statuses of an organism, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002456.label: gravidity inclusion criterion

OBI:0001189.definition: An epitope protection experiment that determines the success of the epitope intervention based on increased survival of the host.
OBI:0001189.label: epitope protection experiment based on survival

OBI:0001188.definition: An efficacy of epitope intervention experiment that tests the ability of inducing an epitope immune response to increase the severity of an existing disease in the host.
OBI:0001188.label: epitope disease exacerbation experiment

OBI:0000858.definition: a record indicating that the biological sex of an organism is not known.
OBI:0000858.label: record of unknown sex

OBI:0000859.definition: A RNA extraction process in which the desired output material is RNA in the cytoplasm.
OBI:0000859.label: cytoplasmic RNA extraction

PATO:0001985.definition: A quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being kept below its freezing point.
PATO:0001985.label: frozen

OBI:0000852.definition: a information content entity created to indicate that information about something is not available to the person recording it.
OBI:0000852.label: record of missing knowledge

OBI:0002560.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more family statuses, which, if met, makes a human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002560.label: family status inclusion criterion

OBI:0000856.definition: An assay in which the presence of a material inside a cell is measured by permeabilizing the cell membrane to allow entry of specific antibodies, and counting the stained cells using a flow cytometer.
OBI:0000856.label: obsolete intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay

OBI:0000857.definition: A role played by a nucleic acid molecule that is used in a planned process for its ability to bind a nucleic acid molecules with complementary nucleotide sequence
OBI:0000857.label: complementary nucleotide probe role

OBI:0000854.definition: An analyte assay that detects specific peptides in an input material by separating it using gel electrophoresis, transfering the separated molecules to a membrane, and staining them with_ antibodies specific to the analyte molecules.
OBI:0000854.label: western blot analysis

OBI:0000855.definition: A RNA extraction process in which total cellular and organelle RNA are extracted.
OBI:0000855.label: total RNA extraction

OBI:0001671.synonyms: band shift assay;gel retardation assay;gel mobility shift assay;gel shift assay;EMSA
OBI:0001671.definition: An assay that measures information about Protein-DNA or Protein-RNA interactions using gel electrophoresis and relying on the fact the molecular interactions will cause the heterodimer to be retarded on the gel when compared to controls corresponding to protein extract alone and protein extract + neutral nucleic acid.
OBI:0001671.label: electrophoretic mobility shift assay

OBI:0001670.definition: An assay that determines the presence and estimates abundance of transcript species by first creating an homo or heteroduplex by adding a specific, complementary sequence to the sequence of interest and then exposing the mixture of ribonuclease, which will degrade only single stranded molecules. A detection step will reveal if the sample contained a sequence of interest.
OBI:0001670.label: RNA protection assay

OBI:0001673.definition: A transcription profiling assay that is performed using a very low amount (nanogram scale) of mRNA samples using Cap analysis gene expression (CAGE).
OBI:0001673.label: nano-cap analysis of gene expression assay

OBI:0001672.definition: An assay which transiently disrupts gene transcripts by expressing antisense RNA constructs or delivering RNA interfering molecules in cells.
OBI:0001672.label: gene knock-down assay

OBI:0001859.definition: An assay to determine the sequences of those DNA regions in the genome associated with regulatory activity.
OBI:0001859.label: formaldehyde-assisted isolation of regulatory elements assay

OBI:0001858.definition: An analyte assay that employs UV-crosslinking between RNA and a protein, followed by immunoprecipitation with antibodies for the protein, fragmentation, and high-throughput screening for RNA sequences that interact with a particular RNA-binding protein.
OBI:0001858.label: cross-linking immunoprecipitation high-throughput sequencing assay

OBI:0001677.definition: A process of granulysin production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001677.label: epitope specific granulysin production by T cells

OBI:0001676.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001676.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells

OBI:0001679.definition: An assay that detects protein protein interactions and protein DNA interactions by testing for physical interactions (such as binding) between two proteins or a single protein and a DNA molecule, respectively. The premise behind the test is the activation of downstream reporter gene(s) by the binding of a transcription factor onto an upstream activating sequence (UAS). For two-hybrid screening, the transcription factor is split into two separate fragments, called the binding domain (BD) and activating domain (AD). The BD is the domain responsible for binding to the UAS and the AD is the domain responsible for the activation of transcription. The Y2H is thus a protein-fragment complementation assay.
OBI:0001679.label: yeast 2-hybrid assay

OBI:0001854.definition: A sequence feature identification objective that aims to characterize the interactions between protein and RNA.
OBI:0001854.label: protein and RNA interaction identification objective

OBI:0001857.definition: An analyte assay that combines immunoprecipitation of an RNA-binding protein and RNA-seq to identify mRNAs associated with selected RNA binding proteins (RBPs).
OBI:0001857.label: RNP (ribonuclear particle) immunoprecipitation high- throughput sequencing assay

CHEBI:51760.definition: An organic heteropentacyclic compound that has formula C44H46Cl3N4NaO14S3.
CHEBI:51760.label: Alexa Fluor 546

OBI:0001851.definition: A transcription profiling identification objective that aims to characterize the transcription start sites of genes.
OBI:0001851.label: transcription start site identification objective

OBI:0001850.definition: A transcription profiling assay that determines transcripts, gene structures, and gene expressions using Paired-End Tags and sequencing technology.
OBI:0001850.label: transcript analysis by paired-end tag sequencing assay

OBI:0001853.definition: An assay that identifies the location of regulatory regions, based on the genome-wide sequencing of regions super sensitive to cleavage by DNase I.
OBI:0001853.label: DNase I hypersensitive sites sequencing assay

OBI:0001852.definition: A library preparation that results in the creation of a library of the 5' and 3' ends of DNA or cDNA fragments using adaptors and endonucleases. The preparation may or may not include cloning process.
OBI:0001852.label: paired-end library preparation

OBI:0001459.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells.
OBI:0001459.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells

OBI:0000101.definition: A measurement datum that is the outcome of the quantification of an assay for the activity of a gene, or the number of RNA transcripts.
OBI:0000101.label: measured expression level

OBI:0000102.definition: a study personnel role played by a party who is accountable for the execution of a study component and can make decisions about the conduct of the study
OBI:0000102.label: responsible party role

OBI:0000103.definition: a responsible party role played by a person responsible for the overall conduct of a study
OBI:0000103.label: principal investigator role

OBI:0000105.definition: a protocol application to replace an organ or tissue of an organism
OBI:0000105.label: transplantation

OBI:0001323.definition: A study design in which a microRNA array is used to analyse the microRNA component of the transcriptome.
OBI:0001323.label: microRNA profiling by array design

OBI:0001322.definition: A T cell epitope specific granzyme B release assay that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001322.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific granzyme B release by T cells

OBI:0001453.definition: An assay of epitope specific lymphotoxin A production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001453.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific lymphotoxin A production by T cells

OBI:0001452.definition: A T cell epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production assay that uses a cell culture analyte detection bioassay.
OBI:0001452.label: cell culture analyte detection bioassay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor production by T cells

OBI:0001455.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001455.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-5 production by T cells

OBI:0001326.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001326.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells

OBI:0001457.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-8 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001457.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-8 production by T cells

OBI:0001324.definition: An efficacy of T cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a tolerance induction intervention experiment.
OBI:0001324.label: in vivo assay measuring T cell epitope specific tolerance induction

IAO:0000079.definition: A density plot is a report graph which is a graphical representation of data where the tint of a particular pixel corresponds to some kind of function corresponding the the amount of data points relativelly with their distance from the the pixel.
IAO:0000079.label: density plot

IAO:0000078.definition: The curation status of the term. The allowed values come from an enumerated list of predefined terms. See the specification of these instances for more detailed definitions of each enumerated value.
IAO:0000078.label: curation status specification

OBI:0001699.definition: A competitive inhibition of binding assay in which two antibodies that are known to bind the same antigen are tested for the ability of one antibody to inhibit binding of the other antibody to the antigen, thereby determining if they have overlapping binding sites.
OBI:0001699.label: antibody cross-blocking assay

OBI:0001698.definition: A B cell epitope dependent biological activity determination assay that uses an in vivo intervention experiment.
OBI:0001698.label: biological activity assay measuring B cell epitope specific in vivo activity

OBI:0001971.synonyms: Ion 316 Chip;Ion PGM 316 Chip;Ion PGM 316 Chip v2
OBI:0001971.definition:
An ion semiconductor chip manufactured by Life Technologies which detects polymerase-driven base incorporation to translate into digital form. The 316 chip is compatible with the Ion Torrent PGM and has a run time of:

3.0 hours for 200 bp reads with an output of 30-50 Mb,
4.9 hours for 400 bp reads with an output of 60 Mb-1 Gb.
OBI:0001971.label: Ion 316 Chip v2

OBI:0001693.definition: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a tolerance induction intervention experiment.
OBI:0001693.label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific tolerance induction

OBI:0001692.definition: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on reduction of fertility.
OBI:0001692.label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from fertility

OBI:0001691.definition: is an objective specification which aims to discover cellular structure properties
OBI:0001691.label: cellular structure feature identification objective

OBI:0001690.definition: is an objective specification which aims to discover molecular function realized by a molecular entity
OBI:0001690.label: molecular function identification objective

OBI:0001697.definition: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that detects a decrease in disease.
OBI:0001697.label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific treatment of disease

OBI:0001696.definition: A B cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on survival.
OBI:0001696.label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection based on survival

OBI:0001695.definition: A B cell epitope specific activation of additional immune response in vitro assay that detects agglutination.
OBI:0001695.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific immune complex formation

OBI:0001694.definition: An efficacy of B cell epitope intervention experiment that detects a hypersensitivity response by monitoring skin reactions.
OBI:0001694.label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific induction of hypersensitivity

OBI:0000588.definition: The determination of sulfur or phosphorus containing compounds is the job of the flame photometric detector (FPD). This device uses the chemiluminescent reactions of these compounds in a hydrogen/air flame as a source of analytical information that is relatively specific for substances containing these two kinds of atoms. The emitting species for sulfur compounds is excited S2. The lambda max for emission of excited S2 is approximately 394 nm. The emitter for phosphorus compounds in the flame is excited HPO (lambda max = doublet 510-526 nm). In order to selectively detect one or the other family of compounds as it elutes from the GC column, an interference filter is used between the flame and the photomultiplier tube (PMT) to isolate the appropriate emission band. The drawback here being that the filter must be exchanged between chromatographic runs if the other family of compounds is to be detected.
OBI:0000588.label: flame photometric detector

OBI:0000589.definition: Better flow rates can be achieved by using a pump or by using compressed gas (e.g. air, nitrogen, or argon) to push the solvent through the column (flash column chromatography).
OBI:0000589.label: chromatography pump system

OBI:0000584.definition: An anion exchange column is a chromatography column that is used in anion exchange chromatography and which enables the separation of anion mixtures.
OBI:0000584.label: anion exchange column

OBI:0000586.definition: A plunger column is a chromatography column with adjustable heigth control. By means of an adjustable endpiece (plunger) the user can adjust the column length without disturbing the packed bed. Plunger columns can equalize volume changes and thus avoids dead volumes within the column.
OBI:0000586.label: plunger column

OBI:0000580.definition: A spectrometer suitable for metabolomics and in vivo NMR studies but structural analysis of small molecules and low molecular weight proteins can also be performed. To accomplish these studies there are six probe-heads available. A successor, the AVANCE III came out recently.
OBI:0000580.label: AVANCE II spectrometer

OBI:0000581.definition: A column connector that connects one column on one side with two columns at the other side, hence building a Y shaped structure.
OBI:0000581.label: y-column connector

OBI:0000582.definition: Includes the connection to a high-resolution TOF-LC-MS system.
OBI:0000582.label: Bruker LC-NMR/MS platform

OBI:0000583.definition: For analyzing non-UV absorbing substances, such as carbohydrates, lipids and polymers. This is also the detector of choice for gel permeation chromatography. The refractive index detector is one of the least sensitive LC detectors. It is very sensitive to changes in ambient temperature, pressure changes, flow-rate changes and can not be used for gradient elution. Despite these many disadvantages, this detector is extremely useful for detecting those compounds that are nonionic, do not adsorb in the UV, and do not fluoresce. There are many optical systems used in refractive index detectors but one of the most common is the differential refractive index detector.
OBI:0000583.label: refractive index detector

OBI:0000618.definition: A size exclusion column is a chromatography column as used in size exclusion chromatography and which enables the separation of mixtures according to differrences in molecular size.
OBI:0000618.label: size exclusion column

OBI:0000619.definition: An adjustable restriction that is placed in the waste outlet to allow the necessary pressure to develop at the column inlet to force a flow (q ml/min) through the column. If the flow of mobile phase is Q ml/min then the waste flow will be (Q-q) ml/min. by adjusting the waste flow, the proportion of the sample entering the capillary column can be varied over a wide range of values and the necessary minimum permissible volume for the particular column in use can be selected for analysis. Unfortunately, the fraction taken in this way may not be representative of the original sample. This is due to the individual solutes in the mixture having different diffusivities and, thus, they distribute themselves across the sampling tube in an irregular manner. In general, the components with higher diffusivities (e.g., those solutes of lower molecular weight) will diffuse away from the bulk sample more quickly than those having lower diffusivities.
OBI:0000619.label: chromatography splitter

OBI:0000614.definition: Guard columns are installed between the injection valve and the analytical or preparative column and here will remove contaminants and prolong the lifetime of the columns.
OBI:0000614.label: guard column
