OBI:0000615.definition: An assay that determines protein expression and translation activity using protein extracts collected from a material entity.
OBI:0000615.label: protein expression profiling assay

OBI:0000616.synonyms: High Resolution Probes with Automatic Tuning and Matching;HR_probe_with_ATM
OBI:0000616.definition: The Automatic Tuning and Matching (ATM) option for AVANCE spectrometers is available for double resonance probes in fixed-frequency and broadband tunable configurations with either direct or indirect detection. Thus, for multinuclear operation, as often required for applications in inorganic chemistry, ATM facilitates the accurate setting of 90 degree pulse widths on both observe and decoupling channels for each chosen nucleus and each individual sample - even with full automation. Triple resonance probes in fixed-frequency configurations, as typically used for inverse detection with high-field systems.
OBI:0000616.label: high resolution probe with automatic tuning and matching

OBI:0000617.definition: A gas chromatographic detection system based on the low pressure, gas phase chemiluminescence of the reaction mixture of molecular fluorine with organo-sulfur, -selenium, and -tellurium compounds separated from (gas phase) headspace samples. This detector was originally developed in the research group of John Birks at the University of Colorado, USA and was manufactured and sold by Sievers Instruments (Boulder Colorado, USA). This system can be divided up into three parts: the chromatograph, transfer line, and reaction cell; PMT and photon counting electronics; and the molecular fluorine generator.
OBI:0000617.label: fluorine-induced chemiluminescence detector

OBI:0000610.definition: A gas chromatography device that can auto-inject a small number of samples an inlet.
OBI:0000610.label: auto injector

OBI:0000611.definition: An NMR instrument that is manufactured by Varian.
OBI:0000611.label: Varian NMR instrument

OBI:0000612.synonyms: Bruker Multiple Adjustable Tube Clamp Holder
OBI:0000612.definition: The Bruker Multiple Adjustable Tube Clamp Holder MATCH system is a holder for 100 mm long NMR sample tubes with diameters ranging from micro tubes up to 5 mm NMR tubes. The MATCH insert fits into a standard 10 mm Bruker spinner and is suitable for all non-spinning applications.\n   The MATCH system provides an easy and cost efficient means of optimizing the signal-to-noise ratio of each sample. By matching the NMR tube diameter to the size of the sample, most of the sample can be placed in the active column of the NMR coil. This leads to an enhanced signal detection compared to diluting the same sample quantity in a larger tube.
OBI:0000612.label: Bruker MATCH tube holder system

OBI:0000613.definition: A Solid Phase Extraction (SPE) system provides an interface between liquid chromatography (LC) and NMR. For the process of LC-SPE  NMR a chromatographic separation is done and the peaks of interest are trapped on an individual SPE cartridge after the column. The peak selection is done either by UV detection or by evaluation of the on-line registered MS or MSn spectra.
OBI:0000613.label: Bruker SPE-NMR platform

OBI:0500019.definition: A study design that investigates variance and error estimates in the experimental system, and is where the same extract is compared.
OBI:0500019.label: self vs self design

OBI:0500018.definition: A replicate experimental design type is where a series of replicates are performed to evaluate reproducibility or as a pilot study to determine the appropriate number of replicates for a subsequent experiments.
OBI:0500018.label: replicate design

OBI:0500015.definition: a factorial design which has 2 experimental factors (aka independent variables) and 2 factor levels per experimental factors
OBI:0500015.label: 2x2 factorial design

OBI:0500014.definition: factorial design is_a study design which is used to evaluate two or more factors simultaneously. The treatments are combinations of levels of the factors. The advantages of factorial designs over one-factor-at-a-time experiments is that they are more efficient and they allow interactions to be detected. In statistics, a factorial design experiment is an experiment whose design consists of two or more factors, each with discrete possible values or levels, and whose experimental units take on all possible combinations of these levels across all such factors. Such an experiment allows studying the effect of each factor on the response variable, as well as the effects of interactions between factors on the response variable.
OBI:0500014.label: factorial design

OBI:0500017.definition: An experiment design type where the label orientations are reversed. exact synonym: flip dye, dye flip
OBI:0500017.label: dye swap design

OBI:0500016.definition: A fractional factorial design is_a study design in which only an adequately chosen fraction of the treatment combinations required for the complete factorial experiment is selected to be run
OBI:0500016.label: fractional factorial design

OBI:0500011.definition: Latin square design is_a study design which allows in its simpler form controlling 2 levels of nuisance variables (also known as blocking variables).he 2 nuisance factors are divided into a tabular grid with the property that each row and each column receive each treatment exactly once.
OBI:0500011.label: latin square design

OBI:0500010.definition: A reference experiment design type is where all samples are compared to a common reference.
OBI:0500010.label: reference design

OBI:0500012.definition: Greco-Latin square design is a study design which relates to Latin square design
OBI:0500012.label: graeco latin square design

OBI:0000034.definition: supernatant role is a role which inheres in a material entity and is realized by a material separation process using gravitational force in which the material bearing the supernatant role is the liquid component of the output material.
OBI:0000034.label: supernatant role

UO:0000005.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the average kinetic energy of the particles in a sample of matter.
UO:0000005.label: temperature unit

UO:0000006.definition: A unit which is a standardised quantity of an element or compound with uniform composition.
UO:0000006.label: substance unit

OBI:0001529.definition: A service in which a service consumer provides some input data and a service provider transforms, models, or interprets the input data and returns this generated data as output.
OBI:0001529.label: data analysis service

UO:0000001.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the distance between two points.
UO:0000001.label: length unit

PR:000023089.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the Escherichia coli K-12 ligA gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.
PR:000023089.label: DNA ligase

UO:0000003.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the dimension in which events occur in sequence.
UO:0000003.label: time unit

OBI:0302914.definition: Digital curation is the process of establishing and developing long term repositories of digital assets for current and future reference by researchers, scientists, and historians, and scholars generally.
OBI:0302914.label: digital curation

OBI:0001524.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding equilibrium association constant (KA) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect direct binding.
OBI:0001524.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring equilibrium association constant [KA] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001527.definition: A service  in which the service provider assists the consumer in activities directly or indirectly associated with the production and analysis of experimental research data.
OBI:0001527.label: support service

OBI:0001526.definition: A process of interleukin-17A production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001526.label: epitope specific interleukin-17A production by T cells

OBI:0302910.definition: a process by which an  event or an entity is described before it actually happens or is being discovered and identified.
OBI:0302910.label: prediction

OBI:0302911.definition: a planned process with objective to check that the accuracy or the quality of a claim or prediction  satisfies some criteria and which is assessed by comparing with independent results
OBI:0302911.label: validation

OBI:0001523.definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17F production assay that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001523.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17F production by T cells

OBI:0001522.definition: An algorithm used to assemble individual sequence reads into larger contiguous sequences (contigs).  Assembly details include but are not limited to assembler type (overlap-layout-consensus, deBruijn), assembler version, and any relevant quality control information such as per cent known genes/ESTs captured.
OBI:0001522.label: sequence assembly algorithm

PR:000003745.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the human ADAR gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.
PR:000003745.label: double-stranded RNA-specific adenosine deaminase

GO:0005575.definition: A location, relative to cellular compartments and structures, occupied by a macromolecular machine when it carries out a molecular function. There are two ways in which the gene ontology describes locations of gene products: (1) relative to cellular structures (e.g., cytoplasmic side of plasma membrane) or compartments (e.g., mitochondrion), and (2) the stable macromolecular complexes of which they are parts (e.g., the ribosome).
GO:0005575.label: cellular_component

OBI:0000923.definition: A binding assay that uses the detection of electromagnetic waves in a surface to detect material entities adsorbed to the surface, which change the local optical index of refraction.
OBI:0000923.label: surface plasmon resonance binding assay

OBI:0000920.definition: An analyte assay in which a series of beads coated with antibodies specific for different analytes and marked with discrete fluorescent labels are used to simultaneously capture and quantitate soluble analytes.
OBI:0000920.label: cytometric bead array assay

OBI:0000921.definition: a labeled specimen that is the output of a labeling process and has grain labeled RNA to be able to detect RNA in future experiments.
OBI:0000921.label: labeled RNA extract

OBI:0200003.definition: A logit-log curve fitting is a curve fitting where first the limits y_0 an y_infty of y when x->0 and x->infinity, respectively, are estimated from the input data points (x_1, y_1), (x_2,y_2), ..., (x_n, y_n). Then a curve with equation log((y-y_0)/(y_infty-y))=a+b log(x) is obtained, where a and b are determined to optimize its fit to the input data points.
OBI:0200003.label: logit-log curve fitting

OBI:0000924.definition: A specimen  that has been modified in order to be able to detect it in future experiments
OBI:0000924.label: labeled specimen

OBI:0200000.definition: A planned process that produces output data from input data.
OBI:0200000.label: data transformation

OBI:0000811.definition: a quality of a DNA molecule that inheres in its bearer due to the order of its DNA nucleotide residues.
OBI:0000811.label: primary structure of DNA macromolecule

OBI:0000928.definition: A material separation function is a function that decreases the resolution between two or more material entities.
OBI:0000928.label: material combination function

OBI:0000929.definition: a service provider role which is realized by a servicer provider organization performing some training
OBI:0000929.label: obsolete_training service provider role

OBI:0200034.definition: Jacknifing is a re-sampling data transformation process used to estimate the precision of sampling statistics and is a resampling method
OBI:0200034.label: jackknifing method

OBI:0200008.definition: A hyperlog transformation ia a data transformation that, for each (one dimensional) real number input x, outputs an approximation (found, e.g. with the Newton's method) to a solution y of the equation EH(y)-x=0, where EH denotes an eh transformation.
OBI:0200008.label: hyperlog transformation

OBI:0000972.definition: a processed material created to have a function and which requires electrical power to execute
OBI:0000972.label: obsolete_electrically powered device

OBI:1110002.definition: An occurrence of disease is a process involving pathologic changes within an organism
OBI:1110002.label: obsolete_occurrence of disease

OBI:0000975.definition: A binding assay which uses a flow cytometer to detect pairs of cells that are bound to each other by staining them with different fluorescent labels.
OBI:0000975.label: cell-cell binding detection by flow cytometry assay

GO:0007596.definition: The sequential process in which the multiple coagulation factors of the blood interact, ultimately resulting in the formation of an insoluble fibrin clot; it may be divided into three stages: stage 1, the formation of intrinsic and extrinsic prothrombin converting principle; stage 2, the formation of thrombin; stage 3, the formation of stable fibrin polymers.
GO:0007596.label: blood coagulation

IAO:0000030.definition: A generically dependent continuant that is about some thing.
IAO:0000030.label: information content entity

OBI:0002562.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more countries of residence which, if met, makes a human being suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002562.label: country of residence inclusion criteria

OBI:0200030.definition: A median centering is a data transformation that takes as input an n-dimensional (real) vector, performs a median calculation on its components, and subtracts the resulting median from each component of the input.
OBI:0200030.label: median centering

GO:0001508.definition: A process in which membrane potential cycles through a depolarizing spike, triggered in response to depolarization above some threshold, followed by repolarization. This cycle is driven by the flow of ions through various voltage gated channels with different thresholds and ion specificities.
GO:0001508.label: action potential

OBI:0001489.definition: A mass spectrometry of MHC ligands assay that identifies eluted ligands from cell bound MHC.
OBI:0001489.label: mass spectrometry assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation of MHC ligands eluted from cellular MHC

OBI:0000976.definition: A datum used to record the answer to a self assessment of whether a person uses their left hand, right hand primarily or each hand equally
OBI:0000976.label: handedness categorical measurement datum

OBI:0302838.definition: an information content entity which results from a validation process aimed at confirming a claim, a finding or a predicted information entity about a material entity or a process by experimental means.
OBI:0302838.label: validated information

OBI:0200137.definition: A network analysis in which an input data set describing node objects and edge relationships between node objects is used to determine the output quality of a subgraph partition of the network.
OBI:0200137.label: network subgraph quality calculation

VO:0000001.definition: A vaccine is a processed material with the function that when administered, it prevents or ameliorates a disorder in a target organism by inducing or modifying adaptive immune responses specific to the antigens in the vaccine.
VO:0000001.label: vaccine

OBI:0200136.definition: An edge quality calculation in which the input is a data sets of shortest paths between all pairs of node in the network and the output is the sum of all shortest paths that traverse the specific edge.
OBI:0200136.label: edge betweenness calculation

GO:0002367.definition: The appearance of a cytokine due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus contributing to an immune response, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0002367.label: cytokine production involved in immune response

OBI:0200134.definition: A node quality calculation in which a path describing the shortest path needed to transverse through connected nodes and edges to arrive at a specific target node in the network.
OBI:0200134.label: node shortest path identification

OBI:0200133.definition: A node quality calculation in which an input data set describing object nodes and directional relationship edges between object nodes is used to enumerate the number of unique relationships pointing out of an individual object node.
OBI:0200133.label: node out-degree calculation

OBI:0200132.definition: A node quality calculation in which an input data set describing object nodes and directional relationship edges between object nodes is used to enumerate the number of unique relationships pointing into an individual object node.
OBI:0200132.label: node in-degree calculation

UBERON:0001988.definition: Portion of semisolid bodily waste discharged through the anus[MW,modified]
UBERON:0001988.label: feces

UBERON:0001987.definition: organ of metabolic interchange between fetus and mother, partly of embryonic origin and partly of maternal origin[GO]. The fetal portion of the placenta is known as the villous chorion. The maternal portion is known as the decidua basalis. The two portions are held together by anchoring villi that are anchored to the decidua basalis by the cytotrophoblastic shell.
UBERON:0001987.label: placenta

OBI:0200130.definition: A node quality calculation in which an input data set describing object nodes and relationship edges between object nodes is used to enumerate the number of unique relationships of an individual object node.
OBI:0200130.label: node degree calculation

CLO:0000018.definition: A cell line cell that is capable of replicating a limited number of times in culture before undergoing senescence.
CLO:0000018.label: mortal cell line cell

CLO:0000019.definition: A cell line cell that is expected to be capable of an unlimited number of divisions, and is thus able to support indefinite propagation in vitro as part of an immortal cell line.
CLO:0000019.label: immortal cell line cell

NCBITaxon:10116.synonyms: Rattus sp. strain Wistar;rat;Norway rat;rats;brown rat
NCBITaxon:10116.label: Rattus norvegicus

CHEBI:33697.definition: High molecular weight, linear polymers, composed of nucleotides containing ribose and linked by phosphodiester bonds; RNA is central to the synthesis of proteins.
CHEBI:33697.label: ribonucleic acid

CHEBI:33696.definition: A macromolecule made up of nucleotide units and hydrolysable into certain pyrimidine or purine bases (usually adenine, cytosine, guanine, thymine, uracil), D-ribose or 2-deoxy-D-ribose and phosphoric acid.
CHEBI:33696.label: nucleic acid

OBI:0300311.definition: observation design is a study design in which subjects are monitored in the absence of any active intervention by experimentalists.
OBI:0300311.label: observation design

OBI:0001659.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a flow cytometry assay.
OBI:0001659.label: flow cytometry assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0000712.definition: A pathogen challenge is the administration of a live pathogenic organism to a host
OBI:0000712.label: pathogen challenge

OBI:0001284.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-12 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001284.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-12 production by T cells

IAO:0000024.definition: a unit of measure is the quality of some material entity compared to which another quality is some multiple of.
IAO:0000024.label: obsolete_unit of measure

SO:0000148.definition: One or more contigs that have been ordered and oriented using end-read information. Contains gaps that are filled with N's.
SO:0000148.label: supercontig

BFO:0000004.definition: A continuant that is a bearer of quality and realizable entity entities, in which other entities inhere and which itself cannot inhere in anything.
BFO:0000004.label: independent continuant

CHEBI:24636.definition: Nuclear particle of charge number +1, spin 1/2 and rest mass of 1.007276470(12) u.
CHEBI:24636.label: proton

BFO:0000002.definition: An entity that exists in full at any time in which it exists at all, persists through time while maintaining its identity and has no temporal parts.
BFO:0000002.label: continuant

BFO:0000003.definition: An entity that has temporal parts and that happens, unfolds or develops through time.
BFO:0000003.label: occurrent

OBI:0001930.definition: A value specification that is specifies one category out of a fixed number of nominal categories
OBI:0001930.label: categorical value specification

OBI:0002446.definition: A study design in which proteins in a sample are detected, quantified or otherwise analysed.
OBI:0002446.label: proteomic profiling design

OBI:0002022.definition: A DNA sequencer which is manufactured by the Illumina corporation, with a single flow cell and a throughput of up to 35 Gb per day. It supports sequencing of single, long or short insert paired end clone libraries relying on sequencing by synthesis technology.
OBI:0002022.label: Illumina HiSeq 1000

UBERON:0000362.definition: the inner portion of the kidney consisting of the renal pyramids
UBERON:0000362.label: renal medulla

OBI:0001286.definition: A study design in which experiment double stranded RNA is synthesized with a sequence complementary to a gene(s) of interest and introduced into a cell or organism, where it is recognized as exogenous genetic material and activates the RNAi pathway resulting in knockdown of the transcripts and providing a means to study downstream changes in gene expression.
OBI:0001286.label: RNAi profiling by array design

OBI:0200082.definition: Longitudinal analysis is a data transformation used to perform repeated observations of the same items over long periods of time.
OBI:0200082.label: longitudinal data analysis

OBI:0002097.definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the dissociation constant KD.
OBI:0002097.label: assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

GO:0002524.definition: An inflammatory response to an exogenous environmental antigen or an endogenous antigen initiated by the adaptive immune system.
GO:0002524.label: hypersensitivity

OBI:0002368.definition: A clinical history in which there is a diagnosis of cancer.
OBI:0002368.label: clinical history of cancer

OBI:1110126.definition: A MHC ligand assay that detects the binding of a ligand to an MHC molecule.
OBI:1110126.label: assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0000376.definition: A synthesizing function is a function to assemble new output materials from distinct input materials.  The output materials typically consist of chemically distinct monomeric objects or object aggregate polymers.
OBI:0000376.label: synthesizing function

OBI:0002363.definition: A performance status value specification designed for classifying patients 16 years of age or older by their functional impairment.
OBI:0002363.label: Karnofsky score vaue specification

PATO:0002243.definition: A physical quality inhering in a fluid (liquid or gas) by virtue of the amount of fluid which passes through a given surface per unit time.
PATO:0002243.label: fluid flow rate

OBI:1110037.definition: An immune epitope assay that detects T cell epitope recognition.
OBI:1110037.label: assay measuring binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

OBI:0100062.definition: A secondary cultured cell population that represents a genetically stable and homogenous population of cultured cells that shares a common propagation history (ie has been successively passaged together in culture).
OBI:0100062.label: obsolete_cell line

OBI:0002410.definition: An information content entity that indicates the state of a female's cessation of menstruation.
OBI:0002410.label: menopausal status

OBI:0002143.definition: An RNA-seq assay to identify transcription start sites and active enhancer elements through isolation of bromouridine (Bru) labelled RNAs after UV light exposure introduces transcription-blocking lesions.
OBI:0002143.label: bromouride labeling and sequencing after UV exposure

OBI:0002140.definition: An assay to determine the temperature of an evaluant.
OBI:0002140.label: temperature measurement assay

OBI:0002141.definition: An assay to determine the volume of an evaluant.
OBI:0002141.label: volume measurement assay

OBI:0002146.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) antigens.
OBI:0002146.label: HIV antibody assay

OBI:0002415.definition: A information content entity that indicates the exposure of an individual to carcinogens in the workplace or environment.
OBI:0002415.label: exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history

OBI:0002144.definition: An assay which aims at identifying the endogenous population of extrachromosomal circular DNA originating from a subset of genomic loci and potentially having profound consequences on the regulatory and coding capabilities of these regions. The assay includes creation of a library out of the circular DNA molecules and subsequent sequencing using parallelized sequencing methods.
OBI:0002144.label: extrachromosomal circular DNA sequencing assay

OBI:0002145.definition: An analyte assay that measures the presence or amount of antibodies to a specified antigen._
OBI:0002145.label: antigen specific antibodies assay_

OBI:0002418.definition: An exposure to environmental and workplace carcinogens history where the carcinogen is diesel exhaust.
OBI:0002418.label: exposure to diesel exhaust history

BFO:0000020.definition: A continuant that inheres in or is borne by other entities. Every instance of A requires some specific instance of B which must always be the same.
BFO:0000020.label: specifically dependent continuant

OBI:0400043.definition: Aparatus in the fluidic subsystem where the sheath and sample meet. Can be one of several types; jet-in-air, quartz cuvette, or a hybrid of the two. The sample flows through the center of a fluid column of sheath fluid in the flow cell.
OBI:0400043.label: flow cell

OBI:0002149.definition: An antigen specific antibodies assay that is meant to detect antibodies that bind to hepatitis B virus (HBV) core antigens.
OBI:0002149.label: core HBV antibody assay

OBI:0400045.definition: Part of the fluidic subsystem. The fluid pressure regulator maintains constant pressure within the sheath and or sample lines by filling the lines with enough gas to push the fluid at the desired rate. The gas is usually air, and less frequently nitrogen. In the sheath line, the gas is pushed into the sheath tank. In the sample line the gas is pushed into the collection tube. Fluid pressure regulators maintain great enough pressure to push sample fluid out of the tube and sheath fluid out of the sheath tank.
OBI:0400045.label: fluid pressure regulator

OBI:0400044.definition: A flow_cytometer is an instrument for counting, examining and sorting microscopic particles in suspension. It allows simultaneous multiparametric analysis of the physical and/or chemical characteristics of single cells flowing through an optical and/or electronic detection apparatus. A flow cytometer is an instrument that can be used to quantitatively measure the properties of individual cells in a flowing medium.
OBI:0400044.label: flow cytometer

OBI:0200191.definition: Adata visualization which has input of a gene list and produces an output of a report graph which is capable of rendering data of this type.
OBI:0200191.label: gene list visualization

OBI:0002443.definition: A footprinting assay that determines protein-binding sites on DNA by partial cleavage of ligand-protected DNA restriction fragments with methidium-propyl-EDTA (MPE). MPE-Fe(II) in the presence of oxygen efficiently catalyzes the non-specific clevage of DNA.
OBI:0002443.label: methidiumpropyl-EDTA-iron(II) footprinting assay

CHEBI:33359.definition: A cobalt group element atom that has formula Rh.
CHEBI:33359.label: rhodium atom

PR:000003252.definition: A serpin that is a translation product of the human SERPINC1 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.
PR:000003252.label: antithrombin-III

GO:0019815.definition: An immunoglobulin complex that is present in the plasma membrane of B cells and that in its canonical form is composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains and two identical immunoglobulin light chains and a signaling subunit, a heterodimer of the Ig-alpha and Ig-beta proteins.
GO:0019815.label: B cell receptor complex

GO:0019814.definition: A protein complex that in its canonical form is composed of two identical immunoglobulin heavy chains and two identical immunoglobulin light chains, held together by disulfide bonds and sometimes complexed with additional proteins. An immunoglobulin complex may be embedded in the plasma membrane or present in the extracellular space, in mucosal areas or other tissues, or circulating in the blood or lymph.
GO:0019814.label: immunoglobulin complex

PR:000025475.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the Ustilago sphaerogena RNU2 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.
PR:000025475.label: ribonuclease U2

OBI:1110059.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:1110059.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells

OBI:0002098.definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the on rate.
OBI:0002098.label: assay measuring the on rate [kon] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

OBI:0002099.definition: A T cell epitope binding constant determination assay that measures the off rate.
OBI:0002099.label: assay measuring the off rate [koff] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

OBI:0002094.definition: A bisulfite sequencing assay in which a whole-genome sequencing library is prepared, bisulfite converted and amplified, followed by a capture enriching for targeted bisulfite-converted DNA fragments that are are subsequently identified by DNA sequencing.
OBI:0002094.label: MethylC-Capture sequencing assay

OBI:0002095.definition: A material processing that has as its input a specimen and as its output a collection of specimens.
OBI:0002095.label: specimen family creation

OBI:0002096.definition: A T cell epitope specific proliferation assay performed on cells in vitro that uses a CFSE assay.
OBI:0002096.label: carboxyfluorescein succinimidyl ester staining assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells

CHEBI:37333.definition: A non-ionic gadolinium chelate having a macrocyclic triamine framework. It is used as a paramagnetic contrast agent in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
CHEBI:37333.label: gadodiamide

OBI:0002090.definition: A reverse transcribed polymerase chain reaction that is used to amplify a mRNA sequence between a defined internal site and the 5' or 3' end of the mRNA.
OBI:0002090.label: rapid amplification of cDNA ends

OBI:0600064.definition: a planned process with the objective to insert genetic material into a cloning vector for future replication of the inserted material
OBI:0600064.label: recombinant vector cloning

OBI:1110057.definition: a process of an MHC molecule binding to an entity playing the role of epitope to create an MHC:epitope complex which is then bound by a TCR molecule.
OBI:1110057.label: MHC:epitope complex binding to TCR

OBI:1110056.definition: A biological process where T cells produce IL-2 resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:1110056.label: epitope specific IL-2 release by T cells

OBI:0000379.definition: A mechanical function is a function that is realised via mechanical work (through an certain amount of energy transferred by some force).
OBI:0000379.label: mechanical function

OBI:0002564.definition: A histological assay that is intended to check for the presence or level of a specific disease.
OBI:0002564.label: histopathology assay

GO:0044809.definition: The appearance of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 (CCL17) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0044809.label: chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production

OBI:0400034.definition: A dye laser is a laser in which the lasing medium is a fluorescent dye, usually dissolved in an organic solvent such as ethanol or ethylene glycol. The particular dye used determines the wavelengths the laser can emit. The laser medium is places between two parallel mirrors for light emission amplification.
OBI:0400034.label: dye laser

OBI:0002561.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more sexes which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002561.label: sex inclusion criterion

OBI:0001931.definition: A value specification that consists of two parts: a numeral and a unit label
OBI:0001931.label: scalar value specification

OBI:0002563.definition: An inclusion criteria that defines and states one or more ethnicities which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002563.label: ethnicity inclusion criterion

OBI:0001060.definition: A robotic device that is used to excise spots from gels.
OBI:0001060.label: spot cutter

OBI:0001061.definition: A device that is used to apply microwave irradiation to chemical reactions.
OBI:0001061.label: microwave synthesis system

OBI:0001062.definition: A device that measures the degree of darkness (the optical density) of a photographic or semitransparent material or of a reflecting surface.
OBI:0001062.label: densitometer

OBI:0001063.definition: A device that is used to automatically stain tissue sections on slides or tissue specimens.
OBI:0001063.label: automatic staining machine

OBI:0001064.definition: A device for processing histological tissue having a tissue carrier basket suspended from a turntable overlying a plurality of beakers suspended from a carrier plate. The turntable is raised, indexed, and lowered by a suitable driving mechanism to move the tissue basket sequentially through the beakers. Timers can each be programmed to control the movement of the turntable to provide various different cycles for processing the tissue. Some of the beakers are received in individual thermal baths to heat and control the temperature of the substances received in the beakers for treating the tissue.
OBI:0001064.label: automatic tissue processor

OBI:0001065.definition: An optical microscope that uses two separate optical paths with two objectives and two eyepieces to provide slightly different viewing angles to the left and right eyes.
OBI:0001065.label: stereo microscope

OBI:0001066.definition: A balance that consists of a metal plate on which to place an object and a digital readout of the measurement of its mass.
OBI:0001066.label: top loading balance

OBI:0001067.definition: A device or system in which perfusion units are integrated.
OBI:0001067.label: perfusion station

OBI:0001068.definition: A nuclear medicine tomographic imaging device that uses gamma rays to provide 3D information, typically presented as cross-sectional slices through the specimen but with the ability to be freely reformatted or manipulated as required.
OBI:0001068.label: SPECT scanner

OBI:0001069.definition: a manufacturer role which is played by the person or organization that manufactured the array
OBI:0001069.label: array manufacturer role

OBI:0002093.definition: A 5' rapid amplification pf cDNA ends that uses RNA ligase to add an RNA adapter oligonucleotide to intact 5' mRNA ends, allowing the amplification of cDNA only from full-length, capped mRNA.
OBI:0002093.label: 5' RNA ligase mediated rapid amplification of cDNA ends

IAO:0000442.definition: A role inhering in a person or organization that is realized when the bearer participates in the work which is the basis of the document, in the writing of the document, and signs it with their name.
IAO:0000442.label: author role

IAO:0000443.definition: a planned process in which journal articles are read or processed and data items are extracted, typically for further analysis or indexing
IAO:0000443.label: data item extraction from journal article

OBI:0001998.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses an immunohistochemistry assay.
OBI:0001998.label: immunohistochemistry assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001999.definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that uses a 3D structure determination of bound complex assay.
OBI:0001999.label: 3D structure determining assay of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

OBI:0001994.definition: A MHC binding constant determination assay measuring binding on rate (kon).
OBI:0001994.label: assay measuring the MHC ligand binding on rate [kon] of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0001995.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium association constant (KA) determination assay that uses an analytical chromatography assay.
OBI:0001995.label: chromatography assay measuring the association constant [KA] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001996.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses an analytical chromatography assay.
OBI:0001996.label: chromatography assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001997.definition: A footprinting assay that uses hydrogen/deuterium exchange to measure B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody.
OBI:0001997.label: hydrogen/deuterium exchange assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001990.definition: A MHC binding constant determination assay measuring half life of binding.
OBI:0001990.label: assay measuring the half life of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0001991.definition: A MHC binding constant determination assay measuring half maximal effective concentration (EC50).
OBI:0001991.label: assay measuring the half maximal effective concentration [EC50] of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0001992.definition: A MHC binding constant determination assay measuring half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50).
OBI:0001992.label: assay measuring the half maximal inhibitory concentration [IC50] of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0001993.definition: A MHC binding constant determination assay measuring binding off rate measurement data item (koff).
OBI:0001993.label: assay measuring the off rate measurement [koff] of a MHC:ligand complex

UBERON:0000105.definition: A spatiotemporal region encompassing some part of the life cycle of an organism.
UBERON:0000105.label: life cycle stage

CHEBI:25078.definition: A low-molecular-mass compound present in bioluminescent organisms that emits light when oxidized in presence of enzyme luciferase.
CHEBI:25078.label: luciferin

OBI:1110129.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects cytokine production.
OBI:1110129.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific cytokine production by T cells

OBI:1110128.definition: An assay that detects the binding of an epitope to an adaptive immune receptor or a immune response process resulting from such a binding event
OBI:1110128.label: immune epitope assay

OBI:1110125.definition: A MHC ligand assay that determines what ligands are processed and loaded onto MHC molecules by eluting ligands and identifying them.
OBI:1110125.label: assay measuring MHC ligand processing and presentation

OBI:1110124.definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that qualitatively detects MHC:epitope complex binding to TCR.
OBI:1110124.label: assay measuring qualitiative binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

OBI:1110127.definition: An immune epitope assay that detects B cell epitope recognition.
OBI:1110127.label: assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0001227.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001227.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-6 production by T cells

OBI:1110120.definition: Any molecule recognized by the adaptive immune receptors? Recognized means bound with a certain affinity? From GO ag binding:Interacting selectively with an antigen, any substance which is capable of inducing a specific immune response and of reacting with the products of that response, the specific antibody or specifically sensitized T-lymphocytes, or both. Binding may counteract the biological activity of the antigen. see OBI_1110120 below
OBI:1110120.label: assay antigen role

OBI:0001704.definition: A B cell epitope dependent biological activity determination assay that detects secondary in vitro activity.
OBI:0001704.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific activation of additional immune response in vitro

OBI:1110122.definition: abnormal, harmful processes caused by or associated with a disease
OBI:1110122.label: pathologic process

OBI:0001204.definition: a DNA microarray used to detect polymorphisms in DNA samples
OBI:0001204.label: SNP microarray

OBI:0001205.definition: A study design that compares samples from different cell components.
OBI:0001205.label: cell component comparison design

OBI:0001206.definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001206.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor production by T cells

OBI:0001207.definition: A process of macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001207.label: epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells

OBI:0001200.definition: A study design that classifies an individual or group of individuals on the basis of alleles, haplotypes, SNPs using high througput sequencing techniques.
OBI:0001200.label: genotyping by high throughput sequencing design

OBI:0001201.definition: A process of tolerance induction by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001201.label: epitope specific tolerance induction by T cells

OBI:0001202.definition: A study design in which the innate behavior of the organism is examined, e.g. path finding in bees.
OBI:0001202.label: innate behavior design

OBI:0001203.definition: An assay of epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001203.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells

OBI:0001208.definition: A process of T cell activation resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001208.label: epitope specific T cell activation

OBI:0001209.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-10 production by T cells.
OBI:0001209.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells

OBI:0001194.definition: An assay of epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001194.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific transforming growth factor-beta production by T cells

OBI:0001195.definition: A study design that assesses the operator performance and relation to data consistency and quality.
OBI:0001195.label: operator variation design

OBI:0001196.definition: An assay of epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001196.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells

OBI:0001197.definition: A study design that detects genomic copy number variations using microarray technology.
OBI:0001197.label: comparative genome hybridization by array design

OBI:0001190.definition: An epitope intervention experiment that tests the ability of inducing an epitope immune response to treat an existing disease  in the host.
OBI:0001190.label: epitope treatment experiment

OBI:0001191.definition: Half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50) is a scalar measurement datum that measures the effectiveness of a compound to competitively inhibit a given process, and corresponds to the concentration of the compound at which it reaches half of its maximum inhibitory effect.
OBI:0001191.label: half maximal inhibitory concentration (IC50)

OBI:0001192.definition: An administration in vivo to either actively or passively immunize an organism in order to induce a response against a specific immune epitope
OBI:0001192.label: epitope specific immune intervention

OBI:0001193.definition: A process of cytokine production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001193.label: epitope specific cytokine production by T cells

PATO:0001995.definition: A quality that inheres in an entire organism or part of an organism.
PATO:0001995.label: organismal quality

ENVO:00001998.definition: Soil is an environmental material which is primarily composed of minerals, varying proportions of sand, silt, and clay, organic material such as humus, gases, liquids, and a broad range of resident micro- and macroorganisms.
ENVO:00001998.label: soil

OBI:0001198.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-27 production by T cells.
OBI:0001198.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-27 production by T cells

OBI:0001199.definition: A study design that is conducted entirely in a living organism, e.g. a compound treatment in a mouse model.
OBI:0001199.label: in vivo design

OBI:0000828.definition: An organization formed with a goal to have its members conduct investigations
OBI:0000828.label: research organization

OBI:0000827.definition: A dose of medicine or placebo in the form of a small pellet.
OBI:0000827.label: pill

OBI:0000826.definition: A planned process, part of a study design execution, during which the treatment of subjects is ongoing
OBI:0000826.label: treatment portion of study execution

OBI:0000825.definition: A study subject role which begins to exist when a subject is assigned to be one of those who will receive a placebo, and realized in a study execution in which they receive the placebo
OBI:0000825.label: to be treated with placebo role

OBI:0000824.definition: Recombinant YAC cloning is a  process with the objective to insert genetic material into a yeast artificial chromosome vector for future replication of the inserted material
OBI:0000824.label: recombinant YAC cloning

OBI:0000823.definition: An assay that measures the time between the addition of the thrombin and the clot formation in plasma.
OBI:0000823.label: thrombin time assay

OBI:0000822.definition: A single blind study execution is defined as any study execution in which the subjects are not informed of which study arm they are part of during the portion of the trial when the subjects are being treated
OBI:0000822.label: single blind study execution

OBI:0000821.definition: A pill in the form of a small rounded gelatinous container with medicine inside.
OBI:0000821.label: filled capsule

OBI:0000820.definition: An assay that evaluates blood coagulation by measuring the time required for the appearance of fibrin strands following the mixing blood or plasma with phospholipid platelet substitute (e.g., crude cephalins, soybean phosphatides). It is a test of the intrinsic pathway (factors VIII, IX, XI, and XII) and the common pathway (fibrinogen, prothrombin, factors V and X) of blood coaguation . It is used as a screening test and to monitor heparin therapy.
OBI:0000820.label: activated partial thromboplastin time assay

OBI:0001842.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001842.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells

OBI:0001843.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001843.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes measuring epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells

OBI:0001840.definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17A production assay that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001840.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17A production by T cells

OBI:0001841.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001841.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells

OBI:0001846.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001846.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells

OBI:0001663.definition: A T cell epitope specific granulysin release assay that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001663.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific granulysin release by T cells

OBI:0001844.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-12 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001844.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-12 production by T cells

OBI:0001845.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001845.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells

OBI:0001848.definition: An assay that incorporates chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP)-based enrichment, chromatin proximity ligation, Paired-End Tags, and high-throughput sequencing to determine de novo long-range chromatin interactions genome-wide.
OBI:0001848.label: chromatin interaction analysis by paired-end tag sequencing assay

OBI:0001849.definition: An assay that incorporates Paired-End Tags and sequencing technology to determine structural variants.
OBI:0001849.label: structural analysis by paired-end tag sequencing assay

CL:0000010.definition: A cell in vitro that is or has been maintained or propagated as part of a cell culture.
CL:0000010.label: cultured cell

OBI:0001669.definition: An assay that measures protein-protein interactions by separating target proteins on an SDS-PAGE gel, transfering them to a solid substrate, hybridizing with a protein probe and visualizing bound proteins using a probe-directed antibody. This is a adaptation on the western blot assay.
OBI:0001669.label: far-Western blot assay

OBI:0000134.definition: Hardware_testing_objective is a methodology_testing_objective role describing a study designed to examine the effects of using different hardware, e.g. scanner.
OBI:0000134.label: hardware testing objective

OBI:0000136.definition: a device in which environmental conditions (light, photoperiod, temperature, humidity, etc.) can be controlled
OBI:0000136.label: incubator

OBI:0000131.definition: Molecular_feature_identification_objective is a biological_feature_identification_objective role describing a study designed to examine or characterize molecular features of a biological system, e.g. expression profiling, copy number of molecular components, epigenetic modifications.
OBI:0000131.label: molecular feature identification objective

OMIABIS:0000050.definition: A processed specimen that is the output of a fixation process.
OMIABIS:0000050.label: fixed tissue specimen

OBI:0001449.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-1 beta production by T cells.
OBI:0001449.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-1 beta production by T cells

OBI:0001446.definition: A process of interleukin-15 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001446.label: epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells

OBI:0001447.definition: A process of macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001447.label: epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 gamma production by T cells

OBI:0001332.definition: A DNA methylation profiling assay in which the methylation state of DNA is determined and can be compared between samples using array technology
OBI:0001332.label: DNA methylation profiling by array assay

OBI:0001445.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-2 production by T cells.
OBI:0001445.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-2 production by T cells

OBI:0001334.definition: A process of granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001334.label: epitope specific granulocyte colony stimulating factor production by T cells

OBI:0001335.definition: An assay that analyses the microRNA component of the transcriptome using a microRNA array.
OBI:0001335.label: microRNA profiling by array assay

OBI:0001440.definition: A study design in which all specimens are compared to every other specimen.
OBI:0001440.label: all pairs design

OBI:0200064.definition: A centroid mass spectrum is a data transformation in which many points are used to delineate a mass spectral peak, is converted into mass-centroided data by a data compression algorithm. The centroided mass peak is located at the weighted center of mass of the profile peak. The normalized area of the peak provides the mass intensity data.
OBI:0200064.label: centroid mass spectrum

CL:0000236.definition: A lymphocyte of B lineage with the phenotype CD19-positive, CD20-positive, and capable of B cell mediated immunity.
CL:0000236.label: B cell

OBI:0001689.definition: An assay which uses compound cytochalasin (CHEBI: 23528) to block actin polymerization-dependent cell motility (GO:0070358) and actin filament polymerization (GO:0030041).
OBI:0001689.label: cytochalasin-induced inhibition of actin polymerization assay

CL:0000235.definition: A mononuclear phagocyte present in variety of tissues, typically differentiated from monocytes, capable of phagocytosing a variety of extracellular particulate material, including immune complexes, microorganisms, and dead cells.
CL:0000235.label: macrophage

CL:0000232.definition: A red blood cell. In mammals, mature erythrocytes are biconcave disks containing hemoglobin whose function is to transport oxygen.
CL:0000232.label: erythrocyte

OBI:0200042.definition: A hierarchical clustering is a data transformation which achieves a class discovery objective, which takes as input data item and builds a hierarchy of clusters. The traditional representation of this hierarchy is a tree (visualized by a dendrogram), with the individual input objects at one end (leaves) and a single cluster containing every object at the other (root).
OBI:0200042.label: hierarchical clustering

OBI:0001680.definition: A binding assay that detects interacting proteins for a targeted domain where mammalian guanyl nucleotide exchange factor (GEF) Sos is recruited to the Saccharomyces cerevisiae plasma membrane harboring a temperature-sensitive Ras GEF, Cdc25-2, allowing growth at the nonpermissive temperature using the Sos recruitment system, a kind of yeast 2 hybrid system.
OBI:0001680.label: Sos-recruitment assay

OBI:0001681.definition: An assay that determines protein DNA interactions using a single fusion protein in which the activating domain is linked directly to the binding domain.
OBI:0001681.label: yeast one-hybrid assay

IAO:0000064.definition: A plan specification which describes the inputs and output of mathematical functions as well as workflow of execution for achieving an predefined objective. Algorithms are realized usually by means of implementation as computer programs for execution by automata.
IAO:0000064.label: algorithm

IAO:0000065.definition: A software interpreter is a software application that executes some specified input software.
IAO:0000065.label: software interpreter

OBI:0001684.definition: An assay that uses initial modification of DNA by sodium bisulfite, converting all unmethylated, but not methylated, cytosines to uracil, and subsequent amplification with primers specific for methylated versus unmethylated DNA.
OBI:0001684.label: methylation-specific polymerase chain reaction assay

OBI:0001685.definition: An assay that estimates genome-wide DNA methylation and measures methylation of DNA sequences. AIMS is based on the differential enzymatic digestion of genomic DNA with methylation-sensitive and methylation-insensitive isoschizomers followed by restrained PCR amplification of methylated sequences.
OBI:0001685.label: amplification of intermethylated sites assay

OBI:0001686.definition: An assay that localizes a specific DNA or RNA sequence within a portion or section of tissue using artificially induced nucleic hybridization.
OBI:0001686.label: in-situ hybridization assay

OBI:0001687.definition: A role inhering in a person who represents an institution, organization, or service provider and realized when communication is directed at them about the entity they represent.
OBI:0001687.label: contact representative role

OBI:0200040.definition: Molecular decomposition is the partition of a network into distinct subgraphs for the purpose of identifying functional clusters. The network data is run through any of several existing algorithms designed to partition a network into distinct subgraphs for the purpose of isolating groups of functionally linked biological elements such as proteins.
OBI:0200040.label: modular decomposition

GO:0002390.definition: The synthesis or release of platelet activating factor following a stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0002390.label: platelet activating factor production

OBI:0000621.definition: A custom made column ia a chromatography column which is specifically tailored according to the needs of the separation as requested by a scientist or working group.
OBI:0000621.label: custom made column

OBI:0000620.definition: For medical, biological and material sciences research, avance imaging systems provide optimal object handling and performance with a variety of samples types. Two classes of imaging probes are available: in vivo probes for handling and sustaining live objects such as animals and plants, and conventional imaging probes for materials samples.
OBI:0000620.label: Bruker micro imaging probe

OBI:0000623.definition: An assay that exploits the magnetic properties of certain nuclei (those with a spin) to resonate when placed in particular magnetic field conditions. Instruments recording NMR spectrum and sets of analysis can be used to deduce identity of chemical as well as composition of complex chemical mixtures.
OBI:0000623.label: NMR spectroscopy assay

OBI:0000622.definition: A gel permeation column is a chromatography column which is used in gel permeation chromatography and which employs as the stationary phase a swollen gel made by polymerizing and cross-linking styrene in the presence of a diluent which is a nonsolvent for the styrene polymer. The polymer to be analyzed is introduced at the top of the column and then is elutriated with a solvent. The polymer molecules diffuse through the gel at rates depending on their molecular size.
OBI:0000622.label: gel permeation column

OBI:0000625.definition: The ECX series of NMR spectrometers is designed for any laboratory needing an easy-to-use, reliable, routine NMR system. The ECX NMR series is available from 300 to 500 MHz. The console is designed around a modular, digital NMR electronics chassis controlled by an intelligent acquisition computer. For unprecedented flexibility, the JEOL NMR system offers a Windows XP, Mac OSX or LINUX. Both the workstation and spectrometer may be connected to a standard network, allowing seamless remote operation anywhere in the world.
OBI:0000625.label: JEOL ECX NMR spectrometer

OBI:0000624.definition: Bruker BioSpin introduces the SampleJet, a robot for NMR tube automation. The SampleJet has been consciously designed to meet the growing customer demand for simplicity, versatility and higher throughput in NMR sample tube automation.\n  The SampleJet utilizes the modern-day industry standard for sample arrangements-the 96 well plate array. Therefore, the samples may be handled by standard lab automation devices before or after the NMR measurement.
OBI:0000624.label: Bruker SampleJet system

OBI:0000627.definition: A pump system that pump and mix up to four different solvents in parallel.
OBI:0000627.label: quaternary pump system

OBI:0001920.definition: An assay in which timing of DNA replication is quantified as a function of genome position based on genome-wide sequencing.
OBI:0001920.label: DNA replication timing by sequencing assay

OBI:0000629.definition: Magic angle spinning, nowadays a routine technique for solids NMR, still offers the capability of innovation. The high mechanical performance of MAS probes in conjunction with efficient rf pulse techniques open new exciting fields in solids NMR of biological samples and in the field of quadrupolar nuclei.
OBI:0000629.label: Bruker solid magic angle spinning probe

OBI:0000628.definition: Carbon nanotubes (CNTs) are known to have high thermal and mechanical stability and have the potential to be high-performance separation media that utilize the nanoscale interactions. CNT can be applied in long capillary tubes for the development of gas chromatography columns. A film of CNTs can be deposited by chemical vapor deposition (CVD) to form the stationary phase in the open tubular format. Altering the CVD conditions can vary the thickness and the morphology of the CNT film, which opens the possibility of selectivity tuning. The ability to fabricate long tubes coated with CNTs can be readily employed in other gas- and liquid-phase separations as well.
OBI:0000628.label: carbon nanotube column

OBI:0200044.definition: an agglomerative hierarchical clustering which generates successive clusters based on a distance measure, where the distance between two clusters is calculated as the maximum distance between objects from the first cluster and objects from the second cluster.
OBI:0200044.label: complete linkage hierarchical clustering

OBI:0001295.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-17 production by T cells.
OBI:0001295.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17 production by T cells

OBI:0200199.definition:
Gas chromatography mass spectrometry is a data transformation combining mass spectrometry and  
gas chromatography for the qualitative as well as quantitative  
determinations of compounds.
OBI:0200199.label: gas chromatography mass spectrometry

OBI:0500002.definition: a study design which use the same individuals and exposure them to a set of conditions. The effect of order and practice can be confounding factor in such designs
OBI:0500002.label: repeated measure design

OBI:0500003.definition: a repeated measure design which ensures that experimental units receive, in sequence, the treatment (or the control), and then, after a specified time interval (aka *wash-out periods*), switch to the control (or treatment). In this design, subjects (patients in human context) serve as their own controls, and randomization may be used to determine the ordering which a subject receives the treatment and control
OBI:0500003.label: cross over design

OBI:0500000.definition: A plan specification comprised of protocols (which may specify how and what kinds of data will be gathered) that are executed as part of an investigation and is realized during a study design execution.
OBI:0500000.label: study design

OBI:0000558.definition: The UNITY INOVA is also the easiest spectrometer to use and is also the choice of those interested in using advanced NMR techniques in their own research, but without becoming, or hiring, an NMR expert. A complete set of turnkey operating environments is available for the UNITY INOVA covering the structure and dynamics of biological macromolecules, small molecules, solids, and imaging. These packages put the combined NMR expertise of the entire Varian NMR community at your fingertips.
OBI:0000558.label: Varian UNITY INOVA spectrometer

OBI:0500006.definition: A parallel group design or independent measure design is a study design which uses unique experimental unit each experimental group, in other word no two individuals are shared between experimental groups, hence also known as parallel group design. Subjects of a treatment group receive a unique combination of independent variable values making up a treatment
OBI:0500006.label: parallel group design

OBI:0500007.definition: A randomized complete block design is_a study design which assigns randomly treatments to block. The number of units per block equals the number of treatment so each block receives each treatment exactly once (hence the qualifier 'complete'). The design was originally devised from field trials used in agronomy and agriculture. The analysis assumes that there is no interaction between block and treatment. The method was then used in other settings So The randomised complete block design is a design in which the subjects are matched according to a variable which the experimenter wishes to control. The subjects are put into groups (blocks) of the same size as the number of treatments. The members of each block are then randomly assigned to different treatment groups.
OBI:0500007.label: randomized complete block design

OBI:0500004.definition: N-of-1 design is a cross-over design in which the same patient is repeatedly randomised to receive either the experimental treatment or its control (Senn, 1993).
OBI:0500004.label: n-to-1 design

OBI:0500005.definition: A matched pair design is a study design which use groups of individuals associated (hence matched) to each other based on a set of criteria, one member going to one treatment, the other member receiving the other treatment.
OBI:0500005.label: matched pairs design

OBI:0000553.definition: Capillary LC-NMR is a hyphenated technique coupling capillary liquid chromatography and NMR, which increases sensitivity dramatically through the use of miniaturization of the chromatographic techniques and NMR detection volume. LC-NMR hyphenated systems separate a mixture into its pure components and couple the output to NMR for automatic sample analysis. The ever increasing need to measure lower sample amounts and lower level impurities demands the highest NMR sensitivity. Traditional LC-NMR systems with relatively large peak volumes are not optimized for such low levels of detection. Bruker BioSpin, together with Waters and Protasis has developed a Capillary LC-NMR system. The latest capillary LC attributes and highest capillary flow probe sensitivity combine with state of the art NMR systems technology. Greater mass sensitivity and faster spectral analysis with smaller sample volumes is possible. This system is ideal for analysis of metabolites and impurities associated with the drug development process.
OBI:0000553.label: Bruker Capillary LC-NMR platform

OBI:0001293.definition: A study design in which the pathological condition of a part, organ, or system of an organism is studied. The etiology may be from infection, genetic defect, or environmental stress.
OBI:0001293.label: disease state design

OBI:0000551.definition: The needle assembly attached to the autosampler, comprises the injector needle that feeds a sample or carrier gas into the inlet
OBI:0000551.label: needle assembly

OBI:0000550.definition: A gas generator that generates nitrogen gas.
OBI:0000550.label: nitrogen generator

OBI:0000557.definition: Any pump system used in flash column chromatography to push the solvent through the column. Better flow rates can be achieved by using a pump or by using compressed gas (e.g. air, nitrogen, or argon) to push the solvent through the column (flash column chromatography).
OBI:0000557.label: flash pump system

OBI:0000556.definition: A pump system optimized for isocratic chromatography.
OBI:0000556.label: isocratic pump system

OBI:0000555.definition: An optional part of an NMR instrument used to hold samples prior to NMR analysis and that sequentially loads these samples into the analytical part of the NMR instrument. \n   alt The autosampler is an automatic sample changer device.
OBI:0000555.label: autosampler

OBI:0000006.definition: the role of a human being that is realized by enforcing regulations to ensure consumer safety
OBI:0000006.label: role of being consumer safety officer

OBI:0001532.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-9 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001532.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-9 production by T cells

OBI:0001533.definition: A storage service in which a service consumer provides data as input which a service provider stores and returns as output in its original form.
OBI:0001533.label: data storage service

OBI:0001530.definition: A service that has some information content entity as input and output.
OBI:0001530.label: data service

OBI:0001531.definition: A purified MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001531.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001536.definition: A binding constant defined as the ratio of kon over koff (on-rate of binding divided by off-rate)
OBI:0001536.label: equilibrium dissociation constant (KD)

OBI:0001537.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001537.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001534.definition: A purified MHC binding assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001534.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001535.definition: A process of interleukin-7 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001535.label: epitope specific interleukin-7 production by T cells

OBI:0001538.definition: A service  in which the service provider offers educational materials or events, such as courses, workshops or graduate programs, to the service consumer.
OBI:0001538.label: training service

OBI:0001539.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001539.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0200198.definition: Tandem mass spectrometry is a data transformation that uses two or more analyzers separated by a region in which ions can be induced to fragment by transfer of energy (frequently by collision with other molecules).
OBI:0200198.label: tandem mass spectrometry

UBERON:0001359.definition: A clear, colorless, bodily fluid, that occupies the subarachnoid space and the ventricular system around and inside the brain and spinal cord.
UBERON:0001359.label: cerebrospinal fluid

OBI:0001105.definition: A microscope that forms images of surfaces using a physical probe that scans the specimen.
OBI:0001105.label: scanning force microscope

OBI:0001666.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding on rate (kon) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001666.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring binding on rate [kon] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001667.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation and provides IC50 values determined under assay conditions where the IC50 approximates a KD value.
OBI:0001667.label: purified MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex approximated by IC50 using fluorescence detection

OBI:0200061.definition: Imputation is a means of filling in missing data values from a predictive distribution of the missing values.  The predictive distribution can be created either based on a formal statistical model (i,e, a multivariate normal distribution) or an algorithm.
OBI:0200061.label: data imputation

OBI:0001664.definition: A T cell epitope specific granulysin release assay that uses an intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay.
OBI:0001664.label: intracellular material detection assay measuring epitope specific granulysin release by T cells

OBI:0000485.definition: Any instrument that is used to carry out a chromatography experiment.
OBI:0000485.label: chromatography instrument

OBI:0000484.definition: An NMR sample holder is the part of an NMR instrument, which carries the NMR probe,sample tube and the nmr sample.
OBI:0000484.label: NMR sample holder

OBI:0000487.definition: In fourier transformation NMR, all frequencies in a spectrum are irradiated simultaneously with a radio frequency pulse. Following the pulse, the nuclei return to thermal equilibrium. A time domain emission signal is recorded by the instrument as the nuclei relax. A frequency domain spectrum is obtained by Fourier transformation.
OBI:0000487.label: fourier transformation NMR instrument

OBI:0000954.definition: is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the hypodermis (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe
OBI:0000954.label: subcutaneous injection

OBI:0000481.definition: A chromatography detector is a device that locates in the dimensions of space and time, the positions of the components of a mixture that has been subjected to a chromatographic process and thus permits the senses to appreciate the nature of the separation.  Defining characteristics are Dynamic Range, Response Index or Linearity, Linear Dynamic range, Detector Response,  Detector Noise Level, Detector Sensitivity or Minimum Detectable Concentration, Total System Dispersion, Sensor Dimensions, Detector Time Constant, Pressure Sensitivity, Flow Sensitivity, Operating Temperature Range.
OBI:0000481.label: chromatography detector

OBI:0000480.definition: BRUKER BIOSPIN's experienced Research & Development group not only delivers top-performance probes for the more common experiments, but also a wealth of special probes for almost any application. For high resolution (HR) NMR we offer probes with a variety of important characteristics and features.
OBI:0000480.label: Bruker high resolution probe

OBI:0000951.definition: an intervention design in which the treatment is the administration of a compound
OBI:0000951.label: compound treatment design

OBI:0000482.definition: A normal phase column is a chromatography column in which the stationary phase is more polar than the mobile phase. Its counterpart is the reversed phase column.
OBI:0000482.label: normal phase column

OBI:0000489.definition: The nitrogen phosphorus detector (NPD) (sometimes called the thermionic detector) is a very sensitive, specific detector the design of which, is based on the FID. Physically the sensor appears to be very similar to the FID but, in fact, operates on an entirely different principle. The nitrogen phosphorous detector (sometimes called the thermionic detector) is a very sensitive but specific detector that responds almost exclusively to nitrogen and phosphorous compounds. It is based on the flame ionization detector but differs in that it contains a rubidium or cesium silicate (glass) bead situated in a heater coil, a little distance from the hydrogen flame. If the detector is to respond to both nitrogen and phosphorous then the hydrogen flow should be minimal so that the gas does not ignite at the jet. If the detector is to respond to phosphorous only, a large flow of hydrogen is used which is burnt at the jet. The heated bead emits electrons by thermionic emission. These electrons are collected under a potential of a few volts by an appropriately placed anode, and provides a background current. When a solute containing nitrogen or phosphorous is eluted from the column, the partially combusted nitrogen and phosphorous materials are adsorbed on the surface of the bead. The adsorbed material reduces the work function of the surface and, as consequence, the emission of electrons is increased which raises the current collected at the electrode. The sensitivity of the detector to phosphorous is about 10-12 gram per ml and for nitrogen about 10-11 gram per ml at a signal to nose ratio of 2. The alkali bead as a finite life and needs regular replacement.
OBI:0000489.label: nitrogen phosphorous detector

OBI:0200019.definition: A loess group transformation two-channel is a loess group transformation in the special case where the input is the result of an MA transformation applied to intensities from the two channels of a two-channel assay.
OBI:0200019.label: loess group transformation two-channel

CHMO:0000102.definition: Microscopy where the specimen is illuminated with visible light and a system of lenses is used to produce an image.
CHMO:0000102.label: light microscopy

OBI:0001660.definition: A T cell epitope specific granzyme A release assay that uses an intracellular material detection by flow cytometry assay.
OBI:0001660.label: intracellular material detection assay measuring epitope specific granzyme A release by T cells

OBI:0002187.definition: An extracellular electrophysiology assay where a single microelectrode is placed in close proximity to a single neuron to measure voltage and current changes over time. This is the technicque used by Hubel and Wiesel to measure firing properties of primary visual cortex neurons in the 1950s in their original Nobel-prize winning study. A classic, old technique.
OBI:0002187.label: single-unit recording

OBI:0002453.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states one or more clinically significant bodily components, dispositions, and/or bodily processes of an entity that are inferred from relevant clinical findings or self-reported, which, if met, makes the entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002453.label: health status inclusion criterion

OBI:0001108.definition: An device that is used to determine the order of nucleotides in nucleic acid sequences.
