OBI:0001108.label: nucleic acid sequencer

OBI:1110017.definition: a process in which a a human being lives in the same household as another human being that is known to be infected with an infectious agent
OBI:1110017.label: living with infected household contact

OBI:0002184.definition: The cut-open oocyte Vaseline gap (COVG) voltage-clamp technique is designed to solve weaknesses in the two elextrode voltage clamp by maximizing the benefits of the Xenopus oocyte expression system by improving on clamp speed, signal-to-noise ratio, and ability to effectively perfuse the oocyte. In this way, it was possible to combine the most popular transient expression system, and the associated benefits of molecular cloning and site-directed mutagenesis, with the superior voltage-clamp properties of cut-open cell techniques.
OBI:0002184.label: cut open oocyte voltage clamp assay

OBI:0001107.definition: A device that is used to perform paraffin embedding of tissue specimens.
OBI:0001107.label: tissue embedding station

OBI:0000319.definition: material to be added role is a protocol participant role realized by a material which is added into a material bearing the target of material addition role in a material addition process
OBI:0000319.label: material to be added role

OBI:0000318.definition: a eluate is a material entity which results from an elution, e.g. from a chromatography column. it has as part a material entity with role mobile phase
OBI:0000318.label: eluate

OBI:0001106.definition: A gel electrophoresis system that is used to separate very large molecules of DNA.
OBI:0001106.label: pulsed-field gel electrophoresis system

OBI:0002180.definition: A patch-clamp assay where a patch of the membrane is attached to the patch pipette, detached from the rest of the cell, and the cytosolic surface of the membrane is exposed to the external media, or bath. This provides the experimenter has access to the intracellular surface of the membrane via the bath and can manipulate the environment at the intracellular surface of single ion channels. For example, channels that are activated by intracellular ligands can then be studied through a range of ligand concentrations.
OBI:0002180.label: inside-out patch clamp assay

OBI:0001628.definition: A CRID symbol used to identify an investigation.
OBI:0001628.label: investigation identifier

OBI:0001102.definition: An spectrophotometer that is used to investigate chemical species that have one or more unpaired electrons, such as organic and inorganic free radicals or inorganic complexes possessing a transition metal ion.
OBI:0001102.label: electron paramagnetic resonance spectrometer

OBI:0001668.definition: A binding assay that screens membrane soluble proteins by fusion of two integral membrane proteins (bait and prey) to two different ubiquitin moieties. One moiety is also fused to a transcription factor (TF) that can be cleaved off by ubiquitin specific proteases. Upon bait and prey interaction, Nub and Cub-moieties assemble, reconstituting the split-ubiquitin. The reconstituted split-ubiquitin molecule is recognized by ubiquitin specific proteases, which cleave off the reporter protein, allowing it to induce the transcription of reporter genes.
OBI:0001668.label: split-ubiquitin assay

UBERON:0000310.definition: The upper ventral region of an animal's torso.
UBERON:0000310.label: breast

OBI:0200062.definition: A continuum mass spectrum is a data transformation that contains the full profile of the detected signals for a given ion.
OBI:0200062.label: continuum mass spectrum

OBI:0001339.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001339.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-4 production by T cells

OMIABIS:0000052.definition: A fixed tissue specimen that is placed in a slide.
OMIABIS:0000052.label: fixed tissue slide specimen

OBI:0001965.definition: a study design that has a decision analysis objective specification as part
OBI:0001965.label: decision analysis study design

IAO:0000303.definition: A textual entity intended to identify a particular institution
IAO:0000303.label: institutional identification

IAO:0000302.definition: A textual entity intended to identify a particular author
IAO:0000302.label: author identification

IAO:0000301.definition: a textual entity intended to identify a particular publication
IAO:0000301.label: citation

UO:0000270.definition: A unit which is a standard measure of the volume of fluid which passes through a given surface per unit time .
UO:0000270.label: volumetric flow rate unit

IAO:0000307.definition: A table where the constituent texts are abbreviations and their expansions
IAO:0000307.label: table of abbreviations

IAO:0000306.definition: A textual entity that contains a two-dimensional arrangement of texts repeated at regular intervals across a spatial range, such that the spatial relationships among the constituent texts expresses propositions
IAO:0000306.label: table

IAO:0000305.definition: A textual entity that names a document
IAO:0000305.label: document title

IAO:0000304.definition: A textual entity that describes a figure
IAO:0000304.label: caption

IDO:0000586.definition: A part of an extended organism that itself has as part a population of one or more infectious agents and that (1) exists as a result of processes initiated by members of the infectious agent population and is (2) clinically abnormal in virtue of the presence of this infectious agent population, or (3) has a disposition to bring clinical abnormality to immunocompetent organisms of the same Species as the host (the organism corresponding to the extended organism) through transmission of a member or offspring of a member of the infectious agent population.
IDO:0000586.label: infection

IAO:0000309.definition: A figure that expresses one or more propositions
IAO:0000309.label: diagram

IAO:0000308.definition: An information content entity consisting of a two dimensional arrangement of information content entities such that the arrangement itself is about something.
IAO:0000308.label: figure

OBI:0001553.definition: A MHC:ligand binding assay that measures a binding constant.
OBI:0001553.label: assay measuring a binding constant of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0001330.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001330.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells

OBI:0001331.definition: A molecular feature identification objective that aims to characterize the abundance of transcripts
OBI:0001331.label: transcription profiling identification objective

OBI:0001444.definition: A study design that classifies an individual or group of individuals on the basis of alleles, haplotypes, SNPs.
OBI:0001444.label: genotyping design

OBI:0001333.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells.
OBI:0001333.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells

OBI:0001442.definition:
A quantitative confidence value that measures the minimum false discovery rate that is incurred when calling that test significant. 
To compute q-values, it is necessary to know the p-value produced by a test and possibly set a false discovery rate level.
OBI:0001442.label: q-value

OBI:0001336.definition: A study design in which some aspects of the experiment is quality controlled for the purposes of quality assurance.
OBI:0001336.label: quality control testing design

OBI:0001337.definition: A study design that the organism's clinical history of diagnosis, treatments, e.g. vaccinations, surgery etc. is studied.
OBI:0001337.label: clinical history design

PATO:0001196.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the abdomen of an organism relative to another entity.
PATO:0001196.label: ventral to

PATO:0001193.definition: A spatial quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's being located toward the side relative to another entity.
PATO:0001193.label: lateral to

CHEBI:30682.definition: An iron group element atom that has formula Ru.
CHEBI:30682.label: ruthenium atom

OBI:0100039.definition: A material entity which is derived from a  protein
OBI:0100039.label: obsolete_fragment derived from protein

UBERON:0000479.definition: Multicellular anatomical structure that consists of many cells of one or a few types, arranged in an extracellular matrix such that their long-range organisation is at least partly a repetition of their short-range organisation.
UBERON:0000479.label: tissue

OBI:0001721.definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that characterizes the 3D structure of an antibody / BCR with a ligand.
OBI:0001721.label: 3D structure determining assay of a 3D B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0200088.definition: a nonparametric (actuarial) data transformation technique for estimating time-related events. It is a univariate analysis that estimates the probability of the proportion of subjects in remission at a particular time, starting from the initiation of active date (time zero), and takes into account those lost to follow-up or not yet in remission at end of study (censored)
OBI:0200088.label: Kaplan Meier

UBERON:0000473.definition: A gonad of a male animal. A gonad produces and releases sperm.
UBERON:0000473.label: testis

GO:0042571.definition: An immunoglobulin complex that is secreted into extracellular space and found in mucosal areas or other tissues or circulating in the blood or lymph. In its canonical form, a circulating immunoglobulin complex is composed of two identical heavy chains and two identical light chains, held together by disulfide bonds. Some forms of are polymers of the basic structure and contain additional components such as J-chain and the secretory component.
GO:0042571.label: immunoglobulin complex, circulating

OBI:0001682.definition: An assay that identifies the sequence-specific target site of a DNA-binding domain. In this system, a given transcription factor (TF) is expressed as a fusion to a subunit of RNA polymerase. In parallel, a library of randomized oligonucleotides representing potential TF target sequences, is cloned into a separate vector containing the selectable genes HIS3 and URA3. If the DNA-binding domain (bait) binds a potential DNA target site (prey) in vivo, it will recruit RNA polymerase to the promoter and activate transcription of the reporter genes in that clone. The two reporter genes, HIS3 and URA3, allow for positive and negative selections, respectively. At the end of the process, positive clones are sequenced and examined with motif-finding tools in order to resolve the favoured DNA target sequence
OBI:0001682.label: bacterial one-hybrid assay

GO:0007049.definition: The progression of biochemical and morphological phases and events that occur in a cell during successive cell replication or nuclear replication events. Canonically, the cell cycle comprises the replication and segregation of genetic material followed by the division of the cell, but in endocycles or syncytial cells nuclear replication or nuclear division may not be followed by cell division.
GO:0007049.label: cell cycle

GO:0016064.definition: An immune response mediated by immunoglobulins, whether cell-bound or in solution.
GO:0016064.label: immunoglobulin mediated immune response

OBI:0002314.definition: A categorical value specification that is an assessment of the stage of a cancer according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) v7 staging systems.
OBI:0002314.label: clinical tumor stage group according to AJCC 7th edition

OBI:0002310.definition: A categorical value specification that is a  pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of ovarian cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
OBI:0002310.label: pathologic distant metastases stage for ovary according to AJCC 7th edition

OBI:0200081.definition: A sequence analysis objective is a data transformation objective which aims to analyse some ordered biological data for sequential patterns.
OBI:0200081.label: sequence analysis objective

OBI:0200080.definition: A data transformation that takes as input data that describes biological networks in terms of the node (a.k.a. vertex) and edge graph elements and their characteristics and generates as output properties of the constituent nodes and edges, the sub-graphs, and the entire network.
OBI:0200080.label: network analysis

OBI:0001222.definition: An assay of epitope specific RANTES production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001222.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific RANTES production by T cells

OBI:0002137.definition: A value specification that specifies the value of the RNA Integrity Number as a real value between 1 (most degraded) and 10 (most intact).
OBI:0002137.label: RNA Integrity Number value specification

OBI:0002136.definition: A data transformation using the RIN algorithm to generate a quality measure of RNA based on features from an electrophoretic trace.
OBI:0002136.label: RNA Integrity Number calculation

GO:0032618.definition: The appearance of interleukin-15 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032618.label: interleukin-15 production

GO:0032619.definition: The appearance of interleukin-16 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032619.label: interleukin-16 production

OBI:0002421.definition: An information content entity that indicates whether or not  an entity has met a specific requirement in order to take part in a given process.
OBI:0002421.label: indicator of whether an inclusion criterion was met

OBI:0002132.definition: An assay that detects differences in protein abundance using samples that have been metabolically labeled in vivo with a stable non-radioactive heavy isotope containing amino acid for a short period of time. After diluting the pulsed cells into growth media without label, high resolution mass spectrometry-based proteomics is used to analyze the time-dependent decay and determine protein stability.
OBI:0002132.label: pulse stable isotope labeling by amino acids in cell culture

OBI:0302729.definition: A material entity  that is made up of at least 2 scattered molecular aggregates, one playing the role of solvent and the other one playing the role of solute.
OBI:0302729.label: chemical solution

OBI:0400059.definition: Point within the fluidic subsystem at which the laser intersects the stream, illuminating the cells where they emit their fluorescence and scatter the light. The laser irradiates the cell at the interrogation point.
OBI:0400059.label: interrogation_point

GO:0032612.definition: The appearance of interleukin-1 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032612.label: interleukin-1 production

GO:0032613.definition: The appearance of interleukin-10 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032613.label: interleukin-10 production

GO:0032610.definition: The appearance of interleukin-1 alpha due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032610.label: interleukin-1 alpha production

GO:0032611.definition: The appearance of interleukin-1 beta due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032611.label: interleukin-1 beta production

GO:0032616.definition: The appearance of interleukin-13 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032616.label: interleukin-13 production

GO:0032617.definition: The appearance of interleukin-14 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032617.label: interleukin-14 production

GO:0032614.definition: The appearance of interleukin-11 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032614.label: interleukin-11 production

GO:0032615.definition: The appearance of interleukin-12 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032615.label: interleukin-12 production

OBI:0200095.definition: An exponential transformation is a data transformation consisting in the application of the exponential function with a given base a (where a>0 and a is typically not equal to 1) to a (one dimensional) real number input. For alternative definitions and properties of this function see, e.g., http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exponential_function and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Characterizations_of_the_exponential_function.
OBI:0200095.label: exponential transformation

OBI:0002167.definition: A protein localization assay that determines the specific subcellular location of a protein. The location is visualized through electron microscopy._
OBI:0002167.label: subcellular protein localization assay

OBI:0200151.definition: The exponential base is a feature of an exponential function which is defined in http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exponential_function. Its value can be any positive real number (typically different from 1).
OBI:0200151.label: exponential base

OBI:0400066.definition: A logarithmic voltage amplifier is an analog electronic circuit that puts out a voltage or current proportional to the voltage or current at its input, with logarithmic proportionality. In an analog system, the logarithmic voltage amplifier is used to present parameters with a high dynamic range on a more useful scale.
OBI:0400066.label: logarithmic voltage amplifier

OBI:1110046.definition: The process of removing an organ from its source organism
OBI:1110046.label: organ harvesting

OBI:1110047.definition: A T cell population characterized by expressing the CD3 molecule on its surface.
OBI:1110047.label: cultured CD3+ T cell population

OBI:1110044.definition: A mixed cell population obtained by processing whole blood. The cells are characterized by having a similar density and are largely mononuclear cells (includes T cells, B cells, and other cell types).
OBI:1110044.label: cultured PBMC cell population

OBI:1110045.definition: Is the disposition borne by a material entity that is realized in a process of being bound by a adaptive immune receptor.
OBI:1110045.label: disposition to be bound by an adaptive immune receptor

OBI:0400065.definition: A light source is an optical subsystem that provides light for use in a distant area using a delivery system (e.g., fiber optics). Light sources may include one of a variety of lamps (e.g., xenon, halogen, mercury). Most light sources are operated from line power, but some may be powered from batteries. They are mostly used in endoscopic, microscopic, and other examination and/or in surgical procedures. The light source is part of the optical subsystem. In a flow cytometer the light source directs high intensity light at particles at the interrogation point. The light source in a flow cytometer is usually a laser.
OBI:0400065.label: light source

OBI:1110040.definition: is a disease caused by an infectious agent
OBI:1110040.label: infectious disease

OBI:1110041.definition: A cell specimen comprised of a mixed population of cells obtained by processing whole lymph node into individual cells, typically performed using a sieve. This population includes T cells, B cells, macrophages, and other cell types.
OBI:1110041.label: lymph node cell specimen

OBI:0002551.definition: A specimen that is derived from suprapubic skin.
OBI:0002551.label: suprapubic skin specimen

OBI:0002550.definition: A specimen that is derived from sigmoid colon.
OBI:0002550.label: sigmoid colon specimen

OBI:0002553.definition: A specimen that is derived from uterus.
OBI:0002553.label: uterus specimen

OBI:0002552.definition: A specimen that is derived from testis.
OBI:0002552.label: testis specimen

OBI:0002555.definition: An inclusion criterion that defines and states an age bracket which, if met, makes an entity suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002555.label: age group inclusion criterion

OBI:0002554.definition: A specimen that is derived from vagina.
OBI:0002554.label: vagina specimen

OBI:0002557.definition: A value specifcation that specifies the oldest age when specifying an age range.
OBI:0002557.label: maximum age value specification

OBI:0002224.synonyms: pT: Pathologic spread colorectal primary tumor (AJCC 7th Edition)
OBI:0002224.definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of colorectal cancer following the rules of the TNM American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) version 7 classification system as they pertain to staging of the primary tumor. TNM pathologic primary tumor findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
OBI:0002224.label: pathologic primary tumor stage for colon and rectum according to AJCC 7th edition

OBI:0002559.definition: An inclusion criterion defines that a human being has to be a hospital patient to be suitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002559.label: hospital patient inclusion criterion

OBI:0400063.definition: A LactoScope_C4 is a spectrophotometer with which the composition of milk and milk products is analysed via infrared technology. The LactoScope determines the amount of the constituents fat, protein, lactose and the total solids content with extreme accuracy.
OBI:0400063.label: LactoScope C4

OBI:0400062.definition: A krypton-ion laser is an ion laser that uses krypton as the lasing medium. These lasers can emit at 468, 476, 482, 520, 531, 568, 647 (the most powerful line), and 676 nm all at once. They have much lower gain than argon lasers however.
OBI:0400062.label: krypton ion laser

OBI:0001055.definition: A confocal microscope that uses a Nipkow disk, a mechanical, geometrically operating image scanning device.
OBI:0001055.label: spinning-disk confocal microscope

OBI:0001054.definition: A device that is used to produce targeted molecular pharmaceuticals for use in positron emission tomography.
OBI:0001054.label: PET synthesizer

OBI:0001057.definition: A liquid chromatography instrument that consists of a reservoir of mobile phase, a pump, an injector, a separation column, and a detector. The pump (rather than gravity) provides the higher pressure required to propel the mobile phase and analyte through the densely packed column.
OBI:0001057.label: high performance liquid chromatography instrument

OBI:0002048.definition: A DNA sequencer manufactured by Illumina corporation, with a single flow cell and a throughput of more than 200 Gb per day.
OBI:0002048.label: Illumina HiSeq 3000

OBI:0001051.definition: The output of an extraction process in which DNA molecules are purified in order to exclude DNA from organellas.
OBI:0001051.label: DNA extract

OBI:0400061.definition: A flow cell in which the cells are pinched off as droplets and allowed to drop through the air. The laser intersects with the cell in mid-air. A jet in air flow chamber allows the laser to intersect with the cells without any intermittent media other than air.
OBI:0400061.label: jet_in_air_flow_chamber

OBI:0001053.definition: A device that moves charged particles through a medium by using an electric field induced by electrodes.
OBI:0001053.label: electrophoresis system

OBI:0002508.definition: A specimen that is derived from sputum.
OBI:0002508.label: sputum specimen

OBI:0002043.synonyms: individual-nucleotide resolution cross-linking and immunoprecipitation;iCLIP assay;iCLIP
OBI:0002043.definition: A cross-linking immunoprecipitation high-throughput sequencing assay that identifies protein-RNA interactions using UV light to covalently bind proteins and RNA molecules, allowing for a very stringent purification of the linked protein-RNA complexes.
OBI:0002043.label: individual-nucleotide resolution cross-linking and immunoprecipitation sequencing assay

OBI:0002042.synonyms: Carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay followed by sequencing;HiC assay;HiC
OBI:0002042.definition: A carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay to analyze the organization of chromosomes in an unbiased, genome-wide manner using high throughput sequening following carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture.
OBI:0002042.label: carbon-copy chromosome conformation capture assay followed by sequencing assay

OBI:0002041.synonyms: STARR-seq assay;STARR-seq;self-transcribing active regulatory region sequencing
OBI:0002041.definition: An RNA-seq assay that identifies the sequences that act as transcriptional enhancers in a direct, quantitative, and genome-wide manner from sheared genomic DNA.
OBI:0002041.label: self-transcribing active regulatory region sequencing assay

OBI:0002040.synonyms: ChIRP-seq;ChIRP-seq assay;Chromatin Isolation by RNA purification
OBI:0002040.definition: A detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay that measures regions of the genome which are bound by a specific RNA (or a by a ribonucleoprotein containing the RNA of interest) using high-throughput sequencing.
OBI:0002040.label: chromatin isolation by RNA purification sequencing assay

OBI:0002047.definition: A processed material that is comprised of an antibody that is covalently linked to an enzyme through bioconjugation. The enzyme can be used as a detection method when the enzyme's reaction produces a detectable signal, for example a color change when the substrate is added.
OBI:0002047.label: enzyme-linked antibody

OBI:0001058.definition: A measurement device that detects biological, chemical or physical events of samples in microtiter plates.
OBI:0001058.label: microplate reader

OBI:0002045.definition: A RNA-seq assay that quantitatively profiles RNA polyadenylation at the transcriptome level.
OBI:0002045.label: poly(A)-site sequencing assay

OBI:0002044.definition: An RNA-seq assay that comprehensively characterizes sequence and structural specificity of RNA binding proteins (RBPs).
OBI:0002044.label: RNA Bind-n-Seq assay

OBI:1110019.definition: a process in which a an infectious agent maintained in a laboratory setting is not contained as planned, leading to potential exposure of human beings to the agent
OBI:1110019.label: pathogen release in laboratory accident

OBI:0001292.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects interleukin-15 production by T cells.
OBI:0001292.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-15 production by T cells

OBI:0200153.definition: The number of variables is a feature of any function (including polynomial functions) with domain contained in an n-dimensional vector space and is defined as n, the dimension of such space.
OBI:0200153.label: number of variables

OBI:0002064.definition: A T cell epitope specific granzyme A release assay that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0002064.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific granzyme A release by T cells

OBI:1110132.definition: A transmembrane glycoprotein that serves as a co-receptor for the T cell receptor.
OBI:1110132.label: CD8 receptor

OBI:1110130.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects the killing of an antigen presenting cell (APC) by a T cell whose TCR recognizes an epitope presented by the APC.
OBI:1110130.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific T cell killing

OBI:1110131.definition: A T cell epitope dependent biological activity assay that detects T cell proliferation.
OBI:1110131.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific proliferation of T cells

OBI:0400069.definition: The Luminex 100 is a flow_cytometer_analyser manufactured by Luminex. It is a single laser system (575 nm) with avalanche photodiodes in red and infrared and a single PMT for fluorescence. The flow chamber is a square quartz cuvette.
OBI:0400069.label: Luminex 100

CHEBI:59424.definition: 3H-2,1-Benzoxathiole 1,1-dioxide in which both of the hydrogens at position 3 have been substituted by 3,5-dibromo-4-hydroxyphenyl groups. It is used as a laboratory indicator, changing from yellow below pH 3 to purple at pH 4.6, and as a size marker for monitoring the progress of agarose gel and polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. It has also been used as an industrial dye.
CHEBI:59424.label: bromophenol blue

OBI:0400068.definition: A LSR2 is a sorter manufactured by Becton Dickinson. It features digital electronics, a solid state 488 nm blue laser and optionally can also have any combination of solid state UV (355 nm) and violet (405 nm) lasers and the a HeNe (633 nm) ion laser. The LSR2 has the filters and PMTs to work with 13 fluorescent parameters. The LSR II is one of the most common sorters in use.
OBI:0400068.label: LSR2

SO:0000353.definition: A sequence of nucleotides that has been algorithmically derived from an alignment of two or more different sequences.
SO:0000353.label: sequence_assembly

OBI:0005246.definition: The function of a device realized when administering a substance in vivo, applied particularly to the forcible insertion of a liquid or gas by means of a syringe, pump, etc.
OBI:0005246.label: injection function

OBI:0000726.definition: Peak matching is a data transformation performed on a dataset of a graph of ordered data points (e.g. a spectrum) with the objective of pattern matching local maxima above a noise threshold
OBI:0000726.label: peak matching

OBI:0000626.definition: A sequencing assay which determines information on the sequence of a DNA molecule.
OBI:0000626.label: DNA sequencing assay

OBI:0001290.definition: A study design that identifies forms and abundance of transcripts in the genome using microarray technology.
OBI:0001290.label: transcription profiling by array design

GO:0001047.definition: Interacting selectively and non-covalently with the regulatory region composed of the transcription start site and binding sites for the basal transcription machinery. Binding may occur as a sequence specific interaction or as an interaction observed only once a factor has been recruited to the DNA by other factors.
GO:0001047.label: core promoter binding

OBI:0000727.definition: A k-nearest neighbors is a data transformation which achieves a class discovery or partitioning objective, in which an input data object with vector y is assigned to a class label based upon the k closest training data set points to y; where k is the largest value that class label is assigned.
OBI:0000727.label: k-nearest neighbors

OBI:0000838.definition: a process with that achieves the objective to maintain some or all of the characteristics of an input material over time
OBI:0000838.label: material maintenance

OBI:0000839.definition: a labeled oligonucleotide is a short nucleic acid which underwent a labeling process resulting in a radioactive isotope such as P32 or P33 added to its backbone for instance by end labeling with polynucleotide kinase which added radiolabeled ATP to the 5' end of oligonucleotide
OBI:0000839.label: labeled oligonucleotide

OBI:0200190.definition: A data visualization which has input of a clustered data set and produces an output of a report graph which is capable of rendering data of this type.
OBI:0200190.label: clustered data visualization

OBI:0000834.definition: The output of an extraction process in which DNA molecules above a molecular weight cutoff are purified in order to exclude DNA from organellas.
OBI:0000834.label: high molecular weight DNA extract

OBI:0000835.definition: A person or organization that has a manufacturer role
OBI:0000835.label: manufacturer

OBI:0000836.definition: A test tube is a device consisting of a glass or plastic tubing, open at the top, usually with a rounded U-shaped bottom which has the function to contain material
OBI:0000836.label: test tube

OBI:0000837.definition: An adding a material entity to target with the entity is a pill and the target is the mouth
OBI:0000837.label: oral ingestion of pill

OBI:0000830.definition: A quality inhering in a molecule that is completely defined by the linear sequence of a set of residues which are connected by directional, linear bonds
OBI:0000830.label: obsolete_primary structure of sequence macromolecule

OBI:0000831.definition: a quality of a DNA residue that has a methyl group attached to it
OBI:0000831.label: DNA residue methylation

OBI:0000832.definition: A device in which a measure function inheres.
OBI:0000832.label: measurement device

OBI:0001837.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001837.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells

OBI:0001836.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001836.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells

OBI:0001835.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-18 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001835.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-18 production by T cells

OBI:0001834.definition: A planned process in which new information is inferred from existing information.
OBI:0001834.label: drawing a conclusion

OBI:0001833.definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17A production assay that uses an ELISPOT.
OBI:0001833.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17A production by T cells

OBI:0001832.definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17F production assay that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001832.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17F production by T cells

OBI:0001831.definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17F production assay that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001831.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific interleukin-17F production by T cells

OBI:0001830.definition: A T cell epitope specific interleukin-17F production assay that uses an ELISPOT.
OBI:0001830.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-17F production by T cells

CL:0000001.definition: A cultured cell that is freshly isolated from a organismal source, or derives in culture from such a cell prior to the culture being passaged.
CL:0000001.label: primary cultured cell

CL:0000000.definition: A material entity of anatomical origin (part of or deriving from an organism) that has as its parts a maximally connected cell compartment surrounded by a plasma membrane.
CL:0000000.label: cell

CL:0000003.definition: A cell that is found in a natural setting, which includes multicellular organism cells 'in vivo' (i.e. part of an organism), and unicellular organisms 'in environment' (i.e. part of a natural environment).
CL:0000003.label: native cell

OBI:0001838.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001838.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells

OBI:0000720.definition: The role a material entity plays when it is co-administered with an immunogen in order to enhance the immune response to the immunogen.
OBI:0000720.label: immunologic adjuvant role

IAO:0000059.definition: A report figure is a report display element that has some aspect of illustration, but may be a composite of figures, images, and other elements
IAO:0000059.label: obsolete2_report figure

OBI:0001309.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001309.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells

OBI:0001308.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects IP-10 production by T cells.
OBI:0001308.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific IP-10 production by T cells

OBI:0001305.definition: a genetic characteristics information that is about the genetic material of an organism and minimally includes information about the genetic background and can in addition contain information about specific alleles, genetic modifications, etc.
OBI:0001305.label: genotype information

OBI:0001304.definition: An assay in which double stranded RNA is synthesized with a sequence complementary to a gene(s) of interest and introduced into a cell or organism, where it is recognized as exogenous genetic material and activates the RNAi pathway resulting in knockdown of the transcripts and providing a means to study downstream changes in gene expression.
OBI:0001304.label: RNAi profiling by array assay

OBI:0001307.definition: a DNA microarray which has short fragments of nucleic acid immobilized on a substrate. These are designed to cover the whole genome of the target species. Tiling arrays are used to determine genome binding in ChIP assays or to identify transcribed regions.
OBI:0001307.label: tiling microarray

OBI:0001306.definition: A study design that examines the stability and/or decay of RNA transcripts.
OBI:0001306.label: RNA stability design

OBI:0001301.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells that uses a cell culture analyte detection bioassay.
OBI:0001301.label: cell culture analyte detection bioassay measuring epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells

OBI:0000559.definition: An NMR probe that is designed to hold a liquid sample.
OBI:0000559.label: liquid NMR probe

OBI:0001303.definition: An assay of epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001303.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific granulocyte macrophage colony-stimulating factor production by T cells

OBI:0001302.definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001302.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells

IAO:0000093.definition: Binary executable is a digital entity consisting of the binary representation of machine instructions of a specific processor or they may be binary pseudocode for a virtual machine. A non-source executable file is also called an object program. It is assumed that the binary executable file contains properly-formatted computer instructions.  (derived from Wikipedia, Nov 1, 2007)
IAO:0000093.label: obsolete2_binary executable

IAO:0000091.definition: A report element is a narrative object in which information is presented and consumed by a human being, and is part of a report. Examples of report elements are figure (dot plot), table, text portion (may include a movie or audio clip on a web page).
IAO:0000091.label: obsolete_report element

OBI:0500001.definition: Plan for the precise procedure to be followed in a clinical trial, including planned and actual timing of events, choice of control group, method of allocating treatments, blinding methods; assigns a subject to pass through one or more epochs in the course of a trial. Specific design elements, e.g., crossover, parallel; dose-escalation [Modified from Pocock, Clinical Trials: A Practical Approach]
OBI:0500001.label: clinical study design

IAO:0000097.definition: A report table is a report display element consisting of a matrix of cells layed out in a grid, some set of which are filled with some information content
IAO:0000097.label: obsolete_report table

IAO:0000096.definition: A source code module is a directive information entity that specifies, using a programming language, some algorithm.
IAO:0000096.label: source code module

IAO:0000098.definition:
A data format specification is the information content borne by the document published defining the specification.
Example: The ISO document specifying what encompasses an XML document; The instructions in a XSD file
IAO:0000098.label: data format specification

OBI:0200050.definition: A dimensionality reduction is data partitioning which transforms each input m-dimensional vector (x_1, x_2, ..., x_m) into an output n-dimensional vector (y_1, y_2, ..., y_n), where n is smaller than m.
OBI:0200050.label: dimensionality reduction

PR:000006592.definition: A protein that is a translation product of the human DNASE1 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof.
PR:000006592.label: deoxyribonuclease-1

IAO:0000650.definition: A planned process which takes as input a database and fills another database by extracting concretizations of information entities from the first, transforming them, and loading the transformed concretizations into the second.
IAO:0000650.label: database extract, transform, and load process

OBI:1110018.definition: a process in which a potential host organism lives in a geographic area in which an infectious agent is present to such a degree of frequency that contact is likely
OBI:1110018.label: living in endemic area

OBI:0100014.definition: An organism which contains cells or tissues with a different genotype
OBI:0100014.label: chimera

OBI:0000636.definition: A Computer used for NMR, can be divided into central processing unit (CPU), consisting of instruction, interpretation and arithmetic unit plus fast access memory, and peripheral devices such as bulk data storage and input and output devices (including, via the interface, the spectrometer). Under software control, the computer controls the RF pulses and gradients necessary to acquire data, and process the data to produce spectra or images. Note that devices such as the spectrometer may themselves incorporate small computers.
OBI:0000636.label: acquisition computer

OBI:0000637.definition: A gas chromatography detector is a chromatography detector that locates in the dimensions of space and time, the positions of the components of a mixture that has been subjected to a gas chromatographic process and thus permits the senses to appreciate the nature of the separation. There is no LC detector that has an equivalent performance to the flame ionization detector (FID) used in GC. In general, LC detectors have sensitivities of two to three orders of magnitude less than their GC counterparts and linear dynamic ranges one to two orders of magnitude lower. Only highly specific LC detectors have sensitivities that can approach those of GC detectors.
OBI:0000637.label: gas chromatography detector

OBI:0001949.definition: A reporting party role that is realized by a person or organization who reports the feature annotation results from the analysis of a macromolecular sequence.
OBI:0001949.label: sequence annotation reporting role

OBI:0001948.definition: A textual entity that is used to denote a sequence assembly.
OBI:0001948.label: sequence assembly name

OBI:0000632.definition: An NMR platform for conducting metabonomics studies, traditional metabolism studies, and analysis of complex mixtures, featuring an Avance NMR spectrometer and a microTOF from Bruker Daltonics. By combining the structural resolving power of NMR with mass accuracy of the microTOF Bruker offers a complete system for metabolic research. The Metabolic Profiler provides a simple, easy to use and inexpensive base-system to acquire the spectroscopic data, needed to do basic metabolic profiling including metabonomic statistical analysis.
OBI:0000632.label: Bruker Metabolic Profiler

OBI:0000633.definition: The glass liner can be fitted with a separate heater and the volatilization temperature can, thus, be controlled. This flash heater system is available in most chromatographs. By using a syringe with a long needle, the tip can be made to penetrate past the liner and discharge its contents directly into the column packing. This procedure is called 'on-column injection' and, as it reduces peak dispersion on injection and thus, provides higher column efficiencies, is often the preferred procedure.
OBI:0000633.label: column heater

OBI:0000630.definition: An assay that studies blood and blood producing organs using a variety of techniques and instruments
OBI:0000630.label: hematology assay

OBI:0000631.definition: MERCURYplus spectrometers provide superior control, stability, and performance for high-productivity environments. Surface-mount electronics enable a small footprint without compromising data quality. Modular design allows flexible configuration. Direct digital synthesis, linear amplifiers, and other innovative RF and digital technologies enable push-button operation.
OBI:0000631.label: Varian MERCURY spectrometer

OBI:0001943.definition: A plan specification that specifies a chain encoded in software of processing elements (processes, threads, coroutines, etc.), arranged so that the output of each element is the input of the next. Usually some amount of buffering is provided between consecutive elements.
OBI:0001943.label: software pipeline

OBI:0001942.definition: An organization that provides funding support for projects such as investigations.
OBI:0001942.label: grant agency

OBI:0001941.definition: N50 statistic computed for the contigs produced by the assembly process. A contig N50 is calculated by first ordering every contig by length from longest to shortest. Next, starting from the longest contig, the lengths of each contig are summed, until this running sum equals one-half of the total length of all contigs in the assembly. The contig N50 of the assembly is the length of the shortest contig in this list.
OBI:0001941.label: contig N50

OBI:0001940.definition: the weighted median item size or N50 is a weighted median of the lengths of items, equal to the length of the longest item i such that the sum of the lengths of items greater than or equal in length to i is greater than or equal to half the length of all of the items. With regard to assemblies the items are typically contigs or scaffolds. It therefore denotes the ability of the software to create contigs and provides information about the resulting sequence assembly
OBI:0001940.label: N50

OBI:0001947.definition: A person or organization reporting the feature annotation results from the analysis of a macromolecular sequence.
OBI:0001947.label: sequence annotation provider

OBI:0001946.definition: A short oligonucleotide complementary to target DNA (5'->3' on plus strand) that acts as the leader for DNA extension in a PCR reaction. The polymerase starts replication at the 3'-end of the primer, and copies the opposite strand. A primer is characterized by its 'melting temperature' (Tm) and pairs of primers should have similar Tm.
OBI:0001946.label: forward PCR primer

OBI:0000638.definition: Gas purifiers are instruments used for the removal of gas impurities like hydrocarbons, oxygen, and moisture from carrier gas and fuel gases for GC or GC-MS systems.
OBI:0000638.label: gas purifier

OBI:0000639.definition: is an objective to transform a material entity into spatially separated components.
OBI:0000639.label: material separation objective

OBI:0000548.definition: a process in which cells with a single nucleus are isolated from a blood sample
OBI:0000548.label: isolation of PBMCs

OBI:0000549.definition: A chromatography device where the column cartridge is inserted into and stabilised.
OBI:0000549.label: column cartridger

OBI:0500009.definition: A loop experiment design is where labeled extracts are compared in consecutive pairs. synonym: circular design
OBI:0500009.label: loop design

OBI:0000540.definition: a material separation process in which cells that stick to the container in which they are grown as a cell culture are separated from those in the liquid component of the culture. The output of this process are adherent cells.
OBI:0000540.label: isolation of adherent cells

OBI:0000017.definition: a role which inheres in material entities and is realized in the processes of making, enforcing or being defined by legislation or orders issued by a governmental body.
OBI:0000017.label: regulatory role

OBI:0000542.definition: Any device used in a gas chromatography experiment.
OBI:0000542.label: gas chromatography equipment

OBI:0000015.definition: Biological_feature_identification_objective is an objective role carried out by the proposition defining the aim of a study designed to examine or characterize a particular biological feature.
OBI:0000015.label: biological feature identification objective

OBI:0000544.definition: This Instrument system automatically prepares an NMR sample, inserts it into an NMR magnet, performs NMR experiments on the sample, and transports it back to the preparation system.   The SampleRail fulfills the transporting tasks from the preparation system into the NMR magnet and back.
OBI:0000544.label: Bruker SampleRail system

OBI:0000545.definition: For chromatography analyses, the ability to maintain a stable column environment regardless of ambient temperature fluctuations is critical for maintaining retention time precision. In order to ensure such stable conditions at different chromatography steps a column compartment can be installed that ensures e.g. stable temperature of the column in a given step.
OBI:0000545.label: column compartment

OBI:0000010.definition: A measurement datum that represents the output of a scanner measuring the intensity value for each fluorescent reporter.
OBI:0000010.label: fluorescent reporter intensity

OBI:0000011.definition: A processual entity that realizes a plan which is the concretization of a plan specification.
OBI:0000011.label: planned process

OBI:0001547.definition: A service in which a service consumer provides some input material and a service provider performs some analysis of this material to generate data that is returned to the service consumer.
OBI:0001547.label: material analysis service

OBI:0001546.definition: Interpreting data from assays that evaluate the qualities or dispositions inhering in an organism or organism part and comparing it to data from other organisms to make a conclusion about a phenotypic difference
OBI:0001546.label: comparative phenotypic assessment

OBI:0001545.definition: An assay of epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001545.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific macrophage inflammatory protein-1 alpha production by T cells

OBI:0001544.definition: A cell lysate MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001544.label: cell lysate MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001543.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding and provides EC50 values determined under assay conditions where the EC50 approximates a KD value.
OBI:0001543.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex approximated by EC50 using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001542.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells that uses a detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay.
OBI:0001542.label: detection of specific nucleic acids with complementary probes assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-13 production by T cells

OBI:0001541.definition: A purified MHC ligand binding on rate (kon) determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001541.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring binding on rate [kon] of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0001540.definition: An assay that identifies an MHC ligand using a T cell response assay as a readout
OBI:0001540.label: obsolete T cell recognition of eluted MHC ligand assay

OBI:0000554.definition: A gas chromatography oven is an oven with a heated connection between the GC and the MS instrument in a GCMS-analysis, that keeps compounds in the gas phase as they leave the GC oven.
OBI:0000554.label: gas chromatography oven

OBI:0001549.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand binding equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect loss of binding of a known reference ligand due to competition by the ligand under investigation.
OBI:0001549.label: cell bound MHC competitive binding assay measuring equilibrium dissociation constant [KD] of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001548.definition: A binding constant defined as the ratio of koff over kon (off-rate of binding divided by on-rate)
OBI:0001548.label: equilibrium association constant (KA)

CHEBI:26710.definition: An inorganic chloride salt having sodium(1+) as the counterion.
CHEBI:26710.label: sodium chloride

OBI:0200028.definition: A quantile transformation is a data transformation that takes as input a collection of data sets, where each can be thought as an n-dimensional (real) vector, and which transforms each data set so that the resulting output data sets have equal quantiles.
OBI:0200028.label: quantile transformation

OBI:0000498.definition: An automatic cleaning system for NMR tubes that removes previous probe and sample residues in order to allow for tube recycling.
OBI:0000498.label: NMR tube washing system

OBI:0000499.definition: A component of an NMR instrument that controls the activities of the other components.
OBI:0000499.label: NMR console

OBI:0200168.definition: A correction objective is a data transformation objective where the aim is to correct for error, noise or other impairments to the input of the data transformation or derived from the data transformation itself
OBI:0200168.label: correction objective

OBI:0000492.definition: The Bruker Automatic Sample Changer (B-ACS 60/120), used in conjunction with Bruker DISNMR, UXNMR or XWIN-NMR software, provides dialog-guided facilities which allow the user to easily and effectively perform automatic (continuous) experiments. Features include a 60 or 120 sample capacity, random accessing of samples, positive sample identification with the optional bar code reader, and temperature control of individual samples with the optional sample heater unit.
OBI:0000492.label: Bruker B-ACS system

OBI:0000493.definition: A rapid resolution column is a chromatography column as marketed by Agilent, which is used with a rapid resolution cartridge to ensure a fast chromatography process with good separation resolution.
OBI:0000493.label: rapid resolution column

OBI:0000490.definition: A cation exchange column is a chromatography column that is used in cation exchange chromatography.
OBI:0000490.label: cation exchange column

OBI:0000491.definition: An NMR probe designed to allow the direct detection of acquisition nuclei.
OBI:0000491.label: direct detection NMR probe

OBI:0000496.definition: A capillary column is a thin tube with a small inner diameter, usually around 0.5 mm.
OBI:0000496.label: capillary column

OBI:0000497.definition: The column inlet (or injector) provides the means to introduce a sample into a continuous flow of carrier gas. The inlet is a piece of hardware attached to the column head.
OBI:0000497.label: sample inlet

OBI:0000494.definition: Designed to perform capillary LC with injection of sample volumes ranging from nL to L.
OBI:0000494.label: liquid chromatography autosampler

OBI:0000495.definition: A degassing system used for degassing solvents in liquid chromatography. Dissolved gasses, usually nitrogen and oxygen from the air, tend to be evolved in the mobile phase as the pressure is reduced when the mobile phase leaves the liquid chromatography column and enters the detector. Gasses in the mobile phase in the detector can produce completely unacceptable noise and, thus, must be removed. The dissolved gasses were originally removed under vacuum but, unfortunately, are soon replaced if the solvent is left in contact with air at atmospheric pressure. For this reason degassing is now usually carried out by bubbling helium through the mobile phase reservoirs. Secondly, vacuum is used in the thermionic detector. This consists of a device, very similar in design to the thermionic valve which is attached to a vacuum and a small quantity of the eluent from a gas chromatography column allowed to bleed through it. Helium is used as the carrier gas. The presence of solute vapor causes the thermionic current to fall. This type of detector tends to become contaminated rather readily.
OBI:0000495.label: vacuum degasser

OBI:0000944.definition: An assay that measures the unequal distribution of fine motor skill between the left and right hands typically in human subjects by means of some questionnaire and scoring procedure.
OBI:0000944.label: handedness assay

OBI:0000945.definition: A device  that supports another device such as a precision instrument by isolating it from vibration that is transmitted from the floor.
OBI:0000945.label: vibration isolation table

OBI:0000946.definition: a function to remove viable organisms from an input material
OBI:0000946.label: sterilization function

OBI:0000129.definition: A reference substance role that is realized when characteristics or responses elicited by the bearer are used to ensure an instrument is within protocol specification of accuracy or performance
OBI:0000129.label: calibration substance role

OBI:0000940.definition: A microscope that produces an image of an object by targeting it with an electro-magnetic beam in the visible frequency range
OBI:0000940.label: optical microscope

OBI:0000941.definition: a role which inheres in a person who uses a service
OBI:0000941.label: service consumer role

OBI:0000942.definition: is the injection of a material entity (bearing the administered substance role) into the dermis (bearing the target role) of an organism using a syringe
OBI:0000942.label: intradermal injection

OBI:0000943.definition: chemical cleavage is a protocol application relying on a chemical compound to cause the fragmentation of an input material that is susceptible to that chemical agent
OBI:0000943.label: chemical cleavage

OBI:0600048.definition: The process of creating a copy of some biological entity in cell culture
OBI:0600048.label: vector mediated amplification

OBI:0000948.definition: A device that measures and displayes signal voltages, usually as a two-dimensional graph of one or more electrical potential differences (vertical axis) plotted as a function of time or of some other voltage (horizontal axis).
OBI:0000948.label: oscilloscope

OBI:0000949.definition: is realized in a planned process where the bearer participates
OBI:0000949.label: accessed material role

OBI:0000125.definition: A measurement datum measuring the number of analysis events lost due to errors in data acquisition electronic coincidence in a flow cytometer instrument. The datum has a qualitative role.
OBI:0000125.label: number of lost events electronic

OBI:0001166.definition: a study design in which the accuracy or the quality of the result of an assay is checked by comparing with real time PCR results
OBI:0001166.label: validation by real time PCR design

OBI:0200054.definition: A network graph quality calculation in which an input data set of subgraph modules and their in-degree and out-degree qualities is used to calculate the average modularity of subgraphs within the network.
OBI:0200054.label: global modularity calculation

OBI:0001437.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001437.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 9 production by T cells

OBI:0001436.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytotoxic T cell degranulation assay that detects granzyme B release by T cells.
OBI:0001436.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific granzyme B release by T cells

OBI:0200055.definition: A dye swap merge is a replicate analysis which takes as input data from paired two-channel microarray assays where the sample labeled with one dye in the first assay is labeled with the other dye in the second assay and vice versa. The output for each reporter is obtained by combining its (raw or possibly pre-processed) M values in the two assays, where the M value in an assay is defined as the difference of the log intensities in the two channels. This can be used as a normalization step, when appropriate assumptions are met.
OBI:0200055.label: dye swap merge

OBI:0000788.definition: A complex of two or more linked MHC molecules including a fluorescent label that can be loaded with a ligand, and is used in flow cytometry assay to bind to T cell receptors of T cells specific for the ligand
OBI:0000788.label: fluorescently labeled MHC multimer

OBI:0200056.definition: A moving average is a data transformation in which center calculations, usually mean calculations, are performed on values within a sliding window across the input data set.
OBI:0200056.label: moving average

GO:0006955.definition: Any immune system process that functions in the calibrated response of an organism to a potential internal or invasive threat.
GO:0006955.label: immune response

IAO:0000310.definition: A collection of information content entities intended to be understood together as a whole
IAO:0000310.label: document

IAO:0000311.definition: A document that has been accepted by a publisher
IAO:0000311.label: publication

IAO:0000312.definition: A publication that is about an investigation
IAO:0000312.label: publication about an investigation

IAO:0000313.definition: A document that has been accepted by a patent authority
IAO:0000313.label: patent

IAO:0000314.definition: an information content entity that is part of a document
IAO:0000314.label: document part

IAO:0000315.definition: A summary of the entire document that is substantially smaller than the document it summarizes.  It is about the document it summarizes.
IAO:0000315.label: abstract

IAO:0000316.definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the objective specification (why the investigation is being done)
IAO:0000316.label: introduction to a publication about an investigation

IAO:0000317.definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the study design of the investigation
IAO:0000317.label: methods section

IAO:0000318.definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about a study design execution
IAO:0000318.label: results section

IAO:0000319.definition: A part of a publication about an investigation that is about the study interpretation of the investigation
IAO:0000319.label: discussion section of a publication about an investigation

OBI:0200057.definition: A replicate analysis is a data transformation in which data from replicates are combined, e.g. through descriptive statistics calculations, and the results might be utilized for a variety of purposes, like assessing reproducibility, identifying outliers, normalizing, etc.
OBI:0200057.label: replicate analysis

IAO:0000012.definition: A digital entity is an information entity which is a collection of bits that can be interpreted by a computer. Two digital entities are the same if they are bitwise identical.
IAO:0000012.label: obsolete2_digital entity

OBI:0400098.definition: The SomaScope is an instrument to quantify somatic cells in milk.
OBI:0400098.label: SomaScope

OBI:0000957.definition: An assay where a person makes a statement that indicates what handedness he has from a choice of different categories.
OBI:0000957.label: self reported handedness assessment

OBI:0100026.definition: A material entity that is an individual living system, such as animal, plant, bacteria or virus, that is capable of replicating or reproducing, growth and maintenance in the right environment. An organism may be unicellular or made up, like humans, of many billions of cells divided into specialized tissues and organs.
OBI:0100026.label: organism

OBI:0200015.definition: A loess global transformation two-channel is a loess global transformation in the special case where the input the result of an MA transformation applied to intensities from the two channels of a two-channel assay.
OBI:0200015.label: loess global transformation two-channel

OBI:0000955.definition: A device used in the first step in making electrodes, that applies constant tension on a glass capillary tube and eventually breaks it while heating it; this produces a very fine point on the capillary tube.
OBI:0000955.label: electrode puller

OBI:1000036.definition: a cell lysate is a material entity which is output of a cell lysis process
OBI:1000036.label: cell lysate

OBI:0000784.definition: A 'blue top' test tube that contains anticoagulant for storing blood specimens'
OBI:0000784.label: anticoagulant-containing test tube

OBI:0000953.definition: A specimen that has been intentionally physically modified.
OBI:0000953.label: processed specimen

OBI:0200011.definition: A logical transformation is a data transformation that, for each (one dimensional) real number input x, outputs an approximation (found, e.g. with the Newton's method) to a solution y of the equation S(y)-x=0, where S denotes an s transformation.
OBI:0200011.label: logical transformation

OBI:0000483.definition: The APOLLO is a compact, modular, multiple-DSP, Windows XP Professional-based console that can be equipped with up to 8 DDS-based RF transmitter channels configurable from 2 kHz to 3.5 GHz. Each transmitter channel produces a nominal 1V output and has the most agile frequency, phase and amplitude control of any system on the market. An array of additional options are available including multiple RF transmitters, linear high-power RF amplifiers, digital receiver arrays, low noise figure preamplifiers, a gradient control system, shim unit, MAS spin-speed controller, variable temperature unit, digital lock system and probe/coil interface. With its numerous options, the Apollo can be configured for any NMR, NQR or MRI application.
OBI:0000483.label: APOLLO console

OBI:0000950.definition: a specimen that is output of a paraffin storage process in which specimen is embedded in paraffin
OBI:0000950.label: paraffin specimen

OBI:0200155.definition: A divisive hierarchical clustering is a hierarchical clustering which starts with a single cluster and then successively splits resulting clusters until only clusters of individual objects remain.
OBI:0200155.label: divisive hierarchical clustering

OBI:0200154.definition: An agglomerative hierarchical clustering is a hierarchical clustering which starts with separate clusters and then successively combines these clusters until there is only one cluster remaining.
OBI:0200154.label: agglomerative hierarchical clustering

OBI:0200156.definition: Data partitioning is a data transformation with the objective of partitioning or separating input data into output subsets.
OBI:0200156.label: data partitioning

CHEBI:33250.definition: A chemical entity constituting the smallest component of an element having the chemical properties of the element.
CHEBI:33250.label: atom

OBI:0200018.definition: A loess group transformation one-channel is a loess group transformation in the special case where the input is the result of an MA transformation applied to intensities from two related one-channel assays.
OBI:0200018.label: loess group transformation one-channel

OBI:0002306.definition: A categorical value specification that is a pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of renal cancer following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases. TNM pathologic distant metastasis findings are based on clinical findings supplemented by histopathologic examination of one or more tissue specimens acquired during surgery.
OBI:0002306.label: pathologic distant metastases stage for kidney according to AJCC 7th edition

GO:0010573.definition: The appearance of vascular endothelial growth factor production due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0010573.label: vascular endothelial growth factor production

OBI:0001869.definition: An array that consists of 3-micron silica beads that self assemble in microwells on either of two materials: fiber optic bundles or planar silica slides.
OBI:0001869.label: Illumina BeadChip

OBI:0200150.definition: An MA transformation is a data transformation which takes as input a collection of data points (g_1, r_1), (g_2, r_2), ..., (g_n, r_n)  with the r_i and g_i positive real numbers, and whose output is the collection of data points (A_1, M_1), (A_2, M_2), ..., (A_n, M_n) where, for each i, A_i=(log(g_i)+log(r_i))/2 and M_i=log(r_i)-log(g_i). Here log denotes a logarithmic transformation.
OBI:0200150.label: MA transformation

GO:0001816.definition: The appearance of a cytokine due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0001816.label: cytokine production

OBI:0000959.definition:
A preparation device that uses a vibrating razor blade to cut
through tissue.
OBI:0000959.label: vibrotome

UBERON:0002072.definition: Lowermost layer of the integumentary system in vertebrates. Types of cells that are found in the hypodermis are fibroblasts, adipose cells, and macrophages. It is derived from the mesoderm, but unlike the dermis, it is not derived from the dermatome region of the mesoderm. The hypodermis is used mainly for fat storage[WP].
UBERON:0002072.label: hypodermis

OBI:0200152.definition: The polynomial degree is a feature of a polynomial function defined as the highest power of the polynomial's terms, where the terms of a polynomial are the individual summands with the coefficients omitted.
OBI:0200152.label: polynomial degree

GO:0032609.definition: The appearance of interferon-gamma due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels. Interferon-gamma is also known as type II interferon.
GO:0032609.label: interferon-gamma production

GO:0032608.definition: The appearance of interferon-beta due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032608.label: interferon-beta production

OBI:0002126.definition: A fixed tissue slide specimen that is the output of immunohistochemistry slide staining.
OBI:0002126.label: IHC-stained fixed tissue slide specimen

OBI:0002127.definition: A cell specimen that contains only one cell.
OBI:0002127.label: single cell specimen

OBI:0002120.definition: A cytometry assay where lymphocytes from two individuals are co-cultured with the lymphocytes from one of the allogeneic individuals (Responders) being labeled (with 3H Thymidine or BrdU) and the proliferation of the labeled cells is measured, which is thought to reflect recognition of histocompatibility antigens on the unlabeled cells (stimulators).
OBI:0002120.label: mixed lymphocyte reaction assay

OBI:0002121.definition: A genotyping assay in which the alleles of genes encoding for killer cell immunoglobulin-like receptors are determined.
OBI:0002121.label: killer cell immunoglobulin-like receptor typing assay

OBI:0002122.definition: A genotyping assay in which the alleles of genes encoding for major histocompatibility complex molecules are determined.
OBI:0002122.label: major histocompatibility typing assay

OBI:0002123.definition: A staining using labeled antibodies, i.e. the analytical part of immunohistochemistry. The staining is applied to fixed specimens on slides to identify biomarkers in tissues.
OBI:0002123.label: IHC slide staining

GO:0032601.definition: The appearance of connective tissue growth factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032601.label: connective tissue growth factor production

OBI:0302736.synonyms: SCGE assay;single cell gel electrophoresis assay
OBI:0302736.definition: An assay that measures DNA damage (DNA breakage) in eucaryotic cells exposed to a challenge by determining the size and shape of DNA migration by detecting fluorescently labeled DNA from a cell placed in an electric field using gel electrophoresis
OBI:0302736.label: comet assay

OBI:0302737.synonyms: polymerase chain reaction-single strand conformation polymorphism assay
OBI:0302737.definition: An assay that identifies DNA sequence variation (mutation, deletion, insertions) in target DNA sequences amplified using polymerase chain reaction using gel electrophoresis and denaturating conditions
OBI:0302737.label: PCR-SSCP assay

GO:0032605.definition: The appearance of hepatocyte growth factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032605.label: hepatocyte growth factor production

OBI:0302731.definition: a role which inheres in some molecular entity realized during the process of buffering
OBI:0302731.label: buffer role

GO:0032607.definition: The appearance of interferon-alpha due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032607.label: interferon-alpha production

OBI:0302733.definition: solute role is a role played by a chemical entity which is dissolved by another chemical entity (the solvent) when creating a solution
OBI:0302733.label: solute role

PATO:0000011.definition: A time quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of how long the bearer has existed.
PATO:0000011.label: age

PATO:0000018.definition: A luminous flux quality inhering in a bearer by virtue of the bearer's emitting longer wavelength light following the absorption of shorter wavelength radiation; fluorescence is common with aromatic compounds with several rings joined together.
PATO:0000018.label: fluorescence

SO:0001248.definition: A region of the genome of known length that is composed by ordering and aligning two or more different regions.
SO:0001248.label: assembly

OBI:0002546.definition: A specimen that is derived from liver.
OBI:0002546.label: liver specimen

OBI:0002547.definition: A specimen that is derived from minor salivary gland.
OBI:0002547.label: minor salivary gland specimen

OBI:0002544.definition: A specimen that is derived from the esophagogastric junction.
OBI:0002544.label: esophagogastric junction specimen

OBI:0002545.definition: A specimen that is derived from ileum.
OBI:0002545.label: ileum specimen

OBI:0002542.definition: A specimen that is derived from aorta.
OBI:0002542.label: aorta specimen

OBI:0002543.definition: A specimen that is derived from the atrium auricular region.
OBI:0002543.label: atrial appendage specimen

OBI:0002540.definition: A specimen that is derived from coronary artery.
OBI:0002540.label: coronary artery specimen

OBI:0002541.definition: A specimen that is derived from spleen.
OBI:0002541.label: spleen specimen

OBI:0600063.definition: vector mediated expression sis the generation of copies of biomaterial by in a cell_culture modified for this purpose by insertion of an expression vector
OBI:0600063.label: vector mediated expression

OBI:0001956.definition: An assay that produces data about protein-DNA interaction or DNA epigenetic modification using immunoprecipitation
OBI:0001956.label: assay using chromatin immunoprecipitation

OBI:0002548.definition: A specimen that is derived from omentum.
OBI:0002548.label: omentum specimen

OBI:0002549.definition: A specimen that is derived from female gonad.
OBI:0002549.label: ovary specimen

OBI:0002058.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects oncostatin M production by T cells.
OBI:0002058.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific oncostatin M production by T cells

OBI:0002059.definition: A T cell epitope recognition assay that quantitavely characterizes the binding of a TCR with a ligand by determining a binding constant.
OBI:0002059.label: assay measuring a binding constant of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

OBI:0200066.definition: a data transformation that performs more than one hypothesis test simultaneously, a closed-test procedure, that  controls the familywise error rate for all the k hypotheses at level α in the strong sense. Objective: multiple testing correction
OBI:0200066.label: Holm-Bonferroni family-wise error rate correction method

GO:0035746.definition: The appearance of granzyme A due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0035746.label: granzyme A production

OBI:0002050.definition: A MHC:ligand binding assay that uses a 3D structure determination of bound complex assay.
OBI:0002050.label: 3D structure determining assay of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0002051.definition: A B cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on pathogen burden.
OBI:0002051.label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from infectious challenge based on pathogen burden

OBI:0002052.definition: A B cell epitope in vivo intervention experiment that uses a protection from challenge in vivo intervention experiment based on tumor burden.
OBI:0002052.label: in vivo assay measuring B cell epitope specific protection from tumor challenge

OBI:0002053.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a microarray.
OBI:0002053.label: microarray assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0002054.definition: A B cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a nuclear magnetic resonance assay.
OBI:0002054.label: NMR assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a B cell epitope:antibody complex
