GO:0034343.definition: The appearance of type III interferon due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels. Interferon lambda is the only member of the type III interferon found so far.
GO:0034343.label: type III interferon production

OBI:0002056.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects production of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells.
OBI:0002056.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 17 production by T cells

OBI:0002057.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells.
OBI:0002057.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific macrophage migration inhibitory factor (MIF) production by T cells

OBI:0200049.definition: A data transformation in which the Benjamini and Yekutieli method is applied with the aim of correcting false discovery rate
OBI:0200049.label: Benjamini and Yekutieli false discovery rate correction method

GO:0072535.definition: The appearance of tumor necrosis factor superfamily member 11 (TNFSF11; RANKL) due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0072535.label: tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production

OBI:0001957.definition: A study design that aims to compare different types of hardware for performance, reproducibility, accuracy and precision.
OBI:0001957.label: hardware testing design

OBI:1110015.definition: Process of administering an object playing the role of immunogen to a living organism
OBI:1110015.label: Immunization in vivo

OBI:0002438.definition: An assay that detects the proximity of chromosomal DNA through the use of a ligation reaction in isolated nuclei.
OBI:0002438.label: nuclear ligation assay

OBI:0002439.definition: A nuclear ligation assay that detects chromosomal interactions between any two genomic loci. Chromatin segments are cross-linked, cut by restriction enzymes, ligated, and finally analyzed by PCR.
OBI:0002439.label: chromosome conformation capture assay

OBI:0002432.definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of sex with someone who has been diagnosed or at risk for a blood borne infections disease in a specified time frame, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002432.label: history of sex with someone with a history of blood borne infection  exclusion criterion

OBI:0002433.definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of sex with someone who has used intravenous drugs in a specified time frame, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002433.label: history of sex with someone with a history of intravenous drugs exclusion criterion

OBI:0002430.definition: An exclusion criterion defined as whether an individual has ever been diagnosed with metastatic cancer (cancer that spread beyond the initial site such as to other organs like brain bone or liver), which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002430.label: history of metastatic cancer exclusion criterion

OBI:0002431.definition: An exclusion criterion defined as when an individual has a history of intravenous drug abuse for a specific timeframe, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002431.label: intravenous drug use exclusion criterion

OBI:0002436.definition: An assay that identifies RNA binding proteins by cross-linking RNA and proteins with UV light, then purifying the bound complexes by oligo(dT) capture. Finally, the complexes are analyzed by mass spectrometry.
OBI:0002436.label: RNA interactome capture

OBI:0002437.definition: A fluorescence microscopy technique where the specimen under investigation is fully bathed in light, as opposed to confocal microscopy in which only a small portion of the specimen is illuminated.
OBI:0002437.label: widefield microscopy

OBI:0002434.definition: An exclusion criterion defined  as whether an individual has a history of repeatedly reactive screening assays for HIV-1 or HIV-2 antibody regardless of the results of supplemental assays, which if met, makes the individual unsuitable for a given task or participation in a given process.
OBI:0002434.label: HIV exclusion criterion

OBI:0001046.definition: A device or system that supports a biologically active environment. ALAN SAYS NOT AN INSTRUMENT
OBI:0001046.label: bioreactor

OBI:0000252.definition: a cohort role is a biological replicate role played by a group of study participants who share a common characteristic of interest to the study.
OBI:0000252.label: cohort role

OBI:0001706.definition: A B cell epitope recognition assay that detects biological activity.
OBI:0001706.label: assay measuring B cell epitope specific biological activity

OBI:0000801.definition: A measurement datum which represents information about an ordered series of action potentials in an organism's CNS measured over time.
OBI:0000801.label: spike train datum

OBI:0000800.definition: A process in which bonds are created that link one polymer to another
OBI:0000800.label: cross linking

OBI:0000803.definition: Is a process in which the tertiary or secondary structure of a polymer is disrupted
OBI:0000803.label: denaturing

OBI:0000802.definition: An assay that measures the prothrombin ratio, which is the prothrombin time for a patient, divided by the result for control plasma. Most commonly the test is preformed using blood plasma. Blood is drawn into a test tube containing liquid citrate, which acts as an anticoagulant. An excess of calcium is added to enable the blood to clot again.Tissue factor (also known as factor III or thromboplastin) is added, and the time the sample takes to clot is measured optically as the prothrombin time, which is compared to a control sample.
OBI:0000802.label: prothrombin time assay

OBI:0000805.definition: An antithrombin-III (AT-III) assay in which exogenous bovine thrombin and heparin are added to test plasma to form a thrombin-heparin-AT complex. The residual thrombin not bound then hydrolyzes the p-nitroalanine substrate to produce a yellow color, which is read at 405 nm. The intensity of color produced is inversely proportional to the AT present. A calibration is done with standard human plasma reagent and results for a given specimen are reported as a percentage relative to the standard
OBI:0000805.label: antithrombin-III berichrome assay

OBI:0000804.definition: A process in which an investigator is made aware of which study arm that a patient is participating in, for example whether they are receiving a placebo or a treatment with an investigational compound.
OBI:0000804.label: informing investigator of subject study arm

OBI:0000807.definition: a planned process in which an organism is exposed to some stimulus with the intent to invoke an action
OBI:0000807.label: presentation of stimulus

OBI:0000806.definition: An objective specification maintains some or all of the qualities of a material over time.
OBI:0000806.label: material maintenance objective

OBI:0000809.definition: DNA that has been produced in an enzymatic amplification process
OBI:0000809.label: amplified DNA

OBI:0000808.definition: An assay that quantitatively measures heparin in human plasma using Factor Xa and Antithrombin III in excess, where the rate of Factor Xa inhibition is directly proportional to the heparin concentration. The residual Factor Xa activity, measured with a Factor Xa-specific chromogenic substrate, is inversely proportional to the heparin concentration.
OBI:0000808.label: spectrolyse heparin antifactor-Xa assay

OBI:0001824.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-18 production by T cells that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001824.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-18 production by T cells

OBI:0001825.definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001825.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 19 production by T cells

OBI:0001048.definition: An image acquisition device that takes video or still photographs, or both, digitally by recording images via an electronic image sensor.
OBI:0001048.label: digital camera

OBI:0001049.definition: A device for dropping and immobilizing a solution of biomolecules, for example, nucleic acids such as probe DNA, mRNA, and peptide nucleic acid (PNA), and proteins on a DNA microarray surface to manufacture a DNA microarray.
OBI:0001049.label: chip spotting device

OBI:0001820.definition: A process of chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001820.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-X-C motif) ligand 16 production by T cells

OBI:0001821.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001821.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-22 production by T cells

OBI:0001822.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells that uses an ELISPOT assay.
OBI:0001822.label: ELISPOT assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-23 production by T cells

OBI:0001823.definition: A process of chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001823.label: epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 21 production by T cells

OBI:0001042.definition: a transfer unction where the transfer requires work to move the entity, often against a gradient.
OBI:0001042.label: pump function

OBI:0001043.definition: is a transfer function that displaces cells from one place to another
OBI:0001043.label: cell transfer function

OBI:0001040.definition: A current amplification function is an amplification function that increases the amplitude of a current.
OBI:0001040.label: current amplification function

OBI:0001041.definition: A stabilization function is a function that holds or isolates an entity such as an instrument or specimen steadfast or at an unfluctuating level or quantity.
OBI:0001041.label: stabilization function

OBI:0001828.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells that uses a cytometric bead array assay.
OBI:0001828.label: cytometric bead array assay measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells

OBI:0001047.definition: A device that is used to measure the pH (acidity or alkalinity) of a liquid.
OBI:0001047.label: pH meter

OBI:0001044.definition: A device that records the patterns of pulse waves inside blood vessels.
OBI:0001044.label: angiograph

OBI:0001045.definition: A device that is used to transfer nucleic acids from agarose gels onto a membrane, based on the movement of buffer from a reservoir through the gel and the blotting membrane to a stack of dry blotting paper by capillary force. The molecules are carried to the blotting membrane on which they are adsorbed.
OBI:0001045.label: capillary blotter

OBI:0000799.definition: Recombinant phage cloning is the process of using a phage plus some insert nucleic acid for the purposes of amplification of the insert material achieved by phage assembly in vitro.
OBI:0000799.label: recombinant phage cloning

OBI:0001310.definition: A study design that assays differences between distinct species.
OBI:0001310.label: species comparison design

OBI:0001311.definition: A T cell epitope 3D structure determination assay that uses an X-ray crystallography assay.
OBI:0001311.label: X-ray crystallography assay determining the 3D structure of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

OBI:0001316.definition: A process of interleukin-21 production by T cells resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001316.label: epitope specific interleukin-21 production by T cells

OBI:0001317.definition: A T cell epitope qualitative binding assay that uses a cell-cell binding detection by flow cytometry assay.
OBI:0001317.label: flow cytometry assay measuring cell-cell binding of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

OBI:0001314.definition: A process of T cell enhancement of B cell mediated immune response resulting from the recognition of a T cell epitope.
OBI:0001314.label: epitope specific T cell enhancement of B cell mediated immune response

OBI:0001315.definition: An assay of epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells that uses an ELISA.
OBI:0001315.label: ELISA measuring epitope specific chemokine (C-C motif) ligand 1 production by T cells

OBI:0000791.definition: A multiple testing correction objectives is a data transformation objective where the aim is to correct for a set of statistical inferences considered simultaneously
OBI:0000791.label: multiple testing correction objective

OBI:0000790.definition: Recombinant BAC cloning is a  process with the objective to insert genetic material into an F plasmid based bacterial artificial chromosome for future replication of the inserted material
OBI:0000790.label: recombinant BAC cloning

OBI:0000793.definition: A double blind study execution is defined as any study execution in which neither the subjects nor the investigators are informed of which study arm the subjects are part of during the portion of the trial when the subjects are being treated
OBI:0000793.label: double blind study execution

OBI:0001319.definition: An assay of epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells that uses a cell culture analyte detection bioassay.
OBI:0001319.label: cell culture analyte detection bioassay measuring epitope specific interferon-gamma production by T cells

OBI:0000795.definition: A measurement device with the function to measure and record the level/amount of glucose in a blood sample
OBI:0000795.label: glucometer

OBI:0000797.definition: The primary structure of a protein that is completely defined by the set of its amino acid residue parts and the linear order induced by the peptide bonds that hold them together
OBI:0000797.label: obsolete_primary structure of protein

OBI:0000796.definition: The objective to separate a material entity into different compositions of which one or more have are purified fractions that contain higher concentration of a desired component, while others contain impurities and are not of interest
OBI:0000796.label: purification objective

IAO:0000088.definition: a document assembled by an author for the purpose of providing information for the audience. A report is the output of a documenting process and has the objective to be consumed by a specific audience. Topic of the report is on something that has completed. A report is not a single figure. Examples of reports are journal article, patent application, grant progress report, case report (not patient record)
IAO:0000088.label: report

UBERON:0001225.definition: Outer cortical portion of the kidney, between the renal capsule and the renal medulla.
UBERON:0001225.label: cortex of kidney

IAO:0000642.definition: A textual entity that expresses the requirements necessary to use a resource, e.g. software.
IAO:0000642.label: requirements textual entity

IAO:0000643.definition: A textual entity documenting statistical analysis tools and techniques employed.
IAO:0000643.label: statistical analysis textual entity

IAO:0000640.definition: A textual entity that discusses work from other publications and expresses their relevancy to the content of a document.
IAO:0000640.label: related work textual entity

IAO:0000641.definition: A part of a document about a resource described in the document, e.g. software, that describes the requirements necessary to use the resource, e.g. operating systems, hardware, etc. in the case of a software resource.
IAO:0000641.label: requirements section

IAO:0000644.definition: A part of the document used to describe the statistical methodologies employed in the work presented in the document.
IAO:0000644.label: statistical analysis section

IAO:0000645.definition: A part of a document that contains one or more tables.
IAO:0000645.label: tables section

OBI:0001958.definition: A study design for identifying in the literature prior studies of a pre-determined phenomenon or set of related phenomena according to certain criteria, extracting findings from these studies, and summarizing these findings and/or attempting to draw new conclusions from them which were not justified by any of the individual, prior studies. Many systematic reviews also assess the quality of the studies so reviewed.
OBI:0001958.label: systematic review study design

OBI:0001959.definition: a planned process which consists in running a set of samples as a pool in one single instrument run of data acquisition process while retaining the ability to associate individual results to each of the individual input samples thanks to the use of a multiplex identifier, introduced during the ligation step of the individual library preparation and specific to a given sample.
OBI:0001959.label: sequencing library multiplexing

OBI:0001228.definition: A T cell epitope specific helper activity assay that detects the ability of a T cell epitope to enhance an antibody response.
OBI:0001228.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific helper T cell enhancement of a B cell mediated immune response

OBI:0001229.definition: A T cell epitope equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) determination assay that uses a surface plasmon resonance assay.
OBI:0001229.label: plasmon resonance assay measuring the dissociation constant [KD] of a T cell epitope:MHC:TCR complex

OBI:0001226.definition: A study design in which some aspect of the organism's environmental history is studied, such as exposure to teratogen, radiation, climate etc.
OBI:0001226.label: environmental history design

OBI:0001951.definition: A short oligonucleotide complementary to target DNA (5'->3' on minus strand) that acts as the leader for DNA extension in a PCR reaction. The polymerase starts replication at the 3'-end of the primer, and copies the opposite strand. A primer is characterized by its 'melting temperature' (Tm) and pairs of primers should have similar Tm.
OBI:0001951.label: reverse PCR primer

OBI:0001952.definition: A freezing process by which material entities are quickly frozen by subjecting them to cryogenic temperatures, or in direct contact with Liquid nitrogen at -320.8F or -196°C.
OBI:0001952.label: flash freezing

OBI:0001953.definition: A planned process in which a material entity has it's temperature lowered to below the freezing point in order to bring it to a state in which it can be maintained at this lower temperature in order to preserve some of its qualities.
OBI:0001953.label: freezing

OBI:0001954.definition: An assay in which portions of chromatin, the ordered and organized complex of DNA and its interaction partners that make up a chormosome, is extracted and purified by immunoprecipitation with antibodies or tags, and subsequently analyzed
OBI:0001954.label: ChIP assay

OBI:0001955.definition: A positive reference substance role that inheres in a material entity that is known to bind to a target entity, and that is realized in a competitive binding assay that has as specified input the target entity, an evaluant and the positive reference substance, where the binding of the evaluant to the target is measured based on the evaluant's ability to compete with the positive reference substance for binding to the target.
OBI:0001955.label: competitive binding reference ligand role

OBI:0001220.definition: An assay of epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells that uses a cell culture analyte detection bioassay.
OBI:0001220.label: cell culture analyte detection bioassay measuring epitope specific interleukin-10 production by T cells

OBI:0001221.definition: A ChIP-ChIP assay in which immunoprecipitated chromatin is run on a SNP array to detect polymorphism specific DNA elements in the isolated chromatin
OBI:0001221.label: ChIP-chip by SNP array assay

GO:0033036.definition: Any process in which a macromolecule is transported to, or maintained in, a specific location.
GO:0033036.label: macromolecule localization

OBI:0000579.definition: The predecessor series of the Varian UNITY INOVA spectrometer.
OBI:0000579.label: Varian UNITY spectrometer

GO:0036262.definition: The appearance of granulysin due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0036262.label: granulysin production

OBI:0000575.definition: An NMR magnet manufactured by Bruker for Ultra-High Field NMR, available from 750 MHz to 900 MHz, which provides reliable operation at reduced temperature and ambient pressure via being rigidly mounted and stabilized.
OBI:0000575.label: Bruker Ultrastabilized NMR magnet

OBI:0000574.definition: A high temperature column is a chromatography column which is suitable for and withstands very high temperatures in chromatography ovens.
OBI:0000574.label: high temperature column

OBI:0000577.definition: A concentration is a relational quality that inheres in a material entity towards molecular scattered aggregate that is part of it by virtue of some ratio of masses of the two or the counts of the grains of the two or volume occupied by the larger material entity.
OBI:0000577.label: obsolete_molecular concentration

OBI:0000576.definition: a material entity that consists of all the molecules of a specific type that are located in some bounded region and which is part of a more massive material entity that has parts that are other such aggregates
OBI:0000576.label: scattered molecular aggregate

OBI:0000571.definition: Manufacturer role is a role which inheres in a person or organization and which is realized by a manufacturing process.
OBI:0000571.label: manufacturer role

OBI:0000570.definition: A spin column is a chromatography column which is suitable for putting it into a centrifuge. A spin column enforces separation through increased G-forces while spinning the column in a centrifuge. It is often used in DNA gel extraction kits.
OBI:0000570.label: spin column

OBI:0000573.definition: A pump system optimized for gradient chromatography.
OBI:0000573.label: gradient pump system

OBI:0000572.definition: A combination of devices that are used in connection with a sampling head for transferring components of an applied sample to the analyzing part of a chromatography system.
OBI:0000572.label: transfer line

OBI:0001554.definition: A scalar measurement datum that represents the number of events occuring over a time interval
OBI:0001554.label: rate measurement datum

OBI:0001555.definition: A MHC binding qualitative binding to ligand assay using MHC in a purified MHC molecule preparation.
OBI:0001555.label: purified MHC binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0001556.definition: A cell lysate MHC binding assay that uses radioactivity detection to detect direct binding.
OBI:0001556.label: cell lysate MHC direct binding assay of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001557.definition: A storage service in which a service consumer provides some material as input which a service provider stores and returns as output.
OBI:0001557.label: material storage service

OBI:0001550.definition: A MHC binding qualitative binding to ligand assay measuring MHC ligand binding using MHC present on cells.
OBI:0001550.label: cell bound MHC binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex

OBI:0001551.definition: A service in which a service consumer receives the right to use a resource (instrument, database, software, etc) that is owned or managed by a service provider.  Ownership of the accessed resource remains with the service provider during and after provision of service.
OBI:0001551.label: access service

OBI:0001552.definition: A T cell epitope specific tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production assay that uses an intracellular cytokine staining assay.
OBI:0001552.label: intracellular cytokine staining assay measuring epitope specific tumor necrosis factor (ligand) superfamily member 11 production by T cells

IAO:0000610.definition: A textual entity, distinct from the abstract, that describes the significance and broader context of the document content. The author summary is often written in a non-technical manner and is aimed at both scientists and non-scientist readers, e.g as described in the article submission guidelines for PLoS Genetics (http://journals.plos.org/plosgenetics/s/submission-guidelines).
IAO:0000610.label: author summary textual entity

OBI:0001558.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001558.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

OBI:0001559.definition: A cell bound MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses fluorescence detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001559.label: cell bound MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using fluorescence detection

OBI:0000978.definition: An assay in which a measurement is made by observing entities located in a container.
OBI:0000978.label: in container assay

OBI:0000971.definition: a specimen that is output of a specimen creation process used for an investigation without storage.
OBI:0000971.label: fresh specimen

OBI:0000970.definition: A measurement datum which is the result of combining multiple datum. For example, a mean or summary score.
OBI:0000970.label: scalar score from composite inputs

OBI:0000973.definition: A measurement datum that representing the primary structure of a macromolecule(it's sequence) sometimes associated with an indicator of confidence of that measurement.
OBI:0000973.label: sequence data

OBI:0200035.definition: Bootstrapping is a statistical method for estimating the sampling distribution of a statistic by sampling with replacement from the original data, most often with the purpose of deriving robust estimates of standard errors and confidence intervals of a population parameter like a mean, median, proportion, odds ratio, correlation coefficient or regression coefficient
OBI:0200035.label: boostrapping

OBI:0200032.definition: K-fold cross-validation randomly partitions the original sample into K subsamples. Of the K subsamples, a single subsample is retained as the validation data for testing the model, and the remaining K - 1 subsamples are used as training data. The cross-validation process is then repeated K times (the folds), with each of the K subsamples used exactly once as the validation data. The K results from the folds then can be averaged (or otherwise combined) to produce a single estimation. The advantage of this method over repeated random sub-sampling is that all observations are used for both training and validation, and each observation is used for validation exactly once. 10-fold cross-validation is commonly used
OBI:0200032.label: K-fold cross validation method

OBI:0200033.definition: is a data transformation :  leave-one-out cross-validation (LOOCV) involves using a single observation from the original sample as the validation data, and the remaining observations as the training data. This is repeated such that each observation in the sample is used once as the validation data
OBI:0200033.label: leave one out cross validation method

OBI:0001974.synonyms: Ion 314 Chip;Ion PGM 314 Chip v2;Ion PGM 314 Chip
OBI:0001974.definition:
An ion semiconductor chip manufactured by Life Technologies which detects polymerase-driven base incorporation to translate into digital form. The 314 chip is compatible with the Ion Torrent PGM and has a run time of:

2.3 hours for 200 bp reads with an output of 30-50 Mb,
3.7 hours for 400 bp reads with an output of 60-100 Mb.
OBI:0001974.label: Ion 314 Chip v2

IAO:0000614.definition: A textual entity that expresses a detailed account of a portion of the medical history for a specific patient.
IAO:0000614.label: case report textual entity

OBI:0000158.definition: an eSource document is a digital document consisting of a logical collection of Source data and other eSource documents that can be presented in an ordered way and capture the time of completion, change, and any signatures
OBI:0000158.label: eSource document

OBI:0000154.definition: the role of a organization that is realized by members reviewing study designs for their agreement with regulations
OBI:0000154.label: role of Institutional Review Board

OBI:0000153.definition: A material combination in which cell cultures of two or more different types are are combined and allowed to culture as one.
OBI:0000153.label: cell co-culturing

OBI:0000927.definition: a storage process with input material entity and output freeze dried material for long time storage
OBI:0000927.label: lyophilization storage

OBI:0000151.definition: a device manufacture with the intent to provide a porous unsized paper used for filtering.
OBI:0000151.label: filter paper

OBI:0001715.definition: A competitive inhibition of binding assay using a assay
OBI:0001715.label: obsolete B cell epitope competitive binding assay

OBI:0200041.definition: A k-means clustering is a data transformation which achieves a class discovery or partitioning objective, which takes as input a collection of objects (represented as points in multidimensional space) and which partitions them into a specified number k of clusters. The algorithm attempts to find the centers of natural clusters in the data. The most common form of the algorithm starts by partitioning the input points into k initial sets, either at random or using some heuristic data. It then calculates the mean point, or centroid, of each set. It constructs a new partition by associating each point with the closest centroid. Then the centroids are recalculated for the new clusters, and the algorithm repeated by alternate applications of these two steps until convergence, which is obtained when the points no longer switch clusters (or alternatively centroids are no longer changed).
OBI:0200041.label: k-means clustering

OBI:0000377.definition: A perturb function is a function that disrupts the normal function of a system induced through either internal or external means.  External means of perturbation include: (1) displacement fields in the physical sense - e.g., temperature change, osmotic shock, pressure change; (2) application of small molecules such as drugs or toxins to perturb the function of specific pathways or application of surfactants to perturb the normal function of plasma membrane.  Internal means of perturbation include: (1) manipulation of gene function via gene knockout or transcript knockdown via RNAi; (2) directed genetic mutation leading to minimal aa alterations that interfere with peptide function.
OBI:0000377.label: perturb function

GO:0044807.definition: The appearance of macrophage migration inhibitory factor due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0044807.label: macrophage migration inhibitory factor production

OBI:0000375.definition: A freeze function is a function to decrease the internal kinetic energy of a material below the freezing point of that type of material.
OBI:0000375.label: freeze function

OBI:0000374.definition: A excitation function is a function  to inject energy by bombarding a material with energetic particles (e.g., photons) thereby imbuing internal material components such as electrons with additional energy.  These internal, 'excited' particles may lead to the rupturing of covalent chemical bonds or may quickly relax back to there unexcited state with an exponential time course thereby locally emitting energy in the form of photons.
OBI:0000374.label: excitation function

OBI:0000373.definition: a physical process of converting an atom or molecule into an ion by adding or removing charged particles such as electrons or other ions. This excludes chemical processes of dissociation.
OBI:0000373.label: ionize process

OBI:0000372.definition: A material separation function is a function that increases the resolution between two or more material entities. The  to distinction between the entities is usually based on some associated physical quality.
OBI:0000372.label: material separation function

OBI:0000371.definition: A heat function is a function that increases the internal kinetic energy of a material
OBI:0000371.label: heat function

OBI:0000370.definition: A contain function is a function to constrain a material entities location in space
OBI:0000370.label: contain function

GO:0044808.definition: The appearance of Oncostatin M due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0044808.label: Oncostatin M production

OBI:0000378.definition: A filter function is a function to prevent the flow of certain entities based on a quality or qualities of the entity while allowing entities which have different qualities to pass through
OBI:0000378.label: filter function

OBI:0302899.definition: decapitation is a process by which the head of a living organism is physically removed from the body, usually resulting in rapid death (in the case of Rhodnius prolixus, it might take a bit longer..)
OBI:0302899.label: decapitation

OBI:0302898.definition: intentional overdosing is a process by which an excess dose of a chemical compound is given with the intent of causing death
OBI:0302898.label: intentional overdosing

UBERON:0001088.definition: Excretion that is the output of a kidney
UBERON:0001088.label: urine

UBERON:0001089.definition: Secretion produced by a sweat gland.
UBERON:0001089.label: sweat

OBI:0302891.definition: trypsination is a protease cleavage which uses enzyme trypsin to act on proteins present in an input material entity
OBI:0302891.label: trypsination

OBI:0302890.definition: polymerization is process by which molecular entity of small mass are aggregated in motifs over the course of a chemical reaction catalyzed by enzymes or other molecular entities acting as catalyst. polymerization results in molecular entity of high molecular weight
OBI:0302890.label: polymerization

OBI:0302893.definition: A maintenance process by which material entities that are not actively metabolizing are placed in well identified location and possibly under controlled environment in ad-hoc devices/structures in order to preserve and protect them from decay/alteration and maintain availability
OBI:0302893.label: storage

OBI:0302892.definition: An enzymatic ligation is a planned process in which molecules  are joined by covalent bonds through the action of an material entity with a ligase activity
OBI:0302892.label: enzymatic ligation

OBI:0302895.definition: electrocution is process by which electric current is applied to a material with quality alive and result the termination of life process.
OBI:0302895.label: electrocution

OBI:0302894.definition: cell lysis is a process by which cell membrane integrity of live cells  is compromised and leads to cell death. Cell lysis may be achieved by means of viral action or osmotic shock.
OBI:0302894.label: cell lysis

OBI:0302897.definition: asphyxiation is a process by which oxygen supplies are restricted (by mechanical, e.g obstructing airways or chemical means, e.g. increasing CO2 partial pressure) resulting in termination of life in oxygen reliant organisms.
OBI:0302897.label: asphyxiation

OBI:0302896.definition: cervical dislocation is a process by which a Vertebrate organism has its life terminated by rupturing spinal cord between cervical vertebrae induced by excessive mechanical torsion
OBI:0302896.label: cervical dislocation

OBI:0200060.definition: A T cell epitope prediction takes as input an antigen sequence, and through an analysis of this sequence, produces as output a prediction of the likelihood the biomaterial is a T cell epitope.
OBI:0200060.label: t cell epitope prediction

HP:0000855.definition: Increased resistance towards insulin, that is, diminished effectiveness of insulin in reducing blood glucose levels.
HP:0000855.label: Insulin resistance

OBI:0000208.definition: Methodology_testing_objective is an objective role carried out by a proposition defining the aim of the study is to examine the effect of using different methodologies.
OBI:0000208.label: methodology testing objective

UBERON:0002048.definition: Respiration organ that develops as an oupocketing of the esophagus.
UBERON:0002048.label: lung

OBI:0000202.definition: A role borne by an entity and that is realized in a process that is part of an investigation in which an objective is achieved. These processes include, among others: planning, overseeing, funding, reviewing.
OBI:0000202.label: investigation agent role

OBI:0000201.definition: An assay that measures the amount of radiation in the radioactive spectrum (alpha, beta or gamma rays) emitted from an input material.
OBI:0000201.label: radioactivity detection

OBI:0000207.definition: a worker role of providing medical care either within or outside the study timeline
OBI:0000207.label: health care provider role

OBI:0000205.definition: Dropout is a study subject role borne by an entity realized by a process of leaving the study earlier than the protocol specified and where the bearer of the dropout role had been borne study subject role prior to bearing dropout role.
OBI:0000205.label: obsolete_dropout role

OBI:0000204.definition: a role that inheres in a material entity and is realized in the use of that material entity by an organism when it is used in that organism's metabolism and provides nourishment.
OBI:0000204.label: nutrient role

IAO:0000325.definition: A part of a document that is about a specific other part of the document.  Usually footnotes are spatially segregated from the rest of the document.
IAO:0000325.label: footnote

IAO:0000324.definition: Part of a publication that is about the contributions of people or institutions other than the authors.
IAO:0000324.label: acknowledgements section

IAO:0000327.definition: A table that relates document parts to specific locations in a document (usually page numbers).  This is also a document part (subsumption there should be inferred).
IAO:0000327.label: table of contents

IAO:0000326.definition: part of a document that is segregated from the rest of the document due to its size
IAO:0000326.label: supplementary material to a document

IAO:0000321.definition: part of a document that enumerates the authors of the document
IAO:0000321.label: author list

IAO:0000320.definition: A part of a document that has citations as parts
IAO:0000320.label: references section

IAO:0000323.definition: A part of a publication that is about the specific contributions of each author
IAO:0000323.label: author contributions section

IAO:0000322.definition: part of a document that has parts that are institution identifications associated with the authors of the document
IAO:0000322.label: institution list

UBERON:0001836.definition: A fluid produced in the oral cavity by salivary glands, typically used in predigestion, but also in other functions.
UBERON:0001836.label: saliva

IAO:0000329.definition: A shorter version of a document title
IAO:0000329.label: running title

IAO:0000328.definition: A table that relates figures in a document to specific locations in that document (usually page numbers).  This is also a document part (subsumption there should be inferred).
IAO:0000328.label: table of figures

OBI:0001648.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses an antibody cross-blocking assay.
OBI:0001648.label: cross blocking assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0200157.definition: Data vector reduction is a data transformation objective in which k m-dimensional input vectors are reduced to j m-dimensional output vectors, where j is smaller than k.
OBI:0200157.label: data vector reduction objective

OBI:0001649.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a radio immuno assay.
OBI:0001649.label: RIA measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0200045.definition: A single linkage hierarchical clustering is an agglomerative hierarchical clustering which generates successive clusters based on a distance measure, where the distance between two clusters is calculated as the minimum distance between objects from the first cluster and objects from the second cluster.
OBI:0200045.label: single linkage hierarchical clustering

PATO:0000146.definition: A physical quality of the thermal energy of a system.
PATO:0000146.label: temperature

OBI:0001645.definition: A B cell epitope qualitative binding to antibody assay that uses a calorimetric binding assay.
OBI:0001645.label: calorimetry assay measuring binding of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0100010.definition: A material entity which results from viral transformation process using EBV as transformation agent when applied to B-cell entity
OBI:0100010.label: Epstein Barr virus transformed B cell

OBI:0100015.definition: An anatomical entity is a material entity that is part of a multicellular organism, and which is large enough so that it forms an identifiable structure in the organism. Specifically, it excludes granular parts of the organism, such as atoms, molecules, cells, which can be removed from the organism without affecting it. It is defined as the union of 'multi-tissue structure', 'body substance' and 'portion of tissue'
OBI:0100015.label: obsolete_anatomical entity

OBI:0001646.definition: A B cell epitope 3D structure determination assay that uses an electron microscopy imaging assay.
OBI:0001646.label: electron microscopy assay determining the 3D structure of a B cell epitope:antibody complex

OBI:0100017.definition: A material entity which derives from blood and corresponds to blood plasma without fibrinogen or the other clotting factors.
OBI:0100017.label: blood serum specimen

OBI:0100016.definition: a material entity which corresponds to the liquid component of blood, in which the blood cells are suspended.
OBI:0100016.label: blood plasma specimen

UBERON:0000995.definition: the female muscular organ of gestation in which the developing embryo or fetus is nourished until birth
UBERON:0000995.label: uterus

OBI:1000029.definition: a phage display library is a collection of materials in which a mixture of genes or gene fragments is expressed and can be individually selected and amplified.
OBI:1000029.label: phage display library

OBI:1000023.definition: Supernatant of a cell culture is a material entity which contains media, supplements, and secreted products of the cells and becomes the environment of cultivated cell.
OBI:1000023.label: cell culture supernatant

OBI:1000024.definition: A material entity which results from the aggregation of cells produced by the application of centrifugal force to a liquid containing cells in suspension
OBI:1000024.label: cell pellet

OBI:0001641.definition: A B cell epitope specific activation of additional immune response in vitro assay that detects complement-dependent cytotoxicity.
OBI:0001641.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific complement-dependent cytotoxicity

OBI:0001642.definition: A B cell epitope specific activation of additional immune response in vitro assay that detects antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity.
OBI:0001642.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity

OBI:0001867.definition: a process whereby a new type of cell line is created, either through passaging of a primary cell culture to relative genetic stability and compositional homogeneity, or through some experimental modification of an existing cell line to produce a new line with novel characteristics  (e.g. immortalization or some other stable genetic modification, or selection of some defined subset).
OBI:0001867.label: establishing cell line

OBI:0200016.definition: A sine transformation is a data transformation which consists in applying the sine function to a (one dimensional) real number input. The sine function is one of the basic trigonometric functions and a definition is provided, e.g., at http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Sine.html.
OBI:0200016.label: sine transformation

OBI:0001583.definition: A half life datum of the time it takes for 50% of bound complexes in an ensemble to disassociate in absence of re-association.
OBI:0001583.label: half life of binding datum

OBI:1000207.definition: A globular or round particle of defined physicochemical properties and size which can be exploited as either the primary substance for detection or as a secondary solid platform for the attachment of bioactive molecules.
OBI:1000207.label: assay bead

OBI:0200063.definition: Quantifying subgraph navigability based on shortest-path length averaged over all pairs of subgraph vertices
OBI:0200063.label: characteristic path length calculation

OBI:0001582.definition: direct binding assay measuring MHC ligand binding using MHC derived from a cell
OBI:0001582.label: obsolete cell bound MHC direct binding assay

GO:0032906.definition: The appearance of transforming growth factor-beta2 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032906.label: transforming growth factor beta2 production

GO:0032907.definition: The appearance of transforming growth factor-beta3 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032907.label: transforming growth factor beta3 production

OBI:0002357.definition: A performance status value specification designed by the Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group to assess disease progression and its affect on the daily living abilities of the patient.
OBI:0002357.label: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group score value specification

GO:0032905.definition: The appearance of transforming growth factor-beta1 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.
GO:0032905.label: transforming growth factor beta1 production

OBI:0001581.definition: A measurement of an EC50 value under specific assay conditions approximates KD, namely the binding reaction is at an equilibrium,  and the concentration of the receptor must be much less than the KD for the ligand.
OBI:0001581.label: equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) approximated by EC50

UBERON:0001255.definition: distensible musculomembranous organ situated in the anterior part of the pelvic cavity in which urine collects before excretion[MP].
UBERON:0001255.label: urinary bladder

OBI:0001580.definition: A service in which a service provider facilitates the transport of some material entity to a specified destination for the service consumer.
OBI:0001580.label: material transport service

OBI:0000117.definition: An assay where the output data is a datum with one of two values denoting success and failure.
OBI:0000117.label: Bernoulli trial

OBI:0001586.definition: A purified MHC ligand half life of binding determination assay that uses radioactivity detection to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001586.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring half life of a MHC:ligand complex using radioactivity detection

CHEBI:51756.definition: An organosulfonic acid that has formula C34H33N3O11S2.

OBI:0001584.definition: A purified MHC binding assay that uses a phage display binding assay to measure direct ligand binding.
OBI:0001584.label: purified MHC direct binding assay measuring binding of a MHC:ligand complex using phage display

UBERON:0002067.definition: The dermis is a layer of skin between the epidermis (with which it makes up the skin) and subcutaneous tissues, and is composed of two layers, the papillary and reticular dermis[WP].
UBERON:0002067.label: dermis

CHMO:0000087.definition: Any type of microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) by illuminating it with light of specific wavelengths. These specimens are called fluorophores.

UBERON:0000996.definition: A fibromuscular tubular tract leading from the uterus to the exterior of the body in female placental mammals and marsupials, or to the cloaca in female birds, monotremes, and some reptiles[WP].
UBERON:0000996.label: vagina

GO:0009987.definition: Any process that is carried out at the cellular level, but not necessarily restricted to a single cell. For example, cell communication occurs among more than one cell, but occurs at the cellular level.
GO:0009987.label: cellular process

GO:0032637.definition: The appearance of interleukin-8 due to biosynthesis or secretion following a cellular stimulus, resulting in an increase in its intracellular or extracellular levels.

IAO:0000300.label: textual entity

UBERON:0006618.definition: A small conical pouch projections located on the upper anterior portion of each atrium of the heart.
UBERON:0006618.label: atrium auricular region

OBI:0001280.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific interleukin-16 production by T cells

OBI:0001465.definition: A T cell epitope specific cytokine production assay that detects monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells.
OBI:0001465.label: biological activity assay measuring epitope specific monocyte chemotactic protein-1 production by T cells

CHEBI:52673.definition: A fluorescent dye of absorption wavelength 555 nm and emission wavelength 565 nm, derived from a 3,6-diaminoxanthene-4,5-disulfate.
CHEBI:52673.label: Alexa Fluor 555

OBI:0000696.definition: is a DNA sequencer which is manufactured by Applied Biosystems and which enable DNA sequencing by ligation
OBI:0000696.label: AB SOLiD System

GO:0030097.definition: The process whose specific outcome is the progression of the myeloid and lymphoid derived organ/tissue systems of the blood and other parts of the body over time, from formation to the mature structure. The site of hemopoiesis is variable during development, but occurs primarily in bone marrow or kidney in many adult vertebrates.
GO:0030097.label: hemopoiesis

OBI:0002205.definition: A categorical value specification that is a histologic grade assigned to a tumor slide specimen according to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) 7th Edition grading system.
OBI:0002205.label: histologic grade according to AJCC 7th edition

OBI:0002204.definition: A cannot be assessed determination of pathologic staging of lymph nodes.
OBI:0002204.label: pNX

OBI:0002201.label: determination if assay will provide reliable results

OBI:0002200.definition: A reason for lack of data item that is the negative output of a determination if assay will provide reliable results.
OBI:0002200.label: cannot be assessed determination

OBI:0002203.definition: A cannot be assessed determination for pathologic primary tumor staging.
OBI:0002203.label: pTX

OBI:0000690.definition: is a process which realizes a material separation objective by relying on antibodies to specifically binding to material entity
OBI:0000690.label: immunoprecipitation

CHMO:0000089.synonyms: confocal laser scanning microscopy;LSCM;CLSM;confocal laser scanning fluorescence microscopy;scanning confocal fluorescence microscopy;fluorescence confocal microscopy;confocal fluorescence imaging;confocal-laser scanning microscopy;fluorescence confocal scanning laser microscopy
CHMO:0000089.definition: Microscopy where the specimen can be made to fluoresce (emit energy as visible light) by scanning a gas (Ar or Kr) laser spot of specific wavelength over its surface and using a spatial pinhole to eliminate out-of-focus fluorescence.
CHMO:0000089.label: confocal fluorescence microscopy

UBERON:0001037.definition: A filament, mostly protein, that grows from follicles found in the dermis[WP].
UBERON:0001037.label: strand of hair

OBI:0000691.definition: is a DNA sequencer which is manufactured by Applied Biosystems corporation (formerly Perkin-Elmer). It allows automated chain termination DNA sequencing. It has part polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis system and a laser -based detection system to detect fluorescence intensity emitted by the dyes attached to the dideoxyterminator nucleotides or to the primers.
OBI:0000691.label: ABI 377 automated sequencer
